Regenirex in Kearney, Nebraska offers comprehensive regenerative medicine solutions for patients seeking non-surgical alternatives to pain management and healing. Located in the heart of Buffalo County, our state-of-the-art facility combines cutting-edge medical technology with personalized care to address a wide range of orthopedic and chronic pain conditions. Since our founding, we've been committed to helping Central Nebraska residents regain mobility and improve their quality of life through innovative treatments.

At Regenirex, we specialize in harnessing the body's natural healing capabilities through advanced regenerative therapies. Our medical team utilizes evidence-based treatments including platelet-rich plasma (PRP) injections, stem cell therapy, and other minimally invasive procedures designed to accelerate healing and reduce inflammation. These treatments are particularly effective for joint pain, sports injuries, arthritis, and degenerative conditions that haven't responded well to conventional treatments.

Comprehensive Services

Our practice offers a full spectrum of regenerative medicine services, including:

  • Customized treatment plans for knee, shoulder, hip, and spine conditions

  • Advanced diagnostic imaging

  • Non-surgical pain management solutions

  • Rehabilitation support and guidance

  • Ongoing patient education and wellness resources

Patient-Centered Care

What sets Regenirex apart is our dedication to personalized medicine. We understand that each patient's condition is unique, which is why we develop individualized treatment protocols based on thorough evaluations and medical histories. Our compassionate staff ensures patients are informed and comfortable throughout their healing journey.

Visit Our Facility

Located at 5205 2nd Ave, Kearney, NE 68847, our modern clinic is equipped with the latest medical technology in a comfortable, welcoming environment. We proudly serve patients from across Nebraska and neighboring states.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our innovative treatments, call us at +1 308-237-9696 or visit our website at http://regenirex.org/. Our team is ready to help you explore how regenerative medicine might be the solution you've been searching for.

Dr. Matthew J. Stottle, MD serves Omaha, Nebraska and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management services. As a board-certified physician specializing in interventional pain medicine, Dr. Stottle combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. His practice at Omaha Pain Physicians offers comprehensive treatment plans tailored to each individual's unique needs and circumstances.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

At his conveniently located office in West Omaha, Dr. Stottle provides a wide range of pain management solutions including medication management, minimally invasive procedures, and interventional techniques. His approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, allowing for more effective long-term relief. Patients suffering from back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome find specialized care under Dr. Stottle's expert guidance.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Stottle believes in creating personalized treatment plans that consider each patient's medical history, lifestyle, and goals. His commitment to patient education ensures that individuals understand their condition and treatment options, empowering them to participate actively in their recovery journey. The practice prides itself on minimal wait times, thorough consultations, and responsive follow-up care.

Practice Information

Location: 13340 California St #101, Omaha, NE 68154, United States

Phone: +1 402-614-1999

Website: [http://omahapainphysicians.com/](http://omahapainphysicians.com/)

Hours: Monday-Friday: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM

New patients are welcome, and most major insurance plans are accepted. For appointments or additional information, please contact the office directly.

column40:
They really took time with me and spelled things out well, I understood. I came back to Dr Stottle because he and Stacie listen while I figure things out and explain things in detail.|I've been with Dr. Stottle since he took over the practice from Dr Skiba. So it has been like 8 years. I've always been treated with respect even sometimes when I maybe didn't deserve it. Kylie is absolutely a dream. Her goal is to make sure you don't get stuck paying for something you thought was covered. If you ever get stuck paying for a surgery that you were told was covered and it wasn't, it isn't cheap. You will be grateful for her doing her job. Dr. Stottle knows what he is doing. I seen 9 other pain doctors and I've been with him the longest. Very good people.@|I've been seeing Dr. Stottle and his team for going on 7 years for my back. I've had nothing but the best care from them.

If I'm not having procedures done, I see Dr. Lee. I can't say enough great things about this woman! For one, besides the help I get from Dr. Stottle, I am with this clinic because of her! She is beyond kind, understands what I'm going through, doesn't recommend something if she doesn't think it will help, and my favorite part about her, I feel truly cared for. Thank you, Dr. Lee. You have a special spot in my heart, and I'm truly grateful for all that you continue to do to help with my chronic pain.

I love the staff as well. I love when I go in, they take time to chat with me. They make sure my meds and treatments are going well and get to know me personally.

To sum it all up, I feel like I'm part of their family EVERY TIME I go in there.

I should also state that my Mom comes from Sioux Falls, SD to see Dr. Stottle and Lee too! I love seeing the immediate relief on her face once we leave.

Thank you again, I'm forever grateful that I am in such good hands with all of you!|I cannot say enough positive about Dr. Stottle!!! Gratefully, I was referred to him by my surgeon. Dr. Stottle was not going to stop until he found pain relief for me! After living with chronic pain since 2014, and enduring five back surgeries, he found me pain relief!!! Dr. has a wonderful bedside manner. He is a kind soul who genuinely cares for his patients. I highly recommend him without reserve. He has given me back my life.|So grateful for this wonderful group of healthcare professionals!! During my visit Dani greeted me cheerfully and listened to all of my concerns! Dr. Stottle took the time to discuss my options for the day of my appointment and for the future to help with my pain. I know this office sees so many patients and helps so many people- and it's not everyday you find a provider that takes time to listen and explain and doesn't seemed rushed out the door. I trust and value their expertise and have even referred people their way because they are so great! Thank you Omaha Pain!|Have been going to see Dr Stottle for awhile now. Have had terrible back pain. Had gone and seen alot of orthopedic docs and was not getting anywhere. Dr Stottle tried some pain management options. Wasn't getting much relief but I felt positive we were going  in the right direction. Upon a follow-up visit from a procedure I stated it hadn't helped much, in fact the last week or so the pain was much worse. The physician assistant asked if I wanted any pain meds. I said that would be great. In the past I had refused any prescriptions for narcotics. They were going to send in a predetermination for a different procedure to my insurance company. I waited for a few weeks and hadn't heard from them so I called and left a message for the nurse. No call back from her, so I called again, and again, and again. Nobody has called me back!! It seems they want to help you as long as you don't ask for pain meds. If you do they cut you loose without a word as much from them. Extremely poor business practice and they don't seem to really care about there patients well being. I have referred 2 friends to them and they are currently seeing him for their pain management. I hope he treats them better than he has treated me. I would now not recommend his office to anyone else.|I travel 60 miles or so to see Dr. Stottle. I was referred by my neurologist. The two work together to try and help me with all my issues. He and his staff have always been attentive, helpful and kind. They help me to feel relaxed while I am hurting and trying to explains things to them; and he, his nurses and  PAs have not only listened to me, but take the time to answer all my questions; and one thing I love is that they EXPLAIN so that I can understand procedures, medicines, etc. I appreciate all of them and am so thankful to have such a great doctor in our area. I have referred many to them and will continue to do so.|The BEST pain Control Doctor in Omaha!  I have seen three other pain control doctors in Omaha and they neither have the bedside demeanor nor skill of Dr Stottle.  Now he won't let you get away with BSing him or his staff and certainly won't let you violate your pain / prescription agreement!  However, if you are in pain, he will do everything in his power to see you and get you out of pain.  Yes, sometimes he is tied to insurance and pre-approvals, but when I have been at a level 10 pain, he has seen me in the same day and though perhaps I have had to agree to pay his cash price, knowing I can spread the cost of the treatment out over a few months.  At least he saw me the same day and treated me!  Other pain control docs in Omaha won't even see you until the insurance company agrees to pay for the treatment period!  Doctor Stottle's Staff are all extremely caring: from the front desk girls, to the intake nurses, to the injection assistants to the PAs.  I have never encountered a staff member who was not compassionate and willing to bend over backwards to assist a patient!

The other phenomenal thing about Doctor Stottle is he doesn't overschedule patients!  Even when the waiting room is full, I have only waited more than 15 minutes ONCE!  And then I was given a Starbucks gift card to compensate me for my inconvenience!

Absolutely the best Pain Control Doctor in Omaha and possibly in the Midwest!

Renuva Back and Pain Centers Omaha serves the greater Omaha, Nebraska area with comprehensive non-surgical pain management solutions. Located in the western part of the city, our clinic specializes in innovative treatments for chronic back pain, neck pain, sciatica, and other debilitating conditions that affect quality of life. Our team of board-certified specialists combines decades of experience with cutting-edge technology to provide personalized care plans focused on long-term relief rather than temporary symptom management.

At Renuva, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach addresses the root causes of pain through advanced diagnostic techniques and evidence-based treatments including:

  • Spinal decompression therapy

  • Regenerative medicine options

  • Therapeutic exercise programs

  • Joint injections and nerve blocks

  • Customized rehabilitation protocols

Our Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Renuva apart is our commitment to treating each patient as an individual, not just a collection of symptoms. We take the time to conduct thorough evaluations, listen to your concerns, and develop treatment plans tailored to your specific needs and goals. Many of our patients have found relief after years of unsuccessful treatments elsewhere.

Convenient Location

Our clinic is conveniently situated at 13906 Gold Cir #204, Omaha, NE 68144, with ample parking and accessibility features. The office is designed with patient comfort in mind, featuring state-of-the-art treatment rooms and a welcoming atmosphere that helps reduce the anxiety often associated with medical visits.

If you're struggling with chronic pain and seeking alternatives to surgery or long-term medication use, contact Renuva Back and Pain Centers Omaha today to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward reclaiming your active lifestyle.

Nebraska Spine + Pain Center serves patients across Nebraska with locations in Omaha, Columbus, Fremont, Grand Island, Lexington, Norfolk, and South Sioux City. As the region's most preferred spine center, we've established ourselves as the trusted destination for comprehensive back, neck, and spine care. Our Grand Island facility at 620 N Custer Ave provides specialized treatment options for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions, offering hope and healing to those who have been limited by spinal issues.

Our medical team consists of board-certified and fellowship-trained specialists, including orthopedic spine surgeons, neurosurgeons, and pain management physicians who focus exclusively on back, neck, and spine conditions. This specialized focus allows our doctors to develop unparalleled expertise in diagnosing and treating even the most complex spinal disorders. Patients in Grand Island can schedule appointments on the 1st, 3rd, and 4th Thursday of each month, ensuring consistent access to our specialized care.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

At Nebraska Spine + Pain Center, we understand that each patient's pain experience is unique. Our physicians take the time to conduct thorough evaluations, utilizing advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the precise source of discomfort. We then develop personalized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, therapeutic injections, physical therapy, medication management, or surgical intervention when necessary. Our goal is always to restore function and improve quality of life with the least invasive approach possible.

Patient-Centered Care

What truly sets us apart is our commitment to patient-centered care. We believe in educating our patients about their conditions and treatment options, empowering them to make informed decisions about their health. Our compassionate staff guides patients through every step of their treatment journey, from initial consultation through recovery and rehabilitation. When you choose Nebraska Spine + Pain Center, you're not just receiving expert medical care—you're gaining a dedicated partner in your journey toward a pain-free life.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, visit www.nebraskaspineandpain.com or call +1 402-496-0404. Our Grand Island location at 620 N Custer Ave, Grand Island, NE 68803 welcomes patients seeking extraordinary spine care delivered with expertise and compassion.

Kevin Balter, M.D. in Omaha, Nebraska offers specialized pain management services to patients throughout the metropolitan area and surrounding communities. With a patient-centered approach and years of clinical expertise, Dr. Balter has established himself as a trusted healthcare provider dedicated to improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. The practice combines evidence-based medical interventions with compassionate care to address a wide spectrum of pain-related issues.

At Midwest Pain Clinics, Dr. Balter provides individualized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies. The clinic specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation to determine the most effective approach for their specific needs.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 825 N 90th St in Omaha, the clinic features modern medical equipment and comfortable treatment rooms designed to enhance the patient experience. The convenient location offers ample parking and accessibility features for patients with mobility challenges. The facility adheres to strict safety and cleanliness protocols to ensure a safe environment for all visitors.

Patient Information

New and returning patients can schedule appointments by calling +1 402-391-7246. The friendly office staff assists with insurance verification and paperwork completion prior to visits. For additional information about services, treatment options, and patient resources, visit the official website at http://midwestpainclinics.com/. The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to address financial concerns.

Zero stars. Been "working" with Mr. Balter at midwest pain clinic for over a year. Still in the same if not worse pain then before I seen him. Push towards surgery rather then alternative pain relief. Staff and Mr. Balter do not return calls and do not care for their patients. It's all about the profit. I would not recommend him or the clinic to my worst enemy.|ZERO STARS, NOT one star, ZERO. Dr. Balter has the absolute worst care practice and is extremely dismissive and disrespectful to patients. He does not care about patients individually and treats everyone the same while priding himself on it. He makes patients wait up to an hour for scheduled appointments although he will refuse to see a patient if they are 3 minutes late. He does what he wants despite patient refusal or requests, such as radio frequency nerve preparation under the guise of a steroid injection. Beyond horrible to multiple staff and nurses with no decency to those who rely on him as a doctor or supervisor. While under pressure and patient inquiry he can become extremely irritable with the potential of emotional and mental abuse. Dr. Balter is not safe to be around and can display violent behavior that can be triggering or upsetting, especially for women. I would not recommend him whatsoever under any circumstances.|I had never been to a pain management clinic before, and I suspected I would just get pain pills. But Dr Balter and his PA spent so much time with me and were actually concerned with getting to the bottom of my pain, not just padding it with pills.  I was examined, and a diagnosis was suspected, and on my second visit, he actually did a procedure for me! I have been to so many doctors and it seems either no one really cares or no one really had any answers. Dr Balter really came through and he really cares. I am so glad I was referred to this clinic and that he is my doctor!  I have told so many people about my experience, and that they should go see him for their back pain too, thank God for Dr Balter!|I hav back issues. I have seen Dr Butler for
Many years. He is so good at what he does.|Amazing Dr and medical Staff. Everything is well explained, they truly care about your needs! This is the first time I have had a Dr and medical staff listen to my issues and actually make a difference. Dr Balter sets treatment per your needs and is super knowledgeable. Thanks for all of your help!|I trust Dr. Balter to treat any of my pain problems. I've been around the block seeing many pain docs and Dr Balter was the most thorough evaluating me. He was the most careful to explain to me so I understood and felt comfortable making decisions about procedures that could have risks. I felt listened to and that's important to me, especially if there are bumps along the way. We decided to go ahead with the sacroiliac procedure because I did not want to live the rest of my life in pain and taking narcotics or have more surgery. The procedure went well and I am reclaiming and enjoying life again. We had a few minor setbacks, but Dr. Balter carefully helped me get over them too. She didn't take it to Dr Balter immediately, Dr Balters bed side manner tends to suck sometimes. Dr. Griffith F Evans, M.D. serves the Omaha, Nebraska community with exceptional pain management services through Momenta Pain Care. Located in the western part of Omaha, our practice has established itself as a trusted resource for individuals suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions. Dr. Evans brings extensive medical expertise and a patient-centered approach to every consultation, ensuring that each treatment plan is tailored to address specific needs and improve quality of life.

At Momenta Pain Care, we understand that pain is a complex and deeply personal experience. Our practice offers a wide range of evidence-based treatments designed to address various pain conditions, including but not limited to back pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Dr. Evans utilizes the latest diagnostic tools and therapeutic approaches to identify the root causes of pain and develop effective management strategies.

Our Philosophy of Care

We are firmly committed to compassionate and innovative care for every patient who walks through our doors. Our approach combines medical expertise with genuine empathy, recognizing that pain affects not just the body, but every aspect of a person's life. Dr. Evans and our dedicated team work collaboratively with patients to establish realistic goals and create sustainable pain management solutions that enhance functionality and overall wellbeing.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our modern clinic at 1805 N 145th St in Omaha provides a comfortable, welcoming environment where patients can discuss their concerns openly and receive the highest standard of care. The facility is equipped with advanced technology that enables precise diagnosis and effective treatment implementation.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Griffith F Evans, please call us at (402) 991-6559. You can also visit our website at http://momentapaincare.com/ to learn more about our services and approach to pain management. Our office is conveniently located at 1805 N 145th St, Omaha, NE 68154, with accessible parking and amenities.

At Momenta Pain Care, we don't just treat pain—we partner with our patients on their journey toward improved function and a more comfortable, fulfilling life.

PerryWork Precise serves Omaha, Nebraska and surrounding areas with specialized pain management solutions that focus on non-invasive, holistic approaches to chronic pain. Formerly known as Comprehensive Pain Center, our practice has evolved to offer more personalized care while maintaining our commitment to helping patients regain their quality of life. Our team of dedicated specialists combines traditional medical knowledge with innovative techniques to address pain at its source rather than merely masking symptoms.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At PerryWork Precise, we believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our comprehensive assessment process examines physical symptoms alongside lifestyle factors, emotional well-being, and personal goals. This multidimensional approach allows us to create customized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

Services We Offer

Our clinic provides a wide range of pain management solutions including:

- Physical Therapy - Targeted exercises and movements to strengthen affected areas

- Therapeutic Massage - Hands-on techniques to reduce muscle tension and improve circulation

- Biofeedback Training - Teaching patients to control physiological functions

- Nutritional Counseling - Dietary recommendations to reduce inflammation

- Stress Management - Techniques to minimize the psychological components of pain

Why Choose PerryWork Precise

What sets us apart is our unwavering commitment to finding solutions that work for each individual. We take the time to listen, understand, and collaborate with our patients, ensuring they feel heard and respected throughout their healing journey. Our success stories speak volumes about our effectiveness in helping people reclaim their freedom from pain.

Visit Us

Location: 8031 W Center Rd # 226, Omaha, NE 68124, United States

Phone: +1 402-391-8978

Website: [https://www.perrywork.com/](https://www.perrywork.com/)

Contact us today to schedule your initial consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.

column40:
I'd been experiencing hip pain for several years when a colleague recommended PerryWork.
Michael Perry knew exactly where the pain was located. In 15 minutes, I had no pain in my hip. He used natural Saline injections which had little to no pain.
I always assumed I'd eventually have to have a hip replacement. I now know that is not the case.
I cannot recommend PerryWork enough!
They are kind and expert in natural healing.|Had extreme pain in hip down leg from falling on tailbone down stairs and herniated discs. Haven't been handling the pain well for multiple weeks. Lack of sleep.  Overall crappy.  Got xray mri and then saw a professional
Went here and within an hour I was treated and out and took a 3 hour nap have minimal pain and look forward to finally getting some sleep

Thank you for your service it's amazing|Michael provides relief from pain related to inflammation within minutes. The science underlying his rationale and methodology is sound. He provides a service that would be pervasive at all medical facilities if profit weren't the primary objective in our nation's sickcare system.  A warm thanks to Michael and his team!|Attended with scapular pain after nearly 18 months of suffering with it. The treatment was literally one and done, that was over six months ago and haven't had even a single twinge since. Simply amazing.|There aren't enough words in the English language to thank Mike Perry & Elly for their help & healing! :-)

In 2016, I suffered a work-related low back injury and was told I needed surgery. To be specific, I had an L4/L5 double dissectomy and 2 bone spurs removed.  Ever since then, my quality of life has never been the same -- surgeon to surgeon, doctor to doctor, only to have pills shoved down my throat and no progress whatsoever.

I was referred to Mike Perry's office last month.  Mike has completely changed my life in three office visits.

Mike actually put his hands on me to actually feel what was actually going on in my low back.  Can you believe that? No other provider has done this in over a decade, not even in the emergency room.  And trust me, I've seen a lot of "doctors" and "surgeons" over the last 7 years.

Mike recognized and discovered the problem right away, and after three short office visits, I have my life back!!  And the best part -- I canceled my upcoming appointment in 2 weeks because I definitely do not need surgery.

Thank you Mike and Elly!!

Thank you Comprehensive Pain Center!|I am in APRN:Michael Perry's Care for tricky "encapsulated like muscle fascia/or the tight wrapping around, and holding inflammation or scarring my plantar fascia (Heel,Arch Chronic Pain from walk-in,driving & Life!) and the other "overused muscle , tendon attachments that seem to be unforgiving, neck&elbow&after surgical scarring that's deeper than massage or acupressure/needling. It's been my 3rd or 4th bout of 5 visits for this each year or so: and I'm 99.99% better with only a second or two of His (yes, I hate needles &  so, I don't watch.. but after the oozing of 'toxins, maybe it's lymph fluids or equivalent to a blister - release it's been "released of my body's trigger points that held on to my stubborn pains& now, I can stretch, exercise!! Yeah! This, I'm lucky to try & successfully recommend ! Ellie at the desk helps with all questions & has great smiles! Too. PFR|Absolutely amazing! Michael Perry has dedicated his life to treating patients with pain. He listens & he's VERY skilled in treating pain. I've witnessed patients who have seen many other specialists & told nothing more can be done. When they discovered Michael Perry they FINALLY got relief & many have been able to eliminate pain medication. Don't go elsewhere. Michael is your answer. You won't be disappointed!|Went in with a nerve condition and extensive pain. Two months later, with the treatments and proper medication I feel great. Can't thank Mike enough. He is a miracle worker!

CHI Health Clinic Pain Medicine (CUMC - Bergan Mercy) serves Omaha, Nebraska and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services. Located within the Catholic Health Initiatives network, our clinic combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients experiencing chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified pain specialists develops personalized treatment plans that address both the physical and emotional aspects of pain, utilizing the latest evidence-based approaches to improve quality of life and restore function.

At CHI Health Clinic Pain Medicine, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies. Our specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions, from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. We work closely with other medical departments to ensure coordinated care that addresses the root causes of your discomfort.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that pain affects each person differently, we take time to listen to your concerns and develop individualized treatment strategies. Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to improve your overall function and quality of life. The clinic environment is designed to be welcoming and supportive, reflecting our commitment to treating the whole person, not just the condition.

Location and Appointments

Our clinic is conveniently located at 7710 Mercy Rd #224, Omaha, NE 68124, within the Bergan Mercy Medical Center campus. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (402) 717-0880. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans. For additional information about our providers and services, visit our website at CHI Health Clinic Pain Medicine.

Innovative Pain & Spine Specialists of Lincoln, Nebraska provides comprehensive pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. Clayton Damme, MD. Serving patients throughout Lincoln and surrounding communities, our practice focuses on non-invasive approaches to chronic pain relief, helping patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life through personalized treatment plans.

Dr. Damme is a distinguished pain management specialist committed to helping patients relieve chronic pain without invasive procedures. With extensive training and a patient-centered approach, he specializes in identifying and treating the root causes of persistent pain conditions. Dr. Damme completed his residency at the University of Nebraska Medical Center after receiving his medical degree from the University of Nebraska College of Medicine, where he graduated with distinction.

Specialized Pain Management Services

Our practice offers comprehensive treatment for a wide range of chronic pain conditions, including:

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome

  • Degenerative Disc Disease

  • Joint pain

  • Neck and back pain

  • Sciatica

Dr. Damme's approach begins with thorough diagnostic assessments to determine the underlying causes of pain. He then educates patients on all available treatment options, empowering them to make informed decisions about their care.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

At Innovative Pain & Spine Specialists, we believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Dr. Damme takes time to listen to each patient's concerns, developing customized treatment plans that address individual needs and goals for pain management.

Contact Information

Phone: +1 402-413-5010

Address: 7121 Stephanie Ln #102, Lincoln, NE 68516, United States

Committed to helping patients relieve chronic pain without invasive procedures, Dr. Damme specializes in pain management medicine. column40: Dr Rakes is great. Everything about my appointments and procedures has been positive. The staff is excellent, knowledgeable and very friendly. The doctor herself is very concerned, caring and thorough.|I went to Dr Rakes almost over 2 years ago with the onset of debilitating migraines and this abnormal electric shock feeling I kept getting in my head. I was diagnosed with Chronic Severe Migraines and Trigeminal Neuralgia. She worked with me and placed me on meds that completely cleared me of it all. Unfortunately with any pharmaceuticals there are side effects and I wanted to have a baby which was frowned upon while receiving the meds. I weened off and the headaches began again. She worked with me through the entire time. I tried everything I could under the sun and because of insurance there are steps to take to get to the next level of treatment. I was starting to come to terms with that fact I may have to live with migraines the entire time I want to have children which was a horrible feeling. There was days I had to go to the emergency room and they still could not get the headache to go away. They would send me home and let me know they did all they could, prescribe me a sedative and knock me out and cross fingers it worked. Dr Rakes finally got my insurance to approve Botox and I have no words!!!! It was a complete life changer. My migraines have now turned back into normal headaches and I only get many 5 a month instead of over half the month with a constant migraine. My tension in my neck and shoulders are gone and my TMJ has died down. Botox has been the most life changing drug ever given to me. You receive a lot of injections within that 10 minutes however, they do not hurt and results are mind blowing. I would suggest Dr Rakes for any of your pain issues and especially your migraines. One thing to keep in mind though, you have to take steps and try certain medications due to insurance guidelines until they allow stuff like Botox however, be patient and Dr Rakes will guide you through the process.|One of the worst doctors I've ever seen. Dr. Rakes spent less than 5 minutes with me during a follow up visit. In this short period of time she decided there was nothing she could do for my back issues. Midwest Pain Clinics - Columbus serves patients throughout Columbus, Nebraska and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Since our founding, we've built a reputation for combining advanced medical techniques with compassionate, patient-centered care that addresses the root causes of pain rather than simply treating symptoms.

At Midwest Pain Clinics, our mission is to provide the most advanced and compassionate care to patients in pain. Our team specializes in diagnosing and treating various chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive, non-surgical procedures. Each treatment plan is customized to the individual patient's needs, focusing on sustainable pain relief and improved quality of life.

Expert Medical Team

Our world-class physicians bring extensive experience and specialized training in pain management. The medical team is dedicated to precisely diagnosing and treating the source of your chronic pain, not masking it. This approach allows us to develop effective treatment strategies that address underlying conditions while minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our comprehensive approach considers not just the physical symptoms but the emotional and lifestyle impacts of pain. Our goal is to get you back to work, back to family, and back to living as soon as possible through targeted interventions and supportive care.

Our board-certified anesthesiologists and certified registered nurse anesthetists (CRNAs) deliver specialized pain management solutions and anesthesia care for surgical procedures across multiple medical facilities. At Midwest Anesthesia, we offer a complete range of anesthesia services including general anesthesia, regional blocks, monitored anesthesia care (MAC), and acute pain management. This patient-centered approach has established Midwest Anesthesia as a trusted partner in healthcare throughout the Fremont community and beyond.

column40:
My brother had to wait 4 hours to get injections in his back. Instead of seeing the Doctor after waiting forever he seen the doctor outside walking his dog. Needless to say he left the office in a rage in pain and frustrated at the unprofessional behavior and treatment of this clinic!|Went to have a nerve block done by Dr. Blair at this clinic. But totally unprofessional and the Dr made me wait 4 dang hours to have my procedure done. And after 4 hours I left. I saw Dr Blair playing with his dog Outback and the whole office was waiting for him to get procedures done. It took him 4 hours to give 2 injections!! All bcz of how unprofessional he was that day. I'm extremely let down and extremely disappointed with this absolute lack of responsibility and respect for the patient who pays their good hard-earned insurance coverage for being seen in a timely fashion. But 4 damn hours and only 2 injections done in that whole time!! Inexcusable and totally unprofessional behavior by Dr Blair. Drs always say time is money, yeah well my money too. I have to pay high gas prices, get up extremely early, and wait 4 damn hours with 3 people in front of me!? And he wasn't even in the clinic. He was gone and playing around with his dog. Plus two people in front of me one poor woman screamed in agony bcz Dr. Blair was so brutal with her knee injections. An elderly man right before I told my ride that he was never going to have his much-needed neck injection done again bcz of Dr. Blair's negligence. The medical school and Hippocratic oath are to "do no harm". But Dr Blair hurt and caused harm to two poor older people that day. Imo that's totally wrong and evil. Especially as I heard a poor woman scream out in agony crying about how her knee injection hurt so badly. Then an older man was limping out and he was in so much pain his blood pressure could've caused him to have a stroke it was so high after how much pain he experienced from Dr. Blair's ill-suited hands. I won't ever see Dr Blair again based on this time I waited 4 damn hours when Dr. Blair wasn't in the building and made honest hard-working Americans wait 4 hours to be seen!!|Worst doctors I have went to I was on oral medicine doing just fine I never failed a drug test but they push the pain pump i tried it Angela from the clinic side refilled it in April I came home fell asleep and I woke up with pains going from my tailbone all the way to my ankles the pain never went away and every week that I went in i told her and Dr.Raiker about the pain I told them I wanted the pain pump out cause it was doing more harm than good I got it taken out July 31,24 I had it in for 7 months then he fired me as a patient cause I had it taken out i guess he is going to be losing to much money but now he isn't gonna get money out of me as a patient|My fiance goes here once a month to get his pain meds. This is the 2nd or 3rd time that he's had an 8:45 am appointment and he's had to wait 2 hours or more for a doctor to even show up at the clinic. If the doctor isn't going to be there by 8:45am why even have appointments available for that time? What if he had another appointment scheduled after this one and he missed the next one? Plus he has to drive an hour to get to the pain clinic. They have always had the prescriptions refilled before the doctor has even entered the room to talk to him. How do they even know what to prescribe or refill without talking to the patient first? Ok, rant over. MWA do better!|We drove over 1 hour to Fremont from east of Council Bluffs, IA, for a pain pump refill for my significant other. Signed all the paperwork then they inform us the medicine hadn't shown up. We asked them why they didn't call us and reschedule so we didn't have to drive that far for nothing.  They said they thought the medicine would be there by the time we got there. Won't be going back to the Fremont office. Had problems at the Omaha office before now this. Looking for another pain clinic.|Very compassionate staff and doctors,  I have been to many facilities in the past and would highly recommend anyone in pain to go see the doctors at this clinic.  They treat you with respect, dignity, and will strive to rid your chronic pain in multiple ways.  I can't thank Dr. Raikar and Dr. Jeanie Corde enough for all you do.  And a special thanks to all the nurses and receptionist for your hospitality and kindness.
Once again, highly recommend to anyone with a legitimate pain problem.   Thank you again Midwest Anesthesia for all you do and a huge thank you to Dr Jeannie and all the nurses.|COME HERE IF YOU WANT A DOCTOR TO GIVE YOU LOTS OF OPIATES! I originally came here (from Omaha to Freemont) because my APRN Gentry Klein was very understand and a good nurse. Then my insurance changed and I paid out of pocket because she is such a great understanding nurse.

She is currently on maternity leave.  While she was away I got new insurance and was only able to see the head surgeon here, S.V. Raiker, M.D., and unlike my usual thirty minute visit, with Gentry Klein, APRN (who I consider a Saint in the pain management field) he spent all of maybe two minutes with me before he suggested I get a freaking MORPHINE PUMP IMPLANT SURGERY (he also mentioned the "whopping amount of pain relief it would provide", meaning it would get me very high is the literal meaning of that. I had no intention of trying to get pain medication, let alone a surgery, which would cost over like $20 thousand if insurance covered it, but my new coverage wasn't going to do that, so for several, SEVERAL MONTHS every single time I saw Dr. Raikar, he would come in with prescription already in hand and talk about how bad my insurance was for the entire time then leave.  I broke from my coverage with my insurance and did self pay, which they "claim to accept", but instead of seeing APRN Klein (as she's on maternity leave) I got the new girl Trisha, I believe it's also an APRN, not sure, but I expressed my outrage from the beginning of how I was made to feel like a drug addict, then I suddenly see the main doctor and he literally suggests after a minute of discussion that I get a morphine pump surgery basically for no reason other then he would make money and make me completely addicted... I'm still astonished this actually took place...  But I confide in her my concerns, you know, the whole doctor patient confidentiality agreement...  Well I clearly can't prove it, but my second time on she tells me how I've tested posative for alcohol in my last UA's, and if I tested posative a third time they would be unable to treat me.  This was my third time and I'd already taken the UA and I signed an OPIATE CONTRACT and I agreed not to take anything containing THC.  OK that is indisputable.

I came in for my last visit knowing they would terminate me as a patient but I was curious just how they would play this card.  I recorded the entire thing on video so anyone who wants to see, just ask I'll reveal all.... , but I was charged a massive amount more then I usual am for self pay.  Then nurse Trisha comes in and asks me how I've been and I tell her very bad I'd been feeling, as I just found out a few days ago one of my closest friends from University passed away. She gave her (false) sympathies, and then told me we had a difficult discussion to have.  She said how she had on several times told me I can not drink alcohol and I tested posative again. I pointed out to her that this was our third time seeing one another and that she only brought up the issue of alcohol in the previous visit.  So basically she said on the second visit after I'd given a UA that I tested posative for alcohol in the last two, and one more and I would be dismissed.  So I had some drink the night before with friends, nothing in the least excessive, but this was basically checkmate.  I can't prove it, but the second I started talking to the nurses about how I felt neglected, targeted, and a victim of medical malpractice as he was trying to get my to go under unnecessary surgery for a morphine implant I definitely didn't need from the main surgeon Dr Raikar, every single visit seemed like I was wasting their time.  On several occasions they even changed my appointment dates so I ended up going days without medication and in terrible terrible pain as a result of this obvious issue over how much the doctor was getting paid from me insurance vs a self pay system.

I'll just say this, as I did in the beginning.  Go here if you want to get over prescribed and addicted to drugs you don't need cause they will gladly do it.

Go to propublica.net and you'll see.  Most prescriptions in NE.|1.5 hr wait in lobby.  30 min wait in room. Nice visit with APRN but no explanation of medicine to be given and nothing sent to me and its been 8 days of pain without relief. No order CT yet.

Innovative Pain and Spine serves Omaha, Nebraska and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Kelly Zach, our practice has established itself as a leading destination for patients seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. Located conveniently at 17021 Lakeside Hills Plaza Suite 100 in Omaha, our state-of-the-art facility combines advanced medical technology with compassionate care to address the unique needs of each patient.

At Innovative Pain and Spine, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, utilizing both interventional procedures and medication management strategies. Dr. Zach specializes in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our team works diligently to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving functionality and quality of life while minimizing reliance on opioid medications.

About Dr. Kelly Zach, MD

Dr. Kelly Zach brings extensive training and experience in pain medicine to Innovative Pain and Spine. Board-certified and fellowship-trained, Dr. Zach employs evidence-based practices and innovative techniques to address challenging pain conditions. His patient-centered approach emphasizes thorough evaluation, clear communication, and collaborative decision-making to achieve optimal outcomes. Dr. Zach remains at the forefront of advancements in pain management, regularly incorporating new and proven methodologies into his practice.

Patient-Centered Care

Our practice prides itself on creating a welcoming environment where patients feel heard and valued. The administrative and clinical staff at Innovative Pain and Spine work together to ensure efficient scheduling, minimal wait times, and comprehensive support throughout the treatment journey. We accept most major insurance plans and work closely with patients to navigate coverage questions and financial considerations.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Kelly Zach or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 402-413-5010. Additional information about our practice and treatment options can be found on our website at www.innovativepainnebraska.com/kelly-zach-md. Our office is located at 17021 Lakeside Hills Plaza Suite 100, Omaha, NE 68130, United States, with convenient parking available for all patients.

Ihsan Balkaya, MD serves Norfolk, Nebraska and surrounding communities as a dedicated pain management specialist committed to improving quality of life for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. With comprehensive training and a patient-centered approach, Dr. Balkaya offers specialized interventions at his practice located on the fourth floor of 2701 W Norfolk Avenue. His clinical expertise encompasses a wide spectrum of pain disorders, providing relief through evidence-based treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Dr. Balkaya's practice focuses on treating various pain conditions including joint pain, back and neck pain, migraines, cancer-related pain, abdominal pain, pelvic pain, and fibromyalgia. With particular expertise in spinal disorders, he employs advanced diagnostic techniques and therapeutic interventions to address complex pain issues. Each treatment plan is customized to address the underlying causes of pain while maximizing functional improvement and minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that pain affects every aspect of a patient's life, Dr. Balkaya takes time to thoroughly evaluate each case, considering medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal goals. This comprehensive approach allows him to develop effective management strategies that address both immediate pain relief and long-term wellness. Patients appreciate his attentive care and commitment to explaining treatment options in clear, accessible terms.

Professional Background

As part of the respected team at FRPS Clinics, Dr. Balkaya brings specialized knowledge in interventional pain procedures and multidisciplinary pain management. His practice integrates the latest advances in pain medicine with traditional approaches to provide optimal outcomes. When not treating patients, Dr. Balkaya maintains an active lifestyle enjoying hiking, basketball, soccer, and traveling—experiences that inform his understanding of physical wellness and mobility challenges.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Ihsan Balkaya, patients can call +1 402-844-8100 or visit the practice at 2701 W Norfolk Ave, Floor 4, Norfolk, NE 68701. Additional information about pain management services is available at https://frpsclinics.org/specialties/pain-management/, where prospective patients can learn more about treatment options and prepare for their first appointment.

column40: When I first went to see Dr. Birthi, I was using a wheelchair and walker and this was back in November of 2017. He has worked very hard to help me get my life back. He is very compassionate and listens to his patients. He is such an amazing Dr. and I would gladly recommend him to everyone. He has helped me so much and I am so very thankful for him.|Had an initial appointment with Dr. Birthi.  He did not care about my needs and immediately went about prescribing what 'he' thought I should do.  He treated me with no respect and appeared not to care whether I had any input whatsoever.  It so happens that I have a Ph.D. and have studied extensively in chemistry ... perhaps I understand more than he bothered to try to find out.  Gonna find another doctor.|I went to multiple specialists before I found Dr. Birthi and he is the only one that figured out what was wrong and how to fix it. I went from being in pain everyday and have multiple migraines a month to having occasional pain. He did the lidocaine injections and gave me back so much life I wish I had found him sooner|I have been going to Dr.Birthi since 2010 we tried pretty much everything in the sky. But he is the only doctor who I have dealt with that actually cares for his patients. I moved just this year and since Im about 2 and a half hours away I thought it would be easier for me to go to one closer. Boy was I wrong I am thinking that I will be going back to him.|dr birthi loves to do steriod injection  on back pain patients these steriods are not fda approved for spinal injection please reasearch before agreeing to this type of treatment|Had stimulator put in. Became infected. They just put me on more meds. Got sicker. They took out stimulator, washed it off and put same stimulator back in. Ended up horribly sick. Finally went to another Dr and they removed the stimulator and was told they never should have put it back in. Never go here!|Very compassionate. Explains things thoroughly|

column38: John Morales|Herosh Motana|Jim Bennett|Eleanor F|Katie Vroman|Marie case|Kate Knapp|Nicole Murchison
column40:
Ive been a patient at this clinic for years and the waits are extremely long, the receptionists and staff have repeatedly misplaced my appointment times and I've just come from the Fremont clinic. Dr Patel made me wait almost 4 hours to be seen. I wasn't given any instructions about a nerve block I was supposed to have today. While waiting almost 4 hours I saw Dr Patel out back walking his dog and taking his sweet time seeing 2 people ahead of me. Just a freakin 2 people ahead and took 4 hours of waiting!! I got fed up and extremely angry bcz of the wait and I left. Plus I was back in a procedure waiting room in a gown and all ready for my procedure. Then I heard a poor woman scream and cry out in pain bcz Dr. Pitel was so brutal injecting her knees, which enraged me!! A Drs Hippocratic oath is "Do no harm". And now the dumb modern world one says "Cause no pain". But Dr Pitel caused a lot of harm and pain today. I talked to an older male patient and after his procedure, he told a family member that today Dr. Petel hurt him really bad, and his neck injections went very bad. That he'd never have it done again. Dr. Pitel booked a lot of patients with me including only caring about getting paid big money by the majority of people he sees for injections. This clinic overbooks a lot of patients every time I'm there. I'm truly enraged at how unprofessional this clinics Drs can be. Especially Dr. Pitel who imo only cares about getting paid instead of caring for his patients who come to him for relief. I'm truly let down by this and the unprofessionalism of the Drs as they overtook and made me wait almost 4 hours to have a simple injection done. Especially when I saw Dr. Pitel walking his dog around and not even being in the clinic for hours while 2 other patients waited 4 hours to be seen. This truly enraged me. Totally unprofessional and bad management.|Don't go here if you have lots of pain. They don't care about figuring out why. They just want you to keep coming back to make money off you. All they care about is getting you off narcotics doesn't matter if you are in pain or not. I was there for over 4 months trying to get shots for my back so I could then have them lower my daily dose. They kept botching the paperwork to get them approved then blamed me. Now I had been on shots before but not for my back. Insurance wanted the documents showing this. I told them when and where I got them done. Signed the release forms for them. Just for the next month to have to do same thing. Over and over. Yet I was not complying with them. They need to be investigated by the medical board and the DEA.
There is more as well.|My fiance has been in ridiculous pain and trying to get an mri forever with this old worthless stimulator in her back. All she needed was updated paperwork to finally get it figured out and Raiker decides to leave early and cancels her appointment. He's been doing this forever! This place will never change. Ridiculous expensive unnecessary and invasive procedures that don't work for crap.|I've gone to this pain clinic for years now and my experience keeps getting worse. I had a pain pump to give me pain medicine through my spine that was put in by a different clinic. I had that for about three years; I noticed it was bulging and moved around and let this pain clinic know for months. After being ignored for that time, the device worked its way out of my flesh and into the open air - causing a severe spinal infection. They had me go for surgery to get it taken out (while telling me I should get another surgery to get another one put in; My response to that was, "Heck no!") The surgeon asked why I took so long to have surgery to get it fixed and I told him, "I've told your nurse practitioner about this for months and she said there was nothing to worry about." I had the surgery, only to constantly have spinal fluid pouring out of my spine. The pain clinic told me to stop calling so frequently and said it's "normal." I had severe spinal headaches for nearly a month when they finally decided to do another surgery to fix the issue; The surgeon didn't seal my spinal cord correctly. I was miserable and they didn't care. Now the clinic is suggesting a nerve block - another procedure the surgeon could botch. The wait time is ridiculous and the staff doesn't care about you. Go elsewhere.

Edit: The pain clinic can't keep any staff for more than a few weeks, all the practitioners are incompetent and I think I'm done coming here.|My mother goes to this clinic , I take her every month and it use to be fast & good people. Now we are waiting 2 even sometimes 4 hours here.  I'm usually late to work because of it.  This lady always schedules everyone the same day and times making it crowded and no where to sit with extremely long wait times.  I understand that doctor's appointments take time but I don't believe that this is the issue here.  I believe that the doctor is just not that great and doesn't schedule people the right way.  I work in healthcare & to me this is just crazy.|I've been going to this pain clinic for about 2 years now. When I started, it was great. The last few months, my visits were taking around 4 to 5 hours. People waiting to be called back They are They were laying on the floor sleeping  The nurse had called a woman back that was sleeping in the chair. She had been waiting for about 5 hours. The nurse stood by the door offering no assistance to the lady. She was in the chair crying because she couldn't get up So myself and a few other people had helped her up and over to the door to the nurse I had talked to the pa about doing the Paint pump so I went out to the fremont clinic and I was very anxious and scared to have this procedure done They called me back, laid me face down on a table. The 2 nurses were talking about their children's baseball game. And told me the doctor would be in in a few minutes He was not even in the building. He was still driving to the location. I laid there for about a 1/2 an hour. They didn't even acknowledge that I was in the room. The doctor came in, told me. You will feel some pressure in a pinch. But please do not move told that I needed to go to the recovery room for about an hour. I went to the recovery room for about 10 minutes and they told me I could leave mind you. I have never met doctor Riker's before. Never even seen the man's face he come in and done a procedure on me. Didn't even introduce himself after that i could not get off the table and the nurses did not even help me I struggled for about 5 minutes to get up. And then I was told I was supposed to wait in the recovery room for about an hour. After ten minutes, the nurse told me I could leave fter that trial I felt like I was being pushed in the having this procedure done. Almost bullied in a way I almost felt like if I did not get the procedure done They would not continue itreating me for my pain I would not recommend this this pain management clinic to anybody|Probably the one competent pain clinic in the state, I should know since I've been to a lot. This is the first place I've been to that had doctors who I didn't have to teach about medicine (which is how it should be.) I understand from reviews it looks like they used to have some staffing problems but right now they're training a lot of people and I haven't had any unreasonable wait times personally. Linan especially is one of the most competent healthcare providers I've ever interacted with and takes my pain seriously which is very refreshing after years of being told to "just live with it".

Update: they got rid of the only good pain doctor I've ever found|Been going here for about 4 months and when I started I felt so comfortable the physician Nikki listened to me and you could tell she really cared and wanted to help. She was always on time to the appts never waited more than a few minutes. Recently she has moved on and it's been a nightmare between waiting over 45 minutes to an hour and getting your meds plus the communication. A week ago I had called as I had to take more of my pain meds then normal due to a neck issue and it was ok'd but they wouldn't send anymore which was fine I just made sure I had enough until today when I had to see dr again. This morning I had to have a tooth cut out of my mouth mind you I satin dentist chair for an hr and 45 mins and my dentist prescribed medication for pain. Well today was also my pain dr appt and I advised her of this and she told me not to take what dentist gave which was ok as I thought my medicine would've been sent over after at 1215 which nope it was not. I had called 3 times as I'm in all sorts of pain back, neck, and now mouth and they said it would be sent. Well it's 545 and still no medicine.  The communication is not how it should be and it makes me sad as it's a beautiful clinic, the nurse who assist are awesome but the provider Janie is not so friendly or organized.

Craniofacial Pain Center Of Nebraska in Lincoln, Nebraska specializes in diagnosing and treating complex craniofacial pain disorders, TMJ dysfunction, and related conditions that affect the head, face, and neck regions. At the Craniofacial Pain Center Of Nebraska, our team of specialists focuses on treating a wide spectrum of conditions including temporomandibular joint disorders (TMD), orofacial pain, headaches, migraines, sleep apnea, and related neuromuscular issues. We understand that these conditions can significantly impact quality of life, which is why we employ a multidisciplinary approach that may include physical therapy, oral appliances, medication management, and behavioral interventions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

State-of-the-Art Facility and Technology

Located at 4131 Pioneer Woods Dr #101, Lincoln, NE 68506, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic tools that allow for precise assessment of craniofacial conditions. This technological foundation enables our practitioners to develop evidence-based treatment plans that address both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies.

Patient-Centered Approach

column2: Arthritis Knee Pain Clinic of Omaha
column3:
Arthritis Knee Pain Clinic of Omaha serves residents throughout Omaha, Nebraska and surrounding communities with specialized treatments for knee arthritis. Our dedicated medical team focuses exclusively on non-surgical interventions designed to alleviate pain, improve mobility, and enhance quality of life for those suffering from degenerative knee conditions. With years of experience in orthopedic care, our clinic has helped thousands of patients find relief without resorting to invasive surgical procedures.

We offer two primary breakthrough therapies that have shown remarkable results for our patients:

  • Viscosupplementation - FDA-approved therapy that replaces depleted synovial fluid in the knee joint

  • PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) Injections - Utilizing your body's natural healing properties to reduce inflammation and promote tissue repair

Advanced Technology

Our treatments are administered using state-of-the-art digital imaging technology that ensures precise placement of injections. This accuracy is crucial for maximizing effectiveness and minimizing discomfort during the procedure. The viscosupplementation gel works by lubricating and cushioning the knee joint, effectively mimicking the natural fluid that has diminished due to arthritis.

Patient Benefits

Many patients report significant improvement shortly after beginning our therapy protocol. Our treatments may delay or even eliminate the need for expensive, painful knee replacement surgery. We're proud to offer solutions that are:

  • Minimally invasive

  • Performed in-office

  • Covered by most insurance plans, including Medicare

  • Clinically proven to reduce pain and improve function

Get Started Today

We invite you to take advantage of our no-charge, no-obligation knee screening to determine if our treatments are right for you. Contact us at (402) 315-4415 to schedule your appointment or visit our website at www.omahakneepain.com for more information. Our clinic is conveniently located at 3908 N 138th St, Omaha, NE 68164.
column9: Medical clinic|Medical group|Orthopedic clinic|Pain control clinic
column11: At Arthritis Knee Pain Clinic of Omaha, we offer viscosupplementation and PRP injections for people suffering from knee arthritis. Our breakthrough, FDA approved therapy may delay or even replace the need for expensive, painful surgery. Our protocol replaces the depleted fluid in your knee using state-of-the-art digital imaging technology. This ensures that the viscosupplementation injection (which lubricates and cushions the knee joint) is administered in exactly the right place. Many of our patients feel better shortly after our therapy. Our treatment is covered by most insurance companies, including Medicare. Call today to schedule your no-charge, no obligation knee screening!

column40: This is one of the doctors I have been too.  When I hurt my back a few years ago I was sent to him by workers comp. column38: Bryar Godfrey|Joshua East|Eleanor F|Patrick Rupp|Linda Caulder|Susan Seeman|Uriah Giroux|Monica Henry
column40:
Staff is untrained in ADA law on reference tp service dogs. Was asked for documentation, then asked for vaccination records. Left without even finishing paperwork. Left shaking and in tears. Do not recommend this place. They need to train staff in legalities and federal law. Horrible experience! I had driven from Blair to Fremont for this appointment! Will be reporting them to ADA.|Dr. Raikar will always be my hero. I showed up in 2013 with a terrible case of crps and was in terrifying pain and immobility. He stood up for me and was the only one who would truly do something to help me. He is agressive and serious about treating pain. However, this is because he really knows what its like to hurt from experience. He will do something about your pain and attack it because he want his patience to have relief. If your not prepared for serious action then he might not be right for you but if you are in true desperate pain, he will change your life. He fought so hard to get me a cervical stimulator which did fail in 2014 due to a different surgeon after a perfect trial done by Dr. Raikar. He is an incredible mastermind. There is nobody better than him period.

However, at this point I experience relief. He showed me what was possible. I let him down tremendously with a slipping off with my pain medications. But what Dr. Raikar doesnt know is that I straightened up right away at my first chance. I completely turned my life around and started my own company. All because of his incredible injections he bought me time. I stayed honed in for almost 9 years on that relief from that stimulator.

Fast forward to 2023 and I had now spent 4 years being told nobody can get this stimulator in my body correctly. But I would tell them that I saw a guy do it like nothing. I finally had 2 of the most incredible surgeons install a new stimulator to perfection. It has saved my life and completely turned me around again after another near fallout from pain. My point is he was right. What everyone else saw as crazy and too extreme was exactly what I needed. But, Dr. Raikar isnt afraid. He will try. Things arent always perfect but Dr. Raikar I appreciate you more than I have words for. Ive never forgotten what you did and I hope Ive made you proud. We did it. I have it installed and I am one very successful guy. I am still working on my conscience of letting you and Lee down so bad but we are getting better. My new pain Doc is helping me through it. I landed  the best in Northern Colorado. A whole team now that has been astounded by your abilities and insights you gave me. Wish you could see how amazing I am doing now with this thing at c3 through c8.
I still think about you a lot and you take care!!!!
Thank you for believing in me you had to know that I never turned back|This doctor straight up botched my spinal surgery. I had a pain pump that was put in by a different clinic. I had let the nurse practitioner know for months the device was moving and bulging; She said there was nothing to worry about. Eventually the device worked its way outside of my flesh and into the open air - causing a severe spinal infection. I came in for surgery to have it removed. He suggested I get another surgery to have a new pain pump put in but I refused. He didn't seal up my spinal cord properly and I was leaking spinal fluid for nearly a month, all while calling the clinic and being told "it's normal" and they asked me to stop calling them so much. Finally they decided to fix the leak in my spinal cord. I wouldn't have any procedure done by this surgeon!|I have been seeing Dr. Raikar since 2002 in both Fremont and Omaha, plus some of his satellite offices.  The Fremont location is state of the art and has separation from the Office, Surgery Center, & PT.  He is one of the nation's leading pain specialist for many years and there is no one like him in the Midwest at all.  His patient load is extreme due to his Specialty and half the time he is in surgery, which personally I have had many.  His staff support is Amazing.  Be prepared to wait at any of the offices, bring a book or tablet, it's worth waiting to be treated by the Best of the Best.|I don't have 100% relief but with back injuries you never do no matter what. He's awesome and I love how he gets the injections done quick and spot on with no poking around several times trying to find the spot. The staff is AMAZING I wouldn't go see anyone else ever.|I take my 90 year mother there several times a year for procedures and appointments to relieve back pain.  We have to wait well over an hour, sometimes up to two hours every time.   Dr. Raikar has no respect for a patient's time. The procedures he performs help the pain, but we are strongly considering finding another doctor even if we do have to travel into Omaha.   It would take less time to drive to and from Omaha than it does to sit in his waiting room.|Total joke of a doctor.  Only after your money.  I came in originally and when I had Medica Insurance it was plenty of time and service, then I had to switch this year and it went from a actual Dr visit to about two minutes where he would just walk in the room prescription in hand hand just complain about my insurance then leave.  Oh and the very first time I saw him, I was on a low dose of oxycodone, and he immediately suggested I get a 20+ thousand dollar surgery to have a freaking morphine pump installed.  Said it would give me a real "whopping" amount of pain relief, I.e. get me very high and addicted.  Yeah, thanks but no thanks Dr. They make you sign a no THC contract, but they will find any excuse to terminate you as a client and leave you with nothing but painful withdrawals if they feel their not extracting enough money from you or your insurance.  Great job guys..|All I can say is that him and his APRN Melissa Okun don't want to listen, my husband took 3years backwards, they have him on oxycodone and we both said that it does nothing for him. My husband has No quality of life. Thank you so much for setting him back, where he used to have 4 good days to zero. We started out with oxy and hydro. Put him on meds that worked put a stimulator in and now we are back to ground zero. Thank you so much for nothing but taking our money.

Midwest Pain Clinic in Omaha, Nebraska offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the metropolitan area and surrounding communities. Strategically located at 730 S 38th Ave, our clinic combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified specialists utilizes evidence-based approaches to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At Midwest Pain Clinic, we provide a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy coordination, and behavioral health support. Our specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology enabling us to offer advanced interventional procedures such as epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted drug delivery systems. These minimally invasive techniques provide alternatives to traditional surgery and often result in faster recovery times with fewer complications.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating partnerships with our patients through education and shared decision-making. Our team takes the time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition, explain treatment options, and develop customized care plans that align with individual goals and preferences. This collaborative approach has helped countless patients reclaim their lives from debilitating pain.

Contact Information

Midwest Pain Clinic

730 S 38th Ave

Omaha, NE 68105

United States

Our convenient location near the intersection of 38th Avenue and Leavenworth Street provides easy access for patients throughout the Omaha metropolitan area. The clinic offers ample parking and is accessible for patients with mobility challenges.

column38: Paulina Garcia|Amie Massey|JohnJohn|Randy Rope|Deanna Waller|Allison Stauffer|Joshua Scheele|Nameless Ghoul
column40:
I was referred to Dr Soares and as he was adding pressure to my neck to see if it caused pain, I tried explaining a tense cramping feeling it would cause. He was not satisfied with that response and asked if it was pain, i reiterated that it felt tense and uncomfortable. He responded arrogantly telling me not to change my words because those feelings are not pain and should only be a yes or no answer. A true doctor should take in consideration what one feels regardless if its related to "real pain" or not.|This "doctor" misdiagnosed my pain that I had in my lower back. Turns out I have to have lumbar surgery. He acted like nothing was wrong with me. Also my sister has been a patient. She has severe RA & completely disabled. He refused her meds without a careforher as a person. She is waiting for a shoulder replacement & Achilles tendon surgery. Thanks Dr Saorez....for nothing!|I've been to my fair share of Pain Management Dr's. I had been seeing Dr. Raikar, who had me pumped up on narcotic pain medicine, and treated me like an experimental pain cushion. Although some injections helped, he never kept up with those injections. He always came up with a reason to do other injections/procedures, that offered no help at all. Then, he kept pressuring me to allow him to put in another type of internal stimulator, than the 1 i have. Overall, it had me worried, for my long term health. So my Dr. suggested Dr. Soares. And so far, I've gotten my pain medicine cut in half. While it is affecting me to a degree, he is at least working with my surgeon to come up with the best way to move forward. And for that, I am truly appreciative.|Soares has a very poor attitude when it comes to listening to his patients! I have been on Oxycodone for over 4 years and every time I had to go see him for about 5 minutes, he was always trying to trick me into saying that it's not working and was going to take me off of oxycodone. I've tried about everything else but oxycodone was the only thing that worked. He put me on a pain patch that I told him that I've tried before and it didn't work but it was either that or nothing.I happened to have a rotator cuff surgery and my surgeon gave me oxycodone along with a couple of other medications when I had a script from Soares and that really set Soares off. He immediately got mad telling me I was non compliant and he was taking it away. He also used the excuse that I couldn't be trusted to take my meds right. I had told him that if I didn't need it for a day or so, I wouldn't take it. He said that I wasn't taking it according to his instructions, and that's all it to to have it taken away. There are several other issues that come into play that I'm not going to get into now, so I'm just going to stop here. Final answer is  he has a terrible attitude and I wouldn't recommend seeing him! He started out as a decent guy but got a lot worse! I understand that the regulations for opioids have changed and it may not be all his fault but I think there are a lot better ways to work with the patient.|I went to him for my back pain and he was rude and didn't listen to a word i said or my chart. I was taking tramadol and told him it does not help at all he tells me that is all he would prescribe. He told me he could do a lumbar block and they would contact my insurance to see if it was covered and they would let me know. That was last November and i still haven't heard from his office. When I called them to ask about the procedure they told me someone would call me back.
well I have still not heard back from his office. This Doctor is a quack and needs to retire. Worst doctor I have been to.|The only reason I give this so-called doctor a 1 star is so I can give a review.  Save your money and time!! He tried to tell me my pain is in my left lumbar, when he clearly was looking at my MRI, I got up, said no thank you and left.
He has no manners and treated me like a idiot.|Dr. Soares is always very professional and has been my pain doctor for a few years now.  The staff is very friendly and professional too.  All my pain is managed very well because of Dr. Soares.

Thank you!

Josh|TLDR; pain docs are polarizing depending on if they help you, but Soares is a nice guy and tries.

I was NERVOUS because the reviews, which are unfair so I wanted to correct the record. Dr Soares took his time with me, listened to every concern, and was very kind. I did tell him I did not want to change my medications which are via my PCP, so I cannot say how it goes to talk to him about narcotics. My PCP had told me when he referred to Soares that he is conservative about narcotics--which i strongly prefer. I have seen other pain management docs who brushed off my pain. Soares was so much better. He was kind, listened, and recognized my diagnosis and how CRPS was 'missed'. He has the experience with CRPS that a lot of metro doctors don't. We talked about a spinal implant and I had a LOT of questions; when he didn't know the answer, he admitted it. And, on a follow up, he had that answer, so he looked into it. Listen, seeing a pain doc is a BAD TIME. If you're (legitimately) here, you're in debilitating pain, probably at the end of your rope and desperate. Maybe he can help, maybe not, but as a doctor he's a good one.
