column38: Alma Griffin|Stephanie Veurink|bruce hodgins|Dusten Rydstrom|Delaine Krager|Kris Hoffman|Shane M|Kris Gray
column40:
I absolutely adore Dr. King. He takes his time, listens, explains everything, & always has my best interest at heart. The dr's who administer my epidurals, are very efficient, quick, gentle & godsends. The nurses are all wonderful, patient, & caring. My only concern is the front desk staff at the clinic could use some refreshers on customer service & having empathy towards the patients. Other than that, everything else is great!|My grandma is 76 years old and has chronic pain. She has been treating for her pain for the past 20+ years and has never been treated poorly until transferring here. She transferred her pain management care here due to her last provider retiring and this is the only facility left in this area who can provide pain management services with controlled substances. I had a very upsetting experience with this nurse practitioner when she saw my grandma, who is hard of hearing. From the start, she walked in with a scowl on her face, which immediately made my grandmother feel uneasy. Her tone was snippy and condescending, and it was clear she didn't have the patience or understanding for someone with hearing difficulties. When my grandma asked her to repeat something, instead of speaking more clearly or trying to help, the nurse practitioner just seemed annoyed, which was incredibly frustrating and disrespectful. It's deeply concerning that someone in a healthcare role would treat elderly, hard-of-hearing patient this way. She also kept saying my grandma was argumentative. My response to this is she is clearly in pain. You should be trained to handle negative interactions when someone is in pain and be more understanding. Especially when reducing her pain medication in half after she has been on the same dose for over 10+ years. If reduction is necessary, tapering off gradually should be the correct step. She also does not talk to my grandma in a way she understands by explaining her reasons for reducing her medication like a grown adult, she just acts cold and says: "why don't you have your social worker prescribe you meds then?" My Grandma doesn't understand all of the medical jargon which is why I went with her to this last appointment, and she is depressed and anxious about having to interact with this provider. Oh, and two weeks ago was supposed to be her appointment. My grandma showed me her card. I drove all the way to her appointment, plus my grandma has to get ready to go out in the cold, to be told she doesn't have an appointment. So, two weeks later at this appointment, I asked the Nurse Practitioner what happened, she said my grandma stormed off before it got scheduled. I find this hard to believe since my grandma is in a wheelchair and can't move without someone pushing her wheelchair. My Grandma told me it was the nurse practitioner who stormed off and said my grandma is too difficult to deal with. She left her ALONE in the patient room to open up a heavy door and ask for help to get out. The nurse practitioner also wrote it on the card when her appointment was, so my grandma left under the impression she has an appointment. I came with her to this appointment because she felt she was being mistreated, and I wanted to make sure she was getting the attention and care she needed. I wasn't expecting this level of treatment. Healthcare providers, especially those who deal with patients experiencing pain, should be properly trained in how to manage not only the physical aspects of pain but also the emotional and behavioral challenges that often come with it. Patients in pain can become frustrated, anxious, or even irritable, and it's essential for providers to approach them with empathy, patience, and understanding. Effective communication is key, especially when it comes to patients who may have additional challenges, like being hard of hearing or elderly. A provider who is trained in pain management should be able to recognize these behaviors and respond in a way that makes the patient feel heard and respected, rather than dismissed or frustrated. Unfortunately, we were told she can't transfer providers as the clinic has a policy that she needs to stay with the provider she started with. I understand this policy because you shouldn't doctor hop to get the medication you want, but because of the disconnect in communication and the personality clash/disrespect I would think this would be considered. I will look into telehealth as there is no other provider in this area for pain management.|The arthritis in both of my hands is so severe that I could not do simple functions and had almost zero grip, until I was referred to Dunes Pain Specialists..  I am so thankful for everything they do for me, and they are so mindful of my overall health. Thank you all for giving me back a better quality level of health to my life.|For the last 3-4 years I have been a patient of the Dunes Pain Specialist in Dakota Dunes and everything was fine up until recently. I really enjoyedy Drs that I had and felt like I was heard by the Drs to help get to the bottom of my pain management. The problem that I had was just recently, I got sick with walking Pneumonia and the Dr and nurses made it possible to still have my appt over telehealth while I was sick. However, I guess they expect you to call even when you're sick on your death bed to call and schedule the next appointment and didn't tell me this during my telehealth visit, they just assumed I knew. When it came to scheduling my next appointment my husband made the call for me and was told there were no available appointments in November so they scheduled me a visit on Dec 9!!!! Called my pharmacy to request a refill on meds (controlled substances that will send someone into withdrawal) and they denied it stating that I needed to have a face to face visit which is fine but not until Dec9! They offered to send in a med to help with withdrawal and when I tried to plead my case to them (having pneumonia which I'm still battling) the nurse got nasty and snippy with me. I did match her tone, she kept asking me if I wanted a copy of my "contract" if I understood the terms of it and when I asked her if she understood that I have been really really sick with pneumonia this nurse pretty much hung up on me. I'm frustrated with this place because I am being "punished" having my contract terminated and my healthcare stopped here because the nurse Bethany was rude to me and to my husband when he called!! When I called back down there today I was told that the Dr decided to terminate and keep it that way! My suggestion to people looking to Dr here is be very very very careful because as it seems that nurse in particular most likely wasn't honest with the Drs and told them I was rude and hostile on the phone and I absolutely was not! It was very apparent they can treat you like absolute crap and get away with it! Also you can't be extremely sick and miss Manning an appointment!|I have had good experiences with DPS. I find my situation and pain levels are taken seriously and followed up in a timely manner. David King clicks with me and under a hands my situations, pains, and problematic issues.|My wife has been in terrible pain for months and has been going here to try and get relief.  She told me that when she calls to ask questions that they have been very rude.  I just listened to the most recent call and rude would have been refreshing.  As the nurse was belittling my wife because the doctors are "so busy" I jumped in and told her that they way she was treating ny wife was not ok.
If I had an employee treat my patient or customer that way I would be appalled and would fire them immediately for fear that they are costing me money by turning patients away.  You would think that with the amount of money that they charge for their treatments that they could afford to have some training on customer service and how to have some sympathy for the patients that are just trying to find some relief.  I did get the name of the lady we spoke to but in the interest of being decent I won't post it.  By not posting its my hope that they overhaul their phone etiquette across the board.|What a complete waste of time!!!! Tells you your scheduled then turns around and says your not. Very disappointed as I go through excruciating pain everyday! They claim to oh care so much about your pain but they don't in my opinion!!!! Due to all this I cancelled my contract as I don't like being misled!!!|Dr Jermey Paulson is an amazing doctor. He is the only one I trust when it comes to burning my nerves and given me all my other epidurals for pain. His colleague David King is wonderful too. Do to my place of employment, I have met several of the other doctors they work with and I must say they are a great group of guys! They seem to be smiling every time I see them, very nice, very caring, great sense of humor's and down to earth!

Creighton Pain & Management in Omaha, Nebraska offers comprehensive pain management services designed to improve quality of life for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. As part of the respected CHI Health network, our specialized team combines evidence-based medical approaches with personalized treatment plans to address the unique needs of each patient. Located in the heart of Omaha, we serve residents throughout eastern Nebraska and western Iowa with compassionate care focused on pain relief and functional improvement.

At Creighton Pain & Management, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and behavioral health strategies. Our board-certified specialists are experienced in treating a wide range of conditions, including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible to provide effective relief with reduced recovery time.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that pain affects each person differently, our team takes time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition, medical history, and personal goals. This comprehensive assessment allows us to develop tailored treatment plans that address not only the physical aspects of pain but also its emotional and psychological impacts. Our goal is to help patients regain function and improve their overall quality of life through sustainable pain management strategies.

Their facility is equipped to perform various minimally invasive procedures on-site, allowing for convenient and efficient care delivery.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes The Center for Wellness and Pain Care is their commitment to treating each patient as an individual with unique needs. Their physicians take time to thoroughly evaluate each case, listen to patients' concerns, and develop customized treatment plans that align with personal health goals. This patient-centered philosophy extends to their administrative processes, with staff dedicated to helping navigate insurance and scheduling concerns.

For more information about their services or to schedule a consultation, patients can call +1 702-476-9700 or visit their comprehensive website at www.cwpclv.com.

column40: i absolutely love the dedication these providers have for their patients. I have been seen by Harlyn & Dr. Campbell for close to 4 years now, they have been so amazing and supportive with all of my care. I couldn't be more thankful for having such amazing doctors who have become like family to me. Jessica who is the receptionist is absolutely phenomenal at her job she is always so welcoming. Aubrey who is an assistant is always so so sweet & she's so caring. They have all been with me through an insanely difficult time in my life. As i finish my treatment with this office, i am so thankful for the staff, for the treatments they have provided & for always fighting for me to have a better quality of life. 1000% recommend this place to ANYONE !!! Thank you Harlyn & Dr.Campbell for giving me my life back.|Thank You to The Center for Wellness and Pain Care. They gave me excellent care after my car accident. The staff are professional, compassionate, and attentive. Special shout out to Harlyn Veloso for being an awesome Pain Management Specialist. She truly cares about her patients. I got better due to her great care.|The staff at the Green Valley location are professional and efficient! From the front desk staff to the medical providers. Genny is always so kind and personable, she truly takes pride in her work. All of the medical providers are knowledgeable. However, my provider Mae is phenomenal. She takes her time with her patients, I never feel rushed.|I like some of the NP's I have seen here and have been a patient for over five years. My main problem with CWPC is scheduling. I currently go to the Green Valley office. I transferred over from the Cimmeron office two years ago. My first Np at the Cimmeron office was amazing. She was ex-military and ran a tight ship. Never any issues with her. The decline began when she left. Scheduling has been an issue from the beginning. When you call you are speaking to people who have been trained in automatic responses and have no personal connection to you. Many times there now, I have been in a situation where I receive a call at the last minute saying my appt. Has been cancelled and I need to reschedule.  Then after I reached them the next day because I couldn't call them back directly since they called right before closing, I rescheduled my appt. only to be called with another cancelation. I have run out of medicine for days because they have done this to me back to back. Leaving me writhing in pain until they finally see me and call my medicine in. Their telahealth has always been a problem for me. I wind up missing my appointment there because of one bug in the system or another. It is all super frustrating and I am seriously considering finding an alternative pain management. My body cannot afford this kind of stress with delayed solutions and apologies, leaving me in worse pain than I started with.|I have been a patient of Dr. Campbell for 4+ years now. Dr. Nakoba was added to the team over a year ago. If you are dealing with pain & want REAL help, come see them! The Green Valley office is my preferred. From the front desk, Jessica, to the back office & seeing Dr. Nakoba, the welcoming feeling they give you will make any bad day better.|Out of all the locations I've been to over all the years I have been in pain management Dr. Cambell is by far the most compassionate, understanding about his patients and their needs, and treats his patients as he would his very own family. However the Green Valley location always treats you like they would their own. From the moment you walk in you're greeted by nothing but good attitudes and smiles especially from Jessica at the front Desk Jeanni the nurse assistant always giving her personal touch to each patient. Gohnoy is always willing to help and cordial with an incredibly fun and joyful personality. Audrey is always pleasant and sweet always trying to accommodate any extra needs. The staff always goes above and beyond whenever possible. They really care about their patients and knowing everyone on a first name basis is a testament to that. Thanks to all. Blessings|I have been going to the Green Valley offices for a year. They have used many different methods to try to alleviate my pain. Some better than others.  The best part is the staff. Jessica,Jon,Jeannie,Tony are wonderful to work with. All the PAs are great and Dr Wenz and Campbell are terrific for the surgical procedures.  Have also lost 37 lbs with the  Semaglutide. I highly recommend the wellness center for all your needs|I love coming here, they are all awesome and get you in and out quickly as they can. Very caring staff and that's a huge plus for me. Thank you all for caring and being awesome  Jessica is also the kindest person and a pleasure to be greeted by her.

PRIMMED Pain Institute - Southern Hills in Las Vegas, Nevada serves patients throughout the region with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists focuses on helping individuals reclaim their quality of life through personalized treatment approaches. Since our establishment, we have built a reputation for combining evidence-based medical interventions with compassionate care, ensuring that each patient receives the attention and expertise they deserve.

At PRIMMED Pain Institute, we understand that pain is a complex and deeply personal experience. Our advanced pain physicians work diligently to develop tailored treatment models that address the unique needs of each patient. Through thorough evaluations and consultations, we create individualized management plans that incorporate a spectrum of treatment components, from minimally invasive procedures to medication management and rehabilitative therapies.

Our Approach to Patient Care

What sets us apart is our commitment to helping patients achieve a healthy lifestyle beyond just pain relief. We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our multidisciplinary approach considers physical, emotional, and lifestyle factors that contribute to chronic pain conditions, allowing us to provide more effective and sustainable solutions for our patients.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 5741 S Fort Apache Rd #120, Las Vegas, NV 89148, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. The comfortable environment we've created helps patients feel at ease during their visits, contributing to a more positive treatment experience.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 702-798-0111. Our friendly staff is ready to assist you with any questions and guide you through the process of becoming a patient at PRIMMED Pain Institute. For additional information about our practice and services, visit our website at https://primmed.org/.
column11: PriMMed Pain Institute is helping patients achieve a healthy lifestyle. Our advanced pain physicians will tailor a comprehensive treatment model that provides each patient with an individualized management plan with a spectrum of treatment components.

column40:
I came as a new patient after my car accident hoping to get relief and care for my injuries.

Ashley stayed with me from start to finish and was a huge part in making me comfortable. she explained everything from start to finish of my appointment and was reassuring when I needed injections. The injections were not comfortable but her and the doctor talked and coached me through them.

I appreciate the transparency the firm has pertaining to forms, records requests, and extra steps they took to ensure there was no history or drug abuse as prescriptions for medications were needed.|Had a terrible experience here, probably the worst of my life. I wasn't supposed to eat before my procedure, but wasn't told. So when I came in and informed them I'd eaten, they said it was fine and that the anesthesia would just be "tapered".
The shot I got was the most painful experience of my life, I was screaming on the table.
I would've happily rescheduled rather than go through this. They never mentioned extra pain as a result of less anesthesia.
I expressed how upset I was, a doctor never came and spoke to me. They just sent me on my way, not caring at all how upset I was.
I'm concerned that I have nerve damage in my back now because I was flopping around like a fish on the table with a needle in my back.
I can't believe this just happened to me|Impossible to get in touch with. PAs see patients and can only discuss 1 questions per visit. Practice attempted to set up a procedure with me on the wrong body part entirely because their records were mixed up. Doctor did a procedure, gave me instructions for aftercare, and rolled me out the door despite my pain having been so severe I was falling and passing out. Now they are unreachable and not taking appointments and I have been unable to get around safely on my own for a week after this surgery. There is nobody at this practice who has any care or concern for the well being or healing of patients.|Dr Lee is very nice, however last time I was seen by PA Christina Soliman and was made to feel like a junkie needing her fix. Mind you,... I hadn't been there in over a year as I only come in if my neck gets too tight. Most medications do not work to loosen up the knots I get in my neck and shoulder. As someone who only comes in once or twice every 1-2 years I don't feel they should be telling me about not prescribing certain medications because of the risk of misuse. Use your PMP people! I don't doctor shop and yes am in fact an RN whose body is basically falling apart from caring for patients in the ER the past 20 years! Not everyone is looking to get high when they come in... and yes, some people generically need stronger meds. I feel sorry for DR Lee as he is great but this practitioner needs some more training or to see how she feels after 2 decades of lifting, moving, restraining patients! Also, the front desk staff either didn't get pre approval or didn't use an anesthesiologist that was covered and certainly didn't tell me I was going to receive a bill for almost $900 for an epidural in my neck that didn't even work. Dr Lee, you are great but the rest of the office needs work. I don't think I will be back as your PA made me feel as though I was a drug seeker and that's terrible.|Dr.lee is the best doctor I've known.he has the most awesome staff they all are hands on and very kind.im sending all thanks to Ciara.Mahea..Maylene..Mariah..thank u all so much for a job well done keep up the good work..Pamela south|My medication was due four days ago. I have called consistently, emailed and wrote several messages on there helow app. The staff has been nothing, but rude and disrespectful. The front office have lied to me day after day stating that it will be handled by the end of day....well this is day four and I've had to go to the hospital two times because of this! I can't walk without assistance and I've had several failed back surgeries. I have extremely bad pain from not only that but cancer. I was yelled at by Amanda . The Doctor called my medication into the wrong pharmacy and now it's all of a sudden my fault and here four days later nothing still hasn't been called in and to top it off I'm being yelled at and disrespected by Amanda. What happened to being professional, and showing some compassion for someone who's in extreme pain and can't even get out of bed without my medication.  It's now the end of the fourth day on a Friday and I called the office back at 4:00 p.m , I've been on hold for 55 minutes, so I decided to call back on my sons phone and they picked up on the first ring, so that proves that they screen there calls and Nasi hung up the phone as soon as she knew it was me! I can't believe this is what they do to there patients. I wonder if the Doctors are aware of how the front desk is sabotaging there bussiness!|I go in for weekly pain pump adjustments and met PA Maureen who started training this week. She is wonderful, very personable, most professional as it's the first time that the PA has first introduced themselves since Shay a few months back. Keep doing what you're doing Maureen, you'd make an excellent permanent team member there at Primmed.|2 years I was in pain day in night out after a surgery in 2022, the doctors  "didn't know" what they could do or why I can't sit, stand, walk, and especially run post-operative. Moved here, got a new referral from my primary to this place-and 5 min!!! 5 min it took Dr. Mohajer to identify the nerves that were hit during that surgery, order insurance approval and do my shots! I can walk better, still limping a bit but don't really use the walker anymore. And I actually get sleep now, since my pain level is manageable! Dr. Mohajer and Dr.Tio are the best. The whole team is great actually, always nice, always smiling, alway neat, and actually super helpful. Special thanks to Abner, Rachel and Andrea. The impact on the quality of my life-unmeasurable! Forever grateful

column3:
The Center for Wellness and Pain Care of Las Vegas serves residents throughout Las Vegas, Nevada with comprehensive interventional pain management solutions. Founded with a mission to improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions, this specialized medical facility combines advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment protocols. Their team of board-certified physicians and pain management specialists work collaboratively to develop personalized care plans that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

At The Center for Wellness & Pain Care, patients benefit from a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief. The facility offers cutting-edge interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine therapies. Their diagnostic capabilities feature advanced imaging and electrodiagnostic testing to precisely identify pain sources, allowing for targeted treatment strategies that maximize effectiveness while minimizing side effects.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes The Center for Wellness & Pain Care is their unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique needs and circumstances of the individual, with ongoing assessment and adjustment to ensure optimal outcomes. The compassionate staff understands the debilitating impact of chronic pain on daily functioning and emotional wellbeing, providing support that extends beyond medical intervention to include education and lifestyle recommendations.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 6930 S Cimarron Rd, Suite 260 in Las Vegas, their modern facility is equipped with the latest medical technology and designed to create a comfortable, healing environment. The center maintains rigorous standards for safety and efficacy, implementing the most recent advances in pain management science to deliver superior care.

For those seeking relief from chronic pain conditions, The Center for Wellness & Pain Care of Las Vegas offers hope through innovation. To schedule a consultation or learn more about available treatment options, patients can call +1 702-476-9700 or visit their comprehensive website at https://cwpclv.com/.
column11:
About The Center For Wellness And Pain Care
The Center for Wellness & Pain Care of Las Vegas is dedicated to helping its patients through a comprehensive program of interventional pain management. The diagnosis and treatment techniques offered at The Center for Wellness & Pain Care of Las Vegas represent the leading edge of recent medical advances.

column40:
Today while waiting in the lobby for my appointment, I witnessed a customer treat Mayra at the front desk very disrespectful and the way she handled it was amazing. Mayra is always friendly and talks with each patient while having a smile on her face. I have always felt comfortable and welcomed the minute I walk through the door each month. Every staff member treats each patient with high respect. The owner, Dr Campbell is so very kind and sweet. They truly care about every person here at Center For Wellness & Paincare. As a patient going through a weird illness, they have helped navigate my illness and get me the care that I need. For one, the spine stimulator implant was recommended to me and it made a world of a difference in my life! My illness causes weakness, paralysis, nerve pain and the spine stimulator helps me be able to walk as well as helps control my pain along with medication. You will be well taken care of here at Center for Wellness & Paincare. -Nicole H.|All of the doctores are fantastic, especially Mae. I love the front desk employees especially Jessica. She is do friendly and always smiling and makes coming to the doctor a lot less stressful. I have been coming for 3 years and I've had no problems. They bend over backwards to make sure you get the proper treatment for your condition. I highly recommend The Center for Wellness and Pain Care to everyone that needs relief from chronic severe pain.
They also take care accident victims.
5 starts!!|It's hard to get a hold of anyone over the phone, but when someone decides to call you back after you left a message for over a week, it takes about 3-4 weeks to get in an appointment within your schedule. So when I finally schedule a new patient appointment for 3/18/24, it was canceled because their provider isn't available. Mind you, only the NPs see new patients. When requested to see MD/DO, I was told they only see patients with workman's comp or auto accidents. Anyway, new appointment was rescheduled to today 3/25/24 @9a. Arrived 8:30a and doors are locked. So I kept peeping through the tinted windows to see if anyone is in there. I caught one of the front desk's girl attention so she opened the door for me and asked if I had an appointment, my name, DOB, and also confirmed my phone number. Then she proceeded to tell me that I should've gotten a phone call this morning that my appointment was canceled. At this point I'm just frustrated and left. No apologies and no offers to make it right or even to reschedule. Don't waste your time and find yourself a different pain management practice.|The entire staff is caring and responsive. The doctors are willing to chat at length about you and how you can improve. The NPs are knowledgeable and wanting what is best for their patients.  Great place if you're looking for results.|Bradley Tran, M.D., Center for Wellness and Pain Care of Las Vegas (CWPC), is Outstanding as my Chronic Pain Management Specialist and he provides excellent treatments that have significantly lowered my Monthly Pain Level Averages. When you're in pain, long Waiting Room times or having to re-explain your chart history can get frustrating. So, finding a quality Pain Management Specialist with great communication skills, an excellent memory and a well run office is a Godsend. Going to this Pain Care Center every month for the last 10 years I've talked with many new patients and listened to a lot of horror stories. CWPC could improve their Phone Wait-Times and their Message Response-Times but the Phone/Message-Response Wait-Times with pharmacies and health insurance are same. CWPC ticks all the other basic boxes, including many Specialized Treatments and uses "Healow" the best Patient Phone App of all my Doctors. If you need an outstanding Pain Management Specialist make an appointment to see Dr. Bradley Tran. If you found this Review Helpful then smash the Upvote so others can find Bradley Tran, M.D.|Everytime I come to the office the medical assistant Jenny has always been very nice and pleasant.  It's always very welcoming.  That specific office has friendly staff and is very helpful.  I recommend this office to other new patients.|Never got better until I began treatment at Center for Wellness and Pain Care. The staff are such wonderful and caring people, especially Jema who is always helping any way she can. She has always been able to answer any questions that I've had. Thanks to Jema this office is more than a doctor's office, it's an office with staff who cares.

Thank you Jema for all the help and support you have always given me!|Best customer service at front desk greeting me with beautiful smiles. Admitting nurses so wonderful and kind. Physicians are great, willing to help at all times through medication shortages. Wonderful Green Valley office!

Precision Pain Center serves Las Vegas, Nevada with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our state-of-the-art facility located at 7380 W Sahara Ave, Suite 160, combines advanced medical technology with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Since our founding, we have established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider in the Las Vegas Valley, offering evidence-based treatments that focus on both pain reduction and functional improvement.

At Precision Pain Center, we utilize a collaborative and multidisciplinary approach that brings together specialists from various medical backgrounds. Our team works cohesively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. We specialize in treating conditions including back and neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, sports injuries, and post-surgical pain management.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. We understand that pain affects each person differently, which is why we take the time to listen to our patients' concerns and develop individualized treatment strategies. Our goal extends beyond pain relief—we focus on restoring function and improving quality of life through comprehensive care plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and lifestyle modifications.

Advanced Facilities and Expertise

Our modern facility is equipped with the latest diagnostic and therapeutic technologies, allowing us to provide cutting-edge treatments in a comfortable environment. The medical professionals at Precision Pain Center bring years of specialized training and experience in pain management, ensuring that patients receive the highest standard of care available in Las Vegas.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about how we can help manage your pain, visit precisionpaincenter.com or call us at +1 702-779-6800. We are committed to being the best quality pain management center in Las Vegas, dedicated to helping you return to a more active, pain-reduced lifestyle.
column11:
At Precision Pain Center we are committed to be the best quality pain management center in Las Vegas.

Our collaborative and multidisciplinary approach reduces pain and restores function. The focus of our treatment is always on the individual needs of our patients.

Dr. Baird and his staff are wonderful! Dr.Baird is so knowledgeable and answered all my questions! I highly recommend if you are looking for a pain center in the area!|After months of appointments, being pressured into a procedure I told them I had a bad reaction to years before, being misled about said procedure every time I talked to someone from their office, and then having a bad reaction to it(surprise) I was basically told that they wouldn't do anything to help my pain. After the procedure I called the office to get some help because I was in so much pain that I literally wanted to die, they said they wouldn't give me anything for the pain. Went to the follow up appointment where they said they won't give me anything else to help because the medications they have prescribed didn't work (I told them before they prescribed it that none of it has ever worked in the past 10 years but they wouldn't give me the things that did help previously)
When I was leaving in tears and I said "I just don't understand how you could have someone telling you they want to die because they are in so much pain and you won't do anything to help them" Dr Baird seriously told me "well I don't have a magic tool box". No, no magic tool box, but you do have a magic prescription pad that you could magically fill out for something to help me but instead you'd rather I keep paying hundreds of dollars to continue to be in an insane amount of pain with no relief in sight. Thanks a lot.|What a fantastic office this is! I have nothing but positive things to say about my entire experience here, from start to finish. Great staff, lovely office, kind people.|I highly recommend this office for its professional staff and advanced services. Dr. Baird and team are excellent.|Wow Dr. Baird is amazing! I struggled with pain for years and ineffective treatments until seeing him. I'm so grateful to his practice|Dr. Baird is knowledgeable and has a wonderful bedside manner. He was truly concerned about the level of pain I was experiencing and explained all my options thoroughly and in easy to understand terms. I'm able to get back to life now that my pain is under control. I highly recommend this practice and doctor.|The staff at Precision is very professional and friendly. Dr. Baird was kind and took the time to ask appropriate questions in order to understand my concerns. He made me feel like he genuinely cares and knows what he is doing.|Had a great experience at Precision Pain Center. Would highly recommend Dr. Baird!

column3:
Relevium Pain Specialists serves Las Vegas, Nevada with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our board-certified physicians combine cutting-edge treatments with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions that impact quality of life. Located in the northwest area of Las Vegas, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and therapeutic technology designed to identify pain sources and provide effective relief strategies.

At Relevium Pain Specialists, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and alternative treatment options. Our team specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is developed with the goal of maximizing function while minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing meaningful doctor-patient relationships built on trust and open communication. Our practitioners take the time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and explain treatment options in clear, understandable terms. This collaborative approach ensures patients are active participants in their pain management journey and fully informed about their care decisions.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Conveniently located at 7435 W Azure Dr STE 190, Las Vegas, NV 89130, our clinic is easily accessible from major highways and offers ample parking. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to verify benefits and explain coverage options to our patients. For appointments or inquiries, patients can reach us at +1 702-940-8007 or visit our comprehensive website at https://www.paininstitute.com/ to learn more about our services and providers.

column40:
Dr. Travnicek is the best pain management doctor I have ever seen! HANDS DOWN!!! I have been in pain management for years  because of continued spinal issues, etc. I've had extensive surgery and am still in chronic pain! Over all these years I have seen at least 7 different "pain management" doctors. NOT ONE has helped me the way Dr. Travnicek has!! She is so understanding, listens to all your concerns, does everything in her power to help control the pain. Her compassion is so heartwarming, she is a doctor who really cares about her patients' and their well being. I have been her patient since 2019, I finally found a doctor that has actually helped me! She is so incredibly knowledgeable in her field. I will never see another pain management Dr. other than her. She is exactly what one needs when looking for help when the pain is so excruciating and one just does not know where to turn! Turn to Dr. T!

Also, making an appointment is simple. I have never had to wait to get in to see her. The wait time when you arrive and get checked in, is maybe 5 minutes or less. That was shocking to me considering I have waited an hour or more to see other doctors. Her staff is so kind and considerate as well. From Barbara and Rachel at the front desk to Soraya her triage nurse, it's simply the perfect place to be, especially when you are in pain and can't sit and wait to see a doctor for 20, 30 minutes or longer!

I hope for anyone who needs pain management that they read this comment and make an appointment with Dr. Travnicek. You will be SO happy you did. I feel blessed to have found her!
Sincerely, Lori...a very happy patient!|Dr Travnicek provides the upmost care. She listens to me and and my concerns and provides the best course of action. I have been to several doctors who seem to look at their patients as money makers and push them through their office. Dr Travnicek does not do this. She is very patient, great at diagnosing, and coming up with plans that provide pain relief.

The medical assistants and front staff are all wonderful as well. They are always welcoming and discrete. Dr Travnicek has a great practice and am happy to have found her practice.|I have been going to pain management for over 20 years; finding Dr Travnicek was an answer to my prayers! She is extremely professional, along with displaying empathey and compassion. My appointments never feel rushed and she takes the time to truly listen to my needs. First time in a long time I don't feel like just a number being herded through. If I had to say there was one small caveat, it would be that the wait times are a little long. Great doctor, super staff!|Dr Travnicek was able to diagnose and fix my lower back problems and now I'm back to being able to exercise, bend over and stand for a much longer periods.  The treatments were almost pain free and she and her staff are professional and cheerful and quickly put one at ease. Highly recommend her!|Amazing Doctor!! I am one of Dr. Travincek patients and love how she interacts with her patients; she listens to her patients concerns and truly cares about all she helps. I highly recommend
her to anyone looking for a pain doctor. When I was first seen by her, I could tell she was compassionate, caring and unlike any other doctor I have been seen by.  She is one of the BEST!!|I am so happy that my cousin Michelle Gardea told me about Dr. Travnicek. I came to her for a second opinion for steroid epidurals instead of 5 epidurals she said two would be the best for my situation. We did the procedure last week and the inflammation is so much better. I am back to PT and on a road to recovery because of the Pain Institute. When or if i need anything else done to my spine i will be seeing Dr T. Thank you and your staff!|I felt validated and respected by all the staff. The Doctor was very compassionate.
I received trigger point injections and I experienced some relief.
I hope to continue to build my relationship with Dr Travnicek.|Dr. Travnicek is one of those doctors that takes her time to get to know her patients. Those kind of doctors.  Are far and few these days.  She explains everything. She's the best pain specialist I've seen in Las Vegas. I highly recommend her!!

column3:
Innovative Pain Care Center serves Las Vegas, Nevada and the surrounding Southern Nevada region with comprehensive chronic pain management solutions. As a dedicated medical practice focused exclusively on pain treatment, they have established themselves as leaders in helping patients reclaim their lives from debilitating chronic pain conditions. Their multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge interventional procedures, medication management, and holistic therapies to address pain at its source rather than simply masking symptoms.

The center offers a wide range of specialized treatments including nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, radiofrequency ablation, and targeted medication protocols. Their board-certified pain specialists develop personalized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique medical history, pain patterns, and lifestyle goals. Patient-Centered Approach

column40:
I have a pretty complicated case to where I'm constantly having appointments, getting lab work done, and having to meet with tons of providers. On top of that for about 3 years I have been dealing with on and off excruciating pain that leaves me in and out the hospital every month. I'm only 28 so the impact of my condition on my life is really draining. Having to plan trips, activities and holidays around the possibility of being in the hospital for pain management really takes a toll on my mental state especially since I'm a very adventurous person, a mom of 2 and a full time employee. Dr. Cloe is truly amazing! With everything I have dealt with I didn't have much expectations. She listened to my issues and quickly came up with a plan. Although my pain is not 100% gone she has gotten it to a manageable spot where I avoid the hospital and the fear of not being able to plan events and activities due to possibly canceling has gone away. Again even though the pain is not 100% gone I am able to stay home lay in bed and find comfort in my own home. The stress on my significant other, that has been with me though it all (and high school sweetheart) has been lifted. He now doesn't have to miss work to be with me at the hospital and finds comfort knowing I'm home. I truly appreciate her so much and appreciate her making this condition a little more tolerable. Her and her staff are so kind and welcoming thank you so much Dr. Cloe! I highly recommend this place.|Katie has been my Chronic Pain treatment provider for several years, ever since my previous doctor quit practicing with almost no notice. She and her staff are skilled, highly competent providers, and treat patients with nothing but kindness and a genuine willingness to help--true patient advocates. If something isn't working, Katie readily offers other avenues to help my pain. I'm always seen on time, and appointment confirmations are appreciated reminders!|I have been to the Carson City location, as well as, the Reno location. I am not exaggerating when I say that Nevada Advanced Pain Specialists have saved my life. I was in 9/10 pain for 2 weeks waiting for a PCP Referral. I was not sleeping because of this pain and began to feel hopeless. My daughter started calling around and found that this facility doesn't need a referral. They also have a Sparks location. No pain management wants to treat Severe TMJ with my insurance except for these pain clinics. I was seen as a new patient within a week. I was fortunate to only need nerve pain medication for this severe pain. I took the first dose, and was relieved within 1 hour. These clinics also offer at least 6 different modalities to treat TMJ. If you are looking for kindness, understanding,  extreme professional and above and beyond proficiency in pain management, please make an appointment at a location near you!|I have been to the practice several times. All of the staff has been so wonderful. Both Dr. Patterson and Jill have been amazing.  Jill is so very patient and thorough and I truly feel she is so patient. She does not rush my appointments, she listens, and I feel she truly cares to make every effort to help me become pain free. I have absolutely no complaints and would  recommend this practice.|Shaylee is an awesome provider!
She always makes me feel like I'm heard and that my opinion about my care matters. Shaylee takes the time to listen and address all my concerns. Shaylee has great bedside manner and genuinely cares about her patients!
Shaylee and her team always go above and beyond to make sure their patients feel welcomed and have what they need. I personally feel like Shaylee and her team strive to make connections with every patient and they know pretty much everyone by name! Everyone on staff that I've ever met has always been kind!
I highly recommend this clinic and Shaylee as a provider!|I have chronic back and hip pain and Shaylee makes me feel heard! She's very understanding and listens. I don't feel like what we talk about goes in one ear and out the other. I love seeing her, I just wish it was closer to fernley.|Katie Always listens to me and is kind and empathetic. I have never felt judged or left feeling unheard. She always knows how to help, and recommends new things, and respects when I am not ready to try a new treatment.|Shaylee and all the office staff are pleasant to interact with. Shaylee listens carefully to everything I tell her or ask her. She works hard making sure that my needs are met. I look forward to my monthly appointments.

Las Vegas Spine & Pain Center serves the Las Vegas, Nevada area with exceptional neurological and pain management services. At their three convenient locations throughout Las Vegas, patients receive personalized care from a distinguished team of board-certified neurologists and interventional pain management specialists. The center has established itself as a premier destination for adults seeking relief from chronic pain conditions through comprehensive, individualized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

What sets Las Vegas Spine & Pain Center apart is their commitment to minimally invasive treatment options whenever possible. Their specialists excel in advanced procedures including spinal cord stimulation, precision nerve blocks, and targeted joint injections. This approach minimizes recovery time while maximizing pain relief, allowing patients to return to their daily activities with improved function and comfort.

Expert Medical Team

The practice boasts some of the most qualified pain management specialists in the field, each bringing extensive training and experience to patient care. Their combined expertise enables the center to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions with consistently positive outcomes. The team's dedication to staying current with the latest advancements in pain management ensures patients receive the most effective treatments available.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

Every treatment plan at Las Vegas Spine & Pain Center begins with a thorough evaluation and diagnosis, followed by a customized approach that considers the patient's complete medical history, lifestyle factors, and treatment goals. column40:
Doctor was very caring about my needs and very informative and explained things in detail to make sure I understood.  Also when an issue occurred with my medicine he fixed it in a timely fashion.  Thank you so much!!|This review is specifically for Lazaro Cueto, RN. I had seen him from April to November 2024 for lower back pain. On my follow up visit for my last procedure, I asked him if the treatment I had gone through could help get insurance's approval for a breast reduction. The very first thing he said was "What would your husband say?"

I was taken aback by the blatant sexism but tried to laugh it off. However, he proceeded to keep ranting about how my husband would definitely not be okay if I got a reduction and if his wife ever tried to get a reduction, he would leave her.

I feel very sorry for his wife and upset that when I ask my health provider and health-related question, his answer is to belittle his patient.|This is the best, professional and excellent service I've ever received from any medical provider, they always treat me with respect, the nurses are always smiling and always treat our concerns with privacy.
Dr PETER MANNAO always listens to my concerns and he makes sure he treats the problem
They offered calls to remind of appointments|Dr. Valencia is a incredibly patient listener, and clearly explains her expertise in neurology. Gentle and pleasant to talk with. I feel like I have a better understanding of my brain health coming out of an appointment with her.|I've been seeing Dr. Le for many years. He has essentially been my doctor my entire adult life so far and I can't express how much gratitude and respect I have for him. Thank you, LVSPC and Dr. Le for always providing such a safe, compassionate and understanding environment. You guys are the best :)|The staff was excellent and the Dr was phenomenal!  Excited to have found such a great practice!|By far the best Neurologist! Extremely knowledgeable, resourceful and compassionate. She is attentive and able to relate to patients. She is fast pace and never out of options. She is amazingly caring and always gave me the sense that she was in control, which is what a patient needs when in pain. Absolutely love her. I moved out of state and I will have a hard time finding someone of her caliber.|Last year I had sepsis as a surgical complication, which has left me with neuropathy and chronic pain.

Dr. Valencia is thorough and friendly. She is great about explaining things in a way that I can understand, without being condescending. The staff is so kind, helpful and patient.

It is easy to get someone on the phone and to make appointments. I never wait in the waiting room for too long for my appointments, they are very punctual. It feels like they respect you and your time.

The office is clean and well kept.

I definitely recommend LVSP for pain management and neurology!

column40:
This place has taken incredible care of me for the last 4 years. I live in terrible chronic pain and they are my shining light to live somewhat of a normal life. Dr. Wentz is one of the nicest people I've ever met in my life, and his care for me has been nothing but exceptional. Dr. Lim has been wonderful as well. I hope they know how much they are appreciated, especially by myself!|Dr. Tran is so awesome. He is very understanding and very kind. My visits with him are always positive and he spends quality time with me.|I recently had the Permanent SCS surgery and I would love to personally thank Dr Tran! He did a phenomenal job and I am so grateful. I am finally on the path of healing and most importantly living with less pain. Dr Tran is the Man|I must say, doctor Carlos and employee Jema are the best and I recommend Center for Wellness and Pain to everyone who needs pain management and treatment. Jema goes out her way to assist me in all my needs, relating to medications, etc.... And I know it's not in her job description to go way and beyond. And my doctor, Doctor Carlos, is an excellent doctor who really cares about my treatments and will do everything he can to help me get better. Jema and Dr. Carlos are the reasons I will always remain at Center for Wellness and Pain. Thank you Jema and Dr. Carlos|I'm an emergency contact for the patient, & I always attend their monthly appointments with them. Over the past year, I have had to exclusively take over communications between them & this clinic. I am burnt out just from my experiences over the phone. Here are some highlights on what to expect when you join the Center for Wellness and Pain Care.

October 2023, the patient I referenced was attempting to make their monthly follow-up via TeleHealth. However, a representative at the clinic said the request was denied because a copy of the patient's late sibling's death certificate was needed in order for the visit to be approved; they cited the patient's insurance as the entity that needed it. Their sibling had never gone to or interacted with the clinic in any way. We phoned the insurance company, who told us that, no, a death certificate was not necessary in order to be covered for a TeleHealth appointment. I called the clinic back on the patient's behalf to inform them of this. After some back & forth, suddenly they had no idea who had even requested this.

March 2024, the clinic told the patient they needed an updated yearly referral from their primary to continue being seen--that if it couldn't be procured before the patient's upcoming appointment, they would be turned away. Once again, cited as insurance requiring it. We went to obtain the referral in 3 ways from the primary, who explained to us that insurance did NOT require a yearly referral. Just the initial referral. Insurance corroborated this. Regardless, he faxed it, sent it over electronically, & gave me a physical copy to hand to the front desk. Clinic received it on time and approved it.

Currently, December 2024, we are now being informed that the clinic had never received any referral for the year of 2024. This is despite the confirmation we received initially that the patient was good to go for the year, as well as the tangible document detailing the referral. This is also despite approximately 8 months straight of the patient having covered appointments. I asked how the patient has even been seen without the referral, in that case, and was told that they could still be seen, but that insurance might not process it. Again, their insurance does not require annual referrals, only the initial one. This contradicts every other claim where an annual referral was needed or they couldn't be seen at all. Because of the constant discrepancies in communication, we are to assume that this document has been lost, though the person I spoke to could not even confirm whether or not the clinic kept a backlog of referrals to see when the last one WAS sent. First a yes, then a maybe, then a no.

Also, I have gone back and forth for nearly 90 days with the clinic & our pharmacy to look for suitable options to extended release medications that the patient can take, as their usual medication went on backorder and has since not been obtainable. Because of this, the patient has been without half of their medication for at least 2 months; despite this being out of the patient's hands, a provider has threatened to disengage them from therapy for submitting a clean UA, BECAUSE they have no medication to take. The IR med is empty and due for refill around each monthly appointment, adding insult to injury.

Some other things to note: While any provider will ask you to reach out for problems regarding prescribed medications, they will take several days & multiple "high priority" requests to complete time sensitive tasks for you. Call takers will frequently say they need to call you back; they almost never do. Any updates to the patient's file, the patient or trusted party has to go after the clinic for it. Providers will also attempt to go against a patient's pharmacy's protocol by neglecting to change instructions in hand with medication adjustments, & deliberately prescribing higher quantities than actually dispensable because "I've never heard of a pharmacy that doesn't allow THAT."

For precious publicity's sake, hopefully, this is all occurring under Dr. Campbell's nose.|I have been going to this office for a year I've had a few injections. I started planning on a joint in September. I was at a hotel and they did an early check out, and my prescriptions are taken. All of my clothing was thrown away, including my insulin pump. I booked another appointment to let the doctors know cause Ii've had a few injections. I started planning on a joint in September. I was at a hotel and they did a early check out, and my prescriptions are taken. All of my clothing was thrown away, including my insulin pump. I booked another appointment to let the doctors know cause I thought I can get another script and Witt my police report which I was not able to I had to come back and I had to get your injections of tramadol throughout the month for a pain management, and then I did a nerve blocker in my ankle I have surgery October 7 on my back. I did a spinal fusion. And I had to do a debridement surgery  nov 5 because I was not healing I did follow up telehealth visits after the hospital. I came back My appointment in November and they placed me on a probation stating that I tested negative and I haven't taken any test. I've had excellent communication with the doctor with everything that was going on to me with me.At  point it saddens me that they're making me come in additional once a week knowing that I'm in physical therapy and I just had a major back procedure. They're putting extra strain on my body. Which is no problem I don't mind coming in and taking the test but because I know that I am taking the medication, but I was told today now they want me to bring in the pills as well so they can count my pills  clearly making me uncomfortable especially since I've had a major surgery I'm offended this how they treat me there patience as I explained to him today, but I can pull my hospital records and my labs or I have clearly been taking the medication|Again I had a great experience with Dr Tran and his clinical staff despite having a quite complicated medical procedure. I have been treated by Dr Tran for over two years and even traveled to his new location when he relocated his practice. Why? ... because I trust his medical judgment and ability to identify the true problem and a solution that invasive enough to help without causing more harm... because his hands where precise and gentle in multiple procedures he performed on me ... and equally importantly he is able to actually listen to my concerns and address appropriately. Great job!|Staff is always friendly and helpful. Dr  Bradley Tran listens and discusses the best options with me.  Does not push options I don't feel comfortable with. No problems getting the medications and procedures I need prescribed.

Nevada Advanced Pain Specialists serves Sparks, Nevada and the surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating chronic pain conditions using the latest evidence-based techniques and technologies. Since our founding, we have been committed to improving quality of life for patients throughout Northern Nevada who struggle with debilitating pain conditions.

At Nevada Advanced Pain Specialists, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, combining interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. Our specialists are experts in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and pain resulting from workplace injuries or automobile accidents.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our practice utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic and therapeutic techniques including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and regenerative medicine approaches. We develop personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific condition, medical history, and lifestyle needs.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (775) 284-8650 or visit our website at www.nvadvancedpain.com. Our office hours are Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, with same-week appointments often available for new patients.

column40:
I've been going to Nevada Advance Pain for a few years now and they've been able to take care of all my pain issues. They've been very good at making my life more comfortable and to be out into the world. Their staff do a great job. They're just a wonderful facility to help you Chloe Jean is my doctor and she's very wonderful understanding helpful she takes care of business. !!|Went to this place that I considered a nightmare because of their capacity to do a lot of stuff on my behalf but I of course got paranoid not wanting someone telling me how to live. Well I was so off base it makes me happy to know that this place can actually help me. I suffer from a bad leg due to sciatic issues, this place, the lady who was there to evaluate me is amazing. She found all my difficulties just by watching me for a few minutes. My favorite thing is the spinal stimulator that I remember being nothing more than a glorified tens machine now has abilities beyond anything I could have imagined. The thought that this device could possibly reduce my pain levels?!?! Heaven. So I am leaving myself in their very capable hands with no fear. This place will hopefully get me to a healthy way of life and not becoming a couch potato because of pain. I'm 62 yrs old and I finally have hope. If you need a good place for pain management this is it. I will update this in a couple of months so let you all know my progress. For now I'm letting go of the controls and allow them to show me a means to have better control of my life.|Cloe is the absolute best! She has been helping with my mother's pain management after chemo and radiation. She is always welcoming and helpful as is her assistant Casey! Thank you so much for taking such great care of my mom. We truly appreciate you both!|I have been with Nevada Advanced Pain Specialists for over 5 years. I have always been treated with kindness and respect. Cloe in particular takes the time to listen. She always gives me her full attention.  She has never pushed me to have any procedure that I am not comfortable with.  She gives me the options and let's me make up my own mind. I would recommend this practice to anyone dealing with chronic pain.|I see Cloe there and have for a few years. SHE IS AMAZING!  I stay there because of her. I don't like that the office won't allow her to sign my mmc card. I don't like that Dr Dennis is not a straight shooter but he has been a decent dr. I don't like they won't help a person get disability or sign for them to get any kind of assistance. But I have been having my meds thru them since 2012 so they must do something right. If I could give Cloe a rating she would get 10 out of 10! She has been an amazing provider for me for years now and I adore her!|Jill is a excellent healthcare provider. She was very thorough at my husband's first visit and took the time to listen and come up with a comprehensive plan for his health|Cloe Jeans has been taking excellent care of me for nearly 6 years. I highly recommend NAPS for anyone living with chronic pain like myself. There are many services and procedures available, and they really work to find the best possible solution for you.|Jill is always prepared for my monthly visits. She knows all my issues by reading other Dr's notes. That gives me confidence in her pain management plan will take in account outside issues.
I trust her completely.

Velazquez Pain Relief Center- Centennial serves Las Vegas, Nevada and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded by Dr. Maria Velazquez, our clinic has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider specializing in non-invasive and minimally invasive pain relief techniques. Our state-of-the-art facility at 7425 W Azure Dr STE 150 combines modern medical technology with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions affecting patients throughout the Las Vegas Valley.

At Velazquez Pain Relief Center, we offer personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique pain profile. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates physical therapy, medication management, interventional procedures, and holistic healing methods. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathy, sports injuries, and post-surgical pain with evidence-based protocols designed to maximize function while minimizing medication dependence.

Expert Medical Team

Our clinic is staffed by board-certified pain specialists, physical therapists, and support personnel dedicated to patient wellness. Dr. Velazquez brings over 15 years of specialized experience in pain medicine, having completed advanced training in interventional techniques and regenerative therapies. Each team member contributes to our patient-centered approach, ensuring comprehensive care from initial consultation through recovery.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take time to listen to our patients' concerns and develop individualized treatment strategies. Our clinic offers flexible scheduling, including same-week appointments for urgent cases, and works with most major insurance providers to ensure accessible care. The comfortable, modern environment at our Centennial location was designed specifically to create a healing atmosphere for patients managing chronic pain conditions.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 702-960-4150 or visit our website at http://velazquezpainreliefcenter.com/. For months I informed my p.a. that my pain was worse. I have 9 fused vertebrae. Clearly they won't control my pain if the only solutions for them is take Narco 5's or a neuro stimulator. I have been to pain clinics, I know what to expect. But this is totally unacceptable.  Now come to find out there is a surgical medical reason for my increased pain. For which I need complicated surgery to repair. Now surgery of course won't happen for at least 6 weeks, but if they won't help someone like me, what does that say about others in pain at this place?!? I even tried to switch offices or see the actual doctor again, and the staff was nasty then hung up on me after I made the request. Took months for my doctor's to talk me into going to a pain clinic again, and my primary doctor isn't pleased this is how this is going. I follow the rules, so when this happens, it makes me lose faith in those charged with helping my pain.|I was very impressed with my experiences at this doctor's office. My first contact was with Lezly and Kim. They always welcome me with a smile and make me feel comfortable. They always answer all my questions and go above and beyond with their services. The knowledge Dr. Chmiela shows is very admirable.
You can tell all the staff cares for your well-being.|I've visited the location on multiple occasions. From the moment you walk through the doors, the welcoming staff and pristine interior set the stage for a professional yet compassionate healthcare experience. All front desk personnel greet each patient with warmth and quickly attend to any needs. The nursing and medical teams maintain positive energy and attentive care despite busy patient schedules. Even behind the scenes, it's clear the diligent facilities and cleaning crews work hard to provide a comfortable environment. Every staff member plays a role in making patients feel valued. My time spent here has shown me that this clinic and the staff prioritize service excellence and patient comfort. They are a cohesive team committed to providing quality compassionate care! Overall an outstanding facility that should serve as an example for patient-focused healthcare done right!|I've been coming here for a few months due to a back injury.  After having my last visit I wanted to give a huge shout out to the staff here.  They are very welcoming, professional and prompt.  From the receptionist Lezly, to the nurse Desitny to Dr Chmieala.  All of these individuals have made my visits easy and stress free.  I would highly recommend coming to this practice if you're having health issues.|The front desk ladies are extremely helpful and caring. I took my mother in law in and felt that she was warmly cared for by the ladies at the front desk. After her appointment she told me that the doctors are very good and examine her well. She is usually a bit critical but she had no complaints about this doctor and his warm staff.|I'm a lien patient at this location, my sister Kimberly was very helpfully to me and other patients. As well for the MA Destiny was very nice and made me feel comfortable, Lezly and Hazel at this location were very nice and made me feel welcomed they offered me water. Dr. Chmiela is a very nice and helpful doctor . Would recommend this location.|I was taken care of unbelievably well. The front office was so kind, one of the MA's who took me back stood out to me the most with her sweetness. And Dr.Chmiela did such a great job at making me feel welcomed and heard.|I came to Velazquez because my last pain doctor was awful. He didn't care about me or helping me. Dr. Chmiela is amazing. Such a nice guy and he cares. He genuinely wants to help me and does. He offers solutions and gives me options. I couldn't be happier to have been recommended here.

I'm currently looking for a new primary care that actually has doctors available and a phone system that works.|OK now I'm gonna try these docs... This has NOT been the best year for good quality doctors for me.. Last pain mgmt closed practice!  Before them, just THE WRONG 'DR.'!!

Diane answered the phone with pleasantries and answered all my questions! AND she even scheduled my new patient appointment, (even with all my 'extras'..!!!) YEAH Diane!!
Step #1, 2 & 3 check, check & check... literally, like we all know  what a rarity nowadays - no putting me on hold? What..? No transferring either... So far.. Obvi this is a new/updated Las Vegas Pain Institute...!! So far, not a representation from those reviews of yester-years... !

column40:
I received a bill for $1,885.00 because whoever does the billing or referrals did not do their job correctly. I have tried numerous times to work out this supposed debt with this office. I have called them on three way calls with my insurance company as well as with the PCP who sent the referral. I have insurance and because their office didn't do their job correctly, the insurance company kicked it back. Now they want to stick me with the bill because they didn't make sure my referral was in the patient portal before seeing me. I called to make sure they accepted my insurance ahead of time to make sure I wouldn't get stuck with a bill. The insurance company said they would have to eat this cost because they dropped the ball. I don't believe I should be stuck with a bill, when I have insurance, got the referral from my PCP, and did everything I was supposed to do prior to seeing them. I have repeatedly tried to get this issue resolved to no avail. Now they have sent me to collections. I saw Dr. Brimhall, who was very compassionate and understanding; however, the billing department or whoever deals with their referrals needs more training. As a practice, they should not penalize their patients when the office doesn't do what they should be doing in the correct manner in which they should do it. I would recommend checking with the referral department, billing department, and insurance company prior to seeing any doctor in this office or you may find yourself hit with a hefty bill.|Grateful!! That is the main word I would use to describe how I feel about the care I have received at Nevada Pain Care. I just want to say that both Andrew Gephardt and Dr. Eric Brimhall are excellent providers. I feel lucky to have found them. They are by-the-books, caring, and professional without a doubt. I really couldn't have asked to find better. They have gone above and beyond to help me get well and I could not be more thankful. It's nice to have providers that actually listen and address your concerns. Nevada Pain Care's staff is very attentive and understanding as well. I appreciate their time and assistance beyond measure.

Prior to seeing Andrew, I was given really useless unhelpful diagnoses. And, I could not get the treatment I desperately needed. No real tests had been done about what I have been experiencing medically. I felt defeated and like I wasn't being taken seriously. Andrew sent me for the proper tests and to the right doctors that not only proved that what I was saying was actually happening, but, this has allowed for me to improve though proper and thorough treatment. Thank you Andrew for your compassion, kindness, and expertise. And, thank you Nevada Pain Care! I have hope now.

Also, I would just like to mention that any time I have been asked who I am seeing for Pain Management here in Southern Nevada, the moment I say Andrew Gephardt, my other doctors have been quite pleased. Andrew and his associates are well-known and respected amongst their colleagues and in the medical community here in Las Vegas. This really puts my mind at ease. I highly recommend this practice. And, again, am grateful. Thank you!|Excellent drs!  They always try to squeeze me in when or if I missed my appointment !I'm never missing another appointment b/c I cannot risk it! Great PA's also.
Nicest, most professional Pain Care Management I have found in all of Las Vegas! Very happy they accepted me.
Dr. Gephardt is amazing as are all of the other Drs. & all of the PA's.
I didn't care for Anastasia at all. Please be aware that EVERYONE else is Polite, Professional & very caring! Finally, a great pain management practice!|I dont not recommend anyone loved ones in pain to this office if you want to be abused by front desk. My Husband was mistreated and not assisted accordingly. On purpose she will emplace false information about arrival so you can be attended two hr later and still not being attended when questioned front desk gets aggressive and doesn't assist instead will argue and will not provide you an office manager. DO NOT BRING your family in pain here.|Andrew and his team over at Nevada Pain Care are truly outstanding in their field. I have dealt with a host of poorer health providers in the past. After my first visit I had a great deal of options presented to me for pain management and within an hour of leaving the office all of the secondary care providers had contacted me to schedule what was necessary in order to receive my treatment. I have never received this type of care from anyone else and I'm truly grateful for what they do.|I had the worst experience with Jill the office manager. I got a call from them asking me to find a specialty pharmacy that will fill my prescription Botox for migraines, I suffer with Cronin migraines. I told the lady I have never had the run around to get the medicine before and that I don't know who to call or what direction to go? I also told her I don't want to be put on a pedestal because I'm the patient and it's not my job. They are lazy pushing their work to be done by sick patients. I asked to speak to the office Manager and was transferred to Jill. I explained Jill what I was told very politely and she started yelling at me that if they want me to do things in their way I should do it? I have never in my life had someone attack me like that, she was beyond rude, unprofessional, the lady needs anger management. Horrible behavior! I asked to speak to an individual above her to voice my abuse from her and let the practice owner know they are losing patience because of awful behavior from management. Next day I got a voicemail that they have discharged me from the clinic. Dear practice owner please have the calls recorded, so you can see how awful patient are being treated. Don't waste your time going to this clinic.|Very good Doctors it just a bit if grind to navigate around their staff.  Some have poor attitudes and some just don't want to go the extra mile and no patience.  Nevertheless, it is hard to let go of Dr. Antflick, he just knows what he is doing. Quite the commute for us but I feel can't find anyone like him.|Everytime I enter the office I'm greeted with a smile, a hello and the paperwork required. Everyone knows my name and if I ever have a problem, the staff either can fix it or will direct me how to. There is normally 10 min wait time between the time you turn in your paperwork and getting called to back to the exam rooms. Everyone & everything is clean & professional. I have never had a pain management doctor who cared as my h as Doc Gephardt has. I drive from Boulder City (just about) to the office every 4 weeks 18 miles 1 way. Yes, the drive is worth it because everyone who works there is polite, well mannered, knowledgeable, professional and work in a timely fashion. If they were not, I would surely have found a pain management doctor whos office is closer to me.
