I see Shannon and she is top notch! She is a caring, understanding provider who listens to her clients. I think she goes above and beyond to help me get what I need which is a rarity these days.
I'm not sure why so many providers leave this office but I'm thankful the owner has managed to keep her there!|I have been to a few different pain management doctors and this office is the nicest, cleanest and most comfortable to have to visit monthly.
But if you can request any Doctor here try and see Shannon Signorino PA-C
I could not be more relived and satisfied to have her as my doctor. I am so Grateful for the help and info she has given me.
I actually look forward to my appointments with her because she actually cares about me and what I go through with pain.
Im A very thankful patient of this place.|I have never done a review for one of my dr's before this. I have also been to many pain management clinics.Our practitioners don't get enough credit or thanks for doing their jobs under the constraints our insurance providers but them in. So ,I just want to say this Shannon Signorino is the person I see there and hands down out of all the people I have dealt with over my many years of pain management she is the ONLY one who has taken the time to explain things to me in detail in a way I can understand so I can better make decisions regarding my health. I commend her for taking the time to be thorough when everyone has such limited time with their patients. She has made me comfortable to ask questions about why I'm having pain and then goes through all the options of what can be done so I can make an educated decision on what I want to do moving forward and together we make a plan. She remembers things from previous appointments and takes copious notes which makes me feel good that in the future we have a detailed report of my progress or lack there of for other dr's or governing boards like SS department. She is.a Great addition to the place and I think she is doing an outstanding job taking care of her patients and manages to get everything done in such a small window of appt times!! I will follow her anywhere! Thanks Shannon for doing such a great job!! It does not go unnoticed|Slow. Backed up. Overwhelmed.
When you call, you will be 20-something in line.. And that can mean you are in line for a voicemail box.. Where no one will call you back.
The coordination with insurance is appallingly slow and if you call they will be unpleasant and rude. It WILL take you 3 months to get care IF you call your insurance for them...

In short, go anywhere but here.|The staff was very polite, and helpful. Dr. Nguyen was very thorough, and, professional, and offered alternative options. I was in, and out in a timely manner. I am very happy with office.|Do not come here under any circumstance if you are young and suffering from debilitating, life-threatening, daily chronic pain. My boyfriend came in today, November 7th 2024, for an appointment with Dr. Dennis Nguyen and was told he is "too young to be having chronic pain". My boyfriend informed him he is not only genetically disabled (fibromyalgia, arthritis), but also suffers from CT proven back discs, saitica, chronic nausea, vomiting, and kidney stones. He needs a cane to walk, on the days he can walk at all. His pain affects every aspect of his life to the point it is the only thing he can focus on. His age has absolutely no correlation to his suffering. He has been prescribed dozens upon dozens of medicines, including narcotics, and absolutely none have touched his pain, even via IV. Dr Dennis Nguyen then prescribed him a medication he has ALREADY TRIED, and FAILED for positive results. What an incredibly unprofessional and disgusting remark to make, and complete failure to treat a patient. Anyone with chronic pain, even/especially young people deserve to be taken seriously. You are a pain specialization center, your doctors should act like it. Disgraceful.|Not very impressed so far with this provider. Took almost 3 weeks after my initial appointment just to SUBMIT my authorization to the insurance company with no communication they were that far behind and been another 3 weeks and no update.|I really like my doctor here. The front staff are typically pleasant and helpful. If you need to get ahold of someone at any extension forget it. I never get a call back so don't wait for it. Call them back again. Other than that it's a pleasure dealing with most of the gals here. I say gals cause I have yet to see a male besides my doctor working there.

Dr. Bonnick is an amazing doctor. I have been seeing her for a few months now and have not once felt uncomfortable or judged. She cares about my health and my problems and tries her best to work with me to improve them. I really appreciate her and hope to continue to see her in the future.|Dr. Bonnick is great. She truly cares about patients. I have sent 4-5 friends to her, they love her also. I have been seeing her for 15+ years now. So she doesn't put up with my nonsense. She can see right through me now. Not telling your Dr. The truth you might as well not go in. Save yourself and her time and let her help people that need her help.|Bonnick is a great doctor. Knowledgeable about everything. Has handouts to read to better your health. Gives tips to help with any problems. Praises you for your good results and encourages you to do better regarding your bad results in a professional manner. I found her from a friend recommendation and will recommend her to others.|Dr Bonnick,
Genuinely cares about her patients and is very thorough. She spends time with her patients has an excellent bedside manner.  She is very responsive when I contact her through the patient portal. I'm glad my friend referred me to her when I moved to Nevada.|She's very thorough and also takes the time to talk to us when we arrive. And and go over everything that we need to talk about. And I like that she is on time. Do not have to wait long when we have an appointment at 2:00. It's usually between 2:00 and 2:20 which is perfectly fine cuz other places they make you wait for hours sometimes.
One complaint I do have is whenever you call you never get answers and you leave messages and you don't get returns. I don't think it's the individual office. I think it's a general office that does that and it's really frustrating when you're sick and you're trying to get a hold of the doctor or you're not getting your medicine and you end up being out of medicine for a week because of it. That's the only complaint I really have. Thank you very much.|Really appreciate the time and effort Dr. Bonnick gives me during our visits.  She obviously cares about my health and you definitely want that in your PCP!|It's unfortunate to have to leave a bad review because my actual practitioner is really awesome. The problem is that it has become impossible to reach anyone at the Bonanza office via phone with simple questions that should not require an appointment. And I have not been able to get responses in any sort of timely manner about very urgent matters regarding necessary prescription and medical equipment.
Their phone tree is set up with a bunch of options that take you nowhere, if I select the option to leave a message for a medical assistant it goes nowhere if I select the option to speak with prior authorization team the voice mailbox is full if I select the option to speak with the specific office the line rings and rings and then just hangs up. Lastly if I select the option to speak with scheduling I do finally reach a human person but the phone tree is set up to forward all calls to an external answering service that has no idea what they're talking about and no ability to contact the office directly apparently.
When I have dealt with the in office staff they are very kind and very helpful but that's not super useful if they are impossible to reach.|Dr. Bonnick is by far one of the Best Drs I've ever had! She listens to your concerns and gets right to it, looking for a solution. If you're a new patient, please consider Dr. Bonnick, you won't be disappointed.

I kind of feel like I am being treated as a junkie. Over 4 suboxone. I just got new insurance and unfortunately my old Dr doesn't take my new insurance. I have been taking it for pain instead of pain pills for a while now. I am prescribed 2 a day. Most days that's perfect but sometimes I have a bad day and I take 21/2 good days I may only take 1 a day. I break the strips into 4ths and some days I only take 1. I have been filling a 30 day prescription every 28 days for a while and that has allowed me to pick up all my prescriptions at once and be able to take what I need and never worry about running out especially if the pharmacy has to order them. But here they are not allowing me that by scheduling my appointment every 30 days. I can easily make that work it's just crappy that I won't have that piece of mind here.|12/3/24 Update: Your ph# hasn't worked all day. Please contact me if you get this.

Not caring or helpful in any respect. The kind of place that makes chronic pain patients feel like drug addicts. I have a regimen that I've used for years, it works well, and my records show I have never exhibited drug-seeking or addiction behavior. She tells me on the first visit that she's changing everything. Also, the things she wants to do, I can't afford. Will not be going back. She also told me she heard my old doctor (who's retiring) is not really retiring but being watched by the DEA. So unprofessional. Very disappointed.|Horrible service- scheduled an appointment to see Dr Obi over a month ago - arrive for my appointment and only seen by the nurse (no Dr) they scheduled me for an MRI) and a procedure-! For what exactly? I decline and stated I want to see Dr Obi first and consult with him- I schedule another appointment, I arrive and another Dr comes in and says I need another MRI,  I ask where is Dr Obi? Sorry he's not coming in today. What??!!! I reschedule again and another week goes by - but was promised that Dr OBi would be there. Nope arrived got another MRI and no Dr Obi. Just unbelievable. I've wasted a good month- I'm still in pain and  have not seen Dr Obi yet.
They never answer their phones. They are a mess.
(Steven the MRI person was the only one that seemed to be on the ball !)
I will be finding another clinic!!! And start all over again. Ridiculous-
BTW I really liked Dr Obi, seemed like a great Dr if and when you can ever see him|I've been going to this doctors office for years. The people are amazing. They're always helpful and polite.  I go to the Durango in Elkhorn office, but I just wanted to leave a review for a x-ray imaging associate named Steven. He is one of the most polite people, and it's very caring and thoughtful about things you may talk to him about  He gave me some advice and I really appreciated him. He's very kind and soft spoken and you guys are lucky to have somebody like that working for you.|Avoid at all costs. The provider sent the wrong prescription to the pharmacy and after two days of relentless calling and trying to get it sorted, no response. No corrections at pharmacy and closed now!

I notice the owner has responded and said correct us directly. I called non stop and asked for a manager to contact me to complain. No one ever contacted me and i never got an apology.|Dr. here is horrible. She does not listen. And treated me as if I was a drug addict. Stated that she could not give Me any controlled substances. She didn't even look over my medical records and asked for images, although they were all provided to her. Prejudice and Incompetent staff.|My father has been coming to this location for 9 months. When he tries to call to confirm his appointments, schedule an appointment or simply ask a question concerning his condition, the phone rings continuously for about a minute and a half and is then cut off.

On 10/27/2023 he called 3 times with no answer and no way to leave a message. His first call was made at 8AM, again at 2:25pm, 2:27pm. He was not given a call back until 3:41pm.

On 10/30/2023- he called at 10:36am, 10:37am, 10:38am. He was unable to leave a message for them and did not receive a  call back until 1:37pm.

On 11/27/2023 he tried calling 5 times at 4:08PM, 4:10pm, 4:11pm, 4:15pm, 4:17pm he called to confirm his appointment for the next day which was scheduled at his previous visit- no one answered and he was unable to leave a message once again.That is when I decided to try calling from my phone and was answered after the 2nd ring.

While on the phone with the front desk he was notified that his appointment had never been scheduled and they would have to "reschedule" him.

Based on the business hours that have been posted to the official website office hours are 8am-6pm. I do not understand why his calls are not being answered. I could almost understand if he was calling during a busy time of day BUT for me to have called 1 minute after his last call to the office on 11/27/2023 and my call to be picked up IMMEDIATELY is unacceptable. If your office is so busy that your staff cannot pick up the phone and even just place the patient on a brief hold there should at least be a voicemail box set up for patients who are unable to get through.|Update:2022 Authorizations submitted a Request for Auth with a 4 yr old MRI ensuring the request would be denied, hoping I would pay cash.

When I pointed out their mistake and asked them to submit a corrected request with the CT they just had me do specifically for THAT Request for Auth, they refused.

This is after I found out Authorizations had been telling me requests for some procedures were being denied when in fact no request for Auth was ever submitted in order to get me to pay cash for those procedures.

Las Vegas Spine & Pain Center serves the Las Vegas, Nevada area with exceptional neurological and pain management services. The practice stands out for its team of board-certified neurologists and interventional pain management specialists who are dedicated to providing comprehensive care tailored to each patient's unique needs. The center distinguishes itself through a highly individualized treatment philosophy that prioritizes custom care plans for every patient. Their medical team emphasizes minimally invasive procedures whenever possible, including advanced treatments such as:

Expert Medical Team

Patient-Centered Approach

column40:
This review is specifically for Lazaro Cueto, RN. I had seen him from April to November 2024 for lower back pain. On my follow up visit for my last procedure, I asked him if the treatment I had gone through could help get insurance's approval for a breast reduction. The very first thing he said was "What would your husband say?"

I was taken aback by the blatant sexism but tried to laugh it off. However, he proceeded to keep ranting about how my husband would definitely not be okay if I got a reduction and if his wife ever tried to get a reduction, he would leave her.

I feel very sorry for his wife and upset that when I ask my health provider and health-related question, his answer is to belittle his patient.|Dr lee is wonderful, but since my PA left, this lady, Crystal is a joke!  Comes to conclusions on 1st meeting, didn't ask me any questions, now after going here for YEARS ive gotta find a new pain dr! Very disappointing! Im guessing many more patients will be leaving now like me because of her. What a shame!|LAZARO CUETO, NP - HORRIBLE TERRIBLE PHYSICIAN! He did nothing to help my nerve damage condition in my left leg, would not write a prescription for Percocet of 100 tablets which i have been taking to help alleviate the aching, accused me of "Doctor Shopping" as all I want to find is a doctor or NP that understands my constant aching in my leg and does not order me to have another Epidural which I did and it did nothing to ease the aching and actually made my leg weaker! This NP is horrid, never have met anyone so discouraging and awful...even told me to have my Primary Physician write the prescription I need. He says at this LV Spine and Pain Center they only push for surgeries, NOT to write prescriptions! Really?  He needs to be disbarred from the  Medical field!!|Staff members were awesome and I didn't have to wait long to see the doctor, which is bonus!
Dr Alexander was not only professional, but very informative. He didn't seem rushed, like many doctors are nowadays. He took time to give me all the info I needed, answered all my questions, and was also very kind. I really appreciate whenever I'm not rushed in and out of the doctor's office like I'm just another number. Thank you Dr Alexander and team!!|Dr. Alexander is laser focused on providing the best patient centered care. He is willing to take on  the insurance companies without giving up, to ensure his patients get what they need, not just what the insurance says they will approve.

The staff from the front desk personnel to the medical assistants at Las Vegas Spine and Pain Center are always polite and professional. They get to know you as a person and provide excellent patient care, consistent with the high standards Dr. Alexander demands.

Now that I am a patient of Dr. Alexander's, I wouldn't consider going anywhere else for my care!|I've never enjoyed going to see my doctor. Dr Rubin makes you feel like family. He is an amazing man who is more than a doctor. He always goes the extra mile to make sure his patient is well taken care of. I'm so blessed to have him as my doctor.|Had my first appointment with the doctor today and he was great. He explained everything very well and had an awesome bedside manner. The nurses and the girl in the front were great also. I look forward to working with him to address my issues.|I am only sharing my experience, thus far, with Maya who answered the phone quickly was both professional and personable.

Maya answered all my questions effectively and efficiently, and provided fax # for my primary to fax med recs.

After reading all the reviews (good & bad) the good outweigh the bad, and also, appear more current.  Also, there are even responses to some poor reviews ... Offering apologies, accountability, and a willingness to resolve and move forward.

I am feeling very hopeful about this pain management facility, and will write another review after having completed my initial appointment.

column48: I have intense back pain. hurts to walk. I had a procedure 4 years ago...I think epidural/steroid shot. is that something that you can fix? I dont know where to start now with my insurance
column49:
Hi Paul.  

I'm just one of Dr. Alexander's patients.  We both suffer from chronic and intense back pain.  If your question was intended for me, I'd recommend 1st call his office and ask if they take your insurance.  Depending on your insurance plan, you might need your GP to fax Alexander's office a referral for you.  If all goes well, schedule your 1st appointment with Dr. Alexander ASAP.  Bring any old MRIs and / or report printouts that you may have. (They may prove to be helpful).

Dr. Alexander will possibly need an updated MRI to see where the issue(s) are and to treat your condition effectively.  

Dr. Alexander and I are in the process of eliminating/reducing pain that radiates down my arm. Today, we're doing a nerve block injection to be certain we've identified the exact problem area.  If so, then we will do the steroid injection that will last longer.  Depending on how long that lasts, we may schedule an RFA. 

It can be a process, long term relief is so worth it!

column3:
Relevium Pain Specialists in Las Vegas, Nevada offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians combine evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to help patients regain control of their lives. Since opening our doors, we've established ourselves as a trusted provider in the Las Vegas Valley, focusing on minimally invasive procedures and multidisciplinary approaches that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Relevium Pain Specialists, we treat a wide range of pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our treatment options include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and advanced diagnostic testing. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, medical history, and lifestyle goals.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in a patient-centered approach that emphasizes education, transparency, and collaborative decision-making. Our team takes the time to thoroughly explain conditions and treatment options, ensuring patients are empowered to make informed choices about their care. This commitment to patient education has helped countless individuals understand their pain conditions and actively participate in their recovery journey.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our modern clinic at 6064 S Fort Apache Rd, Suite 100, Las Vegas, NV 89148 features advanced diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable, welcoming environment. The facility was designed with patient comfort in mind, from the soothing waiting area to the private consultation rooms where patients can discuss sensitive health matters with complete confidentiality.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at +1 702-940-8007. You can also visit our website at http://releviumpain.com/ to learn more about our services, team members, and to access patient resources. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to ensure patients understand their coverage options.

This was my first visit to Relevium clinic after really bad car crash that I was in two months ago.
They have really nice office space.Very calming and relaxing.The wait time was minimal, and the check-in process was really smooth. I saw Dr Schlinger and she was punctual and efficient, making the most of our very first appointment (either though her new laptop  did not want to cooperate )
I was impressed with Dr. Schlinger's expertise and knowledge regarding  my conditions. She took the time to discuss a lot of things and explained possible treatment options and helped me feel confident in my decision to come again and see if I can be helped.|Dr. Hall and his entire staff are truly amazing! The minute you walk into the office you are greeted with friendly, caring staff and a very relaxing atmosphere. Once you meet Dr. Hall
you feel totally at ease. He takes the time to thoroughly explain the procedure you need to have and why you need it. He is extremely knowledgeable and very caring. I would highly recommend Relevium Pain Specialists!|Title: Mixed Experience

My daughter was referred to Relevium Pain Specialist by her lawyer, although her case was eventually withdrawn. I contacted the clinic directly to discuss a discount due to her limited number of visits--just three in total.

The sessions with the pain specialist and psychologist were brief, yet we were charged for longer durations. Despite expressing my concerns, initial assistance from Supervisor Jessica was limited, and subsequent communication left me feeling dissatisfied.

However, a year later, during an in-person visit, I had the opportunity to speak with the owner, who displayed kindness and a willingness to address my grievances.

Overall, while I appreciate the owner's assistance, the high costs and lack of professionalism from the supervisor warrant a four-star review.|I have been a patient of Dr. Hall's since August 2017. As evidenced by other reviewers, Dr. Hall is an outstanding physician. I have been provided with such dedicated and compassionate care. Dr Hall Is very bright and is able to convey treatment options and outcomes in a way that is easily understood. He listens to and answers my questions and I never feel rushed during my appointments. I trust Dr. Hall implicitly and I am so grateful for him. HIs staff is courteous and they are very efficient with submitting prescriptions and appointment referrals. I can't say enough good things about Dr. Hall and his office staff!|I saw Dr. Hall today for low back pain from pregnancy and age. He is very knowledgeable, caring, and thorough. After only 1 visit, he already has a plan of treatment for me. I suffer from anxiety and I left very confident and at ease about him giving me back my quality of life! Definitely the place to go for answers!|I treated with Relevium for my Auto Accident and they are truly the best!  They helped me get the care I needed after my tragic accident.  I was very well taken care of. They are very flexible and easy to deal with. Everyone was very nice, and it is nice to be treated well since you are the patient in need of help. Caring, smiling and laughing is good atmosphere for patients.  Dr. Hall and his PA's are great! I would give them 100 stars out of 10. Even his front desk gals are awesome ladies. Very professional, helpful and compassionate. I will continue to come here!|Dr. Andrew Hall is an extremely kind & caring human being. I greatly appreciate his professionalism and medical expertise when he treated my chronic pain for 2 years. He and his entire office team are always very welcoming and always genuinely concerned for my health and wellness. I highly recommend Dr. Andrew Hall @ Relevium if you want proven results and relief from chronic pain.|Dr Hall has integrity, is empathetic, very smart and has great operative skills. he has taken exceptionally good care of both myself and my family member. column49: Hi Bill! We are an interventional pain practice, so we specialize different injections/procedures to help relieve pain. We would need to obtain the medical records to confirm the type of shot that she had to be sure. If you have the records, or know more details please call the office and we are happy to provide more information if our office performs those procedures.

Align Med Pain Management serves Las Vegas, Nevada with specialized pain management solutions focused on personal injury and worker's compensation cases. Our board-certified physicians and medical professionals combine evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Since opening our doors, we've helped thousands of Las Vegas residents regain mobility, reduce pain, and improve their quality of life through our comprehensive approach to pain management.

At Align Med, we understand that pain affects everyone differently. Our team develops personalized treatment plans that may include medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy, and rehabilitation services. We specialize in treating injuries resulting from workplace accidents, auto collisions, and other personal injury scenarios, working closely with legal and insurance professionals to ensure proper documentation and care.

Comprehensive Care Approach

Our multidisciplinary approach addresses not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain. We offer diagnostic services, therapeutic injections, medication management, and ongoing support throughout your recovery journey. Our goal is to maximize function while minimizing pain, helping patients return to work and daily activities as quickly and safely as possible.

Patient-Centered Experience

We pride ourselves on creating a welcoming environment where patients feel heard and valued. Our administrative team handles the complexities of insurance claims and paperwork, allowing you to focus entirely on your recovery. With flexible scheduling options and minimal wait times, we ensure your pain management needs are addressed promptly and efficiently.

Visit our conveniently located office at 601 S Rancho Dr A6, Las Vegas, NV 89106, or call us at +1 702-475-9915 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at www.myalignmed.com.

At Nevada Comprehensive Pain Center, patients benefit from customized treatment plans designed to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. The medical team utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative therapeutic interventions to manage various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual's specific needs, medical history, and lifestyle factors.

Multidisciplinary Approach

What distinguishes NVCPC from other pain clinics is their comprehensive methodology that integrates multiple specialties. Their team includes board-certified pain specialists, physical therapists, and rehabilitation experts who collaborate to deliver holistic care. This integrated approach ensures that patients receive well-rounded treatment addressing both the physical and psychological aspects of chronic pain management.

Convenient Location

Located at 6990 Smoke Ranch Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89128 in the Summerlin area, the center provides accessible care to residents throughout Las Vegas and surrounding communities. Their modern facility is equipped with the latest medical technology to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective treatment delivery.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about available pain management options, patients can call +1 702-476-9999 or visit their website at nvcpc.com. The center welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans.

column40:
Stay Away! They have negative patient handling capacity. They have too many and not enough people working.
You cannot call each office individually for appointments. You MUST call their main hotline, handled elsewhere or something.
EVERYTHING takes them FOREVER or never happens. They do not care how in pain you are. They are here for the money, not to help their patients.

Today I have called the surgery center 3 times. Each time, I was in line and noticed it ticked down at intervals. Once I got to the front of the queue, I was put straight to Voicemail.. Which they NEVER get back to you.
In short, NO ONE has picked up at surgeries ALL DAY and no one called back.

You will be rushed into their offices then ignored.. New patients they love. They WILL NOT transfer your papers ANYWHERE else. They WILL NOT let you walk in and take your own medical transcripts

Hubby and I are working with a lawyer since we can't get his info and we should have FULL ACCESS.|I was referred to NPC for persistent Neck spasms. My initial visit went very well, and would have rated a 5 star review. However, my follow-up visit has proved difficult, at best. I'm hopeful that this review might prompt some sort of response.

On my follow-up visit, I was told I needed a CT scan, and a pain medication prescription to tide me over until the CT results were ready. Great!

After a week, no referral. I've called now 3 times. Navigating their phone system is an adventure - but I never got to speak to a live person. I've left messages with no response, however to be fair their VM system cannot handle messages over 10 seconds and cut me off.

They don't appear to have a patient portal, so I don't know any other way to contact them. My pharmacy is having the same issue. They won't fill the pain prescription until they contact NPC to verify the prescription. After a week, they have been unable to contact anyone as well.

I've even tried to call and set up / change an appointment. Again, just an eternity on hold and no real person.

This is serious. There is literally no way for me to contact or talk to anyone at NPC.

Taking matters into my own hands, I've done a self pay CT and the results will be ready for evaluation in a few days. I can't even contact anyone at NPC to let them know I don't need the referral anymore.

If you are considering using them, I wish you a better experience.|I like how doctor Leon Perel and his P.A Kevin does their best with limited resources they have.
Until we overhaul our medical systems, doctors hands will be tied in more than one way in how they care for their patients......|Dr Thorn, like the others said he would never prescribe the only medicine that helped. No matter what, no pain meds that actually work. Sent out for tests and referred for different "treatments" that I have followed. It's a scam. Pain clinics must be very profitable. They are planning to eliminate most pain meds no matter your condition.|New patient but changing my mind. All the pain centers are like lawyers looking for billable hours. The location of this center is 1st clue.   Be sure to keep your street contacts, easier, cheaper. Med industry total crooks sanctioned by govt. I dream of giving them shots. Lol|This place took a referral from my Dr & spoke to my insurance provider. The day of my initial appointment they refused to see me because I have an attorney & Im collecting a settlement. Despite this being a preexisting condition AND the fact that I haven't had medical treatment through my attorney in a year. They didn't care that I am in pain & waited 3 months for the referral to see them. They just wanted to get paid by my attorney & not a copay from insurance. Greedy jerks! Don't waste your time. No compassion here!!!|Dr. Perel is a great doctor and so is Kevin his side kick. Front office personal are very nice people. BUT... The billing office is not very good with math. My co-pay should have been $60 and I was being charged $100. Billing called me and said I owe them more money. We got into a slight argument and I said I'm not paying it because she rowed me money. In return I was reported to the credit union. Now I have a ding on my credit score.|They ordered a cat scan for me to determine where a spine stimulator could be placed, due to my excessive hardware in my spine. When the results came back it stated that one of my cages has moved. The PA I saw that day said I needed to "call my surgeon". I asked the front desk if they were going to order a referral. The girl said yes. It never happened. Over the next 2 months I called twice to request that the referral be sent to my surgeon, and it still never happened. That was my only problem with this office, Dr Perel was great, his PA's were great, the staff was nice. I considered the "not ordering my referral" to be a big problem, so I went back to The Center for Wellness and Pain Care.

column3:
Nevada Pain Clinic serves the Southwest Las Vegas, Nevada area with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team specializes in treating patients suffering from acute or chronic pain resulting from surgical procedures, injuries, diseases, or disorders. With a patient-centered approach, we've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider in the Las Vegas Valley, offering evidence-based treatments tailored to each individual's unique needs.

At Nevada Pain Clinic, we understand that pain can significantly impact your quality of life. Our multidisciplinary approach includes friendly consultations where we take the time to listen to your concerns, comprehensive evaluations to accurately diagnose the source of your pain, and state-of-the-art diagnostic imaging to provide precise insights into your condition. Our treatment protocols are designed to address the root cause of your pain, not just mask the symptoms.

Specialized Treatment Options

Our clinic offers a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic approaches to manage various pain conditions. From medication management and minimally invasive procedures to advanced interventional techniques, our pain specialists develop personalized treatment plans focused on improving function and reducing pain. We emphasize effective follow-up care to monitor your progress and adjust treatments as needed for optimal outcomes.

Visit Our Southwest Las Vegas Location

Nevada Pain Clinic is conveniently located at 9333 W Sunset Rd, Suite A, Las Vegas, NV 89148. Our modern facility is equipped with the latest technology to ensure you receive the highest standard of care. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 702-509-7176. Our compassionate team is ready to help you take the first step toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.

column38: Cynthia Quiroz
column40:
My initial appointment was amazing. The reviews seem like people are not happy... Why did the doctor seem to care ??? What I found strange was that I never met my primary doctor...  wow!!!! I have never experienced anything like this... Unfortunately, my blood pressure was at 232 and I guess he decided that I was worth checking up on for my first initial visit.... What a shame everything went through the PA, which was super amazing... this Woman  showed that she cared  about my health and was very concerned about my readings. I believe her name is Stacey ...  I  was seen  by Brittany & and Stacy. I'll  tell you what if it wasn't for these two beautiful educated assistants to the doctor who listened to my  situation. I would've left and found another doctor... but I  chose to stay because of them... Thank you, Lady's, for being human beings . especially Brittany, who lost her beautiful mother, so you  were so,so very fortunate to have a beautiful mother... I wish I had the love you had with your mom...   because I didn't!!!!  my parents were so abusive...  I  really don't want to think about my past because everything is so negative, and all I want is to be happy... thank you, sweetheart for allowing me too be myself...I  got to shared special moments with you.... Thank you, Brittany, for listening...
Cynthia Quiroz

column40:
I absolutely love Nevada pain and spine. All providers are really passionate about the care of the patients. I would like to bring a special light to a wonderful provider, Corinne. She is a Nurse Practitioner at the office, who will always take time to explain things for you. I appreciate her attention to detail and care for the individual as a whole.|This place is a joke. $1500 for a consultation and all that was done was questions were asked. Was told they were going to schedule an MRI, they never did. When my lawyer contacted them they claimed to not know who I was. This place was recommended by my chiropractor and even he was surprised by their lack of motion.  Supposed to have a follow up and every time I call to ask about the MRI I get a super rude person on the other side of the phone. Go somewhere else. This place isn't going to help you and they sure aren't going to do it nicely.|Dear colleague of mine reached out about their experience with one of the practical nurses. I would be mindful if someone treats you differently. I would advised to avoid seeing Nurse Practitioner Corinne Canavero as my dear friend who has sickle cell, was racially profiled and referred to as an addict. The prior doctor did not see any issues prescribing such medications, so as a practitioner, why do you think it's okay to assume they are abusing such? Sickle cell can be extremely debilitating. Sounds like some DEI training is much needed here. Shame on you Corinne.|I had questions about my bill and requested a callback to address my concerns. Despite following up several times, I never received a response. My main issue with the billing is that I was never seen by an actual doctor, yet the charges were higher than any medical professional I've consulted before--including general practitioners, orthopedic surgeons, dermatologists, podiatrists, regenerative specialists, and physical therapists, to name a few.

To put it into perspective, I was billed more for this visit than for an X-ray and assessment with an orthopedic surgeon. This is especially perplexing considering all I did was complete what amounted to a glorified questionnaire.

It's disappointing that this facility prioritizes sending payment reminder letters over responding to callback requests and ensuring transparent, fair billing practices. Integrity in billing should be a standard, not an exception.|Corinne was amazing with my mother, she took her step by step on instructions of her medication which was very helpful considering my mother had to start a stronger medication i was worried for her to take. Corinne was very patient and kind with my mother, I'll always appreciate her for it!|As a confirmed "chicken-bird" when it comes to needles going in my body I couldn't have been more freaked out to be getting epidurals for my bad back. Turns out I was worried about nothing. Dr. Pitman and his staff couldn't have put me more at ease if they tried. I had a Xanax that was prescribed for me to take prior to my procedure but it really barely did anything for me. Dr. Pitman's staff took my vitals and monitored me closely for the roughly 40 minutes allowed for the pill to reach peak efficacy. Dr. Pitman is super professional, explaining everything he was about to do and describing the sensations that I might feel during the procedure. Literally the ONLY "pain" I registered was with the first of the two shots of numbing agent that he prepped me with. A very mild sting, over almost instantaneously, and then we were off to the races. I did not feel any discomfort at all when the steroid injections themselves were done. I was in and out of the exam room in roughly 15 minutes tops. Dr. Pitman and his staff were excellent in monitoring my pain level ( again, next to none!) and they all kept the conversation light and upbeat and as relaxed as you could ever hope for. Dr. Pitman is a magician with those needles and I'm thrilled to know that I can easily tolerate this when they become necessary. My thanks to everyone at Nevada Pain and Spine Specialists!|I switched to different doc waited at least 30 minutes or more last 4 apts, had problems with billing, and ran me out of medication,don't return calls or texts,receptionist yelled at me when I asked how much longer after 35 minutes waiting,docs are ok its all down hill after that, not worth my time ive moved on like I'm sure quite a few others to Gord|I saw Dr. Pittman and Kit yesterday! I had injections in my disc.
Just a quick stab..no problem! I am age 86 and appreciated their kindness, gentleness toward me!  Thank you both!  Sally Shaw

She's kind of abrasive and not very friendly.  She always seems irritated and she speaks as if she hates her job, not happy.  I don't like going there only because of her.  The one who makes the appointments for the procedures, Leslie, doesn't take calls and returns them days later.  People at the front desk, no problems there.  They are nice.   Dr. West alone deserves a 5 star.|Caring kind staff and doctors. I never feel like a number. Surprisingly had to find Healthcare professionals in Vegas that treat patients with respect and love   Thanks Henderson Office. Love @corsetedcomedy|Experience with trying to get an appointment even with a referring doctor and attorneys office calling it took weeks. No return calls. I called and pushed a different number and actually someone helped me schedule one. Then I received a text reminder for my appointment and the text said 15 min early and fill out paperwork online. I came in 15 min before my appointment and was denied saying I needed to be there 30 minutes early since I didn't have paperwork filled out. I showed them my text and no where did it say if you need to fill out paperwork 30 minutes early. They took the 11:30 patient early while I was filling out my paperwork. column3:
Reno Tahoe Pain Associates serves the Reno, Nevada area with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Nairizi and a dedicated team of specialists. Our state-of-the-art facility enables us to deliver exceptional care using advanced interventional techniques and personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Dr. Nairizi, our leading pain management specialist, brings a wealth of international experience and advanced training to our practice. Originally from Tehran, Iran, he received his medical degree from the prestigious Shahid Beheshti University School of Medicine in Tehran. His academic journey continued in the United States, where he earned a master's degree in cellular and molecular physiology from Pennsylvania State University.

Dr. Nairizi's clinical expertise was further refined through his residency training at the Drexel University College of Medicine, followed by specialized fellowship training in interventional pain management at the Pennsylvania State University, Hershey Medical Center. After completing his comprehensive medical education, Dr. Nairizi chose to establish his practice in Reno, where he is now recognized as an industry leader in pain management.

Our Facility

Our modern facility in Reno, Nevada is specifically designed to provide the highest possible level of quality care for our patients. Equipped with cutting-edge technology and staffed by experienced healthcare professionals, we create a comfortable and supportive environment for those seeking relief from chronic pain.

Contact Information

Website: [www.renotahoepain.com](https://www.renotahoepain.com/)

Phone: +1 775-384-1127

Address: 5500 Reno Corporate Dr Suite 300, Reno, NV 89511, United States
column11: Dr. Nairizi is originally from Tehran, Iran. He received his medical degree from the Shahid Beheshti University School of Medicine in Tehran and later obtained a master's degree from Pennsylvania State University in cellular and molecular physiology. He then went on to complete his residency training at the Drexel University College of Medicine. Upon completing his fellowship training in interventional pain management at the Pennsylvania State University, Hershey Medical Center, Dr. Nairizi moved to Reno to join the practice. Dr. Nairizi is recognized as an industry leader in pain management. Reno Tahoe Pain Associates has a facility in Reno, Nevada, that allows for us to offer the highest possible level of quality care of our patients.

column40:
When I first came to the Reno-Tahoe Pain Associates for herniated discs L4-5, S1,  my pain level was at a solid 10.  I have received 2 lumbar epidural procedures now within the last month & now, my pain level has dropped significantly,  maybe a 4 now.
Dr. Ali Nairobi, MD is absolutely wonderful at what he does. I was very apprehensive about having these epidural procedures done but, he had me very relaxed & quite confident in his expertise & he made my experience as comfortable as possible & it was actually not as bad as I had anticipated & he was done before I knew it.
His whole staff are absolutely wonderful as well, very kind & make you feel comfortable & at ease.

Thank you Dr. Nairizi, you are truly worth your weight in gold.|Worst crap I've seen  in 68 years of my life I've been totally  disabled  from accident for  the  last  30 years they had me  visit  them 3 times before they would fill my script in 3 weeks costing  me 185.00 plus my insurance told me to fill out a questioner filling it out they didn't even come back when I  finished it  3 cops and two  parametric came in and said I  was trespass not  giving me my change or my previous 2 doctors. Report's so I could see another Dr   I've been without the prescription that I've taken over 35 years  while I got everything they requested|Dr Nairizi along with the entire clinical staff have been an absolute Godsend. I sustained a crush injury which resulted in nerve damage. I underwent a surgical procedure which resulted in my acquiring CRPS. Due to the CRPS, no orthopedic surgeon would touch me. I was living daily with terrible chronic pain which had negatively affected my mood and sleep hygiene. Dr Nairizi and all at RTPA have been absolutely integral to my care. They have all been wonderful advocates to my needs. I underwent nerve blocks along with ablation's and ultimately had spinal cord stimulator surgery. Mind you, it's not a magic wand but truly has made a difference. I have worked in the medical field ( I am a nurse ) my entire professional life and would readily advise for anyone living with any type of chronic pain to consider this procedure and especially with Dr Nairizi as your provider.|The doctors and staff are not only professional but also are extremely kind and considerate, I have had nothing but positive experience with each and every one of them.
I highly recommend this office to anyone experiencing pain associated from either an accident or with difficulties in aging.
I personally have low pain tolerance and the doctors have always allowed for this in keeping me pain free.
Thank you
Mary|I have been seeing Dr.Narizi for 3 years. He has done wonders on my back. I am able to live my life the way I want to now; with being more active with my kids and family. For those who don't know there are other options to treat pain and not just relying on medication to mask the problem and Dr. Narizi can provide that. I truly belive in his work and treatment options. Thanks for making me feel young again!|There is strong science to pain management, of course: but there is also an element of art. Being able to explain the physiological mechanisms of pain is one thing; to have the medical craft and intuition to unravel the complex interplay of causative factors to deliver deeply insightful diagnosis alongside effective immediate treatment and a longer term rehabilitation plan is a whole step up in capability and clinical excellence.

Jason Machado (APRN) at RTPA achieved this combination of potent skills and threw in a charming and considered manner with clear and intelligible communication style.

My treatment for excruciating shoulder and neck pain was a demonstration of clinical competence, physiological awareness and diagnostic intuition. All in all I was extremely impressed - to be honest it was more than I was expecting and the relief from the pain figuratively and literally lifted a massive burden off my shoulders.

I would not hesitate to recommend Jason to anyone with acute pain, but especially where sports injuries / overuse / wearing out situations are at play. Having someone, who understands that (as one gets older) keeping participating in sport is a key priority to any treatment plan, really does matter! I was very gratified and grateful that Jason is the kind of clinician who really gets that concept, no doubt as an active athlete himself.

Overall the facility was excellent in every aspect - professional, yet friendly; responsive and helpful; efficient and simple to deal with.

I am therefore happy to highly recommend Reno Tahoe Pain Associates.|I have been a patient since 2019 and as a retired RN I can not say enough about the professionalism friendliness of this practice!|Again, Dr Nairizi and his staff have been more than AMAZING!  Dr. Nairizi had to replace a permanent tens unit that I received in 2017 because I lost weight and the tens unit did move (this wasn't unexpected if I were to lose weight), but it had slipped over right on top of my spine.  His office was able to get me in rather quickly (I only have Mondays off, so I needed to schedule it for a Monday), they would have gotten me in sooner if not for my work schedule. Dr. Nairizi is the most pleasant man you could ever ask for and extremely good at what he does too!  I mean EXTREMELY GOOD!  His staff, wow, I can't say enough about them!  I experienced what I now know are burns from an external tens unit, which I would not have known unless one of his assistants (I can't remember her name!  I feel so bad!) hadn't worked for a dermatology firm prior, she told me what they were and wrote down what I needed to get to make them better.  I thought they were allergic reactions to something! She is an angel!  And I can't end this review without mentioning Shawnda!  She was at the front desk and I called her for some advice and she was so extremely worried about me (I thought my stitches had come out, turns out I never had stitches, it was just some new fangled butterfly type bandage) anyway, her care and concern for me was over the top!  She was and is, just a wonderful person!

Thank you to everyone at this office!  You are truly an amazing team!

Go see them, they will help you!!

column40:
This review is directed  toward Stephanie of the office staff.  Avoid her at all cost she will not help you. The medication the doctor ordered was not available due to shortages. I called at 8 AM to get a new medication for my elderly mother and Stephanie didn't bother to pass the information to the doctor. My mom called at 10 AM and she put her off as if it wasn't important. I called back at 1:30 and she had me do her job and call different pharmacies to see who had the new medication available. I called her back after I found which pharmacy had it available and she said she would take care of it. At 4:30 mom called back and it still was not handled. Stephanie called at 5:15 and said it was sent to the pharmacy. I called the pharmacy at 6:30 and 8:00 pm to find out when the prescription would be ready. They said we have not received a prescription from your doctor's office. Stephanie lied about the prescription. How could this woman be so cruel to let an elderly woman suffer. To be honest Stephanie should be fired because she makes Dynamic Pain look bad. The doctors are great but if you have an incompetent person on your staff dealing with meds it ruins the respect you have for the whole office.|Both Dr. Imas and Isaac Tunnel are absolutely amazing. As other people have posted, they take the time to listen to you. I never feel rushed but also I'm usually in and out pretty quickly. Sometimes you find Dr's who are willing to listen but then the rest of the patients sit in the waiting room for an hour not the case here.  I've been with both Drs for a while now and they have really helped me and my quality of life. The staff has always very helpful and courteous. The doctors are EXTREMELY knowledgeable and do an amazing job of explaining everything. From meds to what's going on with your body. Highly recommend this establishment to anyone. Unless your dr shopping, this is not the place, they care about their patients and their health and safety/well-being and you as a person.|I've been a patient of doctor Imas for few years now. He is  very knowledgeable,and he explains everything very well. I also wanna thank Krystal Steckel. She's an exceptional doctor as well. And very kind. They always listen to my concerns. And questions I have. They always go  above and beyond. In patient care.They are very kind with us,  patients..Also there stuff are amazing. They always happy to help.  Thank you Dynamic pain rehabilitation for ben part of my life..God Bless you all.|Staffing nice. Dr. Imas is very intelligent in his scope of practice. I totally understood my Plan of care of Physical Therapy and meds. He one of the Best Dr.'s I've been to and I'm an ICU Nurse who has had several back injuries and One surgery that really didn't help much with the pain. I recommend him for anybody in pain or needs Physical Therapy. Dr. Imas is a 5 star plus for me!|Dr. Imas is incredible! He took his time listening to my concerns and sharing options with me. I am so glad that they work to find a solution not just cover your pain with pills. They actually work to give you a better quality of life. I highly recommend this office. The entire staff is great!|Dr. Imas is great. Listens to his patients spending quality time with them and giving detail explanations. Stephanie is awesome. She really advocated for my husband when his mri was being denied.|Dr. Imas is very careful to not overprescribe or overtreat. He likes to solve issues in non-invasive stages initially, then move on to other treatments based upon the initial results. Takes the time to listen.|I love this office! Dr. Imas and his staff has already gone above and beyond for me and I've only been seeing him for about 3 months now. They always answer my questions, make me feel very comfortable and their compassion truly shows!
You never wait at the appointments, the doctors I've seen so far (Dr. Imas and Dr. Lucy) are very easy to talk to and are so very understanding/informative in pain management.
Stephanie behind the desk is so awesome, she went out of her way to help me with my insurance when she didn't have to but she did it anyways. That's what taking care of a customer is all about. She did her job x1000!  I am ecstatic about being a patient here 
I will recommend Dynamic Pain to any of my friends and/or family that are looking for a new provider!

column2: Centennial Spine and Pain previously known as Centennial Medical Group
column3:
Centennial Spine and Pain serves Las Vegas, Nevada with exceptional interventional pain management services designed to help patients reclaim their quality of life. Previously known as Centennial Medical Group, this specialized practice understands that living with chronic pain can significantly impact your ability to enjoy daily activities and maintain overall wellbeing. Their team of highly skilled physicians combines diverse medical training with a genuine commitment to providing personalized care for each individual who walks through their doors.

At Centennial Spine and Pain, the approach to treatment is never one-size-fits-all. The practice recognizes that pain experiences vary greatly from person to person, which is why their physicians take the time to thoroughly understand each patient's unique circumstances, medical history, and specific needs. This patient-centered philosophy enables them to develop customized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Expert Care from Dedicated Specialists

The physicians at Centennial bring extensive expertise in interventional pain techniques, spine care, and comprehensive pain management. Their combined experience allows them to offer innovative solutions for various pain conditions, from acute injuries to chronic degenerative issues. What truly sets this practice apart is their dedication to making a meaningful impact on patients' lives through compassionate, evidence-based care.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 4454 N Decatur Blvd in Las Vegas, Centennial Spine and Pain provides convenient access to premier pain management services for residents throughout the Las Vegas area. Patients can easily schedule consultations by calling +1 702-839-1203 or visiting their comprehensive website at www.centennialspineandpain.com to learn more about available treatments and approach to care.
column11:
Living with pain every day can prevent you from living your best life. Centennial Spine and Pain is an interventional pain management practice that offers outstanding pain and spine care treatments for residents living in and around Las Vegas, Nevada.

The physicians at Centennial Spine and Pain bring a broad range of training and expertise to the practice. All are highly skilled and committed to impacting the lives of every patient they treat. Centennial's providers share a passion for personalized care. No two people have the exact same experience with pain; therefore, each individual deserves a customized approach. The providers at Centennial Spine and Pain take the time to get to know patients and their needs.
column38: Judy Stewart|Debbie Wilson|Alx H|Lupita Grover|S W|Dixie Blessing|PT|Melani Stevens
column40:
I have been a patient for over a decade. Dr. Lanzkowski did the majority of my procedures. Since he has grown and gotten more Dr. on staff is service has stayed to the same quality and care as the owner himself. Dr. Alvarado, Dr Abassi have kept the high standard I have come to appreciate. With the exception of Dr. braumgalt. This Dr has no respect for the patients time. He can be running hours behind schedule and his disregard for his tardiness is ignored and he couldn't care less about what you are even being treated for he can't take two seconds to look over my chart before he walks in unless it's to look at you with useless judgement. He is good at procedures but unfortunately he cancels it with horrible bedside manner and his need to tell you how smart he is and all the useless knowledge he has picked up over the years. And lastly but certainly not least Dr. Raddue (sp) the anesthesiologist  is perfect in every way. I can't compliment him enough. Mr Sandman gets his signature recipe of sleepy time like no other Dr can!!! No headaches, no nausea, NO WAKING UP MID SURGERY (yes it has happened to me!) he's just amazing. Next time he goes to Scotland I will reschedule! He has never left me feeling anything but better. He is magic. THANK YOU CENTENNIAL SPINE AND PAIN. from front end service to check out. It's seamless and enjoyable! I used to have severe anxiety and not sleep for days before any procedure. NOT WITH THIS STAFF. I'm calm and excited to having a procedure to help manage my pain. Loyal patient for life. I trust them and highly recommend them.|Dr. B and staff are absolutely thee BEST!!! I went in to see him as a new patient because my insurance changed. I wasn't thrilled about that, but I went anyway. So upon arriving, the nurse took me back, and from that moment, going forward, it has been nothing but the best. I went in needing a right hip replacement, and Dr. B thought otherwise, and I agreed on a stem cell reguvenation. BEST DECISION OF MY ENTIRE LIFE!!! I have nothing but GREAT things to say about Dr. B & staff. They are all AMAZING. Thank you sooooo much, everyone  and oooh can't forget "Kaiser" The cutest ever. Lol|My wife had a issue getting her meds at the pharmacy. Called our Dr's office. Spoke with Evelyn at Centennial medical group. Back office and she made sure my wife got her meds in a timely mannor. Friendly, professional and great great personality. She treats you like family. A great addition to the care team. Excellent.|Friendly staff and good doctors, but unfortunately, that's where it ends.
I had an appointment for a pain management shot that was scheduled WEEKS in advance. I'd requested for Centennial Spine to coordinate with my surgeon so that they'd work together on my case and be in accordance. Apparently, that was too much to ask. The day before my procedure, they canceled my appointment due to a lack of communication.
I guess they don't give a hoot about a patients well-being. I bet if they, or their loved ones, were the ones in pain, they'd get their ducks in a row.
I am thoroughly disappointed and disgusted.|This practice doesn't deserve a one star, in my opinion. I've been patient for a long time, despite the fact that none of the treatments were able to relieve my pain and ultimately caused irreversible nerve damage to my skin. I've talked to three different physicians there, and it appears that when they take over from another doctor, they don't even bring up the patient's problem. There is also disorder in the office. The referral process to another practice was really chaotic and unprofessional, and it took about a month. The referral coordinator took four weeks to provide the referral for my carpal tunnel syndrome, and instead of attaching the EMG test result, she sent the results of my lower back MRI.That is unbelievably annoying and shows a total lack of knowledge.|All very pleasant office. Would recommend highly. The staff was polite, brought me water. During consultation darn it I can't think of his name was very detailed but not being a back specialist myself most was foreign. He said he would go over it as much as I need to completely understand. surgery was not advised but a referral was. So I will see another surgeon then return back to this office. Also signs on walls no meds given on first visit = evaluation which I liked. I didn't go for meds I went to find out what's going on with my lower back and explain my scan.|Have been a patient at Centennial Medical since I moved to the area about 17years. Dr. David Lanzkowsky is a wonderful Doctor, very personable, great bedside manners, as well as some of the other Doctors and Assistants who have worked there.  My latest experience has been with the PA Brandy who is also a wonderful addition. If there is a billing question Sabrina in billing dept. is always on top of it, if she doesn't have the answer she will get back to you with it. I HIGHLY recommend Centennial Medical Group.|So happy with the level of attention and care I have received at Centennial Spine & Pain. When I entered the office I lived with constant pain and after one procedure with Dr. Lanskowzky, I have zero pain for the first time in years. His wonderful staff and his warm, caring demeanor made me feel comfortable throughout the entire process. Thank you so much!!!

column3:
Las Vegas Injury Pain Center serves Las Vegas, Nevada with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to individuals suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our state-of-the-art facility combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment approaches to address a wide spectrum of pain-related issues. Founded on the principle that pain management requires a multidisciplinary approach, our center brings together a team of board-certified specialists committed to improving patients' quality of life through personalized care plans.

At Las Vegas Injury Pain Center, our distinguished medical professionals bring decades of combined experience in pain management and rehabilitation:

  • Jamie Jiao, MD - Specializing in interventional pain procedures and comprehensive pain management

  • Hadi Moten, MD - Expert in neurology-related pain conditions and advanced diagnostic techniques

  • David Webb, MD - Focusing on sports medicine and injury-related pain management

  • Marcelo Gomez, PA-C - Physician Assistant with extensive experience in rehabilitation and recovery

  • Ray Troche, PA-C - Physician Assistant specializing in post-operative pain management

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our center offers a full spectrum of treatments for various pain conditions, including but not limited to:

  • Work-related injuries and workers' compensation cases

  • Auto accident injuries and rehabilitation

  • Sports injuries and performance recovery

  • Chronic pain conditions including fibromyalgia and neuropathy

  • Spinal disorders and back pain management

  • Joint pain and arthritis treatment

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain. Our approach combines cutting-edge medical interventions with holistic care strategies to promote long-term healing and improved functionality.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services:

Phone: +1 702-879-2005

Address: 851 S Rampart Blvd #100, Las Vegas, NV 89145, United States

Website: www.lvinjurypaincenter.com

Las Vegas Injury Pain Center welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans, including workers' compensation and auto insurance for injury-related cases.

column38: Frances Malinis|Lillian Steger|clsmooth 333|Nathan Moore|Corrin Douglass|Jimm H|Lisa Roth|April Di Giovanni
column40:
Unfortunately, I was in an automobile accident.
Fortunately, I was referred to LViPC for my treatment.

All the providers and staff I encountered were friendly and professional.
They addressed my concerns and ensured I received proper care for injuries sustained.

Special acknowledgements for Alberto and Griselda who were always very helpful with inquiries and provided follow ups as requested.|It's very rare when I admit that I'm wrong then again it's very rare that I actually am. Well this is one of those times. Went here for a second opinion because the first place I went to was an absolute disaster so I had preconceived notions of how it was going to be. I was completely wrong. They were nothing and I mean nothing like the first place. I have to admit we did get off to a rocky start but that was addressed and corrected immediately. So with my appointment it was absolutely nothing like the first place. they were knowledgeable,friendly, and they listen to my concerns. they give me choices, options, none of this this is what we're going to do thus say the Lord. No going straight for the high dollar treatment and then say well we're going to do surgery next. There was none of that just caring understanding and definitely  what a doctor's office should be. They have that Midwestern values and ethics what you don't see a lot of in Vegas. My conversation with the owner of the clinic was genuine and definitely put my mind at ease. For any of my friends or family that would need a facility like this I would definitely recommend this place. They have definitely earned my trust and faith in them. So if I do have to go up the ladder in treatment options I will be dealing with them and no one else. I had the opportunity to talk briefly with another patient and he highly praised them. Which was nice because the words he used were, they make me feel like family and they truly have my best interest at heart. And after my appointment I understood what he meant by that. My final comment is if you are in an injury and you need pain management go here! do not go anywhere else|Dr. Rosler is one of the most outstanding physicians ever. He takes time to speak with you, listens to you and most of all  he is respectful.
I love the fact that he is not quick to hand out a quick fix like narcotics, he absolutely cares about your well-being and wants to eventually see you get better with whatever the situation may be.
The front staff is very kind and extremely efficient.|2/3 appointments including one procedure had to be cancelled due to the inability of staff to get insurance authorization. The last time,I went in for a nerve block and the office didn't call to authorize until after I had taken off work and was sitting in back awaiting the procedure. They only care about liens and not patients that come in with genuine pain who happen to be coming with insurance.
They wasted my time don't let them waste yours.

I know they are trying to cover their inability to work ahead, but NO ONE shared that there was someone else to speak with, only that maybe they could have the insurance cover me that Friday after already taking the day off from work. It was scheduled TWO WEEKS out specifically so your staff could get insurance authorization. If there was an issue, how about contacting your patient before they arrive in the office? Doctors forget they are there to help their patients, but when a staff is so dysfunctional it only makes things worse. I have asked you stop any further authorizations against my insurance as I have no intention of visiting your office again. Thank you, for your response that did nothing to address the issues your patient faced at the hands of the staff.|I have been a patient for almost two years. Following a back injury from a car accident, I have had quite the road to recovery. Everyone has been incredibly helpful; the front office, scheduling, billing, Physician Assistants, and Doctors have all been wonderful and supportive every single time. I have received beneficial help from Dr. Webb, Dr. Rosler, and Dr. Hall, for a variety of injuries/complications. The doctors have listened to me and then clearly explained to me why I am having the symptoms I was experiencing, as well as their recommendation to resolve those issues and why. Dr. Hall has been my primary physician since he joined the practice, and I cannot recommend him highly enough. He is a master of his specialty and I feel like he has literally given me my life back. (Thank you, Dr. Hall!) If you are struggling with pain, call them today. You will not regret it.|Do not go here if you have a cheap insurance they just look at you and charge you all you got so you wont comeback the asian male doctor and say im good to go back to work and i ask can extend one day he said no i was wondering how he know that my.pain is ok driving home here i go agaian pain on my back and legsn*|I feel very fortunate to have been referred to Dr. Rosler, and this also goes for his administrative & medical teams. After my consultation with Dr. Rosler, my anxiety immediately disappeared. The professionalism, kindness, and over all positive energy that everyone shares within each office, had made my first procedure incredibly pleasant (a lot less scary than I originally feared).
I highly recommend Dr. Rosler, and I'm extremely grateful to have been referred to the VERY BEST!|Getting an appointment for a consultation wasn't an issue. However, I didn't leave feeling exactly comfortable about the recommendation for treatment and how it could benefit me. I was only recommended for the procedure after the doctor decided to due a couple movement tests, he was initially trying to tell me to go see a neurologists to map my nerves. I became even more uncomfortable when I needed to schedule the procedure and was told I would be called and given a time the day before the date I set a month in advance. I was given no information about the procedure or where it would be done. I called the Monday before my scheduled date trying to get more information, make sure the procedure was approved by my insurance and I was pretty much brushed off and she would not give me an appointment time. The representative didn't even want to check on the approval of my insurance until I pressed her to do so. The representative told me the authorization was still pending and she usually doesn't receive approval until the day before. I asked what happens if it is denied, she stated that the appointment would then have to be rescheduled. The possibility of having to go back to my employer and say now I don't need this day off but I am going to have to request another day in hopes this doesn't change, is unacceptable. There is ample time to receive authorization and their practices should be more accommodating to the patients, they should be obtaining authorization prior to scheduling and should be able to set a time at the time of scheduling. Also, I wasn't given any costs this procedure would cost me. I received a call the day before with my appointment with time of 12:30 p.m. Mind you I set this appointment a month in advance, you'd think I would have been the one of the first appointments in the morning. When I asked where I was going, the employee asked, what do you mean? I told her I didn't know where I was supposed to go, back to the office I had my consultation in or a different location. She told me I should have received a pamphlet with all the information I needed. I told her I never received such pamphlet. After stating how odd that was and that I should have received a pamphlet with all the details I needed, she finally provided the location of where I should go and told me no food for 6 hours prior, she said nothing to the fact that I couldn't have water that morning. I've had other more invasive procedures where I was allowed water so I thought nothing of it. Especially since I didn't have any food since dinner the night before and the only thing that kept me from being extremely dizzy with massive stomach cramps was to drink water. If I had known I couldn't have water as well, I would have insisted on an earlier appointment. My last sip of water was at 12 p.m., 30 minutes prior to arriving at the surgery center. When I was finally pulled back over an hour after my appointment, I was honest with staff and when asked if I had any water I told them yes, about 16 oz throughout the morning. They informed me they would have to do the procedure without anesthesia or would have to cancel. The procedure was canceled. I scheduled an entire day off from work and wasted my sick leave to have the procedure canceled because their office staff can't get it together and properly inform their patients. They can't get on the same page with the surgery center staff either as I was told by the surgery center that they would prefer patients have nothing, no food, no liquids, for 8 hours prior to the procedure, not 6. They treat their patients like numbers, no one cared about what had happened. You'd have thought the doctor would have told his staff to check on me once he found out the procedure was canceled but I didn't hear from anyone for 4 business days. And when I did, I was told "oh sorry, I was out on medical leave". And then had the nerve to ask if I wanted to reschedule. Completely unacceptable. Don't waste your time with this office, they will waste yours.
