column40:
Dr. Wilson was great and explained things very well, but I had to fire him/Southern Nevada Pain Center because the office staff is HORRIBLE.
I was scheduled for a procedure and had called in 3 times , over a week, to discuss a couple things and I never received a call back. (after leaving 3 messages, 2 weeks ago)
I contacted my Ins. company, because I did not hear back from the Dr's office and needed to know if my procedure was authorized and how much my portion would be. (The office had a full month before my scheduled procedure to get it pre - authorized, and told me at the 1st apt., that they would.)
The Ins. company stated they had not received anything from them regarding the procedure. I was contacted by the surgical center for the procedure and I notified them that an authorization had never been sent in, so they were being fired and I would go somewhere else where my health and time is better respected and the staff are willing to communicate.
I DO NOT recommend this place if you want/need communication. They are absolutely awful!!!
I am an RN, and NO ONE should ever be treated this way when they are trying to get healthcare.
I do not know how they even stay in business with the way they treat their patients.
They have been reported to the Ins company I am with and they are contracted with. Hopefully the Ins. company will drop them since they don't seem to care about their patients.|I do not recommend So Nevada Pain Center, they have constant staff changes, dont keep good records on their customer and now the final straw was again they accused me of have illicit drugs in my sytem, but each time I retake the urine test the second time it comes out clean.  Not to mention they lost the sample as well.   I do not appreciate after 15 years to be treated like some lowlife criminal.|Front end receptionist has poor customer service skills.  Never makes eye contact or greets patients. All I get from her while her head is face down and pointing " complete the paperwork ".  I would suggest to management that she attends a training that focuses on proper communication , customer service and people skills.|I Patrice Coleman didn't feel welcomed because a so call receptionist told me her name was Veronica if that's her real name when I got my referral she told me that South West medical didn't want me for a receptionist to call and tell a patient another hospital facility doesn't want my presence. That automatically tells me she  d I sent want my color in there facility SHE hurt my feelings behind her telling me I'm n I t wanted. I wish I can get her name she violated my HIPPA RIGHTS and my civil  rights she need to stop bullying new patients  I pray to God I get her real name I'm going to file a civil rights lawsuit on Veronica. How dare you bully me because of my color. 1 out of 10=1|Dr Kim would not see my wife after several procedures because he felt like he did not receive enough money from her car accident.He just totally cut off her meds and left her in a bad situation.|Let me start by saying Dr Erkulvrawstr is the best. He is kind, compassionate and professional in every way and I hold him in the highest regard. His office staff and PAs , on the other hand, are rude, unsympathetic and have no sense of urgency whatsoever. Today I brought in LOA paperwork to the office. I paid the fee to have the paperwork filled out ($60). After I had my appointment with the PA, I asked them to put July 9 as my return to work date because I can't get the procedure done until June 17. The receptionist tells me that the doctor would fill it out and it would be ready in 10-15 days! When it's ready we'll call you to come and pick it up. I said, pick it up? Aren't you going to fax it for me? She  just shrugged. This is May 9. I told them I need to have the procedure done ASAP. They said that they could not get me in before June 17! Unless someone cancels their appointment. So what should I do? Come and sit in the waiting room all day, every day, hoping someone doesn't show up!? Absolutely absurd! Over the past 6 months- a year, this office staff has become a hair and nails salon! No consideration is given, no empathy, no compassion. Zero. It's as if you are bothering a waitress at IHOP for another cup of coffee. People who go to a pain doctor are often.....wait for it....IN PAIN! Scheduling a procedure that will ease your pain SIX WEEKS from now doesn't seem empathetic! I will no longer recommend this office. I've been a patient for 15 years and go to the office on Desert Inn Rd. Apparently they don't need any more business, because they don't take care of the patients they already have anymore. In the beginning, they were great. You waited a reasonable amount of time, for appointments and procedures. Now you feel like you're getting your tires rotated or ordering pizza. Absolute cold hearted, merciless callous customer service! If not for the good doctor, I would seek out another clinic! If you go there, just be advised, you won't find any empathy or compassion there!|Rude lady at the front desk!  I am unable sit for more than a minute or two, and she gave me a clipboard with several pages. What a struggle! I have trimmers so It was sloppy.  She got irritated that I wrote on the wrong line. It was so obvious that she thought I was an idiot. I asked for a place to rest the clip board on so I could and fill it out and she did not even assist me with that in any way.  Then to Dr . Wilson. He didn't even welcome me when he walked in. First thing out of his mouth was, tell me why you can't have an epidural?!  I told him and he may as well told me I'm a liar.  I have an amazing team of doctors, but he  was a disappointment.|I am a patient on this clinic, I really like the doctor I see. Today ( March 28,.2024)at 10:45 am I went to the office for only a question and the lady at the front desk really ignore me, first she say a question? And I say yes, a. Question, I may have an accent But I do speak english. Then she talk to her co worker and said, can you answer a question to her? It was like a joke. The co worker didnt answer so she send me to sit in not a nice way at all. I really feel I was being discriminated because I am latina and this is the first time after 24 years living in the Country. After 20 minuts I just left. Nobody give one minut of attention. Honestly, the clinic should hire better people, I am always very nice and polite when I talk to others but today this lady make me feel very bad. I am a sick person, and thats what the clinic is for. If you dont like sick people or latinos accents you shouldnt be working with people at a front desk. Its called empathy. Next time I will ask for a supervisor and will go ahead and will fill a report and for sure I will make my doctor know about this

column3:
Nevada Comprehensive Pain Center serves Las Vegas, NV with specialized pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. As one of the leading medical centers focused on treating pain and pain-related conditions, our team employs a multidisciplinary approach that combines innovative treatments with compassionate care. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we're committed to developing personalized treatment plans that address both the symptoms and underlying causes of your discomfort.

At Nevada Comprehensive Pain Center, we believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our board-certified physicians utilize the latest diagnostic tools and therapeutic techniques to effectively manage various pain conditions. From back and neck pain to neuropathy and complex regional pain syndrome, our specialists work diligently to improve your quality of life and restore functionality.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our unwavering commitment to keeping our patients' best interests at the forefront of everything we do. We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop treatment strategies that align with your goals and lifestyle. This patient-centered philosophy has established us as a trusted resource for pain management in the Las Vegas community.

Visit Our Las Vegas Location

Our conveniently located facility at 2809 W Charleston Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89102 offers a comfortable environment where patients receive exceptional care. To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, call us at +1 702-476-9999 or visit our website at nvcpc.com. Take the first step toward a pain-free life today.

Absolute Greed, opioid's have created a cottage industry and really the only opioid crisis is the one the almighty powers that be have created.  The short stint of prescription opioid deaths in the early 2000's were done by 2008  but the heroin and new fentanyl in the heroin created a crisis for government and addicts. NOT PRESCRIBED PATIENTS!  Lets through everything opioid and call everything a crisis. In moves the greed.  Nevada Pain Management to the rescue.  Instead of a simple prescription we can rehabilitate everyone with injections for 10-20 times as a doctor visit solution. Except this doesn't work for everyone but not in this companies mind.  Greed Wins!!   Avoid this place if you have more than 1 pain issue and they will not ask for your old doctors records.  Less $$$ for them!!  Criminals!|I'm new so it's hard to say what's bad or good but so far so good, I also keep track with every doctor every treatments and tests that I need for both of my knees, they have not Gave me any treatments lately but they are with UMC ORTHOPEDIC so i been getting cortisone injections in my left knee, but pain medications dont work no more..
My primary doctor should be the one Lifting the dosage more, and send referral out she did, but they only gave me another injection they said the meniscus wait more maybe by March than we can run another MRI and to see if its causes more tears lol so I said to him oh ok..
But by than we can see..He said right now it's just one tear so it's not as bad and that you can still be able to feel the normal tingling sharp pain continues as months goes by but I am a stage 4 now and it's already bone on bone but the goal is to provide therapy and pain medications and treatments to stabilize it, but not to have a surgery. I was told I should be eligible for disability claim because this been over a year now..so I'm just Trying the most I can through out the year its very painful  hurts so bad everyday and nights i can't work, i cant stand or walk.|Unfortunately, I have a medical condition that I have to rely on the professionals to help me deal with my chronic pain.  I am thankful for the awesome staff at Comprehensive Pain Center. I would be up a creek without a paddle if not for the expertise and professionalism of their staff. Definitely a 5 stars|If you are in pain and your insurance approves this place, you are better off going to Walgreens and handling it yourself. Not only do they treat you like a junkie or criminal, you get asked if you have any guns or weapons on you the minute you hit the door. Pathetic they do not care about pain management whatsoever. I had a nerve ablation scheduled which I had to have two Branch blocks previous, they booked one in October of 2023 and then they just fell off the map and never booked the second one. Nor did I ever receive the nerve ablation. After calling 4 months later and asking them why I haven't received another appointment to do the second branch block, they said they will call me back after they spoke with the doctor. No return phone call ever. So, I made an appointment to go in and ask them in person and I got the same answer will be calling you within a week or two and we'll schedule the second one. No call. Absolutely flabbergasted I went back to my surgeon and told him it was going on with the pain clinic. He was completely appalled and then referred me to Velazquez pain center. That is a wonderful place.
I highly recommend Velazquez pain center. They scheduled my nerve ablation within 2 weeks and also gave me pain medication in the interim. I was not treated like a criminal I was spoken to like a person with genuine issues. I broke my neck in a motorcycle accident in October of 2022. I've had three neck surgeries and then a fourth one to install hardware. I do have sever pain all day, all night, every day and every night. There's not a minute that goes by that I'm not in pain. For those of you out there who have the same type of issue, I know you understand. My heartfelt advice to you is to avoid this place at all costs. It is a waste of your time, your energy and your precious effort.|The phone system sucks.  On hold for extended periods of time after a surgical procedure.   If you call to make an appointment after waiting on hold for 20 minutes,  I was disconnected.|Previous experience was excellent EXCEPT, procedure resulted in pain relief for 3-4 days and was expected to last "3-6months"   So attempted calls to the ONE phone number and each of the several Menu options to cancel appointments.   FINALLY got through on "New Patient" line and cancelled.  This is NO reflection on the staff in the surgery center - all were very professional!!|I need pain injections in my neck from an accident. I've had them several times with my old doctor (he retired), so I came here in January 2023. I have had to rounds of mapping in my neck, that by the way too over six months to get done because of there scheduling staff! I need a third one that I've been trying to get since Nov. 2023. They get approval from insurance and no one calls to schedule. I've called the office several times after I see my pain doctor (monthly) and he tells me "oh they'll call you to schedule" and it never gets done. So I call and it either rings for over an hour or You speak to the new girl Ashley who says "Let me look and see if everything in order". Then she says it looks like insurance hasn't sent us anything back, but it's been two months ". Then I tell them I talked to insurance and it was NEVER SENT! Oh we'll resubmit it and call in two weeks. That was 9 weeks ago, again. I call again in July 2024 about an approval they got three months ago that they NEVER CALLED TO SCHEDULE! Tiana says we've called you several times to schedule. No you haven't. I actually have phone bills from Verizon that show EVER SINGLE NUMBER that's called in or out going and your business is NO WHERE ON IT!!! They try to make it look like you're the incompetent one that didn't call back. But they're not smart enough to know that we can prove you've never called or done your jobs. I was told again THEY have to resubmit to my insurance because the approval has expired it'll be two weeks! I can't with these ppl, I'm done. I liked Dr. Carno, he's very good at what he does but if his staff is so incompetent that you can't even see him, what's the point!|My surgeons office sent me to this place for pain injections in my neck.

That was in November 2023... the first red flag was that this clinic said "don't call us for the procedure, we will call you when the PAR is approved by your insurance". In February 2024, I got suspicious and called my health insurance to see the status of the par...

This company never submitted it!    Oh, and I called this company, no answer and no calls were returned... my insurance also called on my behalf, and they couldn't get a hold of them either.

I told my surgeons office about the problems at this clinic, they said we only send you to the better pain management clinics, once you have a problem or a complaint at this (pain management) clinic!

Velazquez Pain Relief Center in Las Vegas, Nevada serves the greater Clark County area with comprehensive interventional pain management solutions. At Velazquez Pain Relief Center, patients benefit from a wide range of minimally invasive procedures and therapeutic interventions. State-of-the-Art Facility

column40:
Dr. Thunder is exceptional, thorough, incredibly knowledgeable, down to earth and isn't afraid to go against the grain if both he and the patient agree on the course of treatment. Dr. Thunder is a breath of fresh air in the pain management arena and I'm so thankful I found him.  He's very easy to talk to and level with in expressing my goals in treatment. I admire his courage and compassion, he does not view his patients as a one size fits all for treatment options. He did an in-dept evaluation on my first visit as well as physical exam. Never had I experienced a provider who specializes in pain management actually sit down with me and discuss my health.

Past experiences were all the same, sit in a room wait 20+ minutes for the doc, ask 4-5 generic questions while never making eye contact, ask if I wanted some steroid shots that only ever put me in more pain then rush out of the room saying "see ya next month" and onto the next patient.

Dr. Thunder actually took his time in trying to piece together my unfortunate long standing time-line battling chronic pain. I came to him that first visit shell shocked from my last pain management physician who was unsupportive of the goals I wanted to reach in pain management along with impossible to effectively communicate with.

I was already very excited to meet Dr. Thunder after carefully reviewing his website that offered some insight on his vision for his patients. I can't thank him and everyone else at this practice enough for all their hard work, dedication, compassion and professionalism. Everyone working in this office is awesome.
10 stars!|I can NOT thanks Dr Thunder and his staff enough! I came to him after being emotionally exhausted from my former pain clinic. I was diagnosed by an orthopedic surgeon with hip dysplasia! I was sent to the university of Standford with the same poor care I received from the former pain clinic. I tried dr thunders trigger point injections to the ketamine infusions!  Both helped on a minor scale. I knew their was something more to my hip issue! I went to the university of Utah for a 3rd opinion! Upon reviewing my x-rays they determined a hip reconstruction would be necessary. I scheduled surgery. Dr Anderson's(surgeon from Utah) nurse had some concerns about my pain management. Dr Thunder made sure I had enough to tie me through the 8 hour car ride home and after surgery care! My case wasn't cut and dry! Upon opening me my socket was completely shredded and dr Anderson had to do a little more than planned to me! 24 hours after surgery I am resting in my home! More than grateful for Dr. Thunder's and Dr Anderson's teams! If your in pain and frustrated from the same run of the mill pain clinics give Dr Thunder a call! He's so kinda and makes the hardest processes a breeze! I can not thank them enough!|I recommend everyone I know to Dr Thunder for any pain management!! The staff is wonderful and accommodating. They are pleasant to work with, always joyful to see you and very caring. Dr Thunder always listens to your needs and works with your pain management to give you a better quality of life! I would never see anyone else for my pain management. I just love them that much!! I feel very blessed to be a patient to this office! If I could I would give them more than 5 stars.|By far the best medical practice I've ever been to. Dr. Thunder and RN Pearla are hands down, the most caring and knowledgeable professionals in the field. I've got a complex medical history. It's rare to find providers that don't need to google my conditions. Not them! Every issue heard. From cutting edge technology (TMS) to physical therapy, acupuncture and even pelvic floor exercises, they do it all to help people regain quality of life. I've been a patient since 2018. I'd move but I'm afraid I'll never find this level of care anywhere else. Thank you Pearla and Dr. Thunder for always taking so much time with me!|Amazing staff and crew here!!
Been under their care for 6 years and they've never given up on my chronic pain. Always wanting and willing to try new cutting edge treatments.

Trina is the best Manual Therapist as well. Front house staff Michelle and JoAnna are really the greatest. Always friendly and always answering the phone with knowledge and understanding.|I have been going to Thunder Pain Mgmt. for 3 1/2 years. They are a great group of Phyicians and staff. Friendly, caring and knowledgeable. Dr. Thunder and Pearla MacDonald., are by far the most knowledgeable pain med. Doctors I have seen over the last 15 yrs. when my chronic pain began, I highly recommend them. My confidence in both of them goes beyond GREAT...  Fantastic!!!|Dr.Thunder and nurse practitioner Pearla plus the friendly staff helped me immensely through horrific pain for 1.5 years at level 10. I didn't have a correct diagnosis until Dr.Thunder saw me for an hour and he gave me thorough check up with information. It took awhile for his regime to work but I finally got out of bed (praise Jesus) and can walk again! (My pain 2-4) I am now cooking, gardening and even hiking. Dr.Thunder has a holistic approach to pain and is open to learning better techniques for pain management.|I cannot begin to express how grateful o am for Dr Thunder and his amazing staff! Trina, the manual therapist literally changed my life with her magical hands. I've been in chronic pain and on pain meds for 15 years. For the last month I have felt almost zero pain AND Im weaning off of the pain meds. I don't even need them anymore. The staff is extremely professional. I recommend Thunder Pain to anyone suffering from pain!  THANK YOU!

Pain Matters Wellness Center in Las Vegas, Nevada is a premier holistic health facility dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic pain through integrative treatment approaches. Established with the mission of addressing pain at its source rather than merely masking symptoms, our center combines evidence-based medical practices with complementary therapies to create personalized care plans. Our team of licensed professionals specializes in treating various conditions including back pain, joint disorders, sports injuries, and post-surgical rehabilitation, all within our modern facility on Durango Drive.

At Pain Matters Wellness Center, we offer a diverse range of therapeutic modalities designed to address pain from multiple angles. Each treatment plan is customized following a thorough assessment of the patient's condition, medical history, and lifestyle factors that may contribute to their discomfort.

Our Approach to Wellness

Beyond in-office treatments, our practitioners provide guidance on home exercises, ergonomic adjustments, and lifestyle modifications that support long-term pain relief and prevention. This collaborative approach has helped countless Las Vegas residents return to their daily activities with improved mobility and significantly reduced pain.

Do not trust Dale D. he will back stab you.|The year, 2018.. I was in the I.c.u. With severe liver sepsis (due to Gastroparesis) And ridiculously horrible back pain! Straight from hospital to Dr. "Geppy's" office, my life would change forever! EVERYONE at this office is SENSATIONAL! Like family! Antflick, Jocelyn Segovia, Jen, I  could go on all day! I see many specialists, NONE As compassionate yet professional as this ENTIRE team! I have seen them every month for over FIVE years! Healthcare doesn't get any better than this!
"Ice, ice baby" -Tara|Dr. Gephardt is a great doctor and very caring, but his staff is abhorrent. They literally lie to try and cover up their errors. I know you know your staff sucks, since you referred me to speak with Jill directly, but she's also a liar and not patient oriented. Hope you can upgrade soon, you deserve superb staff Doc, or at the very least competent.|I love this man and his entire staff especially Jennifer. I have been dealing with a WC nightmare since I moved from California.  I was referred to Dr. Gephardt for pain management post disectomy/fusion I had a little over a year ago. Right away he ordered an MRI and set up an epidural injection for my issue. I have more body parts that need to be addressed and he will be handling them from here on out. He's straightforward, tells it like it is, and listens. I would refer anyone who's looking for pain management to go to Dr. Gephardt.|I suffer with lower back pain and spasms. This affected my daily living, to the point that I went to a surgeon for options. I decided to AVOID back surgery, to proceed with injections in my back and meds to try to keep me stable enough to live my  life.  Dr. Gephardt and Dr. Antflick got me to the point , where I could actually plan a 7 hours drive for the first time in two years.   Their compassionate care to my unbearable pain, was exactly what I needed!  Their staff is also amazing, caring and very professional. If you have back pain and you don't want surgery, please go visit NV PAIN CARE.  They will work their heart out , to help you!|I was referred to Dr. Gephardt by the esteemed spine surgeon Dr. Thalgott for an epidural for a bulging disc low back.  Dr. Gephardt and his staff are the most compassionate providers I have ever experienced.  The epidural he performed was a total success, and if the severe pain comes back I will be going to him again.  This is a wonderful physician and staff and I am so grateful for his help.|Iv been to pain management clinics where the drs are snobby, unprofessional, and do not have the patients best interest at heart.  Now that being said Dr. Gephardt and Dr.  VanLeuven are the BEST DRS IN LAS VEGAS!!! they take the time to actually know you and where your pain is.  They make you feel comfortable so its easier to talk to them.  Iv been with him over a year now and would recommend them to anyone.  My mother even sees them and she loves them. The staff is amazing as well. Everyone is so friendly and helpful its wonderful.   If you have chronic pain please do your self a favor and see them.|Underwent a spinal epidural for stenosis and despite much anxieties, Dr. Gephardt made it an 'almost' pleasant experience. His pleasant demeanor and very positive approach to the procedure was very comforting and the process itself was painless. I was made most comfortable at the clinic and frankly, I slept well through out the procedure.

column3:
Nevada Laser Pain Relief serves Reno, Nevada and surrounding communities with advanced pain management solutions that don't rely on medications or invasive procedures. Our specialized clinic focuses on helping people live pain-free through innovative and natural drug-free options that address the root causes of discomfort while promoting the body's natural healing processes.

At Nevada Laser Pain Relief, we understand that chronic pain affects approximately one in three Americans, significantly diminishing quality of life and limiting daily activities. Our mission is clear: when people get out of pain, they live fuller, more active, healthier lives. Our treatment philosophy centers on the promise that "If It Hurts... We Can Help!"

Advanced Treatment Technologies

We utilize a powerful combination of cutting-edge therapies including:

  • Laser Therapy - Targeted light energy that reduces inflammation and accelerates healing

  • PEMF (Pulsed Electromagnetic Field) Therapy - Stimulates cellular repair and improves circulation

  • Shockwave Therapy - Breaks down scar tissue and promotes new tissue growth

Conditions We Treat

Our specialized treatments effectively address a wide range of painful conditions including:

  • Arthritis and joint pain

  • Tendinitis and sports injuries

  • Post-operative recovery

  • Fracture healing

  • Neck and shoulder pain

  • Neuropathy

  • Migraines and headaches

  • Wrist pain and trigger finger

  • Knee pain

  • Plantar fasciitis

  • All other pain-related issues

Visit Our Pain Relief Center

Experience the difference of drug-free pain management at our comfortable Reno facility. We're conveniently located at 150 Country Estates Circle, Suite 120, Reno, NV 89511. Contact us today at (775) 583-5300 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.

Learn more about our innovative approaches to pain management at www.nevadalaserpainrelief.com

column38: Samantha Watts|Beverly LaRue|Rachel Favella|Ian Gibson|Afraid Of Retribution|KGReno|Dawn Dessaussois|Julia Stead
column40:
Thank you Nevada Laser Pain Relief for saving me in an emergency situation. I live in Las Vegas but travel to Reno often for work, I threw my back out right before my flight to Reno. I was in severe pain and wasn't sure how I was going to make it through the week. Cheyanne and James got me in right away and I felt relief the first day. I just had my third treatment and I am feeling 90% better. Not only did they help me recover quickly but they gave me the tools and knowledge I needed to continue healing. I will be coming to see Cheyanne every time I am in Reno from now on. If your struggling with pain don't hesitate to come to Nevada Laser Pain Relief, what they are offering the world is life changing. Thank you again for taking care of me!|After years of constant pain from knee replacements not allowing me much needed sleep after using my at home Nevada laser pain reliever treatment faithfully in 7 days I could tell the difference, after 30 days I can sleep through the night without mooning , tossing and putting heating pad on my knees . I would not of believed I could feel so much better after years of pain. The staff has been very helpful with any and all my questions.|They prayed with us. They listened. They immediately acted for what we wanted. They are humble and assisted with corresponding other therapies. You must come here. Whatever you're dealing with. Before you have a surgery or injections or medications.

My verse was Matthew 5:4 where those who mourn will be comforted because we were ready to give up. But God blessed us with James and Cheyenne. Through a series of the 8 shockwave & laser sessions to break up the calcified ribs and scar tissue all over my husbands upper back, we were able to go to our chiropractor and for the first time, he can stand straight. The adjustment held too. A week later, another adjustment and the neck adjustment held too. Laser and vibration therapy with acupuncture has allowed the neck to release as well. 14 years of PTSD caused damage reversed (and holding) in 2.5 months total. Their verse is 2 Corinthians 1:4 where God comforts us in our afflictions so that we can comfort others. And that is exactly what they did for us.

Through their prayers and removing the physical aspects, we are being shown that neurofeedback will be the final component as PTSD and insomnia are the cause and what is halting the complete recession of chronic pain and relaxation of the muscles. We don't see those days of insane pain levels anymore. To see my husband smile, chase our children up the stairs for fun, and have hope like never before, it's priceless! We wouldn't have gotten here without them. God used them to lead him beside still waters. And he will find rest.|I absolutely recommend Dr Cori Lentz for physical therapy and have already referred family and friends to her.

A few months ago I was in an accident where I broke both my shoulders (and dislocated at least one of them).  Three months in and I have almost complete recovery of range of motion and am quickly on the path toward full or possibly better physical strength.  I was fortunate that the doctor/surgeon that I worked with had given me the go-ahead to start PT immediately.  And when I asked about the road to recovery, he told me that I probably wouldn't get 100% back and that the timeline was going to be 9 to 12 months.  Although Cori was cautious to disagree with the doctor, I got the sense that the recovery might not be limited...  Note, she did say that a much of the degree of success will come from what I put into it.  This said, I would not be anywhere near this far without Cori's help.

Cori started with class IV laser therapy, which helped reduce the swelling and the bruising/hematomas, and gave me light exercises with the goal of making sure that the joints wouldn't jam up with scar tissue (my words - not hers).  Fortunately, I did not require surgery.  The next couple weeks showed the bones healing well and at least for the most part in the right shape, and during this time the list of exercises grew, primarily toward the goal toward range of motion - with some strengthening mixed in.  Soon, the exercises were more an equal balance toward the goals of range and strength.  Dry needling was used to help kick-start the strengthening as well as provide some pain relief (I am not sure how that worked - but happily it did) as well as assist toward improved range of motion.  As we continued 'recovering' my capabilities, there were times that I couldn't even fire/trigger the muscle(s) that I was supposed to be using.  Cori would help me find that muscle and then helping me focus on it to bring it back to work.  Throughout all of this, Cori was interjecting 'hacks' / tweaks to make the exercise more appropriate / beneficial for my situation.  Sometimes this would be a simple modification to the exercise, however more broadly speaking, Cori introduced me to blood flow restriction, all of which have been key to me regaining my physical strength.

I consider myself a fairly healthy and fit individual and yet when I began working with Cori for this recovery, I was pretty badly broken.  I am fortunate that I had been referred to Cori to help me get my functionality back.  Although, I am not completely back to where I want to be (noting that in some aspects my goal is to be better than what I was before the accident), I am confident that I will get there and I would not have gotten this far without Cori's help.  I suspect that I am going to be 'kicked out' of her office soon (possibly the reason for the timing of this review) since I sense that I have the tools to complete this recovery on my own (again - thanks to Cori).  This said, I will probably come back in for periodic 'check-ups'.|I'm not sure how to put into words how happy I am with the service I have received, long distance I might add, from Cheyanne and James.  I live 1600 miles away from their clinic, so being able to use their services was not possible. So they guided me in the purchase of my own equipment to use at home. I'm sure I exhausted them with questions, but they were always there to answer with an a short period of time. I received my equipment five days after my order was placed. I have been very satisfied with my own results, including my own mother who is 87 years old and suffering from sciatica and low back pain. After one treatment, she was able to take a car ride for over eight hours and was able to get out of the car as though nothing was wrong. The following morning she woke up and told me she felt like she got out of bed like a 20-year-old . I am so excited to continue down this road towards my own recovery.  I cannot thank them both enough.|James and Cheyanne are amazing.  I am an active, athletic 59-year old.  Previously, I injured both of my rotator cuffs.  Rather than pay thousands of dollars on typical physical therapy, I decided to try Nevada Laser Pain Relief.  After 5 weeks of intense therapy sessions, using Red Light therapy, Laser therapy, Shockwave and PEMF therapy, both of my shoulders feel amazing.   If you are experiencing pain, I highly recommend trying Nevada Laser Pain Relief!!|Im feeling so much better,  not just physically, but mentally as well.
My pain is so much better,  I actually feel like a new woman.  Im 60 and I was in horrible pain and with that comes depression and no energy.  Im back to being my old self again. Thank you James and Cheyenne for all your help and support|I cannot recommend Nevada Laser Pain Relief enough!!
I have suffered with chronic migraine since I was 12 years old. I have tried medicine after medicine, many different treatments from doctors and nothing worked. I had been offered Botox from a doctor and couldn't justify putting that into my body. That was when I started seeking out alternative medicine for my migraines. Getting treatment from James has been life changing for my pain management. Going on a regular basis helps prevent the onset of migraines, and going during peak pain alleviates so much for me. James is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about what he does. He truly wants to help his patients and he does successfully.

Nevada Pain Care serves Las Vegas, Henderson, and surrounding areas in Nevada with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians brings decades of combined experience to provide personalized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. We understand that pain can significantly impact your quality of life, which is why we offer a multidisciplinary approach that combines innovative treatments with compassionate care to help you regain control and return to the activities you love.

At Nevada Pain Care, we pride ourselves on offering minimally-invasive and cutting-edge treatments for a wide array of common pain conditions. Our advanced therapeutic options include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Joint injections

  • Nerve blocks

  • Regenerative medicine therapies

Conditions We Treat

Our physicians specialize in world-class pain relief therapies for numerous conditions, including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Sciatica

  • Arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Sports injuries

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient. Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to identify and treat the underlying causes of your pain, helping you achieve long-lasting relief and improved function.

Visit Our Henderson Location

Located at 825 N Gibson Rd, Suite 420, Henderson, NV 89011, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. We welcome new patients and accept most major insurance plans.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 702-912-4100 or visit our website at www.nvpaincare.com.

Nevada Pain Care serves Las Vegas, NV and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Adam Antflick, DO. Our state-of-the-art facility offers personalized treatment plans designed to address chronic pain conditions through both interventional procedures and conservative management approaches. Located conveniently in Southwest Las Vegas, our practice combines cutting-edge medical technology with compassionate care to help patients regain their quality of life.

At Nevada Pain Care, we specialize in treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Dr. Antflick utilizes evidence-based techniques such as epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management to provide effective relief. Our multidisciplinary approach ensures that each patient receives care tailored to their specific needs and medical history.

About Dr. Adam Antflick, DO

Dr. Adam Antflick is a board-certified pain management specialist with extensive training in osteopathic medicine. His approach integrates traditional medical interventions with a whole-person philosophy that considers all aspects of a patient's health. Dr. Antflick is committed to staying at the forefront of pain management advancements, regularly incorporating new techniques and technologies that can benefit his patients.

Patient-Centered Experience

We pride ourselves on creating a welcoming environment where patients feel heard and valued. Our friendly staff works diligently to ensure smooth scheduling, insurance verification, and follow-up care. New patients can expect comprehensive evaluations that thoroughly assess their pain conditions before developing customized treatment strategies.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Antflick, please contact us at +1 702-912-4100. Our office is located at 7220 S Cimarron Rd, Suite 270, Las Vegas, NV 89113. For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at nvpaincare.com.

I am not treated like an individual with a unique case,Im treated with such disrespect .He doesn't listen at all & when i try to advocate for myself he says "if you dont like it,get the hell out". He has taken my life from being productive to being a vegetable like he gets off on making me suffer. If you are in UNBEARABLE amounts of pain & injections dont work,Antflick is your worst enemy. Nobody knows my body better than i do & he thinks he can put every pain patient on a "one size fits all" dose & think that we will be okay. First day i met him he cut my meds by 60%. Haven't seen him in years & he just cut me again for no reason at all before a major surgery. I call it evil to be honest. People like this should NOT BE WORKING with living  people who need compassion & to be heard. I ask if I could see a different doctor I have to go threw him. He also told me it was my responsibility to get my records . He said there was no records in my chart .  So bottom line he has no bedside manner. I was crying when I left the office. He has no compassion for the pattience. He also said he is a md . The doctor I saw was a pa and they don't know anything. Well never go back to that office again.|The doctor I saw took me off my medicine I was on at a previous pain management doctor and lowered me to something different, didn't call the day of, and when he did call it in, called it into the an incorrect pharmacy, so I foresee in the future me having trouble filling it.  The front desk ladies and medical assistant are all ignorant and I again foresee me going off on them because for the copays I pay and I time I give I am not being mistreated by people that can not do their jobs correctly.|I have been seen by Dr Wilson for over a year. Went here with severe low back, neck and right rotator cuff pain. I've been in PM for over last 15 years + a few years in late 90s, so I'm not new to this. Only had 2 PM Doctors in all that time, Dr Batlan and Dr Rosler. Never, ever once abused the prescriptions, went back early for more, lost or sold any meds, shopped Doctors, etc. But do to injuries, forced to take a Disability Retirement in February 2017. Insurance changed from PPO to HMO now. Lousy HPN HMO. Or maybe just the medical group I chose.

Anyways, back to this Quack. Total visit time was 8 minutes, from entering room to leaving. I'm a first time patient to this office. And I was blindsided by his very first question;

Transcript of visit:

Dr Su: SO, YOU ARE HERE TO GET YOUR OPIODS??? (Whaaat???)

Me: No, I'm here for PM. I'm in excruciating pain. But yes, I'm out of pain meds. Have been for a month. But I need something. Some help.

Dr Su: Well I don't write scripts for anyone, I DON'T CARE how bad yours or anyone's pain level is. I'm not jeopardizing my medical license for anybody.

Me: Ahhhhh, ok (wow). So what do you do?

Dr Su: I do injections or freeze the nerves. But I see that you've had those done before and they didn't work.

Me: Well let's try them again. See if anything helps. Maybe the other Doctors, PA's and nurses just didn't know what they were doing or their meds were expired (sarcasm). I don't know why they never worked before but I'm willing to try anything at this point.

Here he performs the most simple exam I've ever seen consisting of Bend to the left, Bend to the right. THAT WAS IT! And his diagnosis, that quickly? ARTHRITIS!! DUH, REALLY??
(But he did not mention the L3-L4-L5 bulging discs, failed fusion of L5-S1 from 2004, fractured C-6 vertebrae from 4 years ago, torn rotator cuff, labrum, bursitis and bone spurs in right shoulder which he never mentioned or examined. Only arthritis).

Dr Su: So before I do anything, this is what I need you to do. I want to be sure that ALL your previous pain meds are out of your system (told him, truthfully, that it's been a month since I had anything except a couple 50mcg patches in that time). And while you're at it, you need to QUIT SMOKING before I'll do any procedure (as if opiod withdrawals weren't bad enough already, let's add nicotine withdrawals into the equation??).

And the clincher?? He says to me, But feel free to come back and see me whenever you feel the need. Goodbye. (Hahaha, never happen)

So, 8 MINUTES, start to finish, for a first time patient.

Did not do a single thing or offer any relief of any type. And he says come back whenever I want? Sure, so he can bill HMO insurance some ungodly amount to do nothing. And collect $70 from me for office visit copay, which I filed a dispute on with my CC company. Lost that too.

I have mentioned this "Doctor" to my Primary Care Provider, HMO insurance nurse, referrals dept, etc. All of them said, "How can he even call himself a PM "Doctor" then??" Beats the hell out of me.

I realize this is a long post but patients need to know not to go to this Quack, OOOPS my bad, I mean "Doctor". His license should be taken away for simply calling himself a PM "Doctor".

I also realize the entire "OPIOID" epidemic has every doctor in the Las Vegas Valley, and America in general, scared sh@#less of the CDC guidelines and the terror tactics of the DEA, but they all need to realize that there are real patients in need.

So now I've been waiting for a 2nd opinion to get approved for over a month and half. Just trying to catch a break. Actually have told doctors that if I was a heroin addict or alcoholic or whatever type addict, or if I had terminal cancer, I would get better treatment than this. Not be cutoff cold turkey of all meds to go through withdrawals by myself.

Anyways, enough of a rant about this "Doctor". If I could put less than 1 star, I would. Good luck if you still choose to go here. Your gonna need it.|I was with Innovative Pain Center for over a year, NEVER had a Issue. Same Doctors all the time, no question with my issues., Medical insurance made me move to this clinic. 1 year of service I had enough, musical doctors, fired or left, even one claiming that a Bullet to my head would stop the pain. Avoid this place if you don't want headaches added to your list of symptoms.|I have always had a good experience  with  the Dr's there  .especially  with Dr Albright very kind and understanding

Nevada Comprehensive Pain Center serves Las Vegas, NV and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians combines extensive clinical experience with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Located conveniently at 9327 W Sunset Rd in Las Vegas, we've established ourselves as a trusted resource for those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

At Nevada Comprehensive Pain Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that addresses both the symptoms and underlying causes of chronic pain. Our treatment options include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and innovative minimally invasive techniques. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

Our philosophy centers on creating individualized treatment plans that consider each patient's medical history, current condition, and personal goals. We believe in empowering our patients through education and active participation in their treatment journey. The NVCPC team takes time to thoroughly evaluate each case, explain treatment options, and answer questions to ensure patients feel confident in their care plan.

Expert Medical Team

column40:
Leigh is fantastic, listens to and is right on top of everything. Stephanie in the front is sweet, and Azra,the MA, is very professional and efficient. Everybody is pretty nice there. One thing:  if you want to get through by phone, it is almost impossible, but it is not the office's fault! So don't yell at them!|James isn't very talkative. Which is ok. He is caring and kind. He gets to know what your needs are and does what he can to help. The nurses here are top of the game! Always on point and ready! They are busy bees to so it's good to them on point.|Patient care is the least of their concerns. Read till the end.

They won't return phone calls. I've called twice because I never got the text saying my doctor submitted my prescription to the pharmacy like I usually get and I also wanted to be sure that my referral was submitted since it didn't seem anything was done that was discussed at my visit. It always goes to voicemail saying to leave a message and they will call you back, but they never do. I begged and pleaded in the message I left for a return call the second time I called in because otherwise I have to try to drive down there to get the answers and I am in so much pain that's hard to do. Still no return call. It's absolutely inexcusable that they can't return a call to let me know if those two issues were done or not. I shouldn't have to drive down to get answers for my PAIN MANAGMENT when I'm in PAIN and I don't have one of my prescriptions now to help manage it.

Same goes for if your pain management doctor calls you and says they have some questions to ask before they can submit for a procedure so please call them back. There is NO WAY TO DO THAT. I can call and call and call leaving multiple messages with the medical staff and NO ONE will let the doctor know. It's ridiculous. If being able to return your doctors call is important to you, then find another place. If getting a response about your medications is important to you, find another place.

Additionally, James and Dr Kaplan will NOT a listen to you. Women, be prepared to be talked over, your pain dismissed and be gaslit about conversations you had with them. He put in for injections a month goes by I hear nothing I go into ask about it and they said that oh it never required approval and I could've scheduled the injection anytime. But they never bothered to tell me this! Additionally, he said he would put in for a referral to an ankle specialist to deal with my ankle pain, but then on my next appointment, he says that that conversation never happened and he refuses to treat my ankle. It is so exhausting having men in the medical field treat women like they don't matter. Additionally, they REFUSE to treat any pain related to a car accident, they will only treat pain that was caused by yourself because if they treat a car accident they will and I quote "have to be subpoenaed and they will blow your case"! What kind of a pain management company will refuse to treat pain from a car accident because they know that they are too incompetent to be put on the stand? At the same time I'm being told that I can only get medication from one doctor (them) but what if I go to an ankle specialist or podiatrist and he puts me on a medication for my ankle or broken toe? Yeah, they like to paint you into a corner then lecture you on seeing too many doctors. That was the final straw and I had to leave. Luckily my insurance changed so I have options where as my previous insurance only used this place. Go anywhere else if you have the choice. Anywhere.|If you're okay with getting whatever procedure Jim shoves down your throat without ever having seen or spoken to a doctor about said procedure, then this is the place for you!

Whenever you say no to whatever procedure Jim is pressuring you to get, he interrupts you so that he can berate and belittle you.  He gets mad, irritated, and frustrated when you ask questions and pressures and bullies you when you decline.

Because I could not get any procedures done (due to another, unrelated condition), I was informed that I had to find another provider, NVCPC would no longer continue to refill my meds.  I had been going there for YEARS.  For years, they/Jim refilled my prescription medications every month, with absolutely no problems.

It wasn't until after I had a telemed appointment with Dr. Coppel, who asked Jim why I'd been going there for all those years and never had any procedures done, that Jim all of a sudden started to shove procedures down my throat.  Three or four months later, because I couldn't get any procedures done, I was told I had to leave.|I have been going here for several years.  Not a great experience.  I have numerous serious health problems.  They don't care!  A few months ago, I caught the flu and spent a several days in the hospital.  They would not do a video appointment.  I was discharged from the hospital and had to immediately go to my pain appointment with a fever of 103 and still testing positive for the flu. When I arrived, they told me I could not be there if I was sick.  What? A couple of months later a heart issue was discovered and the only appointment I could get for the echocardiogram was the same day as my pain appointment.  They leave no appointments available for emergencies.  I tried to reschedule and was treated in a condescending and rude manner. At one point she hung up on me.  I was not rude, saying please and thank you, just wouldn't take no for an answer.  They would reschedule but for a week after my pain medication ran out.   Those Pima graduates are really full of themselves.  I found another clinic and made an appointment for the same day.|Very unhappy with the rude behavior of a male PA. I saw him early on & nearly did not return. But have been seeing Leigh til today . I encountered this rude person again. He should not be seeing clients!! I believe his name is James. It's bad enough to have chronic pain - we shouldn't have to endure rude behavior by the staff, as well. I've been going to NCPC for 17 mo.|Friendly , love dr karno and his pa Leigh! They listen and are considerate of people with pain! and there medical staff at Charleston is terrific! I highly recommend them!|Unfortunately, I have to go here for Injections, nerve blocks. Fortunately, the  APRN I see, Darlyn Makunda-Nonato is excellent. Didn't fill this last one to bad, and they are mostly painful.
She is kind and understanding.
The front office is always friendly , she actually addressed me by name as I walked in. Yes, I was totally impressed, they see alot of people, mask required, I appreciate your help Nevada Comprehensive Pain Center, Sunset/Fort Apache office.

Our Comprehensive Approach

Doctor Jon and Miranda did an incredible job once again. I was in horrible pain, a sciatic nerve that was extremely painful from my lower back to my toe. I had an important appointment with a long trip. They knew how to relieve me and give me hope for recovery. Today they have all my confidence my family is safe. They are incredible and very professional. I have never come across such a professional team in my life for my health. A thousand thanks to all of you you are extremely incredible !!!!!|This place is a Godsend! Everyone here is fantastic. I don't live in Vegas and was on a 14.5 hr road trip and in pain for a week. I called them and asked for an ART session and they had lots of availability and flexibility so that I could plan to stop just as I was passing Vegas.

Bruno was great! The chiropractor also stopped in and met me and helped with the release, so I had 4 hands on me. Very hands on!

Best part , is that it totally relieves my pain and I drove for another 10 hrs and made it home and am still in no pain! I wish they lived closer!|Dr. Petrick is thorough and precise. My pain was at level 8 for the past 3 months. After one visit, my pain level significantly decreased to level 4. After my second visit, I noticed immediate improvement AND the amount of pain I have endured for months is now almost GONE. Dr. Petrick has helped my two kids with their athletic injuries for past 7 + years but this is my first time personally getting help. Biggest regret is waiting so long because I'm so grateful I can take a step without pain again. Thank you to awesome staff in his office and to Dr. Petrick!!|I would highly recommend Dr. Petrick and his team. He is professional and very knowledgeable. Was able to significantly reduce my mother's pain within just a few visits. He is a compassionate and caring person who truly cares about the health and well being of his patients. Office staff is also very courteous and friendly. Scheduling was flexible and easy to get in when needed. Appreciate the care from everyone at Las Vegas Pain Relief Center.|I found Las Vegas Pain Relief Center through a friend after I was having problems with my low back after a back surgery.  I have been a regular patient for over a year and a half now and everyone that works there are great.  They are very professional and very caring!  This group of professionals is second to none!  Today I also had a Cranial Facial Release done and I have been able to breath better all day, cannot wait for my next treatment.  Usually most people feel stress when going to see their DRs, I actually look forward to my visits with DR Petrick and his staff!|I was extremely impressed by Dr. Petrick and his staff. This was my first experience of chiropractic work. He was VERY gentle and knowledgeable. I felt immediate relief of strain and stress. My dear friend has been his client for ten years and insisted he was the best. I have never been more satisfied with the professionalism and therapy that he has provided for me.|What an amazing experience I have every time I visit Dr Petrick!   I've been receiving chiropractic services since 1988.  Not until recent years have I actually felt I was getting proper treatment.  So Dr Petrick is the absolute best doctor I've seen or have been treated by.   His service is second to none.   It's all about muscle manipulation and he is the best.   Stop by and get the power thumb of Dr Petrick to fix you up.  Highly recommended by me to all my friends, family and anyone I know who suffers in pain.  I've been virtually pain free for years until I screw up and crash the mountain bike, take a climbing fall, or just swing the golf club wrong.  And when any of those happen I call make appointment and back to feeling great again!   Dr Petrick can and will make you feel great again.   Get back out and be able to doing the things you love!|I was introduced to Dr. Petrick 5 years ago when I walked into his office with a tennis injury.  The moment I met Dr. Petrick and his staff, I felt welcomed and comfortable and immediately appreciated their genuine concern and attentiveness.  Since my first appointment, I have continued to have complete confidence that any injury the befalls me he can fix, and he does.  Dr. Petrick keeps me healthy and strong and most importantly , on the court!  He truly is an amazing and gifted doctor, and a wonderful and caring individual.  I highly recommend him.

column40:
I finally left NVCPC after about 5.5 years due to insurance change, but even if it had not changed, I would have left for another pain management facility.  I finally got date(s) and follow-ups for my spinal injections.  After waiting 3 months, partially due to my life issues (my mother's caretaker and my mother both passed away) and partially due to the fact that they had no appointments available at the time I could finally come, I went for my appointment.  I was seated, in my gown and all my belongings in the bag they provide,  and was being triaged for the procedure.  Then I was waiting to get my anesthesia, when I told them "Remember I can't take ********, I have seizures from it!" They then told me that they ONLY use that particular anesthesia and recommended I TRY IT or do the injections without anesthesia...neither of which I was going to do.  I told them to forget it and I got dressed and left.  You would think that the PA, when I told her IN THE OFFICE that I couldn't take that particular anesthesia,  would have told me that is all NVCPC used.   All the months of waiting and spinal pain could have been avoided.  I'm sure I would have found another pain management provider by then.  What a waste of time and energy!|Customer service here really sucks .. I was trying my best to ignore the reviews. But I have experienced it for my self, the people that answer the phone calls always sound like they HATE their job and don't want to help you at all . Like your a pain clinic hmm people that are calling is because they are in pain and want to know what is the status on the referrals or the insurance claims.. and receptionists are really rude and answer the calls with sarcastic tones. I wish my doctor would had referred me to a different place.|Having returned 3 or 4 years later i couldn't be happier. Everyone was friendly and professional and my doctor, Dr. Kelner has always been a great doctor and professional. He was a great doc then and now. I don't understand a lot of the bad reviews however even when I was being seen before it was never bad or even close to the stuff they mentioned exceptfor the new patients not being able to reschedule with the front, that is true. I also working ina clinic lab and as a nurse so I understand why. But some people just like to complain i guess. Smh|Referred by primary Dr and was informed by the Dr at the pain center they only treat back pain. So this is only for back pain and Workman comp, persinal injury. This is not a pain management for anything other than back pain|DONT GO HERE I THOUGHT I WAS SEEING A DR NOT AN ASSISTANT TOTAL WASTE OF MY GAS TIME AND MONEY THEY JUST WANT TO DO INJECTIONS THATS IT!!! I was referred here by my primary dr after getting the mri done on my neck and getting the results which showed numerous problems in my spine and going two times to this place I was told they are going to inject me in my neck with cortisone
That's something I'm not going to do I don't want something injected in my neck I asked Pamela if she could give me something for the pain she called in gabapentine which I told her I can't take during the day because it makes me sleepy but that's all I got. These drs are soo afraid to give you pain medicine anymore it's a shame I will not be back I already found a different pain dr this was a total waste of time and money|I couldn't even make it past making my first appointment with out being treated rude and hung up on will never ever go here! Needs to be shut down! Asap! No one deserves to be treated they way they treat people totally disgusting! They should be ashamed!|I am so dissatisfied. I was trying to make an appointment for my husband and the staff was so incompetent. I was told by one girl that they could not look up the referral on the site, then I had my doctors office fax the referral and I called back and was told they do not have it. Then I call 1 week later and told by another girl that the referral was not on the site. So which is it? You don't have access to the site?So incompetent. Ridiculous. Good luck to anyone trying to get help.|The customer service is terrible every time I'm calling to make an appointment. I get put on hold for 20minutes only to be the next one in line and get disconnected. This happened at least seven times in the last two months.

Las Vegas Injury Pain Center serves Las Vegas, Nevada with specialized interventional pain management services. Our boutique clinic focuses on personalized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions, particularly those resulting from personal injuries and accidents. We combine advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment protocols to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Las Vegas Injury Pain Center, we offer a wide range of minimally invasive procedures and interventional techniques designed to provide lasting relief. Our board-certified specialists utilize fluoroscopic-guided injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and other evidence-based treatments to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, developing customized treatment plans based on individual needs and circumstances.

Flexible Payment Options

Understanding the financial challenges that often accompany injuries, we accept attorney liens for personal injury cases, allowing patients to receive necessary treatment without upfront costs. We also offer competitive cash pay rates for those without insurance or who prefer to pay directly for services. Our administrative team works diligently to make the billing process as transparent and stress-free as possible.

Convenient Location

Located at 3603 Las Vegas Blvd N, Suite 111, Las Vegas, NV 89115, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology in a comfortable, welcoming environment. We're strategically positioned to serve patients throughout the Las Vegas Valley with easy access from major thoroughfares.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 702-879-2005 or visit our comprehensive website at www.lvinjurypaincenter.com. Our dedicated staff is available to answer questions about treatment options, insurance coverage, and appointment availability.

column2: ProCare Pain & Spine, Dr Dan Brady DC, PA-C
column3:
ProCare Pain & Spine in Reno, Nevada offers comprehensive pain management and spine care services under the expert guidance of Dr. Dan Brady DC, PA-C. Our state-of-the-art facility combines advanced diagnostic techniques with personalized treatment plans to address chronic pain, spine disorders, and musculoskeletal conditions. We pride ourselves on our patient-centered approach, taking the time to understand each individual's unique circumstances and developing customized solutions that promote long-term healing and improved quality of life.

At ProCare Pain & Spine, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, incorporating chiropractic care, physical therapy, medication management, and minimally invasive procedures. Dr. Brady's dual credentials as both a Doctor of Chiropractic and a Physician Assistant-Certified allow him to provide a unique perspective on pain treatment, blending traditional medical approaches with alternative therapies for optimal results.

Conditions We Treat

Our clinical expertise extends to treating a wide range of conditions including back pain, neck pain, sciatica, herniated discs, spinal stenosis, arthritis, sports injuries, and post-surgical pain. We also specialize in addressing work-related injuries and auto accident recovery, helping patients navigate their care while coordinating with insurance providers.

Our Facility

Located at 3500 Lakeside Court in Reno, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. The comfortable, welcoming environment is designed to put patients at ease from the moment they arrive. We're conveniently situated to serve patients throughout the greater Reno area and surrounding communities.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at (775) 636-6200. You can also visit our comprehensive website at www.procarepainandspine.com for detailed information about our treatment options, patient resources, and online appointment scheduling.

At ProCare Pain & Spine, we're committed to helping you overcome pain and return to the activities you love. Our evidence-based treatments and compassionate care approach have helped countless patients throughout Nevada achieve lasting relief and improved function.

Swift Institute Pain Management serves Carson City, Nevada and surrounding areas with specialized pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. Randall Goode, MD. As a board-certified anesthesiologist with extensive training in pain management, Dr. Goode has dedicated his practice to helping patients overcome both acute and chronic pain conditions. The institute takes a comprehensive approach to treatment, combining advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to ensure each patient receives personalized attention.

At Swift Institute Pain Management, Dr. Goode employs evidence-based treatments designed to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. His expertise spans a wide range of conditions, from post-injury recovery to persistent chronic pain disorders. The practice philosophy centers on improving patients' quality of life by restoring function and reducing dependence on pain medications when possible.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

Patients benefit from Dr. Goode's holistic perspective on pain management, which may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. This multidisciplinary approach ensures that each treatment plan is tailored to the individual's specific needs and circumstances, maximizing the potential for successful outcomes.

Patient-Centered Care

What distinguishes Swift Institute Pain Management is their unwavering commitment to compassionate care. Dr. Goode and his team understand that living with pain affects every aspect of a person's life and approach each case with empathy and respect. Their goal is to help patients return to an active, productive lifestyle as quickly as possible while providing ongoing support throughout the recovery journey.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit https://theswiftinstitute.com/ or call +1 775-348-8800. The practice is conveniently located at 2874 N Carson St # 205, Carson City, NV 89706.

At Innovative Pain Care Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modification guidance. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique needs of our patients, with the goal of maximizing pain relief while minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. This comprehensive approach has helped countless individuals reclaim their lives from debilitating pain. column40:
I'm not a fan for pain management, however; my pain has gotten worse and I finally decided to go and check out what pain management is. My neurologist, Dr. Jay Mahajan referred me to Innovative Pain Care Center. I found the front desk personal to be friendly and helpful. I was seen by Dr. Ryan West. I found him to be compassionate and most importantly, he explained what my MRI showed. He evaluated me and then discussed the options available to me. I was impressed how he took the time to explain everything and based on his professional experience, he tells me an injection would be best for me. He informed me the injection unfortunately last three months but depending on the person, it has been known to last longer. He told me because I have Medicare, they prefer to go with an injection and then if necessary, they will pay for surgery but that's only after all other options have been tried. I found Dr. West to be a kind and understanding doctor, but what I found most impressive, he took his time and listened to all of my concerns. I also like his scheduler. She greets you with a smile, asks if you would like anything to drink. She explains everything to you and before you leave, everything in writing is given to you. Overall, while this was my first visit, I was impressed with Dr. West and the entire staff from Innovative Pain Care Center.|This was my first visit. I was very nervous. But everybody from reception to medical assistant they were very kind. Made me feel better. Dr West was awesome, He  listened to my concerns and very sympathetic and understood my pain. Not many pain Dr.'s are like that these days he took the time to listen to me. And that made me very grateful.
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PAIN
CENTER!.And all the people that work there.

Thank you!!!!|Dr. Wu is amazing! He is knowledgeable, professional, and treats his patients with courtesy. He takes the time to actually listen to your concerns. No matter what time of day my appointment is scheduled, I never feel rushed. His nurse and the office staff at the Rancho location are wonderful as well. I am grateful to Dr. Wu for finding the real source of my back and hip pain after other doctors for years. I highly recommend Dr. Wu. He is not only a great doctor, but an honorable and ethical person.|Disgraceful Customer Service and Appalling Policies

I've never experienced such a frustrating and infuriating encounter with a business in my life. I recently had an appointment with this company, and they refused to provide the service because I was 10 minutes early, instead of 15. To make matters worse, the company had sent me a reminder text clearly stating I needed to be there 15 minutes early. I work in healthcare and was not able to leave my patients early so that I could provide the best care to them (ironic). I hustled there as soon as I was able to leave the hospital that I work at and was still early for my SCHEDULED APPOINTMENT TIME.

Yet, the staff had the audacity to tell me they require "new" patients to arrive 30 minutes early, not 15, despite no prior notice of this absurd policy and the reminder text THAT THEY SENT ME stating that I needed to arrive 15 min early. Mind you no where was it written or even verbally communicated that I would be denied services if not early.... How are patients supposed to keep track of such arbitrary rules when the company can't even communicate consistently? This level of incompetence is not just inconvenient, it's disrespectful.

The company refused to provide any reasonable solution or even apologize for the confusion. Instead, they told me I could reschedule, which is frankly insulting. It's clear this business has zero regard for customer service or patient needs.

If you value your time, money, and dignity, avoid this place at all costs. There are plenty of professional businesses that treat their customers with respect--this one is not one of them. I wish I could rate this place negative stars they don't even deserve one star.|Dr. West and IPCC team were amazing. The front desk staff especiallly Lupe went above and beyond with assisting with scheduling.  Dr. West was thoughtful, kind and took time to explain all I would need to know to be cared for at this practice.  Being a new transplant to Las Vegas from New Jersey there has been a lot to do and making this one change of doctors to manage my pain easier was appreciated more than they know!! I would highly recommend.|After all the disappointment since November - Dr. West is a fresh breath of air.  After one visit we have a treatment plan in place and it doesn't have to do with pain pills.

My wife and I recommend this Doctor and facility to everyone.  Super impressive!!!!|I love their office. Staff is great. Office itself is clean and comfortable. Dr Wu has been so kind and helpful and I can tell is sincere in wanting to help make my chronic pain as comfortable as possible.|Very friendly and knowledgeable staff, I am a new patient and they treated me warmth and kindness. Dr West was awesome, he explained to me that they had several options to treat my issues and he took the time to show and explain to me how the procedure would work. The staff and the lobby was nice as well.
