column3:
Daniel E Fabito MD serves Henderson, Nevada and the greater Las Vegas area with exceptional medical care focused on internal medicine. With over two decades of experience, Dr. Fabito has established himself as a trusted healthcare provider committed to comprehensive patient care and preventative medicine.

At his welcoming practice located at 1748 W Horizon Ridge Pkwy in Henderson, Dr. Fabito offers a wide range of medical services including annual physicals, chronic disease management, preventative care, and treatment for acute illnesses. His patient-centered approach ensures that each individual receives personalized attention and treatment plans tailored to their specific health needs.

Expertise and Specialization

Dr. Fabito specializes in internal medicine with particular focus on diabetes management, cardiovascular health, and geriatric care. His extensive training and ongoing education in the latest medical advancements allow him to provide evidence-based treatments while maintaining a compassionate approach to healthcare.

Patient Experience

Patients consistently praise Dr. Fabito's thorough examinations, clear communication style, and the time he takes to address all concerns. The practice prides itself on minimal wait times and a friendly, professional staff that helps create a comfortable environment for all patients.

Contact and Appointments

To schedule an appointment with Dr. Daniel E Fabito, patients can call +1 702-982-1300 during regular business hours. The practice accepts most major insurance plans and welcomes new patients. For more information about services offered or to access patient resources, visit the official website at http://www.drfabito.com/.
column38: Adrienne DerOhanian|brook vincent|natalie H.|Cynthia Yosef|Shelley Fisher|Sala Smith|Laurie Duvall|Rae Cummings
column40:
Dr. Fabito, his PA Lonnie, and his nurses are very professional, knowledgeable, thorough, nice, and caring. I have gone there for injections in my abdominal area, and each time have had a pain free experience. I am grateful to have been referred to this office for my pain management needs. I am hopeful that under their care, my pain will be resolved once and for all.|Dr. Fabito's office is absolutely phenomenal! They took the time to listen to my concerns and made me feel completely at ease throughout the entire process. The staff is also incredibly friendly and helpful.... and I'd like to give a special thanks to Lonnie! Im already feeling better! I would highly recommend them!!|I endorse Dr. Fabito wholeheartedly after having over 13 lumbar back injections with no relief. As a long-time patient at Fabito Anesthesia and Pain Management, I took a chance on yet another lumbar back injection and achieved success for the first time. I have since had three procedures and am no longer skeptical. This has transformed my life and the lives of many others struggling with chronic pain. I urge you to try, as you have nothing to lose but a better quality of life. Dr. Fabito has a gift for this .Thank you|Dr Fabito is so caring and really listens and finds remedies for your issue! I love his staff. They really listen to my concerns, are patient and caring. I feel lucky to have found Dr Fabito!|Fabito is a hot shot. Showing off in front of a group of students he was quite pleased with himself that he noticed a slice uti from a test I'd had done. Nice. Too bad he didn't diagnose the huge 24/7 agony I'd been going thru since March as hip osteoarthritis and bone on bone. He had me in pain for nearly half a year, and on BS meds for my spinal stenosis that did nothing. He gave me an epidural "for the pain in your leg". What pain in my leg? It's in my groin. I was scheduled for a nerve block "for the pain in your back". What pain in my back? It's in my groin. He didn't even  think about hip, his PA Lonnie is who ordered the mri. So i left him and went to Dr Imas at Dynamic Pain Management. He's great.|Dr. Fabito and his staff is amazing omg the office everyone is always happy. Heather the manager omg she is the best she talks to cause I jab and jab. The two ladies in the procedure room they are the greatest team together and yes, they're funny. I just think everyone in the office is funny. The girl that does the referrals I like her too. She's cool very nice. The new doctor I hope he sticks with Dr. Fabito any Get some funny tips from him. He's awesome .The receptionist are great too and bad at names. Next time I go there I'm gonna get their names and edit this, but always great service. I love that office where people laugh and smile and have fun. That means they are happy workers. Dr. Fabito is my favorite doctor he is so funny and professional helps me with my pain and explains everything. I look forward to going there and that's rare because everyone so happy happiness brings people happiness. I recommend him to everyone. Oh forgot been going to him since I moved here 1 year ago almost. Had shots in my back he knows what he's doing. Their need to be more of him and his staff. They need to make a training video for other doctors offices on how to work and have fun while you are working. Who wants to go to any place when the workers are not happy. I would sit in his office all day just to see him for a visit. I don't mind waiting. He's a doctor. He does a lot of procedures. He is worth the wait and I recommend him to every possible. Thank you Fabito|I see Arial for all my visits. She is not only the most amazing P.A. I've have had the pleasure of working with, but Ariel is also just an incredible person. Ethical, kind, compassionate and extremely intelligent. It amazes me how calm and focused she remains when there is utter chaos around her. I have some very private issues and Ariel was able to work around them beautifully. Such grace.
Dr. Fabito is incredible. I had the chance to talk with him a bit before he did my injections. He was very kind, compassionate , understanding and had a great sense of humor. He was able to put me at ease before I went back to get my injection. Very nice man. He talked with me like we have been friends for years. That's an incredible gift for a doctor to have. I am so thankful I met both Ariel and Dr. Fabito.|Dr. Fabito is a great doctor...the best in town! He is compassionate, caring, asks how I am doing and actually listens to my response.  I have major health improvements since I began seeing him.  I would walk the streets handing out business cards if I could.  Do not overlook this doctor, he is truly the best.  I would recommend him to anyone seeking a Physician that is as interested and invested in your recovery as you are.  TOP NOTCH!  Thank you so much for your concern and guidance through my difficult healthcare journey.

Red Rock Neurology & Pain Management serves patients throughout North Las Vegas, Nevada and surrounding communities with specialized neurological and pain management care. Established as a trusted medical practice in the region, our clinic combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with comprehensive treatment options to address a wide spectrum of neurological disorders and chronic pain conditions. Our board-certified specialists utilize evidence-based approaches to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life and restoring function.

Our neurology department provides thorough evaluation and management for conditions including migraines, seizure disorders, neuropathy, multiple sclerosis, and movement disorders. Using state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment, our neurologists can identify the root causes of symptoms and develop targeted treatment strategies that address both immediate concerns and long-term management.

Interventional Pain Management Solutions

The pain management team at Red Rock specializes in minimally invasive procedures designed to provide relief from chronic pain conditions. Our interventional techniques include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other advanced modalities that offer alternatives to traditional pain medications and surgery.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in collaborative care that involves patients in their treatment decisions. Each treatment plan is customized to address individual needs, with careful consideration of medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal goals. Our compassionate staff ensures patients receive thorough education about their conditions and treatment options.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 702-294-0080 or visit our website at http://www.rrnpm.com/. Our office is conveniently located at 2031 N McDaniel St, Suite 200, North Las Vegas, NV 89030. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans.

column40:
My husband has suffered debilitating migraines for decades with every possible test run and every possible medication prescribed to no avail.  He had his first appointment with Dr. Hawarey this past summer and, after the obligatory MRI which was examined by the doctor, my husband was prescribed a subcutaneous monthly injection medication.  Amazingly, and to his complete surprise, it worked the very first day and has continued to relieve ALL of his migraine symptoms completely since introduction.  The doctor is communicative, knowledgeable, and compassionate.  We enjoy our visits with him every appointment.

The office staff is just as amazing as the doctor.  They answer the phone immediately and transfer the call when necessary to the proper end source; and, when we had an insurance issue, it got resolved timely, professionally and easily.

We feel so thankful and grateful that we chose Red Rock Neurology for his needs and would highly recommend this practice wholeheartedly!|I love the staff at red rock neurology in pain management. They are all so nice and courteous they show that they care about me as an individual. I love Leti. She fights my insurance for me so she can ensure that I get the best treatment possible.Destiana Was so courteous and welcoming at Check out. My doctor is amazing as well.|Kelli was really nice and knowledgeable. She answered all my questions about my knees. The shot she gave me helped my knee pain and didn't hurt at all. 2 weeks later and my knee still feels good with much less pain and I don't notice it. Her bedside manner is excellent. I highly recommend Kelli!|Everyone here is phenomenal. The women at the desk, those who schedule, and deal with insurance are all awesome. They're all so helpful and patient.  Kelli Nissen (NP)is by far one of the most genuine, caring person I have seen in a Las Vegas doctors office. I really appreciate every appointment because they will help you to find out and solve your problem.|The nurse practitioner Kelli was so wonderful! She listened to my concerns more than any other provider has ever done! I am so pleased with her care I've told all my friends and family members with pain issues to come see Kelli!|The front office staff are kind, profressional and so helpful. I have never experienced better in any medical office. Dr. Hawarey is an amazing physician. He worked with me to get my medical issues resolved and under control. He listened to me and was dilligent in his treatment. I highly recommend this medical practice for anyone who needs it.|The front office staff are caring and genuine.  They went the extra miles to help with the insurance process. Kellie NP was attentive and responsive to our concerns. The check out process and referrals were smooth. Overall, we are grateful for their kindness|Hi my name is Patrice Coleman I got my referral sent to RED Rock Dec 2 and I called on the 3rd I was trying to make appointment  but the receptionist told me that the person who set up appointments was on the phone with a client and that she would call me back. Here it is the 6th I didn't know it takes 4 days to call a patient back. But I'm still waiting this make me feel so unappreciated. All I was doing was trying to set an appointment up and they act like they don't care about elderly patients. These young receptionist tell us anything to shut us up I will seek further Authority just to get an appointment stop lying to the elderly an do your job your paid to do

This place is the worst they over book patients if they cared about their pain their patients are in they would not have them sitting so long after sitting in the front for over an hour you get called   The the back just to wait another 35-45 minutes. They are unprofessional, rude! They always push you to get injections that dont work they just want you to get any and everything they can charge your insurance for. All this place cares about is tour money! They do not care about any patient! And the nellis location is ghetto and dirty always.|Do not use Las Vegas Pain Institute if you have the choice!!

I have been coming to this office since July, each visit it is apparent the office is not staffed or trained. Any time I am alone with a doctor or staff they vent how stressed they are with the work environment. It's clear, they don't hide it.

They cannot guarantee the doctor will be on premises to honor scheduled procedure appts, so be prepared to wait a good few hours past your appt time.

They delayed my prior authorization because they didn't know what to do, resulting in it taking a month. I was the middle person getting this process moving along. I had to tell them it was approved, myself. They had no idea. Then they had to "call me back". Never have I received a call back from them as promised. Everything I achieved was through my own persistence.

I fear for those not able to advocate for themselves because this practice certainly will not.|I had an amazing appointment today here. Every consultation was so thorough and the staff was so friendly! Destiny was so sweet and nice helping me around. The office manager was very professional!
I had gotten a similar procedure with another office and had horrible results. I put my faith in here today and was so happy with the results. My pain was gone for the first time!
I was so happy with the fact that every staff member treated me well and cared what I had to say. I'd recommend this place to anyone, I am happy to have found it!|I don't see my review, I wonder why! this place made me wait 3 hours after filling out 70+ pages of information. The Dr or the staff forgot about me and came into my room asking what my name was. 45 minutes after that he sends his assistant in and never once came in my room. However he had the audacity to tell me I need epidural shots in my spine when I came for my previously broken ANKLE that was broken in 3 places not my SPINE! This place needs a serious adjustment and fast.|This pain institute is a waste of time. I was never seen by a Doctor. The doctor uses nurses ( so called practitioners ) so the doctor doesn't see you. I have had a stimulator installed surgically by a doctor in
the Las Vegas Pain Institute on Nellis Blvd.
by Dr. Obi. Then injections at Primed by Dr.
Franco Lee in which I ask for a Anisteolgist
to put me out for the injections. Dr. Lee had successfully did the injections. I was pain free for only one day. So they put me back on
Hydrocodone and asked me to see the Medtronic people to readjust my stimulator
in which I did. The stimulator only takes away
about 30 to 35 percent of the pain away. So they kept me on the pain medication only now they want another lower back exray and
and want me get more injections in my lower
back the problem is that they say my insurance won't cover it and that's a lie. I spent 3 hours there hoping for pain relief and
ended up with nothing. These pain institutions doctors are criminals for not taking care of people who are in extreme pain 24/7. I used to ride motorcycles and
this is how I ended up with 4 degenerative
discs in my lower back. I have more miles on
two wheels than 4 wheels. I was diagnosed with this condition in 2005 and the pain is unbearable as I get older. I'm 70 and in another week I will be 71. So I have been turned down by 4 Neosurgeons to have bone fusion. So as you can see not 1 doctor will help me. This state of Nevada needs to do something about these horrible conditions that these doctors are doing especially to me. I'm almost to the end of my rope and considering suicide because of the Health
Don't Care. I'm in a wheelchair and can't walk
much because of the extreme pain I'm in. I didn't find out the doctors name at this institution, but take my advice DON'T USE
THIS PAIN INSTITUTION.|Absolutely heartbreaking to be treated like an addict and not a pain patient.  I only went here because my insurance changed. This place is an absolute joke. They don't care what your situation is everybody gets the same medication.  I've been on 20mg oxy for almost a year now and they're telling me they will only prescribed me 10mg and half as many.  Doctors like this give the pain management industry a bad name.

It's more prudent for me to spend $200 monthly to see my old pain management doctor than it is to ever come back to this place!|Been there 4 or 5 times. I see a different Dr each time. Dr have ranged from pleasant to absolutely rude. At my appointment a month ago I asked how one of my referrals was coming along and they said no answer as of yet. Well 30days later at my most recent appointment I find out they never submitted my referral from July until the day before my last appointment!  So they have sat on an unsent referral for over 2 months told me a month ago that they've had no response and would check on it. Well they obviously didn't or it would have been caught at least 30 days ago.  People go to pain clinics to figure out a way to stop the pain. Doesn't say much about the staff when not doing their job extends the pain they're being trusted to find a solution for.|Abysmal wait times, terrible lighting and waiting areas, little patient communication, signage literally falling off the walls, and blood on the curtains. You make me wear a mask, then sit me next to a blood stained curtain!? I was sitting waiting for an injection but felt so uncomfortable that I fled before they had a chance to stick me.

And treat you like a person.

Thank you!
Your amazing|I contacted Dr Bien's office and they were very efficient and effective unlike another office I had contacted. People that say rude and nasty things I chalk it up to, "hurt people hurt people" And the front staff do their job and if they are busy they will apologize and will help as well!!|I would leave a ZERO star if possible.  My husband sat in their waiting room for over an hour.  He already had to wait two weeks to see this doctor.  He has been unable to stand/walk for any period of time without excruciating pain.  I was told that Dr. Hardie doesn't review her referrals' charts until they are in the room.  A GOOD DOCTOR reviews charts BEFORE the patient arrives at their facility so they are PREPARED to treat the patient.  Office staff is rude, didn't offer him any reason for the unreasonable delay and suggested he go elsewhere when I called to bring this to their attention.|DO NOT GO HERE!!!
Don't go here if u expect any sort of quality care. They treat u like a p.o.s change thier story every other day. Have been screwing with my husband's treatment since may. He hasn't been paid since July 6th because they can't fill out paperwork in a timely or correct manner. Don't bill insurance right then expect you to pay exorbitant fees because of their billing errors or get it corrected yourself. and then want to withhold getting your paperwork done so that you can get paid when you haven't been paid because they haven't get the paperwork right. They cancel your appointment, because the doctor never seems to be able to come in,for your treatment can't reschedule you for a month and act like you are the problem. We are contacting a lawyer and looking for a new doctor.  Again do not go here!

Update: 9/11/20 apparently if u leave a bad review for your spouse they discharge you as a patient instead of fixing the problem.... Calling a lawyer now!|I have nothing but wonderful things to say about Dr. Hardie and Dr. Fabito abs the office staff.

My husband suffered for almost a decade with pain in his hip. He saw over 1/2 dozen orthopedics that kept saying it was from his hip (even after a back MRI).  He tried several different types of injections in several areas of his hip with no relief. He could not walk or stand without excruciating pain after a few minutes. Even sitting at times on certain chairs was painful. We declined invites from friends due to his not being able to walk the strip,  go to the museum or even just go on a walk.

Dr. Fabito listened and redid his MRI. He spent a lot of time reviewing his old records and MRIs with us explaining that he disagreed with the other doctors and wanted to do an epidural in his spine. He shared that Dr. Hardie would be able to do his epidural if he could not. The day we picked, Dr. Fabito was not able to do the epidural so Dr. Hardie did. She was great. She took the time to explain to him every step and met with us again after.

It's been a little over two weeks and I cannot say any more than I feel so blessed to have found them. My husband is 90% better and has his life back. We are now going on walks together and he is finally out of pain and off all pain meds.

I cannot thank them enough for everything they and the office has done for him. I got my husband back and can't be more thankful.

Great practice and great office staff. A big heartfelt Thank You. We appreciate you all.|Wonderful nurses, doctors & staff. Very helpful with good referrals.

The Pain Clinic serves Las Vegas, Nevada with a comprehensive approach to pain management and wellness. Our integrated healthcare facility combines multiple therapeutic disciplines to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our team of specialists works collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans for each patient.

At The Pain Clinic, we combine medical, chiropractic, acupuncture, massage therapy, and physiotherapy to tailor a treatment plan that provides pain and symptom relief in the shortest number of visits possible. Our goal is to get you better and back to doing your regular activities as quickly as possible, without unnecessary appointments or treatments.

Conditions We Treat

Our experienced team specializes in treating a wide range of conditions, including:

  • Sports injuries

  • "Weekend warrior" injuries

  • Car accident injuries

  • Lower back pain

  • Neck pain

  • Headaches

  • Sciatica

Specialized Services

Beyond traditional pain management, we offer specialized treatments including:

  • Acupuncture therapy - Effective for pain management and also for treating symptoms related to pre-menopause/menopause and anxiety

  • Medical weight loss - Utilizing the latest class of weight loss medications including semaglutide and tirzepatide

  • Men's health services - Including hormone replacement therapy (HRT)

Insurance and Location

We accept most major insurance plans, including Culinary Workers Health. Our clinic is conveniently located at 5445 W Sahara Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89146.

Contact us today: Call +1 702-368-0508 or visit our website at www.painclinic-lv.com to schedule your consultation and begin your journey to pain-free living.

Personalized Treatment Approach

They talking about they the dream team I don't see how nothing still gets done all they do is play around in the office no work gets done don't go to this place!|I usually go to the Durango location but was told last minute that I needed to go to the Jones location due to the only doctor available to do my procedure that accepts my insurance. While the medical professionals were nice and checked on me multiple times before, during, and after my procedure - no one explained my procedure to me. The facility looks run down and disorganized with supplies plied everywhere on counters and ledges. I had to ask the front desk personnel 5 times for a medical note for work and this seemed like a difficult task, saying they were out of paper and couldn't mail or email me one for work. They called multiple times to reschedule  and still I had to wait for the doctor to arrive to do my procedure. Not sure if their computer software is out of date in order to issue simple paperwork or organizational practices are not put into place to assist with scheduling appointment issues, but bringing in order to the current chaos is needed.|Dr is more worried about his outfit more than his patients.If a dr has on a $500 pair of shoes,patients are not his top priority.I have been going to the doctors for 20 yrs and I tell he trying to just get rich.|Staff was friendly and quick. Phones are tough but overall a pleasant experience|DO NOT GO HERE. I RECORDED THE ENTIRE CONVERSATION WITH DOCTOR KRISTINA. I was referred here by my obgyn after a failed endometrial ablation causing severe pain sending me to the ER and completely ruined my quality of life. I am a full time athlete and employeed full time which the pain has left me unable to be an athlete and work. I have endometriosis and Adenomyosis and already consistently live in chronic pain for years that I have managed with diet, chiropractic, physical therapy and massage therapy consistently for years which have not been effective in managing the pain from a failed ablation. I came with my husband as a witness and the nice front desk lady let him back with me, then she came back moments later and kicked him out of the room because the doctor wanted to speak to me alone. I immediately got snippy and asked WHY because I have been through this rodeo before (if you live with endometriosis, Adenomyosis, or are even a woman, you know doctors never take women seriously). The doctor came in and I told her why I was here, she immediately gaslit me (told me not to use language like "kicked out my husband"), and she said she can't prescribe anything on the first visit because I am "too young"  (okay lady, guess what I'm also too young for hysterectomy which is my other option aside from conservative pain management) (also "too young" for endometriosis, Adenomyosis, and a rare seizure disorder that never would have been found if my DAD DIDN'T advocate for me as a minor). I immediately got upset and demanded my husband which she refused to bring back, which I texted my husband to call my dad. The doctor then needed to consult the head doctor about possible injections, and what kind of injections are you planning to give me? What are the side effects of those? You get better insurance kick back from that (definitely)? My husband demanded to come back  as a witness and they refused. The doctor then came back with the manager as witness which is hilarious because the doctor was allowed to have a witness but I was not. HILARIOUS. Thanks to technology though I have the entire conversation with the doctor recorded. She then claimed that I needed to call and get medical records from my obgyn to see if the ablation even happened!!!???? Are you kidding me????? Uhm hello that is your job to request any medical records that YOU need (which should have been done when the appt was scheduled) Not mine (I work in healthcare). I don't know where the providers got their degree at but I would suggest they watch "below the belt" on PBS and take a course in pain science, ever heard of neurogenisis, cross and/or peripheral sensization (which is funny because they're supposedly pain doctors)?
In the end, she reluctantly prescribed a short dose of hydrocodone (which will honestly probably last me a few months because I only need it for these passing out pain episodes, shocking, I'm not a freaking drug addict).
Unless this place is illegally peddling out drugs and they treated me that way because they thought I was a possible set up (I'm almost 30 and well put together and look "perfectly healthy") since I'm not the typical "middle aged" "low back and hip pain" patient that they would get. Don't go here.|So I will leave reviews as I go with my experience, first I've called because I have been trying to find a pain management place to take my insurance it's been almost a year, my L4-L5 are pretty messed up is why I need to be seen, but I just broke my collar bone and this dr I have has put in effort to find me a place it was to here. So my nurse said for me to call them right away and she also sent me an email copy of my referral. The person who picked up the phone I'm she was ready to go home i work for a Dr too answering the phones so I get it she basically was saying wait for the call from them, no ma'am I don't have time like that. I'm in a lot of pain I need to be seen so I hung up I'll try again tomorrow. So far 2 stars|I would like to know how 6 shots totalling est 42,000. That not only tiny shots gave temp instant relief but other shots give actually made pain worst but the protocol for being paid by insursnce
I feel i may ask as been dealing with shots for over decades which experienced enough to know dont last but will INSURANCE PAY 4 ALCOHOL BEING FEDERAL GOVERMENT BANNING PAIN PILLS?

column2: Dr. Satish Sharma & Dr Kunal Parikh - Advanced Pain Management Center
column3:
Advanced Pain Management Center serves Henderson, Nevada and the greater Las Vegas area with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded by Dr. Satish Sharma and Dr. Kunal Parikh, this specialized medical practice has established itself as a premier destination for patients seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. Their state-of-the-art facility at 9029 S Pecos Rd, Suite 2800 in Henderson combines cutting-edge technology with compassionate care to address a wide spectrum of pain-related issues.

The center is led by two highly qualified pain specialists. Dr. Satish Sharma brings decades of experience in interventional pain management techniques, while Dr. Kunal Parikh specializes in innovative treatment approaches for complex pain conditions. Both physicians are board-certified and stay at the forefront of advancements in pain medicine to provide their patients with the most effective treatment options available.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

At Advanced Pain Management Center, patients receive individualized care plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and alternative treatment modalities. The practice specializes in treating conditions such as:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Sports injuries

State-of-the-Art Facilities

The Henderson facility features advanced diagnostic and treatment equipment, enabling the doctors to perform precise interventional procedures in a comfortable, outpatient setting. This commitment to technological excellence allows for more accurate diagnoses and more effective pain relief solutions.

Patient-Centered Care

What truly distinguishes Advanced Pain Management Center is their dedication to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. The team takes time to explain conditions and treatment options thoroughly, ensuring patients are informed partners in their pain management journey.

For those seeking relief from chronic or acute pain, Advanced Pain Management Center welcomes new patients. Their website, www.paindoclv.com, offers additional information about their services and approach. To schedule a consultation, patients can call +1 702-739-8323 during regular business hours.

I went in and they charged me $300 + beyond my deductible and insurance coverage. I was forced to pay $300 plus for them to put wet swab on my leg and ask if I could feel it. And then I was ask if I could fill it more on one leg than the other leg.
They did not listen to me. They did not ask me about my conditions. They had their own agenda and test to do to charge $300 for half hour not to mention what they got from my insurance company that was just my part I had to pay. if I could give them a -10, I would.
If you have a cookie cutter condition, then go to this cookie cutter doctor that your insurance will pay as much as he can get out of them. He doesn't care about you and your condition and your specific needs.
I should've known when he came in the office someone tried to talk to him. He was rude. Also somebody was on the phone unhappy How they were treated was embarrassing. I should've got up and walked out the other way and I would be $300 richer and much would not have to go through that horrible humiliating  experience.
At 65 years old, I am saying he's the worst doctor I've ever gone to in my entire lifetime. Also, he should get in trouble for insurance fraud. Dr's agree to what your insurance deductible after you get a referral sent by your insurance and how they can get away with over charging $300 beyond your insurance. Absolutely horrible|Thank you Dr. Sharma for helping my pain conditions. You really took your time with me, gave me a chance to talk after your exam. You gave me hope for a better quality of life! Dr. Sharma you really deserve my 5 star rating!|Dr Sharma and I have a communication prob, but my nurse practitioner is awesome. Been using Dr Sharma's pain management practice has 2 locations. column3:
COR Spine & Pain Center serves Northern Nevada with specialized care for spine, nerve, and musculoskeletal conditions since 1997. Under the leadership of Dr. Witmer, the center has established itself as a premier destination for patients seeking comprehensive pain management solutions in Reno and surrounding areas. Utilizing advanced diagnostic technology and evidence-based treatment protocols, the practice addresses a wide spectrum of conditions including chronic back and neck pain, sciatica, nerve damage, and complex pain disorders of uncertain origin.

Dr. Witmer brings extensive training in electrodiagnostics (EMG), providing precise nerve function assessment to identify the root causes of pain. The center offers targeted interventions including muscle, joint, and spine injections designed to deliver relief while minimizing invasive procedures. Each treatment plan is customized following thorough evaluation using state-of-the-art diagnostic tools.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

What distinguishes COR Spine & Pain Center is its team-based methodology that addresses pain from multiple angles. The practice emphasizes time-tested, non-operative protocols focused on inflammation control—effectively reducing swelling to mitigate pain at its source. Patients benefit from personalized care plans that evolve from clinical treatments to sustainable self-management strategies.

Patient Empowerment

Beyond in-office treatments, patients receive training in self-driven home programs combining mechanical techniques and medicinal treatments. This empowerment approach ensures long-term pain management success and improved quality of life without dependency on ongoing clinical interventions.

Visit COR Spine & Pain Center at 6255 Sharlands Ave., Reno, NV 89523, or call +1 775-248-1267 to schedule a consultation. Additional information about services and treatment options is available at www.corspine.com.
column11:
Practicing in Northern Nevada since 1997, Dr. Witmer uses the latest technology to analyze and treat spine, nerve and muscle damage, as well as musculoskeletal trauma and disease. He is trained in electrodiagnostics (EMG), muscle, joint and spine injections.

He uses a team approach to evaluate and treat spine (back and neck) pain, sciatica and pain that is reoccurring or of uncertain origin. Emphasizing time tested, non-operative protocols for inflammation control, the swelling and therefore the pain, can be mitigated. This control is then maintained with training in a self driven home program of mechanical and medicinal treatments.

column2: Las Vegas Sports and Spine Center
column3:
Las Vegas Sports and Spine Center in Las Vegas, Nevada offers comprehensive pain management solutions designed to help patients reclaim their quality of life. Our team of specialized pain management physicians combines cutting-edge interventional therapies with personalized treatment plans to address chronic pain at its source. Serving the greater Las Vegas area, our practice is dedicated to not just managing symptoms but working toward functional restoration and long-term relief for our patients.

At Las Vegas Sports and Spine Center, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our physicians utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment protocols to address various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, sports injuries, and neuropathic pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, focusing on minimally invasive approaches whenever possible.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our unwavering commitment to patient-centric care. We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop a customized treatment strategy that aligns with your lifestyle and recovery goals. We pride ourselves on creating a supportive environment where patients feel heard and valued throughout their healing journey.

Convenient Care Options

Understanding the urgency of pain relief, we offer same-day appointments for patients in acute distress. Our virtual health services provide accessible care options for those unable to visit our office in person. These telehealth consultations maintain our high standard of care while offering flexibility and convenience.

Our Facility

Located at 6402 McLeod Dr #1, Las Vegas, NV 89120, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to deliver the most effective pain management treatments available. The center is designed with patient comfort in mind, creating a healing environment that supports your recovery process.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call us at +1 702-707-7246. Our friendly staff is ready to assist you in taking the first step toward a pain-free life. For additional information about our practice and treatment options, visit our website at https://lvsportsandspine.com/.

At Las Vegas Sports and Spine Center, we're committed to helping you overcome pain limitations and return to the activities you love. Our goal isn't just pain relief—it's restoring your function and enhancing your overall quality of life.

column2: Quail Surgical and Pain Management Center
column3:
Quail Surgical and Pain Management Center in Reno, Nevada offers specialized surgical and pain management services to residents throughout Northern Nevada. This state-of-the-art ambulatory surgery center provides comprehensive care through its team of highly skilled physicians and medical professionals. Jointly owned by an affiliate of Northern Nevada Medical Center (NNMC) and community-based surgeons, the center combines hospital-quality care with the convenience and personalized attention of an outpatient facility.

At Quail Surgical and Pain Management Center, patients receive expert care for a wide range of surgical needs and chronic pain conditions. The facility specializes in minimally invasive procedures that promote faster recovery times and improved outcomes. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the specific needs of individual patients, ensuring the highest standard of care.

Facility and Location

Conveniently located at 6630 S McCarran Blvd, Unit C25, Reno, NV 89509, the center features modern medical equipment and comfortable treatment areas designed with patient comfort in mind. The facility's central location makes it easily accessible for patients throughout the Reno area and surrounding communities.

Physician Expertise

While the physicians at Quail Surgical and Pain Management Center are independent practitioners who are not employees or agents of the center itself, they work collaboratively with the facility's staff to deliver exceptional care. This partnership approach ensures patients benefit from specialized medical expertise while receiving coordinated, comprehensive treatment.

For appointments or more information, patients can contact the center directly at +1 775-827-7555 or visit their website at northernnevadahealth.com.
column11: Quail Surgical and Pain Management Center, Inc. is jointly owned by an affiliate of NNMC and community-based surgeons. Physicians are independent practitioners who are not employees or agents of Quail Surgical and Pain Management Center. The facility shall not be liable for actions or treatments provided by physicians.

I had outpatient surgery here yesterday and was treated with utmost respect and compassion. Everything was explained thoroughly and all my questions and concerns were addressed. While having surgery isn't my idea of a fun day, they made the experience less stressful. The staff I dealt with were really great people. I would certainly recommend this facility to anyone.|I've never had surgery before that I could remember in my 36 years. I had my first surgery yesterday. From the check in, to the nurses, to the anesthesiologist to the surgeon, everyone was very kind and very patient answering my entire list of questions... I had a very long list. I also do not like getting needles/IVs put into me. My husband was allowed to come back to calm me down for the IV which made that process for the IV lady so much easier. I had a lot of concerns about anesthesia as I had never been under before either. The anesthesiologist came in and answered all of my questions and concerns, and in all his 27 years of experience he has never ran into what I was concerned about. Which was helpful. I wish I could remember everyone's names but unfortunately I do not, but I do remember Karen and Jordan and Dr. Sasee... but everyone there is absolutely fantastic and very caring and compassionate. I would recommend this place to anyone needing surgery.|Had foot surgery there, the staff was super nice, everything went smoothly, , I recommend this surgery center,|There was one nurse that was incompetent, condescending, dishonest, and rude.. she should have been fired on the spot! column3:
Reno Regenerative Medicine serves Reno, Nevada and surrounding communities as Northern Nevada's premier destination for non-surgical pain relief and rehabilitation. Our specialized clinic focuses on treating chronic pain conditions through advanced regenerative techniques, helping patients who may have previously found little success with conventional treatments. We combine cutting-edge technology with personalized care plans to address the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms.

Our medical team specializes in treating a comprehensive range of conditions including:

- Knee pain and joint deterioration

- Back pain and sciatica

- Shoulder injuries and chronic discomfort

- Neck pain and associated headaches

- Migraines and chronic headache conditions

- Neuropathies and nerve-related disorders

Advanced Regenerative Approaches

At Reno Regenerative Medicine, we distinguish ourselves by offering state-of-the-art innovative treatments rarely found at other medical facilities in Northern Nevada. Our practice employs evidence-based regenerative protocols designed to stimulate your body's natural healing processes, potentially eliminating the need for surgery or long-term medication dependence.

Our Patient-Centered Philosophy

We believe in creating seamless, safe, and effective patient experiences. Our dedicated medical professionals work collaboratively to develop customized treatment plans that address your specific pain concerns while focusing on long-term mobility and quality of life improvements. Our ultimate goal is helping patients GET and STAY ACTIVE regardless of their age or condition severity.

Convenient Regional Access

Patients throughout the region find our location easily accessible. Whether you're from Reno, Sparks, or Carson City, our clinic at 730 Sandhill Road #120, Reno, NV 89521 provides a convenient destination for exceptional care. Many patients tell us the drive is well worth the life-changing results they experience.

Contact us today at (775) 683-9026 or visit http://renoregen.com/ to learn how we can help you overcome chronic pain and return to an active lifestyle.

column40:
I have recently just begun therapy at Reno Regenerative. The staff and management have been wonderful. I am always greeted with a smile and a friendly voice. I feel like I am making some positive progress and I owe it all to them. Many thanks to everyone involved in my care.

Steve Bell|I used to be paralyzed from the waist down from an injury that ocurred in 1989. I recovered slowly, but was able to walk again with only partial paralysis in my right leg. Then I had an accident on horseback that shattered a vertebra in the middle of my spine and had to have a spinal fusion. A few years after that I was in a car accident and fractured my neck in 3 places and had to have a 4 level cervical fusion. As if that wasn't enough, I fell in a hole and snapped my right knee back resulting in severe hyperextension and very little control over my right knee. I recently had a knee replacement and the surgeon made my right leg an inch longer than my left leg. This caused me to experience hip pain and severe spinal scoliosis. I was in tremendous pain and very depressed. I tried to seek help from several different local chiropractors but their adjustments usually ended up causing me more pain and sometimes left me unable to walk for a few days and experiencing migraine headaches. I was feeling even more frustrated and then I attended a seminar by Reno Regenerative Medicine and decided to go in for a consultation. First I met with Brandon the case manager, he was very kind and listened to my long, sad story. He sent me for xrays and had MD Rachel give me an evaluation. She prepared for me several treatment options. Unfortunately I had to choose the cheapest option, but would have preferred the most comprehensive. The office helped me get a loan for what was not covered by my insurance with a reputable credit union. The office paid the interest on the loan and gave me a discount for signing up that day. I am so grateful for this extra assistance. I started treatments immediately, I must say I am completely impressed wirh this office. Even with the cheapest option, my treatments are very comprehensive, including trigger point injections (to loosen spasming muscles), allergy evaluations, flexibility evaluations and muscle strength evaluations, decompression therapy in conjunction with laser treatments to relieve pressure on the spine & reduce inflammation, rehabilitation therapy (includes stretching and muscle strengthening), infrared light therapy, biogenetix supplements, allergy treatments, and of course chiropractic adjustments. Their chiropractors (Dr. Decker & Dr. Wendy) are so gentle, even with all my spinal implants, they are able to treat me without causing me any pain. I was afraid to do decompression therapy because of my spinal implants, but it has worked out great. After my first day of treatments all the pain I was experiencing disappeared. I am halfway thru my treatments and I am doing great, no more hip pain. I am nervous for when my treatments stop because there is no reversing the damage done by the knee surgeon, my legs will remain uneven. Thank god for this office and the progressive treatments they offer, my only other alternative would be pain medicine. Because of them I get drug free pain relief. They have a very knowledgeable staff from the awesome techs in rehab and decompression therapy (thank you Christian, Alex, and Laura) to their Nurse Practitioner Brittany, to their MD Dr. Rachel and her Medical Assistant Whitney. Not to mention their outstanding office staff!! If you get treated by them you will be thankful and impressed. I noticed that the only negative reviews to this office were by people who were afraid to get treated and backed out. This is the most progressive treatment center in Reno, I am so happy I found them!!|I've had neuropathy for years. After my visit and treatment, my feet and legs haven't felt better! The staff are AWESOME! Would recommend Reno   Regenenerative to everyone with Neuropathy.|My daughter is a figure skater/volleyball player. Based on the demanding movements of the sport (jumps, spins, and complex landings) can put significant strain on her spine and joints, leading to misalignments and pain. Wendy provides adjustments improving flexibility, balance, and overall performance while preventing injuries; essentially optimizing body mechanics for optimal sports ability.

I cannot say enough good things about our experience. The entire staff is knowledgeable, friendly, thoughtful and accommodating.|OK, then just talk. This is Annarae Luevano and I had an experience an opportunity to go go through a program at Reno regenerative medicine and I felt that that was an experience. I was a little afraid of it first and then I had a very good experience and excellent experience working with the staff to make sure that I was receiving what I needed never left me questioning or saying I don't know why it was there that day or something like that because they help me with my body becoming back for me a more normal active life, and I appreciated that I feel that the expense for the program was very helpful to make sure I could do it. I felt very And know sometimes I didn't wanna come to the actual physical place because we live across town but every time I was so glad I had come. I learned good exercises good breathing programs and I would recommend this process if you have any issues with muscular breathing balance any of that if you're having trouble with it, this would be the place to come thank you|Had a really nasty ankle sprain (whole foot turned black and blue) searched for something that could help accelerate the healing process. Found Reno Regen and went in for a consult. They recommended cold laser therapy. It was back to 85% 3 weeks in and getting really close to 100% 4 weeks later. The ER Doc said minimum of 6-8 weeks of healing time. It's been a great process. They are so friendly and my ankle is feeling great!! Definitely worth checking out if you have something like this.|The entire staff is extremely friendly and supportive and truely care. I have had zero negative experiences with anyone there. I had stem cell and prp shots, decompression and cold laser treatments, physical therapy along with chiropractic adjustments. The chiropractor is very careful and thoroughly checks yoy before adjustments which I appreciate. I have been able to do things I haven't done in years such as bending over to the ground and being able to travel on vacation without having to find a local chiropractor in the area just in case. I highly recommend.|The team here at Rejuvenate really go above and beyond exceeded my expectations. Their chiropractic service is unbelievably amazing!

He is an extremely efficient Dr, but a very special person as well.

I thank God for him and wouldn't want any other pain management Dr.

I recommend him highly.|I really miss Dr. Kozmary. He is a very excellent Dr. I live  back in California again and there aren't very many good P.M. Dr's here. Plus the DEA is scareing them all.
I wish I was still in Vegas, just so I could see him again. He is awesome and his P.A. at the time was really nice and empathic!
Highly recommended!!!!|This is the WORST OFFICE I'VE EVER BEEN TO!!!! Every time I've been seen I have waited for OVER 2 HOURS to see the Doctor. The staff is rude and you're just a number here! They're annoyed if you ask questions or even speak. When the Doctor finally comes in he is in such a rush, he doesn't even listen to what you have to say, and you literally only get 5 minutes with him. He recommended a surgical procedure but refused to answer any questions or go into detail about it. His reply was, "if you have questions you can ask my nurse." And WALKED OUT THE DOOR AS I WAS TALKING TO HIM!!! He handed me my paperwork and said give this to the nurse. It was my personal file and another 2 patients files as well! Had they're social security #, address, and all their private information!. When I went to give it to the front desk to tell them I have someone else's paperwork, I was scolded and told to go sit down and wait my turn to check out! It took another 30 minutes to wait just to check out. The doctor had written my prescription out wrong and it has taken me 2 WEEKS to get ahold of anyone to try and fix it. The nurse assured me she would call it in, but never does!!! Nobody answers the phone, no one will call you back, and if you do get ahold of someone they're incompetent! When I asked her why she keeps telling me she'll call it in and then doesn't she replied, "the wait on hold was too long for the pharmacy." Wow. I'm so sorry to inconvenience you, I've only been out of my prescription for 2 WEEKS!!!!!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!!! This place is a joke!|I really thought I was going to the right place for my pain. I have degenerated disc disease L1 thru T12. All I got was drugs and more pain after the Ablation. Dr Kozmary nicked a nerve and never addressed it. Now I have additional area of pain that the current narcatics don't help with. Not once has anyone called to check on why I won't return. My new Dr Baumgartl looks at everything that may prohibit my care. Plus he does Stem Cell treatment but first he is assisting in helping me lose weight during my care and truly cares that all options are considered. What a huge difference in care. Don't go to Dr Kozmary if you truly want off meds and or honest answers!

Apex Medical Center serves Las Vegas, North Las Vegas, and Henderson with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. For over 15 years, our board-certified specialists have been dedicated to improving quality of life through innovative treatments and compassionate care. Our multidisciplinary approach combines advanced diagnostic techniques with both interventional and non-invasive therapies to address chronic pain conditions at their source.

At Apex Medical Center, we offer a wide range of treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Our specialists are experienced in treating various conditions such as back pain, neck pain, arthritis, fibromyalgia, migraines, and complex regional pain syndrome. Each treatment plan is customized following thorough evaluation and consultation with our expert team.

Patient-Centered Approach

We pride ourselves on our patient-first philosophy, ensuring that each individual receives personalized attention and comprehensive education about their condition and treatment options. Our facility features state-of-the-art equipment in a comfortable, welcoming environment designed to put patients at ease during their visits. Most insurance plans are accepted, and our administrative team works diligently to maximize coverage for necessary treatments.

Convenient Location and Hours

Located at 1701 Wellness Way, Suite 200, Las Vegas, NV 89106, our main clinic is centrally positioned to serve patients throughout the Las Vegas Valley. With flexible scheduling options and minimal wait times, we strive to accommodate even the busiest lifestyles. Contact our friendly staff at (702) 310-9110 to schedule your consultation or visit www.apexmedicalcenter.com to learn more about our services and providers.

column3:
United Pain Urgent Care serves Reno, Nevada and surrounding communities with specialized urgent care services focused exclusively on pain management. Our dedicated facility offers immediate relief for patients experiencing acute or chronic pain without the extended wait times typically associated with traditional medical settings. Since our founding, we have established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider in the Washoe County area, combining compassionate care with evidence-based treatment protocols tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At United Pain Urgent Care, we understand that pain doesn't wait for appointments. Our team provides prompt evaluation and treatment for various pain conditions, including back pain, joint discomfort, migraines, post-surgical pain, and sports injuries. We utilize advanced diagnostic tools and innovative treatment approaches to address both the symptoms and underlying causes of your pain. Our goal is to improve your quality of life through effective pain management strategies that minimize medication dependence while maximizing functional recovery.

Expert Medical Team

All professionals at United Pain Urgent Care maintain the highest levels of accreditation and pursue ongoing education to stay abreast of the latest trends in the pain management field. Our physicians, nurse practitioners, and support staff bring decades of combined experience in pain medicine, emergency care, and rehabilitation. This multidisciplinary approach ensures that patients receive comprehensive care addressing all aspects of their pain condition.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 6522 S McCarran Blvd A, Reno, NV 89509, our modern facility is equipped with the latest medical technology to provide accurate diagnoses and effective treatments. The clinic environment is designed with patient comfort in mind, creating a calming atmosphere that helps reduce anxiety often associated with pain-related medical visits.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our patient-centered approach includes thorough evaluations, detailed treatment plans, and ongoing support. We take time to listen to your concerns, explain your condition, and discuss treatment options so you can make informed decisions about your care. Follow-up appointments and coordination with your primary care provider ensure continuity of care beyond your urgent visit.

Call us today at +1 775-384-1380 to learn more about our services or to schedule an appointment. For additional information about our practice and treatment options, visit our website at https://www.unitedpainurgentcare.com/.
column11: All professionals at United Pain Urgent Care maintain the highest levels of accreditation and pursue ongoing education to stay abreast of the latest trends in the pain management field. Call us today!!
column38: Susan Arzillo|Melissa Porter-Salazar|Zac Haffner|Colleen Klingseisen|Julianne Conrad|Shaylean Sameh|Ryan Alger|Rachel Beach
column40:
My husband, age 80, was experiencing severe hip/back pain. We were going to try to see if he could get a referral for physical therapy to help him until our daughter recommended that we instead see Dr. Nairizi at United Pain Urgent Care. Dr. Nairizi was wonderful. After a diagnoses of arthritis and explanation of the office procedure he was about to do, he gave my husband a steroid shot which immediately eliminated the pain he was experiencing. My husband walked out of there like a new man. Physical therapy probably would have taken weeks of visits and might not have helped at all.|I was seen by Dr. Wesley due to severe back and leg pain. I have to admit I was pretty grouchy because I was in so much pain, but they took care of me. Dr. Wesley was incredibly kind and knowledgeable.|I have had my back go out twice over the last three years. After trying cupping, acupuncture, chiropractics, and pain medication, nothing was working. I got to where I could barely walk in each of the two instances and this place was able to get me upright in no time. In my case, I received an epidural and was able to get back to my normal life in a matter of days. This office's focus on pain is next to none and I would recommend them for anyone dealing with back pain. So thankful for this place!|I injured my right thumb in a skiing accident and came to this clinic to be evaluated. The receptionist gave me a clipboard with many forms on it, which I attempted to fill out. Very quickly I realized I couldn't write as it was my right thumb that was affected by my injury, and I could not hold a pen. I explained this to the receptionist and asked her if she could take verbally the critical information and when my husband came in about a half an hour he could finish filling out the forms. She said that would be fine, but she would not put me forward to see the medical staff until after the forms were filled out. I drove over to carbon health, urgent care. They saw me right away with no need for me to fill out any forms.|I went to the urgent care because the ad said to come here instead of going to the EmergencyRoom. I do not have an injury, but I have had chronic neck pain for over 25 years. I had pain prescriptions from this pain clinic in the past and when I checked in I had to sign a pain medication agreement.  I wanted a stronger medication, at least temporarily. They offered steroids, physical therapy and trigger point injections, but said that unless I broke something, they will not prescribe pain medication in urgent care. In other words, nothing that would provide immediate relief.|They were amazing with my husband and the staff is so polite!! Definitely recommend|Help me enormously! I had a possible rotator cuff tear/injury and  primary couldn't do much (the recommended an MRI and an X-Ray.) Later in the afternoon I was almost completely paralyzed from the chest up and unable to work or even sleep. I went to Urgent Pain and within an hour I had an X-ray and a was being treated (a series of shots into my shoulder/arm.) I had relief within an hour and was able to sleep and work.

Great service, friendly staff, knowledgeable doctors. Got me out of pain.|Amazing staff and doctors! My only complaint is when using Google search their business hrs are incorrect. It says they're open for urgent care on weekends and I tried going on Sat but they were closed and Sun as well? May need to update their business hours?

column3:
Dr. Christopher A. Woolley, MD in Reno, Nevada provides exceptional interventional pain management services at Sierra Neurosurgery Group. With specialized training and extensive experience, Dr. Woolley has established himself as a leading specialist in addressing complex pain conditions, particularly those resulting from cancer treatments, brain or spine tumors, and various spinal disorders.

As an Interventional Pain Management Specialist, Dr. Woolley focuses on minimally invasive procedures and targeted injections designed to provide significant pain relief while minimizing recovery time. His approach combines cutting-edge techniques with compassionate care, offering patients effective alternatives to traditional pain management methods. Dr. Woolley's specialized training enables him to precisely target pain sources, particularly in complex cases involving oncological treatments and neurological conditions.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

Dr. Woolley's practice encompasses a wide range of interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other advanced pain management techniques. Each treatment plan is carefully tailored to address the unique needs and circumstances of individual patients, with particular attention to those suffering from pain related to cancer treatments or spinal abnormalities.

Professional Setting

Practicing at the respected Sierra Neurosurgery Group, Dr. Woolley works alongside a team of highly qualified neurosurgical specialists. The facility at 5590 Kietzke Ln in Reno offers state-of-the-art equipment and a supportive environment designed to enhance patient comfort and treatment outcomes. The practice maintains the highest standards of care while providing convenient access for patients throughout northern Nevada.

Patient-Centered Care

Dr. Woolley is known for his thorough approach to diagnosis and treatment, taking time to understand each patient's complete medical history and specific pain concerns. This comprehensive evaluation process allows him to develop effective, personalized treatment strategies that address both immediate pain relief and long-term management goals.

For consultations or appointments with Dr. Christopher A. Woolley, patients can contact Sierra Neurosurgery Group at +1 775-323-2080 or visit their website at www.sierraneurosurgery.com for additional information about services and treatment options.
column11: Dr. Woolley is an Interventional Pain Management Specialist, with expertise in procedures and injections to minimize or eliminate pain caused by cancer treatments, brain or spine tumors or other disorders of the spine.

column40:
Dr. Woolley is absolutely fantastic! He knows exactly what he is doing and he is very gentle, kind and compassionate. He explains as he goes so one knows what's coming next. He has done a handful of nerve blocks and ablations on me with more to go. I would not consider any other to perform these on me. Great doctor!|Wow! I was so impressed.. I came in for a short procedure with a lot of questions. Dr Wooley took all the time needed to explain but also to demonstrate on a prosthetic spine so I could visualize what my issue was and how it could/ would be addressed. It was an excellent experience, I've had a great response to his care and highly recommend him. He is also quite approachable and accommodating.|I arrived early, and they were able to get me right in.  Dr Woolley answered all my questions prior to my procedure, and explained the recovery process thoroughly.   He was knowledgeable, and courteous as well.   I'll definitely keep him as my doctor.|Dr. Woolley has been treating me for just over a year and a half.  It is an understatement to say that his care has been beyond expectations. His ability to listen, empathetic nature and the time spent with me has been absolutely one of the best patient/doctor relationships I have ever had. That is a lot to say considering I worked in the medical field for 15 years. His care has directly helped in diagnostic evaluation and narrowing down the specific injuries I have incurred.
Dr. Woolley exemplifies what a doctor should be and how they should care for people. He treats the person, not the chart and I could not be more grateful for his care, time, advice and guidance during a beyond painful and difficult injury.

Thank you Dr Woolley and you team as well! They are all just as wonderful as you and I'm sure they set the foundation for such a great experience and environment. Could not be more thankful for all of them as well!|I was just at my hygienist yesterday talking about Dr Woolley and bragging about him and his team. I think the quality of my life has 100% taken a positive turn due to his care. From Dr Woolley to Amber Sands and everyone on the care team. I've had visits in the past at other facilities and nothing seemed to help or change. Still in pain, still living day to day miserable and uncomfortable for so many years. Not with Dr Woolley and Amber Sands. If you want a team of knowledgeable, caring and thorough doctors who make a difference you should get a referral to Sierra Neurosurgery Group.

Virginia (Gina) Betters|Dr. Woolley is accommodating to my pain needs and I appreciated his thorough communication on what exactly the procedure would be. Serving patients throughout the greater Reno area, our practice specializes in comprehensive pain management solutions that focus on improving quality of life and restoring function for those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

At Nevada Advanced Pain Specialists, Dr. Patterson brings over 15 years of specialized experience in interventional pain management techniques. Our practice offers a multidisciplinary approach to treating various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. We utilize the latest evidence-based treatments and minimally invasive procedures to help patients find relief without excessive reliance on medication.

Our Comprehensive Approach

Dr. Patterson believes in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. This integrated approach has helped thousands of patients throughout Nevada regain control of their lives.

State-of-the-Art Facility

column40:
After one of his procedures, my mother will never be the same again. Her pain was manageable, but he made it 10 times worse! Took her to UC Davis and found out what the problem was. She's much better now.   He only cares about the dollar|My mother at 90 years old went to this Dr. The very first thing they wanted was a Urinalysis, knowing she has a very large amount of metal in her spine for a small crack in her vertebrae.  The Dr. Only came in for a moment, never to examine her, just to Shake Hands during the Covid Outbreak !? Did not give her an Epidermal or cortisone injections. Would NOT Take my Animal to this want to be Doctor|Dr. Nairizi is an absolutely phenomenal doctor.

I came to him years ago with chronic lower back pain after a diseconomy and a laminectomy and he placed a permanent tens unit in my back, which the sciatica has completely gone away.  . Amazing to me!

His friendly nature and very personable approach to my care was simply outstanding!

He discussed everything with me and my boyfriend who I allowed in there and allowed Dr. Nairizi to speak to, including the fact that I would literally have a "box" showing in my back and really wanted to be certain that not only was I comfortable with this device, but that my boyfriend understood what it all entailed as well.

Obviously, my boyfriend and I decided it was necessary, my boyfriend doesn't care and, unless you're wearing a super tight top, no one else will even know.

My "battery" lasts for 10 years and, I must admit, that I was a bit heavier when he performed the procedure, I lost weight (gained it back plus some! ), it did shift some and I am really looking forward to getting this repositioned!  Nothing Dr. Nairizi could have predicted, nor could have I!

He is an absolutely amazing Dr., and, I highly recommend him!

Go and see him, you will not be disappointed!

Looking forward to seeing you soon again Dr. Nairizi!|Dr. Nairizi was recommended for spine injections when my mom was in a lot of pain by her doctor. He was very patient and kind. She was very nervous and he took the time to explain everything to her and eased her anxieties. After the injections she has been pain free for over 6 months now. I would highly recommend Nairizi.|This doctor laughed as he removed staples from the implantation of a DRG stimulator due to  hyperalgesia (pain sensitivity) from CRPS. The post surgical wound opened up and every subq stitch extruded.  I found him to be insensitive and arrogant. I now have and excellent team at Stanford Pain Clinic and a local Stanford trained pain mgmt doctor. I do not recommend Ali Nairizi, MD.

I was a patient when Naiziri was with NV Advanced Pain with Dr Patterson. The Abbott reps were professional and we worked together as an effective team. I had the DRG removed by Dr Patterson

Yes I was a patient of Naiziri|I would never, never recommend Dr. Nairizi.  My pain is in my shoulderblade, not my spine, and I told the nurses and practitioners that.  He obviously didn't listen to them any more than he did me.  I had a Fluoroguide for spine injection, two INJ Peripheral Nerve/BR 9 64640 (whatever that is) and a Triamcinolone Acet injnos J3301???  Nothing was done where I was having the pain and now I'm in worse pain that I have been.  Luckily I have an appointment with a highly recommended person this time!|My experience with Dr. Nairizi's office ended abruptly at the end of 2021 when I was dismissed from his practice for allegedly avoiding requires urine testing. This was a shock to me because I had complied with their requests religiously.  The office employs random testing based on the number you come up with after rolling their dice.  On my last visit, I rolled an 11 and was told by the person taking my vitals that they wouldn't require a sample from me that day.  I then finished up my appt with Kami, a  PA, stopped at the front desk to make a follow up appt with PJ and said goodbye.

An hour later I'm in line at the pharmacy and I get a call from the office manager telling me I ran out before being tested and was no longer a patient and that my prescriptions were cancelled.  To make a strange experience even more strange, nobody at the office will speak with me about this.  I tried Dr. Nairizi and just about everyone on his staff and nobody would speak with me. I am astounded by the lack of professionalism from this office.  In addition to not speaking with me, office staff who witnessed the events did not come forward on my behalf and Dr. Nairizi, contrary to what's on his website, showed a total lack of concern for my health by cutting off all medications immediately. Everyone knows you're supposed to wean off pain meds slowly or risk complications, including seizures and/or stroke.

Most of the staff here are friendly but the office is not patient friendly. They will quickly turn on a patient to cover for staff.  And good luck speaking with Dr. Nairizi.  I don't think he sees any patients for consults or continued care and his staff hm prohibits and patients from access to communicate with the Dr.  He seems more preoccupied taking hundreds of thousands from his preferred medical device companies.  If you become a patient her, rest assured you will be slotted for surgery - either pain pump or spinal stimulator.  Someone's got to pay for all the extra income the doc is manipulating.|I have just seen Dr. Ali Nairizi for lower back pain... I'm so impressed with him and all his staff! They not only made me feel comfortable, but also performed an Ablation on L3, L4, L5 to help eliminate the nerve pain in my lower back! Helping me go from a 10 nerve pain to a "1"! Not only that... he actually said "thank you!" for allowing me to help you today! I can only say "thank you !" Even more! Best of all worlds... use this Doctor for sure! DC

column40: My girlfriend of 17rs died under Mr Harris MD care. I always thought he was over medicating her.  From her first visit. She was prescribed heavy dowses of both fast acting and extended release oxycodone./ oxys. I felt that her appointments were more about him, his wife health issues. Rather than him using the 15min appointment on my girlfriends. His over medicating way with her destroyed our entire world. Especially her. It has been four years without her.
