Nevada Pain & Spine Specialists serves Reno, Nevada and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Kenneth Pitman, MD. Our specialized medical practice focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions through innovative, minimally invasive techniques and personalized treatment plans. Located conveniently in South Reno, our state-of-the-art facility combines advanced medical technology with compassionate care to help patients regain mobility, reduce pain, and improve their quality of life.

At Nevada Pain & Spine Specialists, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our comprehensive approach addresses various pain conditions including back and neck pain, sciatica, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Dr. Pitman utilizes evidence-based treatments such as epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication management to provide effective pain relief.

Expert Medical Team

Dr. Kenneth Pitman brings extensive training and experience in pain medicine to every patient consultation. Board-certified and fellowship-trained, Dr. Pitman stays at the forefront of pain management advancements to deliver the highest standard of care. Our entire clinical team is committed to creating a supportive environment where patients feel heard, respected, and actively involved in their treatment decisions.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we develop individualized treatment strategies that address both the physical and emotional components of pain. Our goal is not just symptom management but helping patients return to their daily activities with improved function and reduced dependence on pain medications.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Kenneth Pitman at Nevada Pain & Spine Specialists, please call +1 775-689-5410. Our office is located at 605 Sierra Rose Dr # 4, Reno, NV 89511. For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at painspine.com.
column38: Anna Iosua|Lisa Hensley|Miriam Maldonado|Ian Wood|Joey DelliGatti|Beck Marko|Janice|Jacy Jackson
column40:
I highly recommend Dr. Pittman and his entire staff.Kit and Kyra assisted me. These ladies are so kind and exceptionally professional. Today I had an epidural on the lumbar area.  I feel no pain in my back right now and am so very grateful! Thankyou so much to Dr. Pittman and every kind person that work here.|I suppose everyone has their own experiences:

-I have been seeing Dr.Pittman for about 3 years after my 4 back surgeries. He has always been very professional and genuinely considerate with the pain I have. He has always made me feel comfortable and he confidently hold's conversation.
I see him consistently every 3 months for migraines injections, amongst other procedures. He has never pushed narcotics (nor have I been on them) or any other medications/procedures. And always has made me feel like I have a choice.
-Never once has he been rude or rushed an appointment.

Also,
I speak with Tina every few months and she is so great, nice and friendly when she calls.
-Also Dr. Pitman, his medical assistant is amazing. She makes you feel very welcome and is always in the best mood. Shes so nice. Some of the staff is just a pleasure.|I hurt myself at work and I never solved it, I only asked for a full body exam and I never asked for photos anymore, I spent 18 months with him, I was a lawyer, the lawyer got me another doctor. They wanted to disable me and they didn't solve me for me the He only knows how to put the injections, and of other pains he does not know, with the other doctor times I had very bad experience or attention I already put me|I Just had the worst experience with Dr Pitman and i will not be giving him my business anymore! Not only was he extremely rude, he was also very dis concerned with anything i had to say or felt. He offered a bias and aggressive opinion and just wants to refer me to surgery instead of manage my back pain. I have told him that i do not want to do surgery as i feel that it should be the last resort. I had an epidural which was extremely helpful but it just didn't last long. I feel Dr Pitman is becoming callus when it comes to patient care. HE IS ONLY THERE FOR HIS PAYCHECK AND NOT FOR THE PATIENTS!|I will just say this......the negative comments below about Dr Pittman are not fabrications. I've experienced all of the complaints from others. Don't appreciate his rudeness or lack of attention to detail. Its inexcusable for a practicing physician, to schedule you for surgery, and then the day before, realize he's not licensed or equipped to perform said procedure. Epidurals and trigger point injections are their MO & are a nice $$ stream for them. Sadly they don't work terribly well, so the fall back is pushing narcs. Their billing company is a dumpster fire with way too many billing mistakes being made. In closing choose this Dr. & or practice at your own peril.|Dr. Pitman gave me my life back. It honestly makes me sad seeing some of the other reviews.  Dr. Pitman has been nothing but amazing.   He has never given up on me or my treatment,  even when there were days where I wanted to give up.   I have a progressive nerve condition that caused me to be in and out of a wheelchair.  I felt like I was burning alive or freezing to death.  A simple breeze from someone walking by felt like I was being sand blasted with razor blades.  He may be quiet and sometime a little intimidating when you first meet him but I have learned that it is when he deeply thinking of a treatment plan.  After seeing him for almost 8 years,  my condition is in remission.  I am now able to walk miles at a time, I am learning to hike and most of all, my three teenagers have their mom back! I don't even have words to describe how much he has changed my life!  Thank you.|I happened to like Dr. Pitman.  He has a crisp, extremely Professional Style and I found him like able.  Is he an extremely warm Dr.  maybe not.  Relationships takes time, and I'm willing to take the time.  I've just seen him once.
He is working well, with my Spine Surgeon and has made requests of me which I am going to follow.  The chances of my having to have Spine Surgery again are very high.  I am very frightened, and found Dr. Pitman to have compassion.   I am following ALL of his requests.   I'm from California, and all of this is new to me.  I'm being a patient, patent and I trust him.
I've had the same PCP for 30 years, and the same Pain Management Dr.  for 12 years.  It's difficult to see a Dr. that knows nothing about me.  Time equals a good Dr. patient relationship.
I've had a Laminectomy, that failed, and the 30th of this year; I had a Spinal Fusion and Rod Insertion that only participants fused.  I also have PTSD, due to surviving a Brutal Assault, that happened years ago.
When you first see Dr. Pitman, the chances of you walking out with opiates are slim.  You need to take a test first, and possibly see a Pain Psychologist.  I was in too much pain to urinate or take a blood test.  I have a pathological fear of needles.
If you abide in Cannabis, he will want a current Nevada Medical License.   I've decided I'm lucky to have a board certified Medical Dr. that is an experienced Anesthesiologist that has practiced for many years.
We seek Pain Drs, to get pain relief and I do believe in time, I will be on Pain Management.  I like the staff, and think Dr. Pitman will turn out to be an excellent fit.
I'm 62 years old, the pic is from my High School graduation.|Dr Pitman, and the clinic not only did not help my husband, but for 5 years just fed him pain pills. He ended up with a horrible addiction, lost his job, our business and he just kept feeding them to him.  Thank you for ruining our lives!

column2: Neuropathy and Pain Centers of America
column3:
Neuropathy and Pain Centers of America in Las Vegas, Nevada offers specialized care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions and neuropathy. Established with the mission to provide non-surgical, drug-free treatment options, this medical facility has become a trusted resource for residents throughout the Las Vegas Valley seeking relief from debilitating pain symptoms.

At Neuropathy and Pain Centers of America, patients receive personalized treatment plans designed to address the root causes of their pain rather than merely masking symptoms. The center utilizes advanced diagnostic technology to accurately identify nerve damage and pain sources, allowing for targeted therapeutic interventions. Their team of specialists brings decades of combined experience in treating conditions ranging from diabetic neuropathy to sciatica, fibromyalgia, and complex regional pain syndrome.

Innovative Treatment Approaches

The center stands out for its implementation of cutting-edge therapies including electroanalgesia, laser therapy, and proprietary protocols developed specifically for neuropathic conditions. These evidence-based treatments have helped countless patients regain mobility and reduce dependence on pain medications. Many patients report significant improvement after just a few sessions, with comprehensive programs typically spanning several weeks for optimal results.

Patient-Centered Care Experience

Located at 8084 W Sahara Ave, Suite B, Las Vegas, NV 89117, the facility offers a comfortable, modern environment designed with patient comfort in mind. New patients benefit from thorough consultations that include comprehensive health history reviews and advanced testing to create customized treatment protocols. The center accepts most major insurance plans and works diligently to maximize coverage for specialized treatments.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, patients can visit their website at www.nvpainrelief.com or call +1 702-257-7246. The center is open Monday through Friday with flexible appointment scheduling to accommodate diverse patient needs.

Individualized Treatment Approaches

Mind and Pain Specialist serves Las Vegas, Nevada with comprehensive outpatient mental health and pain management services. Our multidisciplinary clinic integrates psychiatric care, advanced pain management solutions, and evidence-based addiction treatment programs to address the complex relationship between mental health and physical pain. Located in the heart of Las Vegas, our team of board-certified specialists provides personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

At Mind and Pain Specialist, we offer a full spectrum of outpatient services across three key specialties:

  • Psychiatry - Expert evaluation and treatment for mood disorders, anxiety, PTSD, and other mental health conditions

  • Pain Management - Advanced interventions for chronic pain conditions using both medication management and innovative therapies

  • Addiction Treatment - Compassionate, evidence-based programs for substance use disorders and dependency issues

Specialized Treatments

We proudly offer Spravato (esketamine) treatment for patients with treatment-resistant depression who haven't responded adequately to conventional therapies. This FDA-approved medication is administered in our comfortable, monitored clinical setting by our experienced healthcare professionals.

Patient-Centered Approach

Our philosophy centers on treating the whole person, recognizing that mental health and physical pain are often interconnected. We create individualized treatment plans that address both immediate symptoms and underlying causes, helping patients achieve lasting relief and improved quality of life.

Visit Our Clinic

Mind and Pain Specialist welcomes new patients at our conveniently located facility at 6817 S Eastern Ave, Suite 102, Las Vegas, NV 89119. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (702) 373-5299 or visit our website at mindandpainnv.com.

column40:
Dr. Kraft and his office staff are outstanding professionals. They are always considerate and pleasant. Most recently, Dr. Kraft and his staff helped me tremendously. They went "above and beyond" to help me with the ongoing intermittent shortage of opioids.

The Walgreens Chief Pharmacist unexpectedly did not receive his weekly shipment of 10 mg. Hydrocodone which I have been taking daily for the past 13 years for a very bad back with severe chronic pain that is only totally controlled with 10 mg. Hydrocodone.

The morning of the day my prescription was to be filled the pharmacist told me to come to the pharmacy after 4pm when his weekly shipment of narcotics would arrive. At 5pm when I went to Walgreens the pharmacist told me that no 10mg. Hydrocodone was shipped to his pharmacy. He told me that 7.5 mg. Hydrocodone did arrive and that if Dr. Kraft would send him a new prescription for that lower dose that he would be able to provide that strength to me. Like Dr. Kraft the pharmacist went out of his way to help me.

I was able to call Dr. Kraft's office and few past 5pm and the staff at his office went out of their way to contact Dr. Kraft at home after hours. Dr. Kraft was incredible. From his home that evening, he sent a new prescription to Walgreens which I picked up the next morning. Wow. What great and extraordinary service from Dr. Kraft to get me my medicine. I am 72 years old and a retired pharmacist and I realize how much extra work Dr. Kraft, his office staff and the Walgreens pharmacist did to help me. Also, I have rarely received such incredible service from a physician, his staff and the pharmacist. I cannot thank all of them enough, especially Dr. Kraft and his office staff. Thank you all VERY much. You are all amazing.|I Been With Dr Leon For 2 Yrs And I Can Say Him And His Staff Are Great...This Is One Doctor I Trust With My Health.. Without Any Questions Asked....|RUDE!!! Last year I got in a car accident they never even called me back til like 4 months later for my apt. This time they keep rescheduling and or canceling my apts! They said they prescribed my steroids' 3 times as of yesterday CVS still had nothing! The girls in the office the older one I think her name is Angie hung up on me and when i called her back they didn't answer. My attorney said they been getting some complaint about this office... there def going to lose some business.|Typical Dr. office entitled and inconsiderate of their patients time. Las Vegas Injury Pain Center serves Henderson, Nevada and the greater Las Vegas area with specialized interventional pain management services. Our boutique medical practice focuses on providing personalized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions, particularly those resulting from personal injuries and accidents. With a patient-centered approach, we combine advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment protocols to address the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms.

At Las Vegas Injury Pain Center, we offer a wide range of minimally invasive procedures and treatments designed to provide effective pain relief. Our interventional techniques include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication management. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs and circumstances of individual patients, ensuring optimal outcomes and improved quality of life.

Specialized Attorney Lien and Payment Options

Understanding the financial challenges that often accompany injuries, we proudly accept attorney liens for patients involved in personal injury cases. This arrangement allows patients to receive necessary medical care without upfront costs while their legal claims are pending. For those preferring direct payment, we also offer competitive cash pay options, making quality pain management accessible to more patients in our community.

Convenient Location and Contact Information

Our modern facility is conveniently located at 100 N Green Valley Pkwy, Suite 225, Henderson, NV 89052. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, patients can call us at +1 702-879-2005 or visit our comprehensive website at www.lvinjurypaincenter.com. Our dedicated team is committed to providing prompt responses and accommodating scheduling to ensure timely access to pain relief solutions.

Regenexx Las Vegas serves Henderson, Nevada and the greater Las Vegas area with advanced regenerative medicine solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain, sports injuries, and degenerative conditions. Led by Joshua Goodwin, MD, our practice specializes in cutting-edge, non-surgical interventions that harness the body's natural healing capabilities. As a board-certified Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation physician with additional expertise in sports medicine and interventional spine procedures, Dr. Goodwin brings elite-level training to every patient consultation and treatment plan.

Dr. Josh Goodwin is distinguished in the medical community for his comprehensive approach to pain management and functional restoration. His specialized training in the proprietary Regenexx procedures allows him to utilize patients' own platelet-rich plasma (PRP) and stem cells to effectively address conditions including arthritis, ligament and tendon injuries, and chronic neck and back pain. Each procedure is performed with precision using advanced imaging guidance—ultrasound and fluoroscopy—ensuring optimal placement and maximum safety.

Personalized Treatment Approach

What sets our practice apart is Dr. Goodwin's commitment to identifying the root cause of each patient's condition. Rather than simply treating symptoms, he conducts thorough evaluations to understand underlying biomechanical issues and tissue damage. This diagnostic precision allows him to develop customized treatment plans that not only address current pain but also help prevent future injuries. Patients appreciate his collaborative approach, working together to determine the most effective interventions for their specific needs.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 100 N Green Valley Pkwy #325 in Henderson, our modern clinic is equipped with the latest technology for regenerative medicine procedures. The comfortable, professional environment reflects our commitment to providing exceptional care. We welcome patients from throughout Nevada and beyond who are seeking alternatives to surgery or conventional pain management approaches.

To learn more about our innovative treatments or to schedule a consultation with Dr. Goodwin, visit www.regenexxlasvegas.com or call +1 702-986-0921.
column11: Dr Josh Goodwin is a board-certified Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation physician with specialization in sports medicine, interventional spine, and regenerative medicine. He is an elite trained physician in the Regenexx procedures utilizing one's own PRP and stem cells to improve pain and function related to arthritis, ligament and tendon sprains and strains, and neck/back pain. Dr Goodwin utilizes high level image guidance with the use of ultrasound and fluoroscopy to ensure accurate placement and safety of each procedure. With each patient, he starts by identifying the underlying problem and then works with the patient to find the best solution to help treat and prevent the recurrence of pain or injury.

column38: Brian Keller|Hillary Brooke|Dale Pullano|Scott Mc Cabe|P Sibs|Karen C|Sharon Floyd|Heather C
column40:
This place is a joke. Not the Dr but his staff. So I guess on that end it's also on the Dr. Had injections, was also given a 1 week prescription to hold-over while waiting for the procedure. Injections didn't take, did a follow-up phone apt scheduled for 8:45am, actual call 3:17pm. Dr said another round of injections needed and another week prescription. His office would call me in 2 days maximum to scheduled. Waited 3, called on the forth, left a message. I called 3 more times over the course of 19 days, with no response. Finally got a call back, but by this time I had a trip that had to be taken coming up in the next 2 weeks that couldn't be postponed or canceled.  Scheduled the appointment and asked since I would by flying 6 hours and driving back 12+ hours would the Dr write another prescription for the trip, seeing as I was getting hold overs for a week's time and sitting straight up triggered the pain the most. Keep in mind at this point, I hadn't had any for 2 weeks, was back to feeling how I felt before, but really just needed it for the trip. "You'll have to do a follow-up." OK when? They wanted to do it AFTER my trip. I said is the Dr even aware of how long it took you to schedule me in the first place? No answer. Scheduled both procedure and follow-up. Trip was moved up a week. Now I call to reschedule, no answer. Left message, no reply. This goes on for 4 days. Go to the office, we'll office is closed on Tuesdays, (and weekends.) According to the phone can do walk-ins. Come back Wednesday to see a note that the office will be closed Wednesday and Thursday. I leave Thursday 6am. Call again to ask if the Dr has even been MADE AWARE of my situation and asked. "We'll get back to you." Thus office staff is joke and completely incompetent. I understand seekers and junkies but when you Dr gives you a prognosis and a plan and it's gets interfered with by the staff and you can't even message him, then you need to find a new office.|2 Stars: Great Doctor, Toxic Office Staff

I'm giving two stars because I truly love my doctor, but the office staff is extremely toxic. I called the office two or three times, leaving messages for someone to call me back because I was almost out of my medication. When I finally got through, I explained to the person who answered, "No one ever called me to set up an appointment." Her response? "Okay, do you want to schedule an appointment?" What happened to customer service? Aren't doctors providing a service like the rest of us?

Sensing that I wasn't going to get anywhere, I asked to speak to the office manager. When she answered, it was obvious they had already shared notes before taking the call--she was defensive from the start. As I calmly tried to explain my situation, she continually spoke over me and raised her voice. When I raised my voice to be heard, she told me to lower mine. That's when I realized I wasn't dealing with someone rational or professional. I never even got the chance to fully express my concerns. I asked to speak to the doctor, and that's how the call ended--no solution and a waste of time.

To make matters worse, when I called back to confirm their walk-in hours (which are listed on their answering service), they told me there were no walk-in hours and forced me to schedule an appointment--for a week later. Now I'm out of my medication. I can't believe how I was treated. My primary care physician was shocked and is stepping in to fill my prescription and help me find a new doctor.

It's really a shame. He's an amazing doctor, but the office staff's behavior makes it impossible to continue being a patient there.

This version keeps your frustration clear while maintaining a professional tone. Let me know if you'd like any changes!|Called 4 times and never got a call back.
They called me for an appointment time to review my X-ray, but did have my x-ray??
Haven't had any good experiences so far so I am seeking another referral to another place. Should have looked at the reviews before scheduling|This is the worst doctors office I have ever been to. I was a patient for 10years here because insurance wouldn't let me switch... Sharma is rude and arrogant.. he has never asked how I felt or really even talked to me ... cut my meds down when he first met me , without explanation... and I never felt good after that. Then refused to give me back my old meds , which helped me. I never say "hate", but I hate this man.... He treated me like I was a child and I'm 65 years old. Have not been able to sleep right since he changed the meds.. they were the only ones to help my pain and sleep. Do not go here. The office staff is horrible and you never get an answer when you call. If I could give this no stars he would have gotten it..|Dr. Sharma is a great pain medice doctor. He understands my plight with IBS. He has been treating me for 3 years. His demeanor is always nice. I was lucky to find
this office. I came from LA and desperately needed a pain medicine doctor.|I've been coming here to the Rancho location for over 2 years now. In fact I was getting the address for a friend when I saw bad reviews. The front office and medical assistants are terrific. The ladies are incredibly busy but are always friendly and knowledgeable. Jason was great and I will miss him. I've seen the new PA once and I will admit it's hard to meet new doctors and give all the information you've already told someone I'm sure she will be great too. Dr. Sharma has done several injections on my back and the outpatient surgery center was best I have ever been to. Yes, the phones are VERY busy and you do have to wait on hold, sometimes longer than you might want,  but I really love this office. I feel like it's small and they treat you like a person, not a number. Great experience every time. Thanks to everyone there.|I have been a patient of Dr Sharma
for 5yrs, I have never been so disappointed in a physicians office lack of respect for the fact I was written a prescription for my Fibromyalgia Spinal Pain and they knew my Script of 5yrswas on a Nation Wide shortage but it was written anyway and they were notified immediately to enable them to prescribe something compatible.  Without my medication I grind my teeth and have already chipped them.  I truly cannot believe not only has the PA or Dr subbing for Dr Sharma NOT called me back in 54 hrs even though CVS is FAXING and calling the office NO Response!! I really don't believe
Dr Sharma  knows how unprofessional..|I have seen this pain management for over 5 years and they have done nothing but reduce my pain medication even when I tell them I'm in more pain, so then I have to look for other pain relief untell next visit. They don't listen to anything you tell them they just prescribe u the minimum. No ever answers the phone if u need anything done u have to go to a location to get anything done. This place and the doctor are very in perfetional!! Glade I lady them.

Las Vegas Pain Institute & Medical Center serves Las Vegas, NV and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Brian Le, DO. Had to get injections in my hips for pain. Dr. Reyher is one of the best doctors I have seen in a very long time. He was personable, funny and had a great bedside manner. He took my phobia of needles into great account and was very careful to manage the pain as best he could. Thank you, sir.|I cannot say enough good things about this practice! Dr. Bantum helped guide me through a scary time in my life after being injured. His diagnostic skills with EMG and interventional skills with cervical epidural got me pain free and back to living my life again. He is a empathetic person and helped me through some tough decisions with surgery vs. conservative care. Can't thank him enough for this!
Jose and Yesenia were always able to get me set up for appointments and were joyful to be around. Something that is so important when your dealing with pain. The office is bright and I love the artwork in all the rooms. These guys are the best and I refer to them all the time for people that need physiatry. Thanks y'all!|Dr. Andrea Tatro is the best doctor I have ever been to. She is very thorough and listens to what I have to say as a patient she understands I know my body best. She has helped me find out I had severe arthritis in my hips and shoulders while other doctors wouldn't listen to me and tell me I was too young. After her listening to me and 4 years later I had both hips and shoulders replaced. She helps me with my back and neck to try to avoid surgery and try to keep my pain at a minimum. I truly love her and she knows her stuff. I highly recommend!|If you need an office who treats you like a real human then this is your place.

I loved my few visits to Mountain West Sport & Spine because:
1. From Dr Christopher Twombly and his assistant, to the receptionist and the scheduling and office staff I had nothing but efficient, kind and fun experiences. They are real people!
2. Each appointment was easy to schedule, they accommodated my split shift and I was seen on time for each appointment.
3. Dr Twombly is very knowledgeable and practical in his approach and gave me tremendous confidence that we are doing the right thing.
4. The office decor is professional but shows some staff interests - I loved the colorful drawings of skeletons running, a cross section of a spinal cord in bright colors, the sayings about mountain biking and skiing framed ("A good bicycle well applied will cure anything.") and John Muir's saying ("Of all the paths you take in life make sure a few of them are dirt.").
5. There were smiles and laughs with multiple employees every visit.
Thank you for all you have done for me!|I suffer from sciatica so when I had a severe flare up they were able to get me in within 1 day. The scheduler heard the pain in my voice (I was crying) so she put me on hold and was able to secure an appointment for me the next day. The girls at the front could tell I was uncomfortable so they promptly got me into a room so I can lay down. Dr. Reyher's wait times are a little long but he's worth the wait, he is so sweet and does a thorough evaluation (thus the longer wait times). I'm every pleased with this office and my doctor.|I see Doctor Bantom in this office and have been seeing him for the last 2 years. I have always received the very best cf care. I never feel rush. I would not hesitate to strongly recommend him.|I am currently being treated by Dr.Berry and Casey Dye after being involved in a motor vehicle accident. I cannot express the gratitude I have for this entire office. Yes the wait is worth it. He is so thorough and really makes sure he understands my issues. The office staff is also fantastic! The scheduler was able to always accommodate me when I was in severe pain.|Mountain West had an incredibly welcoming staff! Everyone was so seamless!
Dr.Brain Bantum was so thorough and extremely helpful with my questions and concerns! He took his time and really shows care for each patient that walks through his door.
Yesennia was an amazing staff member a long with the entire team they really know how to run a great office. 10/10 recommendation!

Centennial Spine and Pain serves Las Vegas, Nevada with exceptional pain management services under the leadership of founder Dr. David Lanzkowsky. Established to address both acute and chronic pain conditions, this specialized medical practice combines advanced interventional techniques with comprehensive care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. The clinic's approach focuses on improving quality of life while minimizing reliance on medication through targeted treatments that address the root causes of pain.

Dr. David Lanzkowsky, MD, brings nearly four decades of medical expertise to his practice as a board-certified anesthesiologist. His extensive background in pain management has established him as a trusted authority in the Las Vegas medical community. Dr. Lanzkowsky's approach combines clinical excellence with compassionate care, ensuring patients receive both cutting-edge treatments and supportive guidance throughout their healing journey.

Educational Background

Dr. Lanzkowsky completed his medical degree at Ponce Health Sciences University in Puerto Rico, laying the foundation for his distinguished career. His training continued through an internship at Sinai Hospital of Baltimore in Maryland, followed by residencies at prestigious institutions including North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset, New York, and Stony Brook Medicine in New York. This comprehensive education informs his evidence-based approach to pain management.

Services and Specialties

The clinic offers a wide range of interventional pain management procedures and treatments designed to address various pain conditions affecting the spine and musculoskeletal system. Patients benefit from personalized care plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, targeted injections, and comprehensive pain management strategies aimed at long-term relief rather than temporary solutions.

Location and Contact Information

Centennial Spine and Pain welcomes patients at their conveniently located facility at 4454 N Decatur Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89130. The clinic is easily accessible to residents throughout the Las Vegas metropolitan area. For appointments or consultations, patients can call +1 702-703-3448 to speak with the friendly office staff who are committed to providing prompt and attentive service.

For more information about services, treatment options, or to request an appointment online, visit the official website at www.centennialspineandpain.com.
column11: David Lanzkowsky, MD, is a board-certified anesthesiologist with nearly four decades of experience. The founder of Centennial Spine and Pain in Las Vegas, Nevada, Dr. Lanzkowsky is passionate about helping those in his care find lasting relief from acute and chronic pain. Education has always played a central role in Dr. Lanzkowsky's life. He completed his medical degree at Ponce Health Sciences University in Puerto Rico. He went on to refine his skills and training through an internship at Sinai Hospital of Baltimore in Maryland and residencies at North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset, New York, and Stony Brook Medicine in New York.

Swift Institute - Medical Parkway serves Carson City, Nevada with comprehensive spine, orthopedic, and musculoskeletal care. Formerly known as Spine Nevada, this specialized medical center takes an integrated team approach to treating a wide range of conditions. Harbor Interventional Pain Center, LLC in Newington, NH provides specialized chronic pain management services with a patient-centered approach. We believe that a good working relationship between the physician and patient provides the best treatment outcomes. Our dedicated team of pain specialists works closely with each individual to develop customized treatment plans that address their unique pain conditions and personal health goals.

At Harbor Interventional Pain Center, we utilize a variety of advanced interventional techniques and therapies to help eliminate your pain or reduce it to a manageable level. Our treatment options include precision-guided injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and other evidence-based interventional procedures designed to target the source of your discomfort while minimizing medication dependence.

Personalized Treatment Approach

We understand that chronic pain control is a journey, not a quick fix. Each patient receives a thoroughly customized treatment plan developed after comprehensive evaluation and diagnosis. Our physicians take the time to listen to your concerns, understand your pain history, and work collaboratively with you to establish realistic goals for pain management and improved quality of life.

Patient Partnership Philosophy

Harbor Interventional Pain Center is committed to being your partner throughout your pain management journey. We provide ongoing support, education, and adjustments to your treatment plan as needed to help you maintain the activities of your daily life with minimal disruption from pain. Our team remains accessible to address concerns and modify approaches as your condition evolves.

Visit us at our comfortable, modern facility located at 291 Shattuck Way, Suite 2, Newington, NH 03801. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (603) 294-9190 or visit our website at https://harboripc.com/.

Interventional Spine Medicine in Rye, NH offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the New Hampshire seacoast region. Our specialized medical practice focuses on diagnosing and treating acute and chronic pain conditions using advanced interventional techniques and evidence-based approaches. Led by board-certified physicians with extensive training in pain management, our team is dedicated to improving patients' quality of life through personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain.

At Interventional Spine Medicine, we provide a wide range of minimally invasive procedures and treatments designed to alleviate pain and restore function. Our services include epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication management. We specialize in treating conditions such as herniated discs, spinal stenosis, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

column2: Chronic Pain Relief Centers of New England
column3:
Chronic Pain Relief Centers of New England Calmare Scrambler Therapy serves Plymouth, NH and surrounding New England communities with innovative pain management solutions. This specialized clinic has established itself as a beacon of hope for individuals suffering from chronic pain conditions that have proven resistant to traditional treatments. The center's primary focus is helping patients reclaim their lives through non-invasive, drug-free therapeutic approaches that address the root causes of persistent pain.

What truly distinguishes this clinic is their utilization of FDA-approved Calmare Scrambler Therapy®, a groundbreaking technology that works by interrupting abnormal pain signals. Unlike conventional pain treatments that often mask symptoms, Scrambler Therapy sends "non-pain" signals through the central nervous system directly to the brain. This sophisticated approach effectively retrains neural pathways, reconditioning the brain to recognize a state of "normal self" rather than persistent pain.

Conditions Treated

The center specializes in addressing a wide spectrum of challenging pain conditions, including:

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)

  • Peripheral neuropathy

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Phantom limb pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Chemotherapy-induced neuropathy

Patient-Centered Care

Located at 607 Tenney Mountain Hwy, Suite 201 in Plymouth, NH, the facility offers a comfortable, supportive environment where patients receive personalized treatment plans. The professional team understands the profound impact chronic pain has on quality of life and is dedicated to providing compassionate care throughout the treatment journey.

Contact Information

To learn more about how Chronic Pain Relief Centers of New England can help restore comfort and functionality, prospective patients can visit cprcofnewengland.com or call +1 603-238-9198 to schedule a consultation. Their innovative approach to pain management continues to transform lives throughout New England, offering renewed hope for those who have struggled with persistent pain conditions.
column11: Calmare Scrambler Therapy is a non-invasive pain clinic located in Plymouth, NH, dedicated to helping individuals reclaim a pain-free life. What sets Scrambler Therapy apart is its unique ability to send a "non-pain" signal to the brain through the central nervous system. This non-invasive, drug-free therapy retrains the brain to recognize a state of "normal self," effectively replacing the sensation of pain. Essentially, the brain is reconditioned using advanced Scrambler technology. FDA approved Calmare Scrambler Therapy(r) interrupts abnormal nerve signals that cause pain, restoring hope and comfort for those suffering from various painful conditions, including CRPS, neuropathy, cancer-related pain, phantom limb pain, and more.

I have back issues causing leg pain in both legs. I have been dealing with this issues since I was 18 yrs old and am now in my early 40s. My first Lumbar Epidural Steroid Injection (ESI) was when I was 18, it was extremely painful and caused my issued to get worse ultimately resulting in surgery to correct. My 2nd ESI was about 10 years ago at a spine center in Southern Maine. Again it was very painful and caused a Vasovagal response. For the first 5 weeks after I received my 2nd injection I had zero relief before it finally kicked in and I had 90% relief. I started having issues again in late 2020 and made an appointment with WDH Center for Pain Management. My first ESI with Dr. Zouki was in February of 2021. I explained my experiences with my previous two shots and Dr. Zouki understood my hesitation and gave me some to help me relax. I felt immediate relief which lasted for 3 months. I returned for a 2nd shot which lasted for 6 months. I just had 3rd shot which again gave immediate relief. MY CONDITION IS CRONIC BUT I FEEL THIS IS THE BEST WAY FOR ME TO HANDLE THE PAIN. I GET EPIDURALS AND TRIGGER POINT INJECTIONS AT THE HOSPITAL.  I THANK GOD FOR THE PAI N MGT CENTER:)|Place is a joke horrible doctor experience dismissed my pain told me I had to get off the opioid in order for my pain to go away and when I told him I went months with out them and it was only 10 times worst wouldn't listen to me thought I was just pill hunting but when I proved him wrong bc of my 3 months without them he still said they went a good option for me. This place is a joke

column40:
Dr. Sanchez is an amazing doctor. I felt like I mattered to him and that making me feel better was important to him. He looked carefully at my individual needs, worked with insurance, and helped find a combination of procedures that worked to eliminate my pain in one area and greatly reduced it in another. He was able to suggest types of physical therapy that would help and support my individual needs. I am so very glad that I was a patient of his. I no longer have the pain issues and made great gains under his care. If you are in pain go see him. You won't regret going.|Dr. Sanchez is the most compassionate doctor I have experienced. I have been a patient of Dr. Sanchez
for many years. Dr. Sanchez treats you as an individual and not as a number. He will do his utmost to
help you with pain relief so that you may "live life". He is a Dr. that treats you with true empathy and love.
For this reason I would never leave Dr. Sanchez practice. Dr. Sanchez should be praised every day for his
good works. I am so glad he is my Dr. and my friend.  Zack|Dr. Sanchez and his staff are superb. Dr. Sanchez himself is the best doctor I've ever been to. He is kind, caring, warm & intelligent - but most of all, he is honest and a solution seeker. His years of experience shine, and unlike many of the doctors I've seen, he has the ability to take the most complex medical condition and break it down so that you understand it. He is patient and does not rush any appointment. With that said, if you have an appointment with him, you may have to wait a bit. I would wait hours to see him. He's that good.|Dr. Sanchez has the kindest bedside manner of ANY provider that has ever seen me! His skill level and knowledge is parallel to the true love, concern and gentle touch when having to administer any type of injections and/or treatment.  I have an ongoing issue that unfortunately does surpass Dr. Sanchez's ability, but in the interim, I don't think I could be any luckier to have such an attentive pain management Doctor, who clearly knows exactly what I need.  I am very grateful him & wouldn't ever see anyone else for this kind of specialty care.|Dr.  Sanchez has always taken great care of me for 29 years. His abilities and knowledge are absolutely amazing. My medical issues are complicated and he takes the time to find the best resolution for me. I am and will always be forever grateful . His staff is wonderful and caring.|I love Dr. Sanchez he's the best if it wasn't for him.I would have never won my case for Social Security. I haven't seen him in years but I would love to be his patient again.|I have never been disappointed by visit or a phone call. Should I have questions that need answering he explains well that anyone would understand. Dr. Sanchez is kind understanding, looks out for his patients well being. And he is a very good lessened as I have a 3, 000 watt mouth. Thank you Dr. Sanchez for being the Dr. that all patients out in this world should have. Greatly appreciate you as my pain manager doctor  Respectfully yours Yvonnie G. Roberts|As always Dr Sanchez is the most caring, thorough and compassionate Dr I have ever had the pleasure of knowing. It is because of Dr Sanchez that I am still walking.
5 years ago Dr Sanchez had the awful job of telling me that I would never improve and remain in a wheelchair for life. My friend Manny knew me years before I came to him for help. Because he takes such care with each patient he knew exactly what to say to me. He sat beside me and took my hand and said the magic words "You Can't".
After a few days trying to swallow the "you can't" I realized I could not accept that pronouncement. I went back to see my friend, my former client and now my Doctor and said the same words back to him. "I can't" accept this diagnosis. Manny smiled that Manny smile (if you know him,you know that smile) and said " I didn't think you could". We started my recovery right then. Physical therapy a few times and finally a gym membership and he was true to his word. When it hurt too much I saw Dr Sanchez and he lessened the pain enough so I could keep going. It took 2 years of hard, painful work but I am now back doing my job as a Construction Manager, I see Dr Sanchez once a month. His warmth, his commitment to his patients, and his love of what he does has helped me learn a most important lesson. Recovery and a life in chronic pain is 10% medicine and 90% attitude.
I had atrophy in both legs, atrophy in my back and full body Complex Regional Pain Syndrome stage 2. I now work a full time job, hunt & fish as I used to, I hike and take outdoor photographs. I GOT MY LIFE BACK. My belief is this. Pain is pain, yes it hurts BUT...It hurts a lot more if you spend your time focused on it. If you want a life you can have one. You might need to make a few alterations. But you can have a life. If you make that choice Dr Sanchez will help you and guide you to a place you don't think you can go to. Manny, Dr Sanchez, is one of a kind. He will be your care giver, your source of invaluable information and your greatest cheerleader for your recovery. Trust him, respect him, and most of all...let him help you. Just don't give up!

column3:
Interventional Spine Medicine serves patients throughout New Hampshire with three convenient locations in Barrington, Rye, and Plaistow. The practice stands as a premier destination for those suffering from chronic pain conditions, offering innovative interventional techniques that minimize recovery time and maximize pain relief. With a patient-centered philosophy, their approach goes beyond simply treating symptoms to address the root causes of pain and improve overall quality of life.

The team at Interventional Spine Medicine consists of board-certified specialists with extensive training in pain management and interventional techniques. Their expertise spans a wide range of conditions, including back and neck pain, sciatica, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Using state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and evidence-based treatments, they develop personalized care plans tailored to each patient's specific needs.

Patient-Focused Approach

What truly sets Interventional Spine Medicine apart is their unwavering commitment to understanding each patient's unique experience with pain. The entire staff recognizes the debilitating impact that chronic pain can have on all aspects of life—from work performance to personal relationships and emotional well-being. Patients are treated with kindness, understanding, and respect at every interaction, creating an environment where they feel heard and valued.

Advanced Treatment Options

The practice offers a comprehensive array of interventional procedures, including epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine therapies. These minimally invasive techniques provide targeted relief while avoiding the risks and recovery time associated with traditional surgery.

Convenient Locations

With their main office located at 944 Calef Hwy in Barrington, NH, and additional locations in Rye and Plaistow, Interventional Spine Medicine ensures accessible care for patients throughout New Hampshire. Their facilities are equipped with modern technology and designed with patient comfort in mind.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, patients can visit their website at [www.nhpain.com](http://www.nhpain.com/) or call 603-664-0100.
column11:
Interventional Spine Medicine

Interventional Spine Medicine's team of highly trained and experienced specialists is proud to offer a comprehensive, patient-focused approach to interventional pain medicine that emphasizes each individual's overall health and well-being. The pain management practice has three convenient New Hampshire locations in Barrington, Rye and Plaistow, where every staff member recognizes the debilitating consequences of pain on a person's life. The Interventional Spine Medicine team makes every effort to understand the patient's individual experience and treat them with kindness, understanding, and respect at all times.

Nashua Pain Management, located in Nashua, NH, is a specialized medical practice dedicated to comprehensive pain relief solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Aaron S. Geller, MD. Serving patients throughout southern New Hampshire, our clinic takes a balanced approach to pain management, prioritizing patient comfort while addressing the underlying causes of chronic and acute pain conditions. Our convenient location at 154 Broad St provides a welcoming environment where patients receive personalized care plans designed to improve quality of life and restore functionality.

Dr. Geller specializes in providing non-pharmacological medical guidance alongside thorough evaluations for various treatment modalities. His approach encompasses topical treatments, oral medications, and interventional pharmacologic therapies tailored to each patient's specific needs. Understanding that pain management requires a multifaceted approach, Dr. Geller works closely with patients to develop sustainable treatment plans that address both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies.

Specialized Interventional Procedures

At Nashua Pain Management, patients benefit from Dr. Geller's expertise in minimally invasive interventional procedures, including superficial local anesthetic injections, trigger point injections, and superficial nerve blocks. These targeted treatments provide relief for patients suffering from various pain conditions while minimizing reliance on systemic medications. Each procedure is performed with precision and care, focusing on patient safety and comfort throughout the process.

Our Commitment to Safe, Effective Care

Dr. Geller's practice is founded on the principle of providing safe, effective medical pain management that respects each patient's unique circumstances. By combining medical expertise with compassionate care, Nashua Pain Management helps patients navigate their pain journey with dignity and hope. We understand the profound impact that chronic pain can have on daily life and work diligently to restore function and improve overall well-being.

For more information about our services or to schedule a consultation, please visit www.nashuapainmanagement.com or call us at +1 603-233-6317. Our office is conveniently located at 154 Broad St, Nashua, NH 03063, with accessible parking available for patients.

column40:
Dr Geller is hands down a wonderful physician. He truly cares about finding the best treatment for his patients' pain. He has been able to treat my husband's back pain and my neck pain without pain medication, which was important to us. He is an expert in his field and isn't out to make a quick buck. He really makes sure to understand your concerns as a patient and takes the time to explain everything. His two hour intake appt speaks to that. When our insurance lapsed due to our old coverage ending and our new one not yet having begun, Dr Geller graciously charged us a very minimal cost for just the office visit out of pocket (didn't charge us for the injections). If there is ever a scheduling conflict, the office goes out of their way to fit you in. I like that we can rely on Dr Geller for our pain management instead of a big pain clinic. I know we can trust his expertise and if we ever should need pain medication, I know he will treat us responsibly and not over medicate us.|I have been a patient of Dr Geller since 2004, I was involved in a head on collision and had a 3 level lower lumbar fusion. I caught an infection and had several surgeries after the fusion surgery to clean out the infected tissue. The infection caused severe scar tissue and nerve pain. The first two pain management providers loaded me up on heavy pain killers making it difficult to function and earn an honest income while raising 3 children and providing for my family.

I met with Dr Geller and we spoke of reducing the opioids to a minimum and doing injections as an alternative, it saved my life and lifestyle as it worked and have continued the treatments for 17 years now. Dr Geller cares about "you" not what the book says it pays.

Dr Geller is the definition of what anyone should look for in there doctor. He is also a wonderful person. Dr Geller thank you for all you have done for me and my family.

Sincerely,

Tom P

Boston Ma.|I am the type of person that rarely writes a review or recommendation letters, unless  I truly think that person or organization deserves  recognition. Dr Geller at Nashua Pain Managment is one of the few doctors I have met that truly cares about the well being of his patients and their lives. Dr Geller treats the patients custom medical needs with utmost integrity.  This being said, I have been living with chronic Lyme and old injuries that cause a lot of pain, and distracts me from my job and family most importantly, which is my livelihood. It also distracts me from my life's general physical demands. Dr Geller helped give me my life back. I greatly appreciate his services and I know you will as well. Please stop hesitating on calling if you have chronic pain. Call to set up a pre-evaluation, his care is phenomenal and you will not regret it.|I highly recommend Dr. Geller to any patient who is seeking both a caring and intelligent physician who takes the time to provide outstanding medical care through an attentive, collaborative, and analytical pain management plan. He takes the time to create a personalized plan coupling a thorough analytical diagnosis with up to date education through peer reviewed medical articles. This education allows me as the patient to have a thorough understanding of the reasoning behind both the diagnosis and treatment.|Dr Gellar is a kind and caring person and doctor. I've been with him for many years and feel blessed to have found him. It is a trying time right now in the pain management field, but Dr Gellar genuinely cares for his patients and has their best interests at heart.|I'm a member of the New England Carpenters Union . I work as a carpenter foreman in the commercial industry. After three back surgery's on my Lumbar spine (spinal fusion) and many physical therapy hours I was recommended to see a pain management DR to help control my continued struggle with chronic pain. I started my treatment about 8 years ago with Nashua pain management under the care of DR Arron Galler, MD. DR Galler has worked on many different approaches with me to find the correct treatment that allows me to continue my career as a leader in the carpentry field. Without the help and experience of DR GAller I would not be working in the field that I truly love.             Forever Thankful.|Dr Geller is one of the best doctors i have come across. He has helped me deal with my painful back pain for the last six months i would definitely recommend him to anyone with  pain issues .
Great personality and caring.|Dr. Geller's office does not accept any medicare nor medicare advantage plans by companies such as Anthem, BCBS, United etc. When asked if they would accept self pay the response was "good luck." I then asked for a referral of some other pain management institute and again I was told "Good luck." There was a click and they hung up. Now there is an example of a non-compassionate,non-caring, and disrespectful service provider.

Oasis Recovery serves Nashua, Bedford, and Concord, New Hampshire with comprehensive addiction treatment and recovery programs under the expert guidance of Dr. James A. Mirazita, MD. As a board-certified anesthesiologist and pain management specialist, Dr. Mirazita brings his extensive medical background to help patients overcome dependencies through personalized treatment plans. The practice has established itself as a trusted resource for individuals seeking professional support for addiction recovery throughout southern New Hampshire, offering evidence-based approaches that address both the physical and psychological aspects of addiction.

Dr. Mirazita's credentials include graduating from the Ohio State University College of Medicine in Columbus, followed by completing his internship in general surgery at David Grant USAF Medical Center at Travis Air Force Base in Fairfield, California. His dual specialization in anesthesiology and pain management provides him with unique insights into the complex relationship between pain and addiction, allowing him to develop more effective treatment strategies for patients struggling with substance dependencies.

Comprehensive Addiction Services

At Oasis Recovery, patients receive individualized care that addresses the full spectrum of addiction challenges. The practice's approach combines medical intervention, counseling, and ongoing support to create sustainable recovery paths. With three convenient locations across New Hampshire, Oasis Recovery ensures accessibility for patients throughout the region who are seeking professional addiction treatment services.

Contact Information

The main Nashua location of Oasis Recovery can be found at 280 Main St Suite 431C, Nashua, NH 03060. Prospective patients and referring physicians can reach the practice by phone at (603) 627-4764 or visit their website at www.oasisnh.com to learn more about their services and treatment philosophy.
column11:
James A. Mirazita, MD, is a board certified anesthesiologist and pain management specialist at Oasis Recovery. At the practice's three locations in Nashua, Bedford, and Concord, New Hampshire, he offers addiction treatment and recovery programs to help those with addiction overcome their dependencies.

Dr. Mirazita is a graduate of the Ohio State University College of Medicine in Columbus. He completed his internship in general surgery at David Grant USAF Medical Center at Travis Air Force Base in Fairfield, California.

At CMC Outpatient Medical Clinic, we offer a wide range of diagnostic and treatment services designed to address various health concerns without requiring hospital admission. column2: Full Life Pain and Depression Center
column3:
Full Life Pain and Depression Center serves Grantham, NH and surrounding communities with comprehensive care for chronic pain and mental health conditions. Our specialized clinic combines evidence-based medical interventions with holistic approaches to address the complex nature of persistent pain and treatment-resistant depression. We understand that chronic conditions affect every aspect of life, which is why our team develops personalized treatment plans that consider both physical symptoms and emotional well-being.

Stellate Ganglion Blocks are one of our signature treatments, providing relief for conditions including:

- PTSD and trauma-related disorders

- Anxiety disorders

- Long Covid symptoms

- Fibromyalgia

- Migraine headaches

Ketamine Therapy offers breakthrough treatment for:

- Treatment-resistant depression

- Suicidal ideation

- PTSD

- Chronic pain conditions

Integrative Approach

Our comprehensive care model includes:

- Image-guided injections and interventional procedures

- Medication management

- Nutritional guidance

- Stress management techniques

- Coordination with complementary therapies including physical therapy, acupuncture, chiropractic care, and massage

We believe in treating the whole person, not just symptoms. By combining advanced medical interventions with lifestyle modifications and complementary therapies, we help patients reclaim their quality of life and find lasting relief.

Contact Information:

- Website: http://fulllife.center/

- Phone: +1 603-309-3902

- Address: 151 Rte 10 N Bldg A Unit 2, Grantham, NH 03753, United States
column9: Alternative medicine practitioner|Medical clinic|Pain control clinic
column11:
We are a Chronic Pain Management, Stellate block, and Ketamine therapy clinic. We provide evaluation and treatment of chronic pain and depression. We use an integrative approach with interventions/image-guided injections, medications, nutrition and stress management guidance, and referrals for physical therapy, acupuncture, chiropractic, massage, etc.
We provide Stellate Ganglion blocks for conditions including PTSD, Anxiety, Long Covid, Fibromyalgia, Migraine, etc.
Our Ketamine Therapies are used for PTSD, Suicidal Depression, Chronic Depression, and Pain.
column38: Brett Ashenfelter|Will Eley|Bobbie Crocker|Penny S|Brian Drapeau|Shannon L|Kimberly Bienvenue|Sabrina Gowell
column40:
I cannot say enough wonderful things about my experience with Mindy Wallace and the incredible clinic she has created. From the moment I walked into Full Life Center, I felt genuinely cared for, supported, and encouraged. Mindy has a unique gift for making everyone feel at ease--her warmth, compassion, and deep understanding of holistic well-being shine through in every interaction.

As the owner, Mindy has clearly poured her heart and soul into creating an environment that promotes both emotional and physical healing. You can sense her dedication the moment you step through the doors: the calming atmosphere, the attentive staff, and the meticulously designed, comforting spaces are all a testament to her attention to detail and passion for helping others.

Throughout my time there, Mindy took the time to listen to my concerns, tailor a plan specific to my needs, and guide me through each step with incredible patience and expertise. Not only is she unbelievably knowledgeable in her field, but she also explains everything in a down-to-earth way that put all my fears at ease. She embodies the perfect balance of professionalism and personal touch--offering support that feels genuine and heartfelt.

The impact on my mindset and my overall outlook with regards to my mental health has been extraordinary. I have never felt more seen and understood. Each interaction leaves me feeling renewed and hopeful, and that wouldn't be possible without Mindy's devotion and positive energy. It is rare to find someone who combines cutting-edge knowledge with such a deep sense of empathy and compassion.

If you're looking for a place where you will be taken care of on every level--mind, body, and spirit--there is no better choice than Full Life Center. Mindy's commitment to providing top-notch care, along with the remarkable team she has assembled, truly makes this clinic stand out from the rest.

I wholeheartedly recommend Mindy Wallace and the Full Life Center to anyone seeking a transformative and supportive healthcare experience. Thank you, Mindy, for creating a sanctuary where healing is not only possible but joyful. I am forever grateful for the difference you are making in my life!|Always a great experience at this doctor's office. The doctor is a very fun, loving, caring type of person. She very knowledgeable and understanding and is always learning and educating others.|I have been a patient of Mindy Wallace for many years.  I continue to be amazed by Mindy's drive and dedication.  She is respectful and compassionate.  Her warm, personal approach to my difficult situation has dramatically improved the quality of my life.  Mindy is competent in the latest innovations in pain management and provides optimal patient care.  She has guided me through countless and at times quite serious medical problems, interfacing with numerous medical providers to insure my comfort and safety.  No matter what I present her with, she works to find solutions.  I can say with confidence that Mindy Wallace would be a valued addition to your healthcare team!|There are so many types of pain. From the pain that is dull yet consumes your every thought, to the pain that rules your life ( and everywhere in between) I can't express the gratitude I have for Mindy Wallace at the Full Life Pain and Depression center. I spent my entire life in the medical field and I've worked along side many physicians. I have NEVER met a more caring and competent person than Mindy. Her knowledge astounds me. I spent years trying to manage the pain I was left with after a surgeon nicked my sensory nerve to my dominant hand. It wasn't until I found Mindy that my pain became manageable. She is caring, kind and tenacious when she is looking for ways to help. She is the best possible person you could have in your corner during the worst time of your life. She always goes above and beyond and that speaks volumes for her and her office in today's medical world where most people are numbers, not faces. Seeking help at the Full Life Pain center will be the best thing you've done to improve your pain and your life. I know -because she gave me back mine.|Full Life Pain and Depression Center has become my guardian angel.

Ketamine infusions have saved my life!!

Writing this is not easy, but if it helps one person, it's worth it.

I was suffering from major depression and PTSD. I tried every medication from A to Z with no relief,  just major side effects. I was at the point that hospitalization was the only safe place.

Then I met Mindy and her team at full life pain and depression center. I was in rough shape at this point and for the first time I could tell someone was actually listening.

On that same day of my appointment with Mindy and her team we decided to start ketamine infusion immediately. I could see the relief on my wife's face knowing I was finally getting some real help. After my 3rd Ketamine infusion I felt an amazing relief and for the first time everything became light and brighter. My thousand pound blanket was removed.

Full Life pain and Depression center has given me my life back.|I've just had mt first visit today and wow  - Mindy and her staff are incredibly kind, warm and human.  The time I spent with Mindy felt authentic, I felt heard and she even gave me a hug before I left!  It has been years since I've experienced a medical professional with so much heart still intact for the patients she sees. Bri was also very warm and friendly today!  I look forward to seeing them again soon and highly recommend folx seek help for what ails them with this lovely team!|Have been seeing mindy since 2004..an amazing  individual that has changed my life..I  now have Quality  of life n Quantity. Mindy is one of the best people on my team..and my life wouldn't  be the same without  her care.|My daughter had a stellate ganglion block after 6 months of no smell and altered taste after a covid infection. Within an hour she had full taste and smell back! The staff were professional, kind, an excellent experience!

column3:
Pain Solutions in Nashua, New Hampshire offers comprehensive pain management services designed to help patients regain control of their lives. Serving the greater Nashua area and surrounding communities, our specialized clinic combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified specialists utilizes both interventional procedures and holistic approaches to target pain at its source while minimizing reliance on medication.

At Pain Solutions, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach includes advanced diagnostic testing, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and ongoing pain management strategies. We specialize in treating conditions including back and neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, sports injuries, and post-surgical pain syndromes.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our commitment to treating each patient as an individual with unique needs. We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop customized treatment plans that align with your lifestyle and goals. Our practitioners work collaboratively with your primary care physician and other specialists to ensure coordinated care.

Our Facility

Located at 436 Amherst St, Suite 101 in Nashua, NH 03063, our modern clinic offers a comfortable, welcoming environment equipped with state-of-the-art technology for accurate diagnosis and effective treatment. We've designed our space to be accessible and accommodating for patients experiencing mobility challenges due to their pain conditions.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (603) 577-3003. You can also visit our comprehensive website at https://www.painsolutions.net/ to access patient resources, learn about treatment options, and request appointments online.
column38: Michael Topper|Rebecca Walchak|leslie preissner|Lori Parent|LJ Shurpik|Ruth Hannon|Dave Kenney|Ann Droznick
column40:
Having lower back issues for over a year I contacted Pain Solutions recommended to me by my primary doctor Janet Berger at SMH. I met with Tara at their office and after reviewing my MRI she suggested a Lumbar Epidural Steroid Injection in my L4 and L5 joint. I opted for monitored sedation as I was apprehensive of the procedure. Dr Suchdev visited with me prior to the procedure and convinced me that I would not need the sedation for future injections as his procedure is more than tolerable and painless without it. He was correct and will proceed in the future with no sedation and no worries. Tara and the entire staff was phenomenal in changing my medications and treatment during my procedure.Dr Suchdev walked me through the procedure during the injection and and as promised painless.  I am now moving forward in a positive direction to restore my lifestyle to what it was.|I have been going there for about two years now. With my mystery medical condition they have actually been the only place to listen to me and not dismiss me. After going through different meds that didn't work my other insurance giving issues about not approving meds. They always helped me and made sure I felt like I was going crazy. Love the environment when I go there. They also get me in for emergency appointments quickly.|I have never felt unsafe in a doctors office, I did with these folks.  This seems to be a very low budget operation, procedure tables that do not lower etc.   I'm a senior with mobility challenges.  They had me climb up two stairs to get on a stationary table.  The climb down under anestesia was absurd.  Then rushed into a tiny bathroom cluttered with bins etc. to change.  I'll never go back there and I definitely don't recommend them.|Had an 11:45 appt. Called on my way due to traffic running 8 minutes late. When I arrived 8 minutes late they cancelled my appointment. I drive from 35 miles away....they offered nothing and had a rotten attitude. There was no one else in waiting room. Clinician wouldn't take extra time off her lunch to see me.
Management in Concord was dismissive and said it was my fault . What has this world come to?|Scammers stay away! I stopped going there when it was clear they were adding unneeded appointments just to get more money. Now I have a $500+ hit on my credit report when I got no bills and I paid my portion before each appointment.|I am pleased with my treatments and service. It is well explained that some times the initial injection may not work and another area may need to be injected. The exact location of pain is tricky. It took me three times before the right area was discovered. Great relief! Keep in mind with other reviews people in pain can be, well, cranky. Keep an open mind when you go and be patient.|Been going to Dr. Mirazita for about 18 years now and he is absolutely the best in his field. Trusting your doctor is tantamount to a good experience. Have always trusted his assessments, he keeps well informed on new technologies and treatment modalities and options. Top notch care every time.|They called my mother in the morning the day of her appointment and asked if she could change to the following week. She doesn't drive and relies on family and friends for rides, which she explained ,so they told her to come in for her scheduled time and they would work it out. She arrived 7 minutes late due to traffic  so they refused to take her. She explained how she had spoken to the assistant earlier and that they were going to work her in. The receptionist went out back then came back and told her "the doctor has spoken and we can't see you". Her friend that drove her went up to speak with them and to explain why they were late. They responded by threatening to call security/police. My mom is in her 80's and is pain and this office obviously doesn't care about their patients.  Furthermore she was only coming to consult about her next step in treatment, not even seeing a doctor. Don't tell me they could't have cut her appt short instead of turning her away.

column3:
Concord Orthopaedics in Concord, New Hampshire has been delivering exceptional orthopaedic care to patients throughout the state since 1974. Under the expert guidance of physicians like Jung-Woo Ma, MD, the practice has established itself as a premier destination for comprehensive orthopaedic and rheumatology services. What began as a modest practice with just two orthopaedic physicians has flourished into a robust medical group featuring 28 physicians, 21 physician assistants, and 4 nurse practitioners, all dedicated to providing specialized care tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Concord Orthopaedics, physicians specialize in distinct areas of orthopaedic medicine, ensuring patients receive the most advanced and focused care possible. Their specialties include sports medicine, total joint surgery, spine care, hand surgery, orthopaedic traumatology, foot and ankle care, pediatric orthopaedics, general orthopaedics, and rheumatology. Dr. Jung-Woo Ma brings his exceptional skills and patient-centered approach to this distinguished team of specialists.

Convenient Locations

Understanding the importance of accessibility in healthcare, Concord Orthopaedics maintains seven convenient locations throughout New Hampshire:

  • Concord (Main Office: 264 Pleasant St, Concord, NH 03301)

  • New London

  • Derry

  • Windham

  • Raymond

  • Plymouth

  • Laconia

Ambulatory Surgery Centers

For patients requiring surgical intervention, Concord Orthopaedics offers two state-of-the-art ambulatory (day) surgery centers:

  • Orthopaedic Surgery Center - Concord

  • Orthopaedic Surgery Center - Derry

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment with Dr. Jung-Woo Ma or any of the skilled providers at Concord Orthopaedics, patients can call +1 603-224-3368. For more detailed information about services and physicians, visit their website at www.concordortho.com.
column11: Founded in 1974, with two orthopaedic physicians, Concord Orthopaedics has grown to include 28 physicians, 21 physician assistants, and 4 nurse practitioners providing specialized orthopaedic and rheumatology care. Physicians specialize in a particular area of orthopaedics including, sports medicine, total joint surgery, spine care, hand surgery, orthopaedic traumatology, foot and ankle care, pediatric orthopaedics, general orthopaedics and rheumatology. Our physicians see patients in seven convenient locations in New Hampshire: Concord, New London, Derry, Windham, Raymond, Plymouth, and Laconia. In addition, two ambulatory (day) surgery centers are available: Orthopaedic Surgery Center - Concord and Orthopaedic Surgery Center - Derry.

I have been seeing Dr. Ma since around April 2024 because of arthritic pain in my neck and back. Physical therapy only gave me temporary relief. Neck and shoulder injections plus most recently dry needling ( not as bad as it sounds) performed by Dr. Ma have given me much welcome relief. Praise too for all the staff at Concord Orthopedics for efficiently run practice.|I love this doctor. He's very nice. Very thorough. Has a good manner very honest and that's hard to find nowadays.|Dr MA is a good doctor. He explains things very well. I was referred to Dr MA because I have been experiencing pain in my back and neck. Dr MA told me what he thought was my best options. I followed his recommendations and I feel somewhat better. My back still hurts but my neck feels good.|I've been to this office a few times. Everyone is so nice and you don't have to wait very long at all. Dr Ma is always on time for his appointments. He's very nice and caring about what you have to say and what you need to do to make yourself well.|Dr. Ma is amazing, understanding and best of all....HE LISTENS to my concerns.

Great doctor and highly respect him.|I feel that I had a good experience.  Every one is friendly, kind and professional. Dr Ma took the time to explain things to me which helped me understand things better .|Went to Dr Ma for a follow up.  Dr suggested I have another shot in my back to help pain.  He was trying to help find an answer that would work. It is a very busy office but everyone helpful.|As always, at the follow-up after my shots to manage back pain, Dr. Ma listens, asks appropriate questions, addresses my concerns and assures me that if the pain returns and becomes too much, call him and he will schedule the another round. From my experience, I know, he will personally call me back within 24 hours, usually within a few hours and begin the scheduling process. I am so grateful for this alternative to back surgery available to me through Concord Orthopedics and Dr. Ma.
