column3:
McNamara Terrence DO serves Peterborough, NH and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management and physical rehabilitation services. Dr. McNamara brings his prestigious Mayo Clinic training to the Monadnock region, offering specialized care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. As a board-certified Physiatrist with focused expertise in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation, he combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve their quality of life.

Dr. McNamara's comprehensive training includes both residency and fellowship completion at the renowned Mayo Clinic, establishing him as a highly qualified Pain Physician. His practice encompasses a wide range of conditions, with particular focus on:

  • Spine pain management

  • Joint and muscle pain treatment

  • Comprehensive pain evaluation and diagnosis

  • Minimally invasive pain procedures

  • Rehabilitation medicine

Services at Monadnock Community Hospital

Working collaboratively with the clinical team at Monadnock Community Hospital, Dr. McNamara provides patients with convenient access to specialized pain management services. His practice offers both thorough evaluations and onsite procedures, eliminating the need for patients to travel to distant medical centers for specialized care. This integrated approach ensures coordinated treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. McNamara's philosophy centers on treating the whole person, not just the pain condition. He takes time to understand each patient's medical history, lifestyle factors, and treatment goals before developing personalized care plans. This comprehensive approach often combines multiple modalities to achieve optimal outcomes.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. McNamara, patients can call +1 603-924-2144. His practice is conveniently located at 458 Old Street Rd #200, Peterborough, NH 03458. column40:
Dr. McNamara has helped me tremendously over the past 10+ years with pain management for my back as well as help for arthritis in my hands. Dr. McNamara is kind and an excellent listener. With injections he is very careful to make sure that the patient is aware of each step and is doing ok with the procedure.
Anytime I can I recommend Dr. McNamara for pain management.  I often hear how much he has helped others in the community.
Monadnock Hospital is very fortunate to have him here!|Dr. McNamara and monadnock orthopedics are great! I have been dealing with back pain for most of my life and they take good care of me there.
McNamara's assessment was very thorough, he had helpful suggestions for home exercises, and he was able to administer trigger point injections in office the same day.  The office responds quickly to requests and the DOs advocate for their patients to receive the proper diagnostic imaging/best care possible.|Dr. McNamara is awesome!! Everyone in the office is very nice!  Scheduling is convenient.  Dr. McNamara is very knowledgeable. He's very thorough and let's you know what he is doing step by step before proceeding. He listens to what I have to say. Dr. McNamara includes me in the decision making on how we are proceeding forward.|I have been a patient of Dr. McNamara's for over ten years.  I live with rare chronic pain condition, and Dr. McNamara has helped me both manage the pain and improve my quality of life.  He is very knowledgeable in the science of pain medicine, and he is a highly skilled practitioner of both trigger point and epidural injections.  Most importantly, though, Dr. McNamara works with his pain patients to find what works best for them, and to adjust their pain management plan when necessary.  I highly recommend this excellent pain management physician.|I've been seeing Dr. McNamara for pain management. He is one of the best doctors that I've ever seen. Highly recommended!|I think Dr. McNamara is one of the best doctors that I have ever had work on my body. For about five years, about three times a year, he gave me injections to relieve my severe sciatica. His procedures were absolutely painless. Again, the procedure was painless and has reduced reduced the pain in my knee significantly.  I would recommend him to any of my friends in a heartbeat.

column3:
Interventional Pain Management in Concord, NH offers comprehensive pain relief solutions for patients throughout New Hampshire's capital region. Our specialized medical practice focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using advanced interventional techniques that target the source of discomfort. With a team of board-certified physicians trained in the latest pain management protocols, we provide personalized care plans designed to improve mobility, reduce dependency on pain medications, and enhance overall quality of life.

At our state-of-the-art facility located at 100 Hall St, Concord, NH 03301, we utilize cutting-edge diagnostic tools and minimally invasive procedures to address various pain conditions. Our interventional approach includes epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and joint injections—all performed with precision to maximize effectiveness while minimizing recovery time.

Conditions We Treat

Our practice specializes in treating a wide spectrum of pain disorders, including but not limited to:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Cancer-related pain

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in collaborative care that empowers patients through education and involvement in treatment decisions. Our multidisciplinary team works closely with referring physicians, physical therapists, and other healthcare providers to ensure comprehensive pain management strategies that address both immediate relief and long-term wellness goals.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, contact us at +1 603-228-7160. Our friendly staff is ready to assist you on your journey toward a pain-free life.

column3:
Pain Management of Nashua serves patients throughout Nashua, NH and surrounding communities with a commitment to conservative pain management solutions. Under the direction of Dr. Geller, our practice has established itself as a trusted resource for individuals suffering from chronic pain conditions. We focus on providing medical interventions that prioritize safety and effectiveness without resorting to invasive procedures.

At Nashua Pain Management, we specialize in treating a variety of pain conditions including:

  • Low and mid back pain

  • Neck pain

  • Shoulder pain

  • Migraine headaches

Our Approach

What sets our practice apart is our truly conservative methodology. We believe in addressing pain through non-surgical approaches, avoiding epidurals and other deep injections that can carry additional risks. Our treatment protocols specifically exclude compounded drug injections, focusing instead on evidence-based interventions that provide relief while minimizing potential complications.

Patient-Centered Care

Dr. Geller and our dedicated team work closely with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans that address their specific pain concerns. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take the time to listen and respond to individual needs.

Contact Information

column3:
David J. Nagel MD serves Concord, New Hampshire and surrounding communities with exceptional orthopaedic care. As a distinguished physician at Concord Orthopaedics, Dr. Nagel contributes to a legacy of excellence that began in 1974. What started as a modest practice with just two orthopaedic physicians has flourished into one of New Hampshire's premier orthopaedic groups, now featuring 28 physicians, 21 physician assistants, and 4 nurse practitioners dedicated to providing specialized orthopaedic and rheumatology care.

At Concord Orthopaedics, physicians like Dr. Nagel focus on specific areas of orthopaedic medicine to ensure patients receive the most knowledgeable and targeted care possible. The practice offers comprehensive services including sports medicine, total joint surgery, spine care, hand surgery, orthopaedic traumatology, foot and ankle care, pediatric orthopaedics, general orthopaedics, and rheumatology. This specialization allows for more precise diagnoses and tailored treatment plans for each patient's unique needs.

Convenient Locations

Accessibility is a cornerstone of Concord Orthopaedics' patient-centered approach. The practice maintains seven convenient locations throughout New Hampshire, including Concord, New London, Derry, Windham, Raymond, Plymouth, and Laconia. This extensive network ensures that quality orthopaedic care is within reach for patients across the state, minimizing travel time and maximizing convenience.

Surgical Facilities

For patients requiring surgical intervention, Concord Orthopaedics operates two state-of-the-art ambulatory surgery centers: Orthopaedic Surgery Center - Concord and Orthopaedic Surgery Center - Derry. These day surgery facilities allow patients to receive expert surgical care without extended hospital stays, promoting
column11: Founded in 1974, with two orthopaedic physicians, Concord Orthopaedics has grown to include 28 physicians, 21 physician assistants, and 4 nurse practitioners providing specialized orthopaedic and rheumatology care. Physicians specialize in a particular area of orthopaedics including, sports medicine, total joint surgery, spine care, hand surgery, orthopaedic traumatology, foot and ankle care, pediatric orthopaedics, general orthopaedics and rheumatology. Our physicians see patients in seven convenient locations in New Hampshire: Concord, New London, Derry, Windham, Raymond, Plymouth, and Laconia. In addition, two ambulatory (day) surgery centers are available: Orthopaedic Surgery Center - Concord and Orthopaedic Surgery Center - Derry.

column40:
I needed to have a nerve study completed and was lucky to have Dr Nagel to provide this service. He was very friendly and welcoming and very detailed in explaining the procedure and what he would be doing before starting. He was very patient centered and was had a great sense of humor.

He put my mind at ease about the procedure and what could come from this study.|Great appointment one of my best experiences with your doctor|I admittedly avoid "going to the doctor" as much as possible... but sometimes, for some things, we just have to do it. Dr. Nagel came highly recommended to me. I met with him for the first time yesterday and he was (is) AWESOME. The depth of his care and compassion for people / patients is vast & impressive, and he's clearly intelligent and highly skilled. Although it seems rather strange to put in writing... my appointment with him was actually fun!|This is the BEST experience with any Dr I have ever had. You are a person with a name, not a number. Dr. Nagel was kind, empathetic, genuine, and does everything he can to make you comfortable. He talked to me like I was a life long friend.  There are not even enough words to speak about how great of a Dr he is.|Had a tremendous experience with Dr Nagel. He was approachable... he listened... and was flexible. We chatted during the procedure, during which time he kept me informed as to how things were proceeding, but found a subject matter to my liking that helped keep me from fretting over what was actually going on. Funny sense of humor. Excellent bedside manner. Highly recommended!|We're blessed to have Dr. Nagel to help us.  He's willing to spend the time explaining things so you understand.  He is pleasant and helpful.  He keeps you comfortable and engaged while doing the procedure.  His nursing staff is pleasant and helpful as well.  I didn't know that once he's treated you, you can go to him directly if you have further problems.  Nice to know that.|Dr. Nagel was thorough & professional in his examination of my issues as well as explaining his procedure and its purpose for diagnoses. But the real quality of his work is his "Bedside Manner". His engaging and personal manner puts one at ease, and assures that he is interested. I never got the feeling that I was merely another passing patient. I am confident Hippocrates would be proud of him.|Sorry this took so long. This appointment was one of the best I have ever had. column38: William Smith|Janine King|GL Cote|Peter Wacholtz|Nancy Lee|Cybill Anderson|marla reagan|Mike Childress
column40:
I cannot say enough about Dr. Greenspan. After three years of numerous test and pain drs I even traveled to Boston Mass General and was told nothing could be done for my back pain. Then someone recommended Dr Greenspan to me and I am happy to say that I am now on my road to recovery.The procedure is called Medtronics. Check it out and give him a call. You won't be sorry.|I had an MRI 2 months before Ablation Blocks. I had discomfort a few days before first 1/2 of Ablations. I had at least 1 herniated disc and it was not mentioned at consult. After ablations pain is intensified. Getting another MRI to see if anything else going on where pain is.|I developed an uncommon condition- intercostal neuralgia- over the course of 6 years.  It is a maddening condition to say the least.  Dr. Greenspan was the only pain provider outside of Boston that could perform radiofrequency ablation for this condition.  Even Dartmouth couldn't help me.  Had the procedure done less than  a week ago and I am already off all painkillers.  Dr. Greenspan's technique was amazing!

*UPDATE* Went back to Dr. Greenspan again and he was totally on target and so cordial to speak with after the procedure.  I understand that some patients- including myself- have needed pain medication and that not everything can be cured with a procedure.  That said, Dr. Greenspan does his best to get to the root problem of the pain source without relying on narcotics.  He, like many other physicians and pharmacists, have been put in the middle of the "war on opioids" and people who abuse them and innocent chronic pain patients who just want relief.  Clearly there are no simple answers, but I would certainly expect more from the NH Medical Association in terms of carving the right path for both pain patients and doctors.|I have been seen Dr. Greenspan for over 3 years and I just have to say he is fanominal. I have chronic back pain which I will have to love with for the rest of my life and every time I come in for an injection I love pain free for the duration the injection lasts. He takes his time during each procedure explaining step by step what he is doing. I can't thank him enough for giving me my life back to where ai can at least function on a level of normalcy. His staff is also amazing they are super friendly and really helpful. I highly recommend him and his practice to anyone that is dealing with any sort of pain especially when it is pain that involves the back.|I went to Dr Greenspan after Dr Lehn left , and after many months, of extremely unpleasant encounters, I had to find a different provider. He was arrogant and snide, did not listen to me, and the last MRI that I had told me it looked fine when it had numerous very serious issues on it)) and that is why I ended up leaving. He pushes injections and the stimulator and says pain meds do not help long term. If a doctor makes up their mind about your condition before they enter the room for your appointment there's a problem and the problem is not with you..|Dr Greenspan only cares about making money. Yes he will give you many many medications and get you severely addicted and turn you into something you're not. So if that's what you're looking for he's the doctor for you. He's nothing but a legal drug dealer. He cares nothing about his patients. He will keep you on the meds as long as he can. Even if you od and almost die. You will end up in rehab and most likely lose everything. He will still be rich and you will be either dead or wish you were. So if that's the kind of doctor you're looking for then I recommend him. If that's not what you're looking for then I strongly recommend you don't go to him. He should have his license revoked. I have talked to so many people he has done this to. Including myself. He should not be practicing medicine. Sorry excuse for a medical professional!!!|I am very happy with him.  Where I used to go changed my doctor,  I was very uncomfortable with the new doctor.  When I met Dr. Greenspan,  I knew right away that I liked him, and would want to stay a patient of his.  He is so kind, and has a very soothing way of speaking.   My son has been needing a doctor for quite a while, and does not usually like male doctors,   he ( my son ) has to be on deaths door practically before he will go to a doctor.  I talked him in to going to meet Dr Greenspan, I was pleasantly surprised to hear my son say he liked Dr Greenspan and will continue to go see him.  That says a lot,  for Mario to like a doctor,  a male doctor on top of that speaks volumes as to what a good doctor he is.  It is well worth the 2 hour drive. I feel blessed to have found such a kind and wonderful Doctor.
God bless you doctor Greenspan, and your entire staff.|He's a great doctor, hands down, and the most skillful at spinal injections of any I've seen (and I've seen a LOT!).

I see some complaints from other reviewers, but I can honestly say Dr. Greenspan's only been upset with me when I warranted it. Early on in my treatment a few years back, he took me to task for some of my behaviors...but he was 100% correct. I made the changes needed and he and I now share a solid bond of mutual respect. The man has a keen intellect, plenty of empathy, and an encyclopedic knowledge of his disciplines...but he takes no nonsense. Be sincere, be honest, and be sober and you will not find a better doctor to treat your pain.

This man is a big reason I'm still sane and breathing!

column40: I have been in pain for several years, so I went to Dr Thapa's office on an orthopedic referral. Over the past few years, I have had ablations, Spinal Cord Stimulator trials which failed, and PT to no avail. I'm now scheduled for an injection and possibly another MRI. All through this, Dr Thapa has been gentle, medicates appropriately during painful procedures, and is very cognizant of my pain and frustrations. I am in my 70's and a retired RN. I wish I had gone to him sooner as the back pain has continued. He is determined, kind, aware, and patient oriented. I do not hesitate to refer anyone with pain to give him a chance. I believe a person doesn't have to be in constant, unrelenting pain. I believe he is the best option.|Dr. Thapa is incredible. He took a lot of time to listen to my health concerns and laid out two courses of treatment, even going so far as to print out articles for me to read regarding one of the treatment options and thoroughly explaining the benefits and drawbacks of each. I felt heard and seen, which unfortunately is sometimes lacking in the hospital setting. I'd recommend Dr. Thapa and Wentworth Douglass Center for Pain Management to anyone in need of treatment for chronic pain and/or mental health conditions. His professionalism, while also being kind and accessible, made my experience a great one, for which I am very grateful!||

column40: If it wasn't for these wonderful providers my quality of life would be horrible. They don't treat you like an addict but a person who struggles with pain. Derry Interventional Spine Center serves patients throughout Derry, New Hampshire and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. For more than 25 years, this specialized medical practice has been dedicated to improving quality of life for individuals suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. With convenient office locations in both Bedford and Derry, DISC provides accessible care to patients across southern New Hampshire who seek relief from debilitating pain symptoms.

Led by Dr. Athar Usmani, the center's team includes highly experienced pain nurses who work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans. Their combined expertise allows them to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions using evidence-based approaches that focus not only on pain reduction but also on enhancing patients' daily functionality and overall wellbeing.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

DISC offers an extensive range of treatment modalities designed to address pain at its source. These include:

  • Interventional procedures targeting specific pain pathways

  • Rehabilitation programs to restore function and mobility

  • Medication management with careful oversight

  • Alternative therapies complementing traditional approaches

  • Patient education and support for long-term pain management

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Derry Interventional Spine Center is their unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. The practice's number one goal is helping patients effectively manage and reduce pain while promoting improved day-to-day functionality. This holistic approach addresses not just the physical aspects of pain but considers how pain impacts all dimensions of a patient's life.

Location and Contact Information

column40:
After a fall, and fracturing my L1 and L4, it was recommended that I see Dr. Usmani.    I was in a lot of pain and nervous.   I was very comforted by the doctor and his nurse Jenny.   I felt very taken care of and scheduled my  kyphoplasty (sp).   So on  10/15/24, I was greeted warmly, by Sherry, then Jenny took me back and helped me get ready for the procedure while  being a wonderfully caring and competent nurse.   I was introduced to the team and Dr. Usmani came in and we chatted for a bit while he  answered any questions I had.   I was taken in the room, had the procedure and woke up in recovery.    When I stood up the pain was gone!   My husband was brought back to where I was while Jenny helped me get dressed.   Vitals were taken again and they made sure I was fine to leave.
Even though the fall and breaks were not good,  I have to say I'm so glad I was directed to Dr. Usmani and his team!!!!    They were wonderful!!!!|Yet another doctor that keeps you waiting. Very disrespectful.

He told me my spine was twisting because of spinal muscular atrophy and didn't bother ordering any tests to back up his theory.  He assured me that is what was happening.  I went to a different doctor and got an X-ray and a CT scan and the it showed I had two fractured ribs and my bottom rib became disconnected from the cartilage attached to my sternum.  I now have a protruding rib that causes me a lot of problems. Had I known that's what was going on from the beginning I could have had it heal in place.  The man is too busy to take more patients. He has lied to me on numerous occasions just to get me out of the office.  Do not go to this doctor if you are at all concerned about your health. I would leave my phone number on this review so I can tell you some more horror stories about my experience with this man, but I'm not going to. I'm very surprised there hasn't been more lawsuits thrown at him.|I am very displeased at how I was treated at my first appointment with Dr Hsu. He then wrote a prescription for me to start taking, but his first medication he wanted me to take I am ALLERGIC to.  All my allergies to medications were in my chart.  The second medication he wanted me to start this week, but I needed an EKG first to make sure that I don't have a heart arrhythmia because this medication can cause them. This doctor wanted to change 3 of my meds AND wean me off of a fourth but never really looked at my chart. Plus these 4 meds were prescribed by 3 different doctors and I wanted to run some of these changes by them BEFORE making global changes to my medications.

column3:
Atlantic Orthopaedics & Sports Medicine serves Portsmouth, NH and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Andrew Lehn. Our practice combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients overcome both chronic and acute pain conditions, improving their quality of life and functional abilities.

Dr. Lehn brings exceptional credentials and specialized training to his pain management practice. He received his MD from the Medical College of Georgia, establishing a strong foundation in medical science before completing his residency in anesthesiology at the University of Connecticut. His expertise was further refined through a fellowship at the prestigious Johns Hopkins University, where he focused specifically on chronic pain management techniques and interventions.

Maintaining dual board certifications in both pain management and anesthesiology, Dr. Lehn offers patients a comprehensive approach to pain treatment that draws from multiple medical disciplines. This unique combination of specialties allows him to develop personalized treatment plans that address the complex nature of pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

At Atlantic Orthopaedics & Sports Medicine, Dr. Lehn provides evidence-based treatments for a wide range of pain conditions, including but not limited to:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Sports-related injuries

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Post-surgical pain management

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Lehn's philosophy centers on developing individualized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique circumstances, medical history, and personal goals. By combining interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative approaches, he helps patients achieve meaningful pain relief and improved function.

Contact Information

Location: 1900 Lafayette Rd, Suite C, Portsmouth, NH 03801, United States

Phone: +1 603-431-1121

Website: www.atlanticorthopaedics.org

Schedule your consultation today to discover how Dr. Lehn's expertise can help you manage your pain and return to the activities you enjoy.
column11: Dr. Lehn received his MD from the Medical College of Georgia, followed by completing a residency in anesthesiology at the University of Connecticut. Sorry to be negative here, but patients should not be abused.|Dr. Lehn is amazing. Since my procedure, I've never felt better! He's very kind, caring and knowable. With him, I know I'm in good hands and can breathe easy.  Highly recommend! Atlantic Ortho is great, all around!|Dr. Lehn gave me an injection that gave me relief in my back.
I hope to have this injection again to last longer.
I never thought I would have back relief ever again.
Dr. Lehn has a confident and comforting manner.|Dr. Lehn and the entire team at Atlantic Orthopedics have been fantastic in helping me work through some old injuries which had been significantly impacting my life. Thanks to Dr. Lehn and his expertise I was able to dance the night away at my wedding; something I feared wouldn't be possible. I am incredibly grateful to be regaining my mobility and getting back to the activities that I have missed so much.|Dr. Lehn was very nice. He was very patient and explained things.  I would highly recommend him.  After a few hours og getting my shot I felt wonderful.|Dr lehn is the only doctor in 15 years who has been able to reduce my back pain to a bearable level. Even with that major success he continues to look for  more ways to reduce my remaining back pain. I am so greatful that I found him and continue to be under his care and guidance. Dr. Lehn is truly a rare doctor and in my book he deserves not 5 stars but 10 stars or higher.  THANK YOU DR.LEHN YOUR THE BEST.|When i first met Dr. Lehn, it was by accident. He was my 3rd Dr. i approached with my many physical aliments. I rolled into his office in a beat up ole red huge wheelchair, with no hope inside. After leaving his office some 5 years ago, my spirits were lifted, his bed side manner was very comforting... after many many visits, tests, therapies....ups and downs , treatments of different varsities i am now on a journey with My Fitness Pal and ambulating with a rollator.....In just the past month i have begun to feel so much better, spiritually, physically and mentally And i owe to the gentle yet persistent care of Dr. Lehn. Gods power defiantly works threw Dr. Lehn's Hands Heart & Soul. God Bless him & his staff for all that they give & do. So grateful our paths crossed after seeing other Dr.s with no hope for me in sight. Your truly & sincerely Laurie
BTW I didn't get paid to share all of this  info.  in my review

New Hampshire Regenerative Center serves Manchester, New Hampshire with cutting-edge alternative medicine and pain management solutions. Located in the historic Queen City, our clinic combines innovative therapies with holistic approaches to address chronic pain and promote overall wellness. Our dedicated team of specialists utilizes regenerative medicine techniques that stimulate the body's natural healing processes, offering patients non-surgical alternatives to traditional pain management. We pride ourselves on creating personalized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique health profile, lifestyle factors, and wellness goals.

At New Hampshire Regenerative Center, we welcome patients from all stages of life. Our treatments are carefully adapted for children, active adults, and seniors, ensuring that everyone receives appropriate care tailored to their specific needs. Our practitioners take time to understand each patient's medical history, current challenges, and aspirations for improved health, creating a supportive environment where healing can flourish.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our facility offers the most progressive pain-relieving therapies available in modern alternative medicine. These evidence-based treatments focus on addressing the root causes of discomfort rather than merely masking symptoms. By combining cutting-edge technology with holistic principles, we help patients achieve sustainable relief and enhanced quality of life without excessive reliance on medications or invasive procedures.

Our Holistic Philosophy

We believe in treating the whole person, not just isolated symptoms. This comprehensive approach considers physical, emotional, and lifestyle factors that contribute to pain and health challenges. Our ultimate goal is to guide each patient toward optimal health and pain-free living through education, therapeutic interventions, and ongoing support.

Visit Us: 765 S Main St, Suite 103, Manchester, NH 03102

Contact: (603) 945-1945

Website: https://nhregenerativecenter.com/
column11:

We treat all stages of life, from children to the physically fit, to the elderly. The ultimate goal is to help each patient at New Hampshire Regenerative Center achieve and maintain optimal health and pain-free living!

column40:
I cannot say enough about how excellent the care is at New Hampshire Regenerative Center.  I have personally undergone PRP injections for my hands with Lisa. She is extremely knowledgable, caring and professional. I have Osteoarthritis and highly recommend to anyone experiencing joint pain.|Love this place and the people. Since I started my treatments I have been able to reduce my trips to the chiropractor and I have been able to stop taking my prescription medications. I highly recommend giving this a chance.|This review is long overdue !!!
First and for most my experience has only been professional and clean yet welcoming and relaxed, integrity based, genuine care, clear communication, and my favorite humor and uplifting attitudes to put at ease with any stress on what brought me there.
I have just completed as of last week the 10 sessions of stem therapy/shock wave therapy and I am shocked  at the results.    The 1st one gave me immediate relief from pain to my surprise and this relief has continued.  I have less overall pain in my hip area and I find my movement is more fluid/less stiff in my problem area.
I have been dealing with a hip issue for about 4 years now.  Almost a year ago, I had an MRI done to see what was going on.  Basically it said I needed a hip replacement because at any point it could collapse.
Needless to say I was not able to nor was I going to accept that answer because I'm stubborn lol but because I know how amazing the body is at healing and as an active healthy 50 yrs young person I needed other options.  I had stayed carefully active doing my part, being diligent with self care, exercising, eating well and just overall well being.  I was utilizing many different modalities to keep being able to keep on but I needed to do something more, something different.
I was told about NH Regenerative a couple months ago from someone that had done PRP therapy and was able to avoid shoulder surgery.  I did a little looking into them but when free consultation was the invite it was a no brainer, nothing to loose.  It was a huge weight off of my shoulders because I really didn't know what I was getting into (the costs and commitment and I drive 2 hrs 1 way to go there).
For me it was a must try option.  A minimally invasive way for my body to be given some help and the chance to heal itself, care for itself.....
Regenerate itself !
The thing about these treatments also is they continue to work in the body with the healing effects long after a treatment.
Thank you NH Regenerative Center|I've had a great experience at the New Hampshire Regenerative Center. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable, and the injections have made my knee feel a lot better! I am optimistic that I'll keep improving and would recommend these treatments to others!|Dr Pratt is only out to get money, I showed him my X-ray on both knees and he said I was the perfect candidate for stem cell. So I gave him over $10,000 for laser, pro and stem cell therapy. Plus i traveled over 30 miles twice a week .I spent money for gas and tolls. If you need knee replacement do the surgery, like I just did. Don't go to New Hampshire regenerative center in Manchester they are a RIPOFF|Initial consultation, very informative. Right on time with the appointment, Dr Pratt presented all of the options, was very upfront with the pricing. There was no pressure to do anything. I will be taking the next steps.|I can't say enough great things about this practice, Dr Pratt and his entire staff!!! I had my first PRP injection in my ankle. I have been in so much pain for close to a year and was barely able to walk at 45 years old. These treatments have saved my life and I now am able to walk and my pain is gone. About a year ago the pain started and continued to get worse. I was at my podiatrist office every two weeks for some trial of treatment that did absolutely nothing.  I had cortisone shots, pain meds, topicals and orthotics. NOTHING was working. My only options were fusing my foot. I found NH Regenerative and scheduled my consult and instead of just being told I had arthritis, turns out I had no cartilage in my ankle.  Dr Pratt was very up front about my treatment plan and made it very clear that everyone one was different and he could not guarantee it would take away my pain. I started treatment right away because once you have surgery, it cannot be reversed. I am still receiving my PT with Taylor as well as my light treatments.  The entire staff has been so AMAZING! They all go out of their way to make sure I am taken care of, I honestly can't thank them enough.  I am so happy I found this treatment and practice , thank you for giving me my quality of life back!!!!|After my first visit to NH Regenerative Center having Stemwave therapy,  I didn't have as much clicking in my knee.  I thought WOW!  I'm hoping this therapy will diminish the inflammation and pain in my knee from everyday wear and tear.

Washington Tabitha A MD Pain Management Center serves Lebanon, NH and surrounding communities throughout New Hampshire with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic, located at Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center, offers evidence-based treatments for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Dr. Tabitha A. Washington leads our dedicated team of pain specialists who are committed to improving quality of life through personalized care plans and innovative therapies.

At our center, we provide a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of pain. Our services include diagnostic evaluations, medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies. We specialize in treating conditions such as:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Neuropathic pain disorders

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Arthritis and joint pain

  • Cancer-related pain

Expert Care at Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center

As part of the renowned Dartmouth-Hitchcock health system, our pain management center benefits from the resources of a leading academic medical center. Dr. Washington combines clinical expertise with the latest research advancements to deliver optimal outcomes for patients with challenging pain conditions. Our affiliation with Dartmouth-Hitchcock ensures patients receive coordinated care across specialties when needed.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects each person differently. Our team takes the time to listen to patients' concerns and develop individualized treatment strategies that align with their goals and lifestyle. We emphasize education and self-management techniques that empower patients to take an active role in their recovery process.

Contact Information

Location: 1 Medical Center Dr, Lebanon, NH 03756, United States

Phone: +1 603-650-6040

Website: www.dartmouth-hitchcock.org

New patients are welcome with appropriate referrals. Please contact our office to schedule a consultation and learn more about how we can help manage your pain effectively.

Neurological & Spine Solutions in Bedford, NH offers comprehensive neurological and spinal care under the expert guidance of Dr. Zubin S. Batlivala, MD. Serving patients throughout New Hampshire with personalized treatment plans, our practice combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative therapeutic approaches to address a wide spectrum of neurological and spinal conditions. Our state-of-the-art facility on Hawthorne Drive provides a comfortable environment where patients receive individualized attention and access to cutting-edge treatments.

Dr. Batlivala brings extensive training and experience to each patient consultation, specializing in both surgical and non-surgical management of complex neurological and spinal disorders. Our practice emphasizes thorough evaluation and evidence-based treatment protocols tailored to each patient's unique needs. From degenerative disc disease to spinal stenosis, herniated discs to nerve compression syndromes, we offer comprehensive solutions designed to maximize function and minimize pain.

Our Services

Our practice provides a full spectrum of neurological and spine services, including diagnostic testing, minimally invasive procedures, surgical interventions, and rehabilitation coordination. We work closely with physical therapists, pain management specialists, and other healthcare providers to ensure integrated care that addresses all aspects of our patients' conditions. Our team stays current with the latest advancements in neurological and spine treatment to offer the most effective options available.

column38: Paul S|Barbara Blundell-McDonough|Cara Fiske|Pat Mulcahy|Samantha Perkins|CHERIE BETTENCOURT|diane davis|Cristine Galle
column40:
My experience with Dr. Batlivala has been very positive. He seems to truly care  about helping me deal with my chronic back pain. At first I was a bit put off by his style, but by the second visit I got a much warmer feeling about him and that he really wanted to help me with managing my pain. We had a good laugh about the fact we we were both wearing denim, and at that point I really understood that he was really on my side. We reviewed my MRI scan together and we discussed options to  alleviate my symptoms so that I could enjoy a more pain free lifestyle. I could not feel any more comfortable with "Dr. B"|If I could I would give him a zero. I went to him for help with my CRPS which I've had for many years. I also was born with bilateral pes cavus of the feet. The man was quite curt, rather rude,I could not get a word in. He was more interested in my back that does not bother me. Then wanted me to take Lyrica which I explained I cannot take. It's been tried before. He insisted I could still take it. Told me I need an mri of my back? And to return to see his nurse. That was it my appt. It ended so abruptly. He never even noticed I have no pedal pulse, my toes on my right foot are curling under. I couldn't say anything! And by the way Lyrica ended me up in a psych ward due to suicidal thoughts. Where did this man go to school? Is it my mind or does he just treat women like this? Just my thoughts. I will not be going near New Hampshire Nuero Spine Institute or Dr. Batlivala again.|I did not have a good experience. I waited from 11:25am until 12:45pm to see the doctor. My appointment was at 12pm, I was asked to be early for xrays. No one even acknowledged the delay.

The nurse was very friendly and thorough, but Dr Batlivala was a huge disappointment. The nurse spent more time with me than he did. His bedside manner is terrible. He barely greeted me, never smiled, and hardly even made eye contact. His questions seemed like more of an interrogation than like he wanted to get to know me/help me. He kept asking why I was there, and what I wanted from him (which felt very weird and made me uncomfortable). I have issues with my back, and also autoimmune and neurological disorders. I was recently diagnosed with SFN, and also have lupus. I suffer from back pain and nerve pain and migraine headaches. I have seen several specialists and very much wanted to consolidate care.

I read everything on the website. I was so hopeful that I had found a place that could treat me, and a place where providers would work together on a treatment plan. I told Dr Batlivala that and he told me that is unrealistic, and that doctors don't have time to talk to eachother (maybe he needs to spend time on the website). He barely examined me. He didn't even ask me to come back.

I waited months for this appointment, hoping to meet a provider who could help. I hoped to find  a practice that would treat me as a whole person (and offer something besides pills). I was crying by the time I made it back to the elevator. Very disheartened by the lack of care and compassion.|This doctor does not listen to his patients. I have sever back issues I went to him and suddenly I had a leg issue wait a wrist issue not once did he actually do his job,he is always rushing,has absolutely no manners at all .he puts u way underneath him ..I rate this doc a 1 I'd like to leave a 0 but
I recommend u find another doctor who will treat what is wrong and listen to what u have to say.|He was a great doctor he talked me thru my whole procedure I had for testing for carpal tunnel syndrome. It hurt but not that bad because he talked me thru everything. I would definitely refer him to anyone that need his doctor work.|Dr Batalava cares about his patients. He's intelligent on all different levels of back and spine issues.|Have seen Dr. Batlivala and I am totally delighted that he is taking a serious interest in the pain I am in.
He is a very personable doctor and shows that he cares.  He has given hope where I think there was none.
Thank you doctor.|I just started seeing this Dr. but so far he has taken a serious aggressive approach to pain I've had for over two months. I'm very grateful for his time & services so far. I have a f/ up today...will keep you posted.

The Pain Relief Center in Nashua, NH offers comprehensive chiropractic care and holistic pain management solutions for residents throughout southern New Hampshire. At The Pain Relief Center, we understand that pain affects everyone differently. Using state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and hands-on techniques, we identify the root causes of your discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms. Our Comprehensive Services

Patient-Centered Experience

column40:
The Pain Relief Center is a great place for not only adjustments but pain management as well. Dr. Dohoney offers electric stimulation upon many other things that makes him stand out. I have never ever had a bad experience with him. He is always amazingly professional and gentle. The office is always clean and presentable with amazing front desk staff as well. Dr. Steve always listens to my chiropractic needs and develops an individual treatment plan to meet those needs. Those chiropractic adjustments help me manage my back pain and maintain my quality of life. After seeing Dr. Steve for about 5 years now, I wouldn't see anyone else. I highly recommend The Pain Relief Center for their services!!!!|I've been going to The Pain Relief Center for over 5 years and they have been life saver for my low and mid back pain! I consider Dr. Dohoney to be a professional and an expert at what he does. The staff is always courteous and professional as well. I highly recommend trying this place out before going down the road of cortisone shots and surgery. 5 stars all way. Thank you Steve!|I've been going to Dr. Steve for years. He's amazing. There's been times when I went in having trouble even walking, and he always gets me right again. Now I go once per month for maintenance and I've never felt better. Everyone on staff is always friendly and welcoming - they treat you like family. I highly recommend The Pain Relief Center. Steve is fantastic. Give him a call today.|I am one of Dr. Dohoney's first patients going back over a decade.  I originally asked him to treat major back pain, which he did successfully long ago.  Since then, I've been on monthly maintenance with occasional back, shoulder and hand issues that he treats effectively.  Even if there are no specific pains, I see value in the monthly maintenance.  The doctor is usually on time and does not complain if I'm a little late.  A visit takes about 30 minutes.  He sends reminders via text.  He accepts my insurance and charges fairly for his services.  Personally, he is friendly and professional.  I actually look forward to the monthly treatments.|I can't say enough good things about the Pain Relief Center.  The office is clean & inviting,  the staff is friendly  and Dr Dohoney is amazing !!!
I am a 52-year-old woman who went sledding with her kids and ended up going off a jump and coming down really hard.   It caused severe neck  pain,  headaches,   &  back pain.  A friend recommended I give her chiropractor a try.   After weekly visits  a little over month later, I'm doing so much better.    Dr Dohoney not only treated my acute injury but has helped with chronic lingering issues as well.   I've had plantar fasciitis and Achilles pain on and off for years .  Treatments with Dr Steve have made it so much better.    I am truly amazed and excited by the results.    Over the years I have gone to different chiropractors sometimes two and three times a week and didn't get the results I've received with Dr Dohoney.    Life is too short to be in pain.   It would be worth your time to try something new.     You can't be100% or take care of others when you're constantly in pain.   Don't take my word for it, see for yourself.|I've been going to the Pain Relief Center for over 10 years.  Since starting my treatment there, my back pain has gone away.  Dr. Dahoney is amazing and his staff is so personable and professional.  I would highly recommend The Pain Relief Center to anyone looking to relieve themselves of chronic back or body pains.|Steve at the Pain Relief Center is a wonderful chiropractor! He really pays attention to what is bothering you so he can come up with the best treatment plan for your ailments. Steve is very professional, his office is sanitary, and his staff are nice! I would highly recommend Steve and the Pain Relief Center!

Established as a premier spine and neurological treatment center, our team of board-certified neurosurgeons provides specialized care for patients suffering from spine disorders, brain conditions, and peripheral nerve issues. column40:
I had a patient from the nursing home in acute back pain who had an existing appointment for a follow up and I called last minute to see if they could get her a back injection so I could place the patient on hospice.  The team made sure she got her injection that day so that her pain was managed and she could be appropriately placed on hospice.  Excellent work team! Thank you so much for all of your. hard work!|On October 23, my doctor sent a referral over there so I can get a Cortizone shot in my back for my spinal stenosis. They contacted me via text message to set up an appointment online. I set the appointment up online my appointment Was scheduled for the end of the month. I called yesterday to verify The actual date. I was told there was no appointment for me. I voiced my displeasure with the representative. I don't like doing things online and this is the reason why. The representative Had an attitude with me and once again stated there was no appointment for me and also said well we sent you a message on October 23. What does that have to do with me not having an appointment now because people are too lazy to call you to set up an appointment. Now I have to wait till the day after Christmas  I am not happy. I'm in a lot of pain and it is very very expensive to go there|I highly recommend Dr. Ahn for back surgery. He performed a laminectomy on me with great results. I had severe pain in my lower back and down my right leg. I am two months out, pain free and getting back to a normal life. Thank you Dr. Ahn|I had a very disappointing experience with the customer service at New Hampshire Neurospine Institute. I scheduled an appointment, but at the last minute, they called to reschedule due to staffing issues, which caused significant inconvenience. The representative, Debbie, was unhelpful and unapologetic, with a passive-aggressive tone that made the situation worse. It's clear she needs additional training on how to properly interact with clients. The lack of professionalism in how the situation was handled is extremely frustrating. After reading other reviews, it seems this is not an isolated incident, and poor customer service is a recurring issue. I sincerely hope I won't have to use their services again after my upcoming appointment.|Stay away! In My opinion! I believed they could help with my spinal cord and disc issues. Stay away! They installed a spinal cord stimulator which they convinced me would help. Dr Luther installed it to far to one side. After numerous failed attempts by Abbott and Dr Luther to figure out why the stimulator only works on one side of my body they tried to use Dr ahn to tell me it was my anatomy that dictated where the stimulator would be positioned. Dr Ahn a lower spine surgeon was clearly upset that he had to see me for cervical spine / stimulator issue which he explained wasn't his specialty. I went back numerous times for more lies from Dr Luther telling me it was positioned correctly. They won't fix their mistakes and keep telling me it was correct even though X-rays and their own doctors and a hospital in Boston said it had to be REDONE. They wanted to charge my insurance for another surgery over $75 k to fix there mistakes! So they get all of the money the second time around! Stay away from the workers comp section as Maureen is a liar, they are not there to help you they are there for your insurance companies money! There is a group of doctors that make the decisions in that facility and they don't care about you! Stay away, it should be NEGATIVE STARS! Go to Boston for your herniated disc and spinal care!|The doctor there told me that I had one thing that was causing a lot of pain in my lower back we discuss a 3-month plan. I call back to talk to a nurse. She told me that the doctor never said that it was not in my notes so apparently he was lying to me. I will never go back there again. I don't care how bad my back hurts. They don't know what they're doing|Not the best medical experiences there for my family, spouse went for an injection and they hit a nerve, actually made her pain worse, then I went for injections to lower spine with no relief and then they look at me like well sorry best we can do.  So I can either suffer or take pills all the time.  Not a great experience.|Dr. Ahn is a life saver, and perhaps the most caring Dr I have had. He has done surgery twice on my neck and lower back. In my opinion there's is no better. I recently  went back to see him and after seeing the xrays he ordered an MRI. I have trusted him wrh my life and I will continue to do so.  I also found the receptionists to be helpful and I feel they do the best they can. My final words is Thank you for caring and your professionalism

Founded by dedicated physical therapist Natalie Tilton, our practice has earned recognition for our commitment to individualized care and effective treatment protocols. We believe that quality physical therapy requires dedicated one-on-one attention, which is why each session at Ability Allies is conducted with personalized focus on your specific recovery needs.

At Ability Allies, we offer comprehensive physical therapy solutions including:

  • Orthopedic Therapy - Expert treatment for joint, muscle, and bone conditions

  • Pain Management - Evidence-based approaches to chronic and acute pain

  • Sports Rehabilitation - Specialized recovery programs for athletes of all levels

  • Vestibular Therapy - Treatment for balance disorders and dizziness

The Ability Allies Difference

What sets us apart is our unwavering dedication to patient-centered care. Our award-winning team takes the time to understand your unique challenges, developing customized treatment plans that address your specific goals. We combine hands-on techniques with therapeutic exercises and education to empower you throughout your recovery journey.

New Patients Welcome

We are currently accepting new patients and welcome the opportunity to help you achieve optimal health and wellness. Our modern facility at 68A Fogg Rd in Epping is equipped with state-of-the-art rehabilitation technology to support your recovery process.

Ready to experience top-rated physical therapy? Contact us today at (603) 770-0408 to schedule your initial consultation, or visit abilityallies.com to learn more about our services and approach to physical therapy excellence.

Shawn P. Harrington, M.D., FAAPMR serves Peterborough, NH and surrounding Monadnock region communities with exceptional musculoskeletal care. As a board-certified Musculoskeletal Physician with over 20 years of experience, Dr. Harrington has established himself as a trusted healthcare provider specializing in comprehensive diagnostic evaluation and personalized treatment plans. His patient-centered approach focuses on collaborative decision-making, ensuring that each individual fully understands their condition and participates actively in their treatment journey.

Dr. Harrington's practice philosophy centers on defining each patient's specific problem through thorough evaluation before presenting a range of treatment options. This collaborative approach allows patients to make informed decisions about their care, leading to treatment plans that all parties support and that offer the highest probability of success. Understanding that healthcare isn't always straightforward, Dr. Harrington works diligently to establish flexible treatment strategies that can be adjusted as needed to help patients achieve their health goals.

Practice Information

Dr. Harrington sees patients at his office located at 458 Old Street Rd #200, Peterborough, NH 03458. Appointments can be scheduled by calling +1 603-924-2144. As part of the Monadnock Community Hospital network, Dr. Harrington provides patients with access to comprehensive care resources within an established healthcare system. For additional information about Dr. Harrington's credentials, approach to patient care, and services offered, prospective patients are encouraged to visit his professional profile at monadnockcommunityhospital.com/staff/shawn-harrington-m-d/.

Hampstead Pain Relief serves the Hampstead, New Hampshire area with specialized therapeutic massage services designed to address chronic pain and promote overall wellness. Led by Elizabeth, a licensed massage therapist with extensive training in various modalities, our practice focuses on delivering personalized care that targets the root causes of discomfort rather than just treating symptoms. We understand that chronic pain can significantly impact quality of life, which is why we've developed comprehensive treatment approaches that combine traditional and innovative techniques.

At Hampstead Pain Relief, we offer a range of therapeutic massage options, with particular expertise in Thai massage therapy. This ancient healing practice combines acupressure, Indian Ayurvedic principles, and assisted yoga postures to create a comprehensive treatment that addresses both physical and energetic imbalances. Our therapeutic massage services are specifically designed to help with:

- Sciatic pain relief

- Fibromyalgia management

- Shoulder injury rehabilitation

- TMJ disorder treatment

- Stress reduction and relaxation

Our Approach to Pain Management

What sets us apart is our holistic approach to pain management. Rather than offering temporary solutions, we work with clients to develop treatment plans that promote long-term healing and prevention. Our mission is simple yet profound: to help adults wake up pain-free and reclaim their daily lives from the limitations of chronic discomfort.

Each session at Hampstead Pain Relief is tailored to the individual's specific needs, focusing on restoring range of motion, relieving chronic tension, and creating a sense of balance throughout the body. Our clients consistently report not just physical relief but also improved mental clarity and emotional well-being.

Visit Our Practice

Experience the difference professional therapeutic massage can make in your life. Our practice is conveniently located at 6 Mary E Clark Dr, Suite 5, Hampstead, NH 03841. To schedule your appointment, call us at +1 603-718-9639 or book online through our website at [www.hampsteadpainrelief.com](https://www.hampsteadpainrelief.com/).

Begin your journey toward pain-free living today and discover how our specialized care can help you achieve calm, relaxation, and peace both inside and out.
column11:
We are Hampstead Pain Relief, your destination for expert pain management in New Hampshire! Led by Elizabeth, a licensed massage therapist, we offer targeted therapeutic massage, including Thai massage therapy, to alleviate discomfort and pain in your muscles and provide stress relief.
Our mission is simple: to allow adults to wake up pain-free and reclaim their day. Whether it's sciatic pain, fibromyalgia, shoulder injuries, or TMJ, our treatments help restore range of motion and relieve chronic tension. Enjoy an experience that will allow you to achieve calm, relaxation and peace inside and out.
Give us a call or book your appointment online, and start your journey towards pain-free living!

Access Sports Medicine and Orthopaedics serves Exeter, NH and the entire Seacoast New Hampshire region as the area's premier provider of comprehensive orthopaedic care. With a patient-centered approach, their team of specialized physicians delivers innovative treatments for a wide range of musculoskeletal conditions, from sports injuries to workplace-related issues. Their commitment to helping patients #GETBACKINTHEGAME has established them as trusted healthcare partners for athletes, working professionals, and families throughout the community.

At Access Sports Medicine and Orthopaedics, patients benefit from specialized care for disorders, injuries, and illnesses affecting the muscles, bones, and joints. Their integrated approach ensures that whether you're a competitive athlete with a knee injury, experiencing carpal tunnel syndrome, or recovering from a work-related musculoskeletal condition, you'll receive expert treatment tailored to your specific needs.

Advanced Diagnostic Capabilities

One of the key advantages of choosing Access Sports Medicine is their on-site diagnostic services. Patients appreciate convenient access to Open-MRI technology, osteoporosis screening, and x-ray services without the need for referrals to external facilities. This integrated approach significantly reduces wait times and accelerates the path to recovery.

Rehabilitation Services

This collaborative approach ensures continuity of care and optimal outcomes for patients at every stage of their healing journey.

New Hampshire Orthopedic Center serves patients throughout southern New Hampshire with comprehensive orthopedic care delivered by a team of fellowship-trained, board-eligible and board-certified subspecialty surgeons. With strategically located offices in Nashua, Bedford, Londonderry, and Amherst, NHOC has established itself as the region's premier destination for both surgical and non-surgical orthopedic treatment. The practice's patient-centered approach combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care, ensuring optimal outcomes for individuals suffering from musculoskeletal conditions and injuries.

At New Hampshire Orthopedic Center, patients benefit from specialized care across all orthopedic disciplines. The practice offers expert treatment for conditions affecting the:

  • Foot and ankle

  • Hand and upper extremity

  • Hip and knee

  • Shoulder

  • Spine

The center's sports medicine specialists work with athletes of all levels to facilitate recovery and return to activity. Whether addressing acute injuries or managing chronic conditions, NHOC's multidisciplinary team develops personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs and goals.

Advanced Diagnostic and Treatment Facilities

The Bedford location at 9 Washington Pl #101 exemplifies NHOC's commitment to comprehensive care by offering on-site MRI services for accurate diagnosis without the need for external referrals. Patients can access complete treatment journeys under one roof with integrated Physical and Occupational Therapy departments that provide seamless rehabilitation services. The practice also features a specialized Bone Health Clinic, a dedicated Workers' Compensation team, and Interventional Pain Management services to address diverse patient needs.

For added convenience, New Hampshire Orthopedic Center provides Durable Medical Equipment (DME) directly to patients, eliminating the hassle of sourcing prescribed supports, braces, and mobility aids from third-party vendors.

To schedule an appointment at the Bedford location, patients can call +1 603-883-0091 or visit their website at www.nhoc.com/office-locations/bedford/ for more information about services and providers.

We treat conditions and injuries of the foot and ankle, hand and upper extremity, hip, knee, shoulder and spine as well as sports medicine. Our offices also provide MRI services, Physical Therapy and Occupational Therapy services, Durable Medical Equipment (DME), a Bone Health Clinic, a Workers' Compensation team, and Interventional Pain Management.

As the area's leader in innovative orthopaedic services, Dr. Siegel and his team specialize in diagnosing and treating a wide range of musculoskeletal conditions. The practice focuses on the prevention and treatment of disorders, injuries, and illnesses affecting the muscles, bones, and joints. Doctor Miller in the same office is also a great neurosurgeon.|I would give no stars if I could. I have been dealing with a mystery illness for almost a year now. It causes me daily vertigo and severe migraines. This condition is debilitating, and I can barely leave the house most days. Dr. Trachtman prescribed me a medication that finally helped with the migraine aspect of things. The Lawrence location will not answer my pharmacy to refill my prescription, let alone me. It has been over a month with no medication and my condition is worsening again. I was also told by Lawrence General Hospital to call and have him clear me for an anesthesiologist to get an MRI (severe claustrophobic), and nobody will call me back to let me schedule!!! Do not go here, for the sake of your health.|If I could give a negative number of stars I would.  I had an appointment 3 weeks ago and arrive 20 mins early, as requested in all the paperwork I received.  It was over an hour to check in at the front desk and then 45 more mins to see my doctor.  I have been calling and asking for a detailed receipt of my payment to submit to my FSA and have been told repeatedly that they can't give me a receipt and keep giving me the same number to call, where I get this same response.  I was sent for X-rays, which involved taking time off from work and an hour drive to get to Lowell only to get there and find out that the doctor wrote the script incorrectly.  I have now been waiting over an hour here for the X-ray because they obviously can't do that without an accurate script.  The lack of customer service and the obvious lack of care for their patients is abhorrent.  Once I have these X-rays I will be looking for someone else as I wouldn't trust this place to be able to accurately diagnose or treat me for a common cold.  From start to finish this has been an awful medical practice to work with!|I can't believe the neglect I have been getting from Robert Miller and his entire office, multiple times I have called to be put on hold and get hung up on.. my voice is NOT heard. I have children to live for, i Own a house and I work 50 hours a week. Which is very difficult with a 15 year old head injury. I have fluid build up and I am forming cyst. I have had multiple MRIs and they couldn't even get those done correctly. My injury is causing extreme nausea and dizziness I can't live my life it's very painful. I explained this to my doctor and his assistant and every time I get told I am wrong. I was told there was nothing he could do about it and if he were to drain it like I asked that it wouldn't help my problem and it's a risky operation. My pcp recommended I get it drained due to the pain and I am being neglected on it by this entire office. Unbelievable these people do not care. I would strongly recommend any other office than this one and they lost me as a patient. I will say when I do get this fluid drained and my problems hopefully do go away. I will be sueing this office due to neglect and making me suffer for months on end because my voice was not heard. You can't tell these people anything. Unbelievable huge waste of my time. 6+ months|Just over 5 months ago, Dr Ty performed a double surgery on me(laminoplasty & carpal tunnel....all went well, or so I thought. I had a wonderful 2-hour visit with my 2 kids & my 2 grandsons....my son even saying "Mom, it's the best I've seen you look in 6 months!" That was about to change....
When I first arrived in my hospital room I was told pain meds every 4 hours. The next morning was told I'd be given meds "as needed." I questioned it, I just had double surgery & have severe chronic back issues that was slated for surgery upon recovery from this surgery. "Doctor's orders!" As the surgery meds wore off, I was in severe pain & needed help to get to the bathroom. By the morning, I was experiencing excruciating & immobilizing pain, I couldn't even lift myself up. I spent the entire time at Lowell General Hospital in that condition. The only time my meds were increased is when I was transferred to rehab 3 days later, so I wouldn't enter that facility practically an invalid....I was able to walk to the stretcher & my rehab bed.
I was then put back on the same dosage of pain meds Dr Ty had me on. They resorted to dragging me out of bed(as staff did at LGH) which eventually led to a brutal assault by 2 CNA's because I was in too much pain to even move & which I'm still traumatized by. This is by far the most agonizing experience in my lifetime(& I was a burn victim as a kid)! Safe to say, Dr Ty won't be performing my back surgery! He put me through HELL & I'm still there!!!

BioRestore NH Functional Medicine Practice in Nashua, New Hampshire offers comprehensive, patient-centered healthcare solutions focused on identifying and addressing the root causes of chronic health conditions. Founded on the principles of functional medicine, our practice combines advanced diagnostic testing with personalized treatment plans to restore optimal health and vitality. We serve patients throughout southern New Hampshire and the greater Nashua region who are seeking alternatives to conventional symptom-management approaches.

At BioRestore NH, we believe in treating the whole person, not just isolated symptoms. Our functional medicine practitioners take time to understand your complete health history, genetic factors, environmental influences, and lifestyle choices. This thorough approach allows us to develop customized treatment protocols that address underlying imbalances in your body's systems, promoting natural healing and long-term wellness.

Services We Offer

Our practice provides a wide range of services including comprehensive functional medicine assessments, advanced laboratory testing, nutritional counseling, hormone optimization, gut health restoration, detoxification protocols, and chronic disease management. We specialize in addressing conditions such as autoimmune disorders, digestive issues, hormonal imbalances, metabolic syndrome, chronic fatigue, and inflammatory conditions that often don't respond adequately to conventional treatments.

Visit Our Practice

BioRestore NH is conveniently located at 76 Northeastern Blvd, Suite 34, Nashua, NH 03062. Our modern facility is designed to provide a comfortable, healing environment where patients can begin their journey toward optimal health. We welcome new patients and offer comprehensive initial consultations to understand your unique health concerns and goals.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our functional medicine services, please visit our website at www.biorestorenh.com or call us at +1 888-824-4246. Our friendly staff is ready to answer your questions and guide you through the process of becoming a patient at BioRestore NH.

Pain Center Of The North Shore in Peabody, Massachusetts offers comprehensive pain management solutions for residents throughout Essex County and the greater North Shore area. Established with a mission to improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions, our medical facility combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care. Our team of board-certified specialists utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques and personalized treatment plans to address a wide spectrum of pain disorders, from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome.

At Pain Center Of The North Shore, we provide a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies. Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology that allows us to perform various minimally invasive procedures on-site, including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation trials.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. That's why our treatment philosophy centers on addressing not just the physical symptoms but also the emotional and psychological impact of living with persistent pain. Our compassionate staff works closely with each patient to develop customized treatment strategies that align with their specific goals and lifestyle needs.

Contact Information

Located at 84 Newbury St, Peabody, MA 01960, our clinic is easily accessible to patients throughout the North Shore region. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (978) 532-2650. King and Dr. Moby Parsons, this premier practice has established itself as the region's leading destination for patients seeking customized, same-day joint replacement procedures. Their innovative approach caters specifically to active individuals who want to maintain their lifestyle while addressing joint pain and mobility issues.

The practice is led by two highly-regarded surgeons with extensive experience in orthopedic medicine:

Specialized Services

King & Parsons offers a comprehensive range of orthopedic services with a focus on:

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets King & Parsons apart is their commitment to tailoring treatment plans to each patient's unique needs and goals. This summer I had both knees replaced, seven weeks apart. All in all it was a better experience than I anticipated in every aspect. The day surgeries were both as Dr. Parsons expected and much easier than I expected. I needed minimal pain management at home, I used the CPM and home PT was very helpful to get started being independent. Six weeks after knee #1 the physical therapist said i was progressing so well that knee #2 was starting to hamper my progress. Just in time, #2 was done the following week. I am now 3 months post surgery #2 and I feel great, my knees definitely function much better than before with no pain! I have great faith in Dr. Parsons and the team, I wouldn't go to any other Orthopedic Surgeon.|Dr King and all his staff were excellent.  From my initial office appointment thru the day of surgery and the follow up.  The whole team made you the patient feel relaxed and cared for prior and post surgery.  I could not have asked for anything better.  Dr King, you are one of the finest medical professionals in the area. As far as I am concerned Dr King wrote the book on the best way to achieve a successful total knee replacement.|Dr. King & his assistant are Awesome. They made a total knee replacement a positive experience. My recovery was much faster than when I had my other knee replaced several years ago by a different surgeon. I would Highly recommend Dr. King & his staff they are Marvelous. Linda V|The staff was professional caring took time to explain the procedures. They called to check up on me after the operations  Thet wanted to ensure my success in getting better.
My recovery was uneventful and just minor pain.
I have had both knees done and I am glad I did.|Dr King and his staff are amazing. I had both knees replaced and am able to do things I have not done in years. Pain free, I am no longer bow legged.  My back and balance feel amazing.  They changed my life and I will be forever grateful!!!|Dr Parsons and his team are wonderful! Their expertise along with the caring and compassion are second to none. I had a great experience with my first knee 4 years ago and even better with second one just recently. column3:
Garden State Pain Management serves Clifton, New Jersey and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management solutions. Led by Dr. Koppel, who is Board Certified and Fellowship trained in Regenerative and Interventional Pain Management, our practice brings over two decades of specialized experience to patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. We've established ourselves as a trusted resource for those seeking effective, minimally invasive alternatives to traditional pain management approaches.

At Garden State Pain Management, we focus on minimally invasive therapies for conditions affecting the neck, back, and joints. Our comprehensive treatment plans address a wide range of issues including:

  • Herniated disks

  • Spinal stenosis

  • Vertebrogenic conditions

  • Joint pain and inflammation

Cutting-Edge Regenerative Therapies

Dr. Koppel specializes in advanced regenerative medicine techniques that promote natural healing and long-term pain relief. Our innovative therapies include:

  • Platelet Rich Plasma (PRP): Utilizing the body's own healing properties

  • Stem Cell Therapy: Harnessing regenerative cellular potential

  • Exosome Treatment: Advanced cellular communication technology

  • Prolotherapy: Stimulating natural repair processes

Prestigious Training Background

Dr. Koppel's exceptional qualifications include Fellowship training at The New York Hospital/Hospital for Special Surgery and Sloan Kettering Memorial Hospital, ensuring patients receive care informed by the highest standards in medical education and practice.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services:

Website: www.gspmweb.com

column48: How does he manage pain?
column49: He first asses the pain, injury, etc.  He might suggest different tests to see exactly what's going on.   And he will suggest the best course of treatment.  That can mean prescribing meds along with therapy, or it can mean same day minor procedures or even surgery.  Regardless, if your pain is serious, you'll want to give him a chance.  He's an amazing doctor.
