column40:
This place was amazing 2 years ago, I bring my husband and sister here. The appointments were usually on time, no long waits. Today my sister's appoint is 1 hour and 15 minute waiting time, last visit was 1 hour wait for morning appointments. The staff in the back are not much help, with no empathy. Patients are literally here for pain, and this waiting time is too long for them. I think the staff are scheduling too many appointments for the same time. I wish it was as good as it used to be.|This clinic is the first that I've been able to trust. Dr. Rumbaugh is empathetic, professional, and personable. Their phlebotomist is a hoot, and very good at her job. My favorite receptionist (like ever!) is Holly. Holly always has a smile for me, a kind greeting, and takes a genuine interest in me - beyond being just another face. I'd recommend this clinic to anyone who has suffered from bad treatment elsewhere. They truly care about patients, and I'm thrilled to have found them.|I went for an appt today at 9am got there at 8:30 at 10:15 am I still wasn't seen! I decided to reschedule because I had to go to work!!! There was a rude lady in the front rolling her eyes while she was stuffing her mouth with fruit loops, as I asked to speak to a manager! I wanted to know what the purpose was to draw blood every visit!!! Just seems like they want to use up a persons medical insurance everytime for everything, welp nope I will definitely not approve there  process!
Last they have these signs that states they will not tolerate vulgar language etc but they definitely won't respect the patient care time and insurance!!! Just saying|So far, I have visited this clinic several times. The doctor and tech staff behind the scenes have been great so far. The front desk and the administrative end is a train wreck. Overly long paperwork that asks the same questions I answered previously is one example. Sending an option to do it online in a not timely manner and holding me hostage to answer the redundant questions that are a waste of time if you actually processed the previous responses. This makes you feel like you are being tested to see if you are lying between one questionnaire to another. If this end of things cleans up significantly they could be at least 4 stars.

I just visited again on 10/9/24. I showed up for my appointment only to get told the appointment was not authorized and so I wouldn't be seen. Mind you I got multiple reminders about my appointment, which was good, but nobody on their end contacted me to cancel it and not completely waste my time. This is again where the admin side of things is clearly still an issue.|Dr Raumbaugh and his staff are always so kind. I truly appreciate all he has done to make my migraines more manageable. He's very knowledgeable and always seems un rushed and truly cares about his patients.|I went into the Pain Center with very little hope. I have had migraines for 25 years. Frequent, chronic, severe,  debilitating migraines. I've seen dozens of doctors, had lots of treatments and medications. Dr. Watkins suggested a procedure that took less than an hour. I have only had 2 migraines since then. I am happy with the Pain Center, to say the least. Thank you NMPC!|For years, I was actually impressed with what quality of care I got here until things recently took a turn for the worse. My specialist did not renew his DEA license in time. During that time, no one would call me back to see what other doctor could refill my prescription. I called multiple times begging for help only to be ignored and neglected. I ended up switching to a methadone program because I didn't know where else to turn. You can't just have someone relying on medication for years and expect everything to be fine if they're suddenly unable to get that. Maybe it was a blessing in disguise. The relief I got from this clinic was barely cutting it anymore. Methadone is more efficient. All that being said, this clinic usually does a good job. I have recommended this place to several others. My specialist was one of the only people who seemed to ever believe me about my pain and listen to me about my concerns. I will miss working with him. The office staff were always pleasant and friendly too.|I was in sad shape when I arrived at NM Pain in a wheelchair. Together we formed a treatment plan that gave me the will to go on. It took a lot of hard work and numerous procedures, but they got me back on my feet.

column2: New Mexico Center for Pain & Wellness
column3:
New Mexico Center for Pain & Wellness serves Albuquerque, NM with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to improve quality of life for patients throughout the region. As a physician-owned practice, they bring specialized expertise to every case, focusing on identifying and addressing the root causes of pain rather than merely treating symptoms. Their approach is distinctively patient-centered, ensuring that each individual's voice is heard and their unique circumstances considered when developing treatment plans.

The clinical team at New Mexico Center for Pain & Wellness employs a multi-disciplinary methodology that combines various specialties to create holistic treatment plans. Their collaborative process involves not only the patient but also family members and other healthcare professionals to ensure continuity of care. This integrated approach allows them to develop sustainable solutions using evidence-based practices that represent the cutting edge of modern pain medicine.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

New Mexico Center for Pain & Wellness stands apart through their commitment to conscientious and integrative care. Their treatment protocols address not only physical pain but also consider the emotional and mental well-being of each patient. This comprehensive perspective acknowledges the complex interplay between physical discomfort and psychological health, creating more effective and lasting results.

Location and Contact Information

Address: 6330 Riverside Plaza Ln Suite 100, Albuquerque, NM 87120, United States

Phone: +1 505-322-6687

Website: [www.nmcpw.org](https://www.nmcpw.org/)

Patients seeking relief from chronic or acute pain conditions can find expert care in a supportive environment at the New Mexico Center for Pain & Wellness, where improving quality of life remains the central mission of every treatment plan.

I see they removed my review! I'll make this short! Don't bother! They look for ways to not help you. I received a bill today for my urinalysis that was done at the office. Obviously they couldn't figure out how to bill the insurance co. When my urine was negative the Nurse Practitioner you see started bringing up medications I took two months ago to refuse me medication.
Avoid the stupidity and agrivation!
Go to a DOCTOR.
And yes they treat you like a junkie and accuse you of Dr. Shipping even if you were referred!|Always so thorough and nice I can always count on empty waiting rooms no wait times it's great in and out pain free I'm in I was struggling in so much pain everyday my knees need replacement and so do both shoulders it's a lot of pain and no one wanted to deal with me because of my multiple diagnosis   So thank you so much for being my Angels to help me when I had no one to turn to. Best clinic Ever.|Front desk receptionist was very nice and Dr. Cotto was also very nice and professional as well as his assistant. Overall I will be seeing them for as long as possible and look forward to it.|Dr. Grossete is absolutely amazing. He has the best bedside manner I've seen. He really takes his time with my mom. And it's super appreciated. Always has a smile to give and enjoys my mom's humor. He's extremely knowledgeable and knows what he's doing. Front desk people are always a pleasure. Still fairly new operation, but definitely not new to the practice.|Angela is so awesome, she listens and addresses all my concerns.|Dr Morris met with my wife's grandmother and gave her an honest and detailed plan to help improve her health.  He was great as listening to her, making her feel comfortable and being empathetic, qualities her previous doctors were lacking.  Compassionate care can be difficult to come by, glad we found it in Dr Morris.|When my primary gave me my referral to New Mexico Center for pain and wellness I was quite surprised that I got a call from  Abigail scheduling  so quickly. she scheduled me for an appointment, so my first appointment was with Dr. Andrea she listen to what I had to say, and looked at my medical records and started helping me with my pain management. A few appointments later I had to have a video appointment and it was with Dr. Barazo, I was quite shocked with our appointment. He was rude extremely judge mental, and he also forgot to take care of my pain medication. This was during the Christmas holidays so I couldn't get a hold of anyone in the office to get my medication's taken care of, so after the holidays, I called the office and spoke to Abigail and she told me I apologize. Please let me get in touch with my office manager, Chrystina well that office handled it and I mean handled it . Chrystina called me apologized for the rudeness of that human being and that the patient always comes first. then also told me that she had a new doctor for me to see and his name is Dr. Mark Grossetete. so I went into my appointment with this new doctor the nurse taking care of my vitals and asking if I was OK and anything to be concerned about did she needs to let the doctor know , she is quite caring and understanding and listens to me that something that is very stellar about her and I wish I knew her name at the next appointment. I'll make sure, I have it won't forget,,,,,,,anyway  when he  Dr Grossetete  walked into the room, you could just feel a very caring , astute And extremely nonjudgmental feeling about him. He listen to my issues and is fixing my issues actually better than any other physician ever. I talk to him about some other things that I felt that needed to be addressed and he brought in a wonderful therapist. Via video ,Dr Christy Crews is amazing I didn't realize that I needed and wanted to put a mental therapist in my life and I am so grateful that New Mexico pain and wellness center is taking care of all my needs. Yeah I had a bump in the road with Dr. BARAZO but again that was all handled immediately.|******************************************************************RESPONSE FROM "OWNER" : I'm sorry to hear this. Our clinic must follow policies which was done by our NP. If there is anything that we can help you with please feel free to contact out office.

1) NOTE that the response noted that even with information below, you stated that your NP followed your policies. This response is defensive and does not acknowledge nor show any documentation showing if our interpretation is in error. Which I would gladly accept. An example below is provided for you to investigate to better serve your patients. hopefully prompting a review. The response disregards this completely and offers no information other than "We followed procedures". If you would provide a contact other than "our office" I would be glad to sit down and discuss the issues.

DO NOT GO HERE! Nurse Practitioner would NOT help with an anomaly that showed up in urine test. Their response was to immediately cease any further help. Stating the patient agreement. HOWEVER, the agreement states that if an issue is observed that the patient will be put on a closely monitored program with the intent to build trust with the Dr/Patient. THIS WAS REFUSED! They didnt even follow THEIR OWN PROCEDURES! Furthermore the NP scolded us and said "Ive spent too much time with you already" After communicating my frustration and mentioning I suffer from the aftereffects of a Traumatic Brain Injury. She responded with "I know people with brain injuries and they dont act like YOU!" In addition, She said my pleading and frustration was "abhorent" behavior. NP should be reviewed and retrained.

column3:
New Mexico Pain Associates serves Albuquerque, NM and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists has been helping patients reclaim their lives from chronic pain for over two decades. We understand that persistent pain can significantly impact your daily activities, emotional well-being, and overall quality of life. That's why we're committed to developing personalized treatment plans that address your specific needs and circumstances.

At New Mexico Pain Associates, we offer a wide range of evidence-based treatments for various pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach combines advanced interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support to provide holistic care. We specialize in treating back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain among other conditions.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing meaningful partnerships with our patients. During your initial consultation, our specialists will take the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, review your medical history, and listen attentively to your concerns. This collaborative process allows us to develop the most effective treatment strategy tailored to your unique situation and goals.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

Our modern clinic at 4630 Jefferson Ln NE, Albuquerque, NM 87109 is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies. We maintain a comfortable, welcoming environment where patients can receive care with dignity and respect.

Contact Us Today

Don't let chronic pain control your life any longer. Contact New Mexico Pain Associates at +1 505-633-4141 to schedule your consultation. Our friendly staff is ready to assist you on your journey toward pain relief and improved function. Visit our website at https://www.nmpainassociates.com/ to learn more about our services and patient resources.
column11: Don't let Chronic Pain ruin your quality of life. There is a solution for you and we will use our many years of experience to help you find your pain relief.

column40:
I can't say enough good things about Dr. Gonzales. He has done two cervical facet injection trials on me and then a bilateral cervical radio frequency ablation. All the while, he maintained lines of communication, informing me of everything he did as he was doing it. He answered all my questions in a non-condescending manner. He was aware of the unique way in which natural red heads metabolize pain medications (including opioids) differently from non-red heads and he adjusted dosing appropriately. He explained everything to me so that I understood. He is highly skilled, highly educated, and I would recommend his practice to anyone suffering from chronic neck and back pain like me. The rest of the staff at New Mexico Pain Associates was also very professional and caring. The medical assistant helping me today was Gabby, and she was a gem. She talked to me throughout the whole process, stayed with me when I asked her to, and brought me an ice pack for comfort following my procedure. She helped me feel comfortable and heard. It's a rare thing to be treated so well when all too often these days patients are gaslit and made to feel invisible. I appreciate the care I received today and gladly offer a five star review.|Dr. Gonzalez is absolutely amazing. He listens to all my concerns and needs. All nurses/staff are helpful and help bring a little light to your day. I am so grateful I was able to find such wonderful doctors/Center.|Dr Gonzalez and Figueroa are amazing doctors. They worked diligently to get to the source of my back problem!  Along with their staff Char, Bridgette, Gabby and all the others! Thank you!|New Mexico, Pain Associates (Jefferson Ln) is the best Pain clinic I have ever been to in my 30years.
I see Eddie each month and he is one of the most compassionate people I've ever met.
Dr. Gonzalez hits the spot when it comes to the Radio Frequency Ablation treatments, I receive on my Cervical and lumbar spine: which work!
I am so grateful for all the staff; Charmarie in the front who is always so kind, Ronnie whose concern & patience is admirable. Once, I am ready for RFA  I can always count on Bridgette for levity, and calmness.
As they say Pain Is inevitable, but you have options.
Suffering is a choice. Go to New Mexico Pain Associates on Jefferson Ln. You are Worth It!|Dr Gonzalez and his staff are the best. They are compassionate and walk you through every procedure and truly show they care! I will never go to another pain clinic.|Dr. Diego Gonzalez's knowledge and expertise in his field has helped my husband gain complete pain relief. He understands pain and its implications for lifestyle normalization. Thank you Dr. Gonzalez for your care.|The staff here are top notch, the staff are friendly and very helpful.
Dr  Gonzalez is very good at identifying and stopping your pain. I appreciate them taking care of my nerve pain.
I highly recommend them.
Robert Fincher|Doctor gonzalez and lauren have been fantastic providers for my needs and care. The whole staff at New Mexico pain associates have been really great.. blessings to the host staff.

New Mexico Pain Center serves Alamogordo, NM and surrounding communities with specialized interventional pain management services. Our dedicated team of American Society of Anesthesiology (ASA) Board Certified Pain Management Specialists represents the pinnacle of the medical profession, ensuring patients receive the highest quality care for chronic and acute pain conditions. Whether you're suffering from neck pain, low back discomfort, joint issues, or even cancer-related pain, our comprehensive approach combines advanced interventional procedures with medical management and therapy to create personalized treatment plans.

At New Mexico Pain Center, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our specialists offer a wide variety of interventional pain procedures designed to supplement traditional medical management and physical therapy. Our goal is to improve your quality of life by reducing pain and increasing functionality through targeted treatments.

Expert Care You Can Trust

"Choosing a pain physician is more important than just a search on Google. You want a physician who is knowledgeable, experienced, and someone you can trust." This philosophy guides our practice as we work to build lasting relationships with our patients. All procedures are performed exclusively by ASA Board Certified Pain Management Specialists, optimizing your chances of treatment success.

Our Location and Contact Information

We're conveniently located at 20 S New York Ave, Alamogordo, NM 88310. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 575-395-7246 or visit our website at [newmexicopaincenter.com](https://newmexicopaincenter.com/).

column40:
AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!  My first visit was dec 23. I had been diagnosed with a sub acute compression fracture.

Just a little background. I have had back issues since I was 14. I was diagnosed with 6 vertabrea in my lower back, normal is five. They called it a normal abnormality. This has exacerbated through the years. I now have scoliosis, 10 compression fractures. I have a Medtronic's nerve stimulator installed in my back. Unfortunately, I am no stranger to pain.

This fracture was INTENSE!

I didn't get to see the DR,  the PA came into see me. She's 6' and probably weighs 300 lbs. she came in, stood over me and crossed her arms. VERY INTIMIDATING!!  She informed me my depression score was VERY high and they have a policy and do NOT give pain pills to people with depression!!  WHAT??  I have never heard of ANYONE with chronic pain that wasn't depressed!!

ANYONE OUT THERE WITH CHRONIC PAIN THATS NOT DEPRESSED??

I, honestly don't know what I did to cause this woman not to like me?  Is it because I'm very white?  She was overbearing and rude!  Absolutely no compassion or consideration for me whatsoever!!  I think she's also a bully!

I highly do NOT recommend her!!  The rest of the staff was kind and considerate!!  Did she also look me in the eye and LIE to me!???  That is what I believe!!!|I'm loving my new pain management dr office. Whom ever said be prepared to wait you absolutely wrong. I've come twice now and got right in a room to speak to dr. Also the staff is so absolutely wonderful very courteous and very pleasant. Especially front desk Ericka . Makes my day|NM Pain center was a great experience! The staff is top notch. Everyone from the front desk, lab, retta, and karri were very helpful and very friendly.|Office staff was.vwry kind, the Nurse Practitioner on the other hand....I was pre judged, she spoke down to me like I was a child, didn't do a proper assessment instead relied on some questions in a piece.of paper. A proper assessment could dramatically change things. Walked in, in pain, walked out in pain and in tears.|Medical staff are wonderful. Very friendly and make you feel comfortable.
Only reason for low rating is the horrible experience you encounter upon arrival with the receptionist. Very rude and belittles you.
Had ask to speak with office manager several times but never happened.
Update: turns out the receptionist is the office manager. And still to this day is still sitting on her high horse. RECOMMEND YOU GO TO A DIFFERENT LOCATION.|I was just there for a follow up and blood work. They are great won't go anywhere else for my pain doctor.|They are so sweet and take time to listen to you instead of just shoving medicine down your throat for barely any relief I'm so excited to start my treatment with them.|I've been coming here for months, every time I'm greeted with kindness by the receptionist.

Also the medical staff is also very friendly.

column2: Advanced Pain and Neurology | Interventional Pain Management In Albuquerque, NM
column3:
Advanced Pain and Neurology serves Albuquerque, NM as a premier interventional pain management clinic dedicated to addressing chronic pain through innovative, non-invasive approaches. Founded with the mission of treating the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms, our practice stands out as a proudly opiate-free facility. Our team of specialized physicians combines extensive neurological expertise with cutting-edge interventional techniques to provide comprehensive care tailored to each patient's unique condition.

At Advanced Pain and Neurology, we offer a diverse range of interventional procedures designed to target pain at its source. Our treatment protocols focus on minimally invasive techniques that promote long-term relief while avoiding the risks associated with opioid medications. Each treatment plan is customized following thorough diagnostic assessments to ensure optimal outcomes for patients suffering from various pain conditions, including neuropathic pain, spinal disorders, joint pain, and complex regional pain syndromes.

Our Commitment to Opiate-Free Treatment

As an opiate-free facility, we prioritize patient safety and long-term wellness by utilizing alternative approaches to pain management. This philosophy reflects our understanding of the potential risks associated with opioid medications and our dedication to providing sustainable solutions that improve quality of life without creating dependency. Our interventional techniques often include nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and advanced injection therapies that target specific pain pathways.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing collaborative relationships with our patients, involving them in every step of their treatment journey. Our compassionate team takes the time to educate patients about their conditions and available treatment options, empowering them to make informed decisions about their care. This patient-centered approach has established Advanced Pain and Neurology as a trusted resource for pain management in the Albuquerque community.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Phone: +1 505-361-1931

Address: 4630 Jefferson Ln NE, Suite A, Albuquerque, NM 87109, United States

Website: www.apnclinic.com

My experience at this place, 'Advanced Pain and Neurology', has been amazingly helpful and a true journey for me to healthy healing and wellness. The 'medical team' that cares for my medical needs are excellent. When I say excellent...I feel in their interaction with me a strong element of caring, compassion..and..that 'they see me'. The medical team works together displaying concern for my personhood in a time of pain and discomfort! Grace is very present in making you feel a part of the healing process and helping you to focus on your needs acknowledging any discomfort one may be experiencing guiding and supporting. My medical team shows concern for my emotional and body experiences. They are patient, professional, and kind. I trust my team especially, when I have to have an 'MRI'. My medical team helps me to be comfortable in myself and in their care! They are beautiful and excellent! Being at 'Advanced Pain and Neurology' is a safe incredible place to be for a professional team of integrity to care for one's medical needs in whatever capacity needed! My heart is filled with gratitude gratefulness and thanksgiving! Thank You 'My Medical Team'!|James was great in  MRI and Grace is a wonderful and very sweet. Grace is very helpful and I enjoyed talking to her. All the staff and doctors were so awesome! The MRI was a great experience and made me feel comfortable.|Staff was exceptional! I had another MRI at another well known facility about a month ago. There is no comparison regarding the interaction with the staff. Advanced Pain and Neurology staff were superior to my "other experience". They were professional, courteous, answered my questions and made me feel comfortable. I couldn't be more happy with my experience! These guys were awesome!|The experience at Advance Pain Neurology/ABQ MRI has been great! The hospitality is amazing with warm welcoming from Grace, Faren, Jaqui, and along with the Doctors. Also everyone in the facility is amazing as well. They gave me helpful information towards my recovery/diagnosis. The environment is very well managed and clean all around. The atmosphere is very calming. The knowledge that has been given along with the treatments is helpful. The first day they do tell you that this will be a process that takes time. Just know in due time all the appointments will help me get back on track. This is definitely a facility that values their patients and put them first when they arrive and when they leave. The reminders of the appointments are well structured where it makes it easy for my appointment. Overall it's an amazing facility that if you're recovering I would definitely recommend checking it out! Great experience! :)
Gerry|When I first came in, I wasn't the best patient I should been. They have been great with rescheduling me for at least 3 weeks prior to me actually coming in. They even scheduled me a 4th time after I had come in on the wrong date
The staff is very professional and kind, helpful and I would recommend them to anyone who requires an MRI. I spoke with Grace in beginning in reassuring me I was in good hands. And I was ok.  faran was great in making sure I would be fine in tube.  Fantastic oldie music is my favorite.|I was so damaged after my auto accident, I thought I would never recover. When my regular doctors referred my to this clinic of strangers I worried I would have big bills and no real help. I was wrong, thankfully!

This clinic has a large stable of providers with different specialties, and everything is handled at this address, from assessments through treatments and follow up. Everyone treated me with compassion, even when I was grumpy or confused. They offered me only the most efficient treatments that would help, and it worked! I already feel recovered, and I have hope for my future again. I am most grateful!

Also, I think everyone there is bilingual. Spanish speakers will be heard there, just as I was.|Everyone is very friendly and kind. The office environment is clean and well decorated. If I had extra questions they were happy to help. I enjoyed my treatments here.|I cannot recommend Advanced Pain Clinic enough! The staff is professional, compassionate, and highly skilled in addressing a wide range of pain management needs. From the initial consultation to ongoing care, their team ensures that every patient feels heard and supported. This team that genuinely cares!

After speaking to several colleagues in the medical field and making some aware of my upcoming appt at LCPC I was bombarded with negative feedback. This is unfortunate because I was looking forward for a second opinion. I came online in hopes of a different answer and noticed so many negative reviews. I was also made aware, this facility is the same company as New Mexico Pain Center on Northrise. With all of this said, I will not be making it to my appointment with this facility|Currently sitting in the parking lot awaiting for a call since the inside of the office is OVERFILLED with patients waiting to be seen. Patients sitting on the floor, standing along the wall and stair case. Elderly patients standing and relying on canes to while waiting this long is ridiculous. Appointment was for 10:30, I arrived at 10:15. It is now 11:33 and I have not been seen. In the documents you sign when first being registered, is a notice for the patient stating you will be fined for being late. My question is what happens when you are awaiting over an 1.5 hours  to be seen? Communicating with other patients who are seen on a regular basis, this is sadly a constant way things are run here. Before COVID-19 this was a main issue they faced which continues now. Fasting for the procedure and adding an hour to and from for commute just adds to the dysfunction. Being told after going inside there were 7, 30min - 1hr procedures ahead of mine. This meant I would be at this facility until the afternoon waiting to be seen. There needs to be some order for future patients/clients.
The front staff is less than helpful and they rather blame the patient than fix the issue of double booking or booking patients in time slots which are unrealistic since they are not being seen or being seen later than the intended time given when the appointment was made. An office place needs administrators that will train employees to be accountable and work together to help the clients that arrive to this facility. It is not about how many clients you can get in a day for a payment but how to efficiently help those coming in through your doors and getting them the medical care they are needing which is what brought them to your facility in the first place .
EDIT:
If you cannot serve the amount of people you book, because again 2 hours and a half after the appointment time is ridiculous, you should recommended them to another facility. Yes these patients are in pain and should be given the respect of timeliness, that this facility is expecting from the individuals being seen.|The waiting room is frequently so filled, patients arriving for pain management had to stand around the waiting room.  The waits are frequently long, many time hours waiting. It feels like an assembly line. Medical Staff seem  nice, but they do jump in and our of the room with you and other patients. We were late for our last appointment, we have to drive several hours so we book all of her appointments on the same day and the previous appointment ran late. I called them to let them know and we arrived within the 15 minutes after the scheduled appointment but had to wait a long time in the line to check in. When we got to the front, the woman was rude and impatient and informed us we now had 8 people ahead of us and it would be at least 2 hours, probably more, until my daughter could be seen! They schedule far too many people than they can handle with quality and care. I suggest finding another pain management clinic. We did.|Dr. Coleman is great! CHRISTUS Trinity Clinic serves Alamogordo, NM as a specialized pain management facility dedicated to improving quality of life for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our comprehensive approach combines advanced diagnostic techniques with personalized treatment plans to address the root causes of pain while minimizing reliance on medication. The clinic's team of board-certified specialists brings decades of combined experience in pain management, offering hope and relief to residents throughout Otero County and surrounding communities.

At CHRISTUS Trinity Clinic, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary team provides evidence-based treatments including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy coordination, and patient education. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain using the latest techniques and technologies available in pain medicine.

Patient-Centered Approach

Every treatment plan begins with a thorough evaluation to understand your unique pain experience. Our providers take time to listen, developing customized strategies that align with your goals and lifestyle. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible, focusing on sustainable pain relief and improved function rather than temporary solutions.

Part of the CHRISTUS Health Network

As part of the respected CHRISTUS Health system, our clinic maintains the highest standards of medical excellence while delivering compassionate care rooted in our mission to extend the healing ministry of Jesus Christ. Patients benefit from seamless coordination with other specialists within the CHRISTUS network when additional care is needed.

Contact Information

Address: 2559 Medical Dr Suite 3300, Alamogordo, NM 88310, United States

Call today to schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists and take the first step toward reclaiming your active lifestyle.

column3:
Dr. Irwin J. Isaacs, MD in Albuquerque, New Mexico offers specialized pain management solutions through innovative regenerative medicine techniques. As the founder of the PRP Pain Institute, Dr. Isaacs has established a premier medical practice dedicated to helping patients overcome chronic pain conditions without relying solely on traditional pharmaceutical approaches. His clinic, conveniently located on Montgomery Boulevard, serves patients throughout the Albuquerque metropolitan area with personalized treatment plans focused on platelet-rich plasma therapy and other cutting-edge interventions.

At the PRP Pain Institute, Dr. Isaacs provides a range of advanced treatments designed to address various pain conditions. His approach combines medical expertise with regenerative techniques that stimulate the body's natural healing processes. Patients suffering from joint pain, sports injuries, arthritis, and chronic musculoskeletal conditions can find relief through customized treatment protocols developed specifically for their unique needs.

Specialized Treatment Options

The clinic specializes in Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) therapy, a revolutionary treatment that utilizes components from the patient's own blood to accelerate healing and reduce inflammation. Dr. Isaacs also offers complementary therapies that work synergistically with PRP to maximize results and provide comprehensive pain relief. Each treatment plan is developed following thorough evaluation and consultation to ensure optimal outcomes.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Isaacs prioritizes patient education and involvement in the treatment process. New patients receive detailed consultations where they can discuss their symptoms, medical history, and treatment goals. The clinic's supportive staff ensures a comfortable experience from the initial appointment through follow-up care. Most treatments are performed on an outpatient basis with minimal downtime, allowing patients to return to their daily activities quickly.

Contact Information and Location

The PRP Pain Institute welcomes new patients seeking innovative solutions for chronic pain. The clinic is located at 4163 Montgomery Blvd NE, Albuquerque, NM 87109. Appointments can be scheduled by calling +1 505-503-6990. For additional information about services and treatment options, patients are encouraged to visit the official website at http://prppaininstitute.com/.

Established as a premier medical facility dedicated to alleviating chronic and acute pain conditions, our center combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care. Our board-certified specialists utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative therapies to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Located conveniently on Wilshire Boulevard, we've become a trusted resource for residents throughout Chaves County seeking lasting relief from debilitating pain conditions.

At New Mexico Pain Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. Our team specializes in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Each treatment plan is individually tailored to address the unique needs and circumstances of our patients, with the goal of improving function and quality of life.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

Our Roswell facility features advanced diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable, patient-centered environment. The center is designed to provide a calming atmosphere while ensuring efficient care delivery. Our procedure rooms are equipped with fluoroscopic guidance systems for precise interventional treatments, and our examination rooms offer privacy and comfort during consultations.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and active participation in their treatment plans. Our staff takes the time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes. I have no words for how disappointed in the care I've received from this facility that calls themself a pain management facility. I waited over 3 hours at my first appointment and brought with me my pain management records from where we moved from. I'm allergic to all opioids and have been on a helpful medication for 6 years that after 3 visits and lied to at the first two was told it's not going to be refilled by them and not part of their protocol. It's not a controlled substance and has a lot of research behind it for pain  management help for my conditions. If they can't study, research and adapt and innovate they are just trained monkeys with protocols made by who knows...sickened by this medical practice and will not recommend them to anyone. Absolutely no clue about some real medical conditions and how they could help people.|Excellent customer service, I did paperwork, labs and visit and was out in about 1 hr and 30 minutes. Staff was super sweet and helpful, even after a million questions. Definitely an amazing place, I truly appreciate it so much. Dealing with pain reading the previous reviews I was really worried, but the experience was Awesome! Thanks again for everything guys, you Rock!|Dr. Ravvesoud, Dr. Placenio have been really great with me. They listen, they remember me and my history, they care about my care. And if there are any issues they work quick to help me and make sure I have the care I need. I have been going here since 2020 and have gotten alot of help with my Chronic Pain and health issues. The best I have recieved since my Injuries in 2015. I really appreciate them....|The doctor doesn't do pain medication so if your from out of town try else where. He's also too rushed for questions. The CMAs are very caring they were the only good thing about the place.|I cannot help but to feel that this is nothing but a pill pushing place! Read their paperwork carefully! I will NOT agree to take whatever medication the doctor prescribes because I will NOT take your horrific pills that do nothing but create addicts! I also will NOT allow myself to be treated like an addict when I am NOT there for pills!!! Also, after an hour and a half of waiting I had to leave for other important engagements.  I would NOT recommend this place at all!!!|If I could leave "0" stars I would!! They make you wait a very long time to be seen! The front desk staff are extremely rude and I have many complaints! I have video!|I am not sure if they cause pain or treat pain but all I've experienced is pain.|Great doctors and treatment, but usually an hour or more wait for the appointment and month or more out for scheduling.
I really like that they draw blood and do UA on site so that I don't have to make a special/ additional stop.

New Mexico Pain Center serves Santa Fe, NM and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located in the heart of Santa Fe at 421 St Michaels Dr, our specialized clinic combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Under the expert guidance of Dr. John Watkins and our dedicated team, we offer personalized treatment plans addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions.

At New Mexico Pain Center, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, incorporating the latest medical advancements with traditional therapies. Our treatment options include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies designed to target the source of pain while improving overall function and quality of life.

Meet Dr. John Watkins

Dr. Watkins brings extensive experience in pain medicine to our practice. With specialized training in interventional techniques and comprehensive pain management, he works closely with each patient to develop customized treatment plans. His patient-centered approach focuses on not just alleviating symptoms but addressing underlying causes of pain while minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Care

We understand that pain affects every aspect of life, which is why our approach extends beyond physical symptoms to address the emotional and psychological impacts of chronic pain. Our comfortable, welcoming facility is designed to put patients at ease from the moment they arrive. New patients are encouraged to visit our website at https://newmexicopaincenter.com/dr-john-watkins/ to learn more about our services and approach.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 505-264-9961. Our clinic is conveniently located at 421 St Michaels Dr, Santa Fe, NM 87505, with accessible parking and amenities. We work with most major insurance providers and offer assistance with paperwork and authorization processes to ensure a smooth experience for our patients.

column40:
Read whole post :This place was a joke! Horrendous. Went first time with CD 1.5 yrs old. Dr Watkins says ,oh this is too old, go get another MRI. Got another MRI and he waltzes in and says, severe deterioration , increased since last time, too old for surgery ..then.." I'm leaving ". As in leaving the practice.
Then He says, " Viya con Dios". Done. Are you kidding me!?!! Some guy supposedly coming  up in the future to see patients. They are overwhelmed and could give a shit.
*******    I DID RETURN... the Dr. now is Dr. Vasquez. He had good bedside manner, listened well, discussed MRI results and current medications. We decided on a treatment for next month. We will see. He comes over from Texas  once a month amd even brought some of his staff from Texas. This  was a MUCH more hopeful, professional, educational visit. The staff was extremely friendly as well. . I do believe in giving people and places second chances.|Dr. John Watkins is an absolutely amazing doctor. He truly cares about his patience and their care! His staff is equally amazing and I am blessed to have Dr. Watkins and his team taking care of my pain management. He has never pushed me to do procedures that I can not afford as i do not have insurance. He does everything to take care of me and he has put me on a new medication that has helped my RSD like no other doctors have. I am so happy to be off all the pain and nerve medication that didn't help me, just "got" me through the day. Now i live a fulfilling life thanks to his care! If you are in need of a great pain management doctor, this is the doctor to see. I drive 2 hours one way to see him and I will never change my doctor unless he retires! Thank you, Dr. Watkins and your staff for the amazing treatments I receive from you and your staff!|The staff is amazing. I always feel better after seeing them. They take blood with no pain and they always have a smile, asking how i'm doing. Judith is so easy to talk with. Doctor. Watkins and i are on the same page/team in trying several methods of improving my pain. Exercise, meds, nutrition. What a great pain doc! Thank you all! Keith|I have a lot of nervous system issues with pain and other neurological symptoms. The medical system in general has conditioned me to keep it to myself and not make doctor appointments because its a complicated mess of issues and most doctors stop listening or get frustrated if the explanation of symptoms is longer than a sentence. Dr. Watkin's was incredibly kind and empathetic and really listened to my issue and seemed to be knowledgable about what I was dealing with and some solutions for long term treatments as well as short term treatments. The nurse was just as great. Feeling more optimistic about the future for the first in a while and glad I got a referral to go here.|From the very beginning I have had nothing but a wonderful experience with The New Mexico Pain Center, in particular Dr. Watkins. I had seen 2 previous doctors, who totally misdiagnosed what was causing my pain. He ordered an MRI which was able to show what was causing the pain. He and his staff have been wonderful in helping me to find the proper surgery I needed as well finding the perfect neurosurgeon and hospital. I am forever grateful to them for finding the cause of my pain and offering me a new perspective on life. Thank you Dr. Watkins!|I am a frail 75 year-old woman with severe osteoporosis and scoliosis who had a Vertaflex procedure performed by Dr John Watkins in January 2023. It was an amazing success. I had had pinched nerves for decades. By surgically placing spacers between L3-L4 and L4-L5, the pain was relieved dramatically. I was walking the next day. Prior to the surgery, I had been walking with the help of trekking poles to help stabilize my steps and I no longer use them at all!

The staff are incredibly kind, decent, good, and true. I really, really like how well they all get along with each other. I can't thank Dr Watkins enough for his incredible care. He's my hero.|I have chronic pain and recently moved from California to Santa Fe. I wanted to keep my pain med routine. I met with Dr Watkins at New Mexico Pain Center and I was very impressed with Dr Watkins' calmness. He made several valid suggestions for my pain management care that I was very excited about. In addition, the staff that works at New Mexico Pain Center are top notch. I'm really looking forward to working with Dr Watkins and the New England Mexico Pain Center.!!!!!!!!|I had been seeing dr. Watkins over the course of 5 months. I had called to schedule a  new appointment with him. I felt as though I was being integrated by Raina. I had to defend the unbearable pain - I sometimes get. I was made to feel like like I was drug seeking. The clerical staff was beyond unprofessional. Raina was obviously picking a fight with me over the phone. She discharged me immediately. Because they wanted me to respond negatively. I did indeed call her a B at that point. Don't be fooled by their website. I am only ONE of the MANY they discharge so easily. After pleading my case to the manager  Misty I quickly realized there was zero point in doing so. It became abundantly clear that I was not going to be listed to. My request to speak to dr. Watkins was denied. No surprise there. I found out that once you are discharged from ONE clinic - you are dismissed from the rest. I would have been willing to travel to Albuquerque. But that's the rules. If you insist on going here be prepared to be belittled and expected NOT to defend yourself against the Gestapo.    Their building does NOT meet ADA requirements.

Agape Pain Management and Anesthesia serves Las Cruces, NM and the surrounding Southern New Mexico region with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our integrated approach combines specialized medical care with physical therapy to address chronic and acute pain conditions affecting bones, muscles, and nerves. At Agape, we recognize that persistent pain can be both physically and emotionally draining, which is why our dedicated team works collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

Our facility houses both Agape Pain Management and Anesthesia and the Agape Physical Therapy and Wellness Center, creating a seamless care experience for our patients. This integrated approach allows us to address pain from multiple angles, combining medical interventions with therapeutic exercises and rehabilitation techniques. Our goal isn't simply to mask symptoms but to identify and treat the underlying causes of your discomfort, helping you regain functionality and improve your quality of life.

Personalized Treatment Approach

What sets Agape apart is our commitment to individualized care. Our team of doctors, physical therapists, and specialists collaborates to create unique treatment plans that address your specific pain concerns. We utilize proven methods and evidence-based practices to restore functionality, rebuild strength, and renew your health. Whether you're suffering from back pain, joint issues, neuropathy, or post-surgical discomfort, our comprehensive approach aims to revitalize you and eliminate your pain so you can live life on your own terms.

Our Location and Contact Information

You can find us at 2170 E Lohman Ave, Suite C, Las Cruces, NM 88001. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (575) 449-7002 or visit our website at www.agapepain.com. Our team is ready to help you begin your journey toward a more active and fulfilling life free from the limitations of chronic pain.

When setting up an appointment for my dad we had a great on the phone experience, Holli was so nice, knowledgeable and a truly a star when it comes with dealing with patient concerns. Made us feel welcome. However, when we got into office it was a completely different experience.. The girls at reception hardly seem to know what they're doing, they seem frantic and rude, didn't even ask for my dads pharmacy. Had to receive a call back 2 hours after leaving to provide that info.

3/5 stars. 0 stars for the office but 5 STARS for HOLLI|Dr. Williams and his staff are fantastic. They listen, care, and the wait time is minimal. I have severe chronic back and body pain due to severe septic shock, multiple surgeries, etc. I could not have found a better place to help me. I feel welcome and cared for. Thank you all!|There is 1 goofball here that is still burdening their coworkers and patients with mask-wearing as we approach the year 2025.

I kindly ask you to stop depriving your practice of facial expressions and smiles. I challenge you to consider that the masks being worn by your patients and coworkers aren't sufficient to accomplish anything. Nobody else is still engaged in this laughable measure.

It's an oppressive and cumbersome reminder of a shameful time; a filthy bacterial petri dish that lets the bulk of them pass on through. Meanwhile--you're breathing exhaust.

Aerosol's travel through our air, atmosphere, the breeze, and those tiny spaces in fabric. Consider the impact breathing one's own moist, bacterial exhaust has on a person. Consider that nobody in your building is keeping that mask on constantly because they don't want to wear that thing.

Your coworkers don't want to wear a mask. It's obvious. I'll bet your patients don't either. Are you thinking of them, or only of yourself? Why are we having to live and behave like diseased filthy animal after 1000's of years surviving on this planet? This a political manipulation, not an effective health precaution long-term.

The rest of the world around this building has learned something and moved on.

How do you get to work? How do you buy food? How did you survive before 2020? Certainly you're not a bubble-person. Come on back down to earth. We're waiting for you with smiles.|Arrived 10 minutes early for my appointment to a crowded waiting area. I watched it empty and refill, people after me come and gone. While waiting an elderly man came in, was addressed by name by staff, he said his conditioning repair man was coming and he couldn't be late getting home. About an hr after I arrived was I taken to a room. I told the staff I was almost an hour after my appointment, that my time was as important as Dr.s. I was told 'we are short staffed' I waited 20 more minutes and I hear the older gentleman in the next room. Dr. is in the room to left and the older gentleman to my rt. Next I hear Dr talking with the older man, skipped past me, I walked out 1:15 minutes past my appointment. Never did see the Dr. and canceled all appointments, won't be back. I'm respectfully on time, the Dr is disrespectful when he is not close to on time. Poor scheduling is NOT and excuse, your the Dr. and responsible to see your on time, I opened your schedule for you.

One only because no zero|This place does not respect your time, often waiting 2 hours past an appointment time. Just to get in to the room to wait some more and then only get 5 minutes with the doctor who doesn't listen to facts about your case. Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else.|Great place to get rehab ..don't rush you great personal .and very polite on the other hand dr.office is a chaos 1 hr28 minutes to get called and another 28 minutes to get seen ,,,,to be out. In 3 minutes I think that I'm in a closet|The MAs are the ones who decide what order patients are seen instead of what time patients arrive. I was there a long time and Dr was seeing patients who arrived after me. The managers don't care.|Great doctors!  Very unprofessional office staff.  Long waits, and argumentative when trying to resolve issues.  Also too lazy to verify insurance co-pay.

Pain Solutions serves Albuquerque, NM as a premier interventional pain management clinic dedicated to addressing chronic pain conditions through comprehensive treatment approaches. Established as a trusted healthcare provider in the region, Pain Solutions combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Under the leadership of nationally recognized physician Dr. Craig Nairn, MD, the practice has built a reputation for excellence in diagnosing and treating persistent pain conditions that affect thousands of New Mexico residents.

At Pain Solutions, patients benefit from a wide variety of state-of-the-art interventional and medical pain management techniques. Dr. Nairn employs evidence-based approaches to address complex pain conditions, recognizing that each patient's experience with pain is unique. The clinic's comprehensive diagnostic capabilities allow for precise identification of pain sources, enabling targeted treatment plans that address the root causes rather than merely masking symptoms.

Multidisciplinary Approach

Understanding that chronic pain affects all aspects of an individual's life, Pain Solutions embraces a multidisciplinary approach to treatment. The clinic actively collaborates with other healthcare providers and specialists throughout the Albuquerque community to ensure patients receive holistic care. This integrated approach may include physical therapy, psychological support, medication management, and advanced interventional procedures, all coordinated to maximize patient outcomes.

Expert Leadership

Dr. Craig Nairn brings national recognition and extensive expertise to Pain Solutions. His specialized training in interventional pain management techniques allows the clinic to offer advanced procedures that may not be widely available elsewhere in the region. Patients benefit from his commitment to staying at the forefront of pain management innovations and his dedication to personalized care.

column40:
I just like to say Dr Naran is absolutely wonderful he is really a good doctor and very caring. However, Pain Solutions really needs to take a step back and look at the people that they have answering their phones-- they never ever return phone calls and the girl at the front desk is so hard to deal with and difficult.   She really needs to look at her job position and see if she is right for that job  & she needs retraining, if she stays in this position. I am just about at the point that I want to change doctors because I can't ever seem to get through to anyone at all. That is so unfair to me the patient, and also unfair Dr Narin to be losing a patient|Dr. Nairn is awesome, and the staff are always friendly! Hannah specifically made the billing so much easier! Can't recommend them enough|Dr. Nairn is fantastic! He's been doing this for a long time, and trust me when I say he knows his stuff. Also, he's genuinely a nice person to talk to. He's empathic, knowledgeable, kind and competent!
I have to pay out of pocket since my insurance isn't contracted with his clinic, but his prices are fair. For example he's charging $150 for 3 or more triggers point injections. Lovelace downtown tried to charge me over $2000 for the same procedure. It really shows you how much certain hospitals are milking patients for $$$$, but not this clinic. Also his fee schedule for all procedures is accessible for anyone to look at, and not intentionally opaque and confusing like most hospitals. Great place and great doctor!|Full pockets for him, permanent damage for me.
This guy is a player.  He will tell you anything you want to hear in order to keep you coming back to his office.  He did the one thing a health care provider should never do. He told me he would make my pain go away.  I believed him.
I saw him 3 times.  He tried something different every time.  The third time, he JABBED the needle into the wrong spot on my neck.  He of course blew it off, so I tried not to worry about it.  I now have a pain going down the left side of my neck that is worse than the pain I was seeing him for!
Every single person that works in that office is unfriendly and miserable.  That right there should have told me what kind of person he is.
When I asked for pain medication, I was told I'd have to come in monthly.  Guess his wife must be a big spender.  Gotta keep the bank account full!
Don't waste your time and money here if you actually want to get better.|A Remarkable Journey to Pain Relief with Dr. Nairn:
I am writing this review today to share my incredible experience under the care of Dr. Craig Nairn, an exceptional pain doctor who has been my trusted ally for over a decade. It is disheartening to come across a negative online review that does not accurately reflect Dr. Nairn's outstanding abilities and unwavering dedication to patient care. I feel compelled to provide an honest and glowing account of the exceptional care I have received.

When I walked into Pain Solutions, I was greeted with professionalism, empathy, and a genuine commitment to improving my quality of life. My once unbearable pain has been transformed under Dr. Nairn's expert guidance. Their comprehensive treatment approach and innovative techniques have significantly reduced my pain levels. Now I only require an annual visit.

Dr. Craig Nairn's medical knowledge and diagnostic skills are truly exceptional. He possesses an uncanny ability to listen attentively, understand the complexities of my pain, and develop personalized treatment plans that address my specific needs. Dr. Nairn's commitment to staying at the forefront of pain management is evident in his continuous pursuit of the latest advancements and techniques, ensuring the best possible outcomes for his patients.

What sets Dr. Craig Nairn apart is his genuine dedication to patient well-being. He approaches everyone with compassion and care, taking the time to understand their unique circumstances. Dr. Nairn consistently goes above and beyond by collaborating with other specialists and advocating for additional resources when necessary. His commitment to holistic care is commendable and truly makes a difference in the lives of his patients.

Under Dr. Craig Nairn's expert care, my life has transformed significantly. What was once a daily battle against excruciating pain and limited mobility has metamorphosized into a life of freedom and possibility. Thanks to Dr. Nairn's expertise and compassionate approach, I engage daily in once-unimaginable activities. Their unwavering dedication to my well-being has empowered me to reclaim my life and embrace a future free from the constraints of chronic pain.

For anyone seeking a pain doctor who possesses both extensive knowledge and genuine compassion, I wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Craig Nairn and Pain Solutions. Their commitment to excellence, innovative approach to pain management, and unwavering support for their patients make them an invaluable resource. If you are searching for a doctor who will not only alleviate your pain but also empower you to live a fulfilling life, Dr. Craig Nairn is the one to trust.

In conclusion, I am immensely grateful to Dr. Craig Nairn for his life-changing impact on my journey to pain relief. His expertise, dedication, and compassionate care have made all the difference. I hope this review serves as verification to the exceptional care provided by Dr. Nairn and helps counteract any unjust negativity that may exist.

As a patient, I can confidently say that the support and care received from Dr. Nairn, his medical expertise, and his staff at Pain Solutions far outweigh any administrative challenges that arise as they do at every medical office from time to time. The positive impact on my life, transforming it from one filled with horrible pain and substantial limitations to one of hope and freedom, is a testament to Dr. Nairn's dedication and skills.

Thank you, Dr. Craig Nairn, for being the epitome of excellence in pain management. Your unwavering commitment to improving the lives of your patients is truly commendable. I am forever grateful for the exceptional care you have provided me.|I have been a customer of Dr. Narin for more than 6 years now, and I don't really have any issues or complaints. The hours they are open are perfect for me.

Yes, sometimes I have a little difficultie getting an appointment at the exact time I want one, but the office staff work diligently to get me an appointment as close to my preferred time and day as possible.

The office staff are as polite and knowledgeable as I could ever want or need.

Whenever I have any questions I can get them answered in the office during my appointment, over the phone any time I call, or through the 'Patient Portal' (any time of the day or night).

Unfortunately, there aren't enough Doctors, and staff, like him and his support staff around these days! That's the only issue I actually have. But, I specifically request,  enjoy, and prefer, seeing Dr. Elizabeth. She has a very long (for me) and hard to remember and pronounce last name. I've NEVER found another doctor that is as knowledgeable, caring, hard working, dedicated, friendly, understanding or all around genuinely compassionate as she is! Her smile and kind words never slip or falter . . . because they are equally as genuine as the rest of her and her energy is so welcoming, healing and powerful . . . I NEVER leave her office feeling beat~down, unheard, not listened to, made to feel bad about myself or the help I need, or made to feel tiny, ignorant, insignificant or like I should be grateful that a doctor is willing to even squeeze me into their schedule! Dr. Elizabeth is more than just a daily refreshing breath of air or a kind smile, she's real, empathetic and genuine.
Sandra B.
Albuquerque, NM|Dr. Nairn has a bedside manner unrivaled by any doctor I've personally visited. He's empathetic, caring, an active listener, and as a former anesthesiologist, a pain expert.

Pain Solution's PA, Elizabeth, is an excellent health care provider as well. Elizabeth is kind, a good listener, and focused on providing the best care.

Both Dr. Nairn and Elizabeth take the field of pain medicine seriously and always share information on the latest medical updates related to my conditions each time I have an appointment.|Was able to see Dr. Nairn within a week and a half. He is very good and very personable. Hard to find both sometimes! I received a cervical steroid injection. Quick, painless and now I am pain free.
Full disclosure however. They were not contracted with my insurance company but don't let that deter you. I will bill my own insurance and collect what they pay. It was well worth it. You can't put a price on being pain free!  I highly recommend Pain solutions. Dr. Nairn and his staff are great.

Doc. Pacheco is fantastic but will not be handling pain management service in 3 months from December '24... He's been so great. Now to find someone else....|They try to charge you $80 for a missed appointment...even if they fail to send out the appointment reminders.

Have a meeting last minute, they don't care.

Have a class that runs longer than normal, and you needed to be there for a grade and completion of a lab...they don't care.

Essentially, they do good work...however, it's all about them and only they matter, you are just a number.

When there, they are nice enough people...but their efficiency and operational fortitude are meh.|UPDATE: 8/31st. it's been 2 weeks and still no returned call to reschedule my appointment.  Not that I would anyway. However,  I have received an $80 bill for services NOT rendered. Can you say...inept, unprofessional, irresponsible, and just downright annoying!

I was referred through my doctor. It took 10 weeks to get an appointment. I received several appointment reminders through email and texts, none of which mentioned to call into the office 1.5 hours ahead of my appointment time to confirm arrival. Once I arrived for my appointment,  I was informed I had missed my check-in time. I advised I was never informed about a call-in time. I was informed I would have to call back and reschedule. I'm standing there face to face, but I have to call in. The receptionist was being given these instructions from some anonymous person off to the side. Having waited 10 weeks pain medication-free, because I could not even book an appointment until I was off my current meds with no refills pending, on a triple-digit degree day and in severe pain, I returned home and called back. I was told the scheduler was not available and I had to leave a message. I have been waiting 1 week now for the office to call me to reschedule my appointment.  Meanwhile, I am still without any pain medication. The appropriate response would have been for them to apologize for THEIR mistake,  and seen to it that a new appointment date was a top priority.  This is all very unprofessional and I will be searching for another clinic.|I have been seen for 3+ years here. The staff on Pacheco and Dr Rice side are always so awesome and helpful! Dr Pacheco and Rice both are great and have always listened to me when I would explain things going wrong. I see Pacheco for pain management and I see Dr Rice for injections. I was sent from Academy Orthopedic which each and every one of these Drs have helped me so much! I still have pain but it's being managed. They don't make you feel like you are crazy or lying they try to get to the bottom of what is going on and why. I'm very thankful for this office and everyone who works there. I see some negative reviews and wonder if they are seriously talking about the same place I am. I have never had issues or anyone rude to me at this clinic. If I could rate with more  stars I would.|My Mom is a patient at this office and Dr Rice is an excellent Doctor.  I went into the appointment with my 88 year old mother and Dr Rice was very kind, very optimistic,  and has an excellent bedside manner.  He carefully explained all of her options and, he spoke to mother and not me.   His nurse also is very kind and helpful and respectful.   The only drawback is the receptionist.   I heard her yelling at my mother on the phone prior to her appointment,  she was very gruff when we checked in, and she was rudely talking about my mom which I could plainly hear through the glass.  Would we see Dr Rice again?  Without a doubt!  Somebody just needs to train the receptionist that she is the first point of contact and is 100% in customer service.|My grandma has been very sick lately and  went into heart failure and now her kidneys are not functioning right. I have been taking care of her dealing with all her stuff. I mixed up my appointment that was today thinking it was Friday called to cancel and was told your appointment is today and Dr Rice won't want to see you again. I said my grandma is sick I am sorry I have proof I mixed it up on the day please don't do this. She told me basically in a rude way oh well in more words then that. It's sad doctors can treat patients this way and throw them away like trash when I was just going for radiofrequency and not pain medication so it wasn't like I Violated some contact. I was discriminated against since I have a sick grandma and also I believe because I was told by them they check your financial worthiness to see if you got to pay upfront and I think they pick and choose who to keep. It's fine I know my rights I will be contacting the proper people to report this treatment. To bad because Dr Rice seemed nice at first and skilled but he obviously is in it for the money and not how patients feel or if things are not perfect and exact he throws you away. It's a shame and his front desk lady is rude in a passive aggressive way. Not like she has a hard Job anyone could do her job so I'm not to sure why she behaves that way. I would not recommend this place because you will get thrown away once you miss one appointment by mistake or can't meet their financial worthiness criteria. And this is why the United states has such crappy doctors and medical services because doctors do whatever they want, Dr Rice is prime example.|Run don't walk to a different pain clinic.
Dr Rice is rude, unprofessional, didn't listen to my pain issues, scheduled me for a nerve ablation without any pain relief and his front office staff are almost as rude as Dr. Rice. I changed pain clinics  and I love my doctors and their staff. There are many pain docs now a days so pick anyone but here.

doesn't cared|I went to this practice for SEVERE pain in my hip. The PA I was burdened with, was a rude "B". She would not even listen to the problems I was having with my hip. She focused on my back. I told her I was not asking for help with my back, I have an excellent orthopedist who takes care of it. She insisted I needed procedures on my back and wanted to schedule for the next week for Dr Rice to do these procedures. I thought to myself no way is a stranger working on my back. She got up to make my appointment with Dr Rice. I said wait a minute, what about my hip?  She said it was probably nothing. She was rude and unprofessional with a narcissistic personality.
As it turned out, it was a really big something, requiring a 6 hour surgery to repair, months of intense rehab, and 2.5 months post op still using a walker so as not to put weight on my hip.
I no longer see her name on their web site, wonder why?  I hope she has lost her license!

column40: Being in constant pain is debilitating. My life after cancer has been markedly more slow and frustrating.  I am not agreeable to much. And labeled often. I take pain  medication very seriously and as a last resort. I'm grateful for the ablation and medication. I hope one day my chronic pain will dissipated as seamlessly as it came. In the meantime I will continue to work diligently pushing myself in occupational therapy, in gentle exercise, in eating responsibly, in remembering to take my pain meds and talk therapy. One day I will ride my horse again. Thank you dr g|My mother in law came to see Dr. Gonzalez for a shot for pain relief. He was immediately rude to her and asked her what she was there for, as if he had no clue already. She said that she wasn't sure, the Doctor then said where would you like your shot, and my mom responded saying I'm not sure. He then said we'll make up your mind! My 78 year old mother in law with several disabilities had to be forcibly talked to like that! No bedside manner at all! Not happy, not happy at all!|Dr. Gonzalez is a most outstanding physician. His very busy practice is wonderfully run and very timely. Every member of his staff I have encountered from the women who staff the front desk to nurses, technicians, PAs and of course Dr. Gonzalez himself are excellent. I feel a staff this professional, caring and kind are a testament to the doctor who employs them. They've changed my quality of life giving me so much hope and ability to enjoy the remainder of my time on this planet. What better testament can one give?|I was referred to Dr Gonzalez, my experience was normal and effective. The team there are friendly. Dr Gonzalez did the treatment 2 appointment shots then the ablation treatment fast no pain just a ache. Thank you Dr Gonzalez and his team. I do recommend Dr Gonzalez|Dr. Gonzalez stood across the room, leaning against the wall, white coat, arms crossed. So arrogant.  Female assistant came in and talked to me while he watched. I could not have imagined a worst experience with a doctor.  He only wanted to do injections.  More money for him.  It was so upsetting that years later I haven't forgotten it.|I scheduled an appointment for my back and they had to reschedule after I had already taken off work then when I went in for my appointment I explained to them the pain I'm having and Dr. Gonzalez didn't even see me just his female assistant and right away she recommended an injection procedure. I asked if they can schedule an MRI first before  the injection procedure and his AST  said no. I have really good insurance and I want an MRI just incase I have a tumor on my spine or something is seriously wrong with my back but they won't schedule me for an MRI I don't mind getting the injection but they need to send me for an MRI so they know why my back is hurting so bad.|After a horrific auto accident in 2021, I was referred here by my primary care physician. I've had injections, ablations, ketamine IV's, and trials for spinal cord stimulators. Dr G and his staff have been sweethearts throughout all of these procedures. I was getting NO relief for my constant pain before coming here. These people have given me a reason to get out of bed every day. God bless them!|Dr Gonzalez turned my husband's life around with a morphine pump and vertiflex. We were able to drop 21 opioids a day. He is so much more comfortable after nearly 3 years in terrible pain.

They are always very patient and informative they went above and beyond to take care of my needs Thank you all,  Everyone friendly, Clean facility. I love this place.|This place has become the worst pain management place I've ever seen. It used to be a great place and Dr Pupiales was so helpful and concerned about my chronic pain problems but I was thrown away like so many chronic pain patients become. And now I'm lucky if I even get my meds refilled. I haven't received a single call from them in over a year and I was getting spinal injections to block the pain but I haven't had one in over two years now. I have gave up all hopes of ever receiving any kind of help for my chronic pain problems so I went through treatment and got off the opiate pain pills and now I just live with the pain the best I can. column3:
Pain Management Clinic at Three Crosses Regional Hospital serves Las Cruces, NM and surrounding communities with specialized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team of board-certified pain specialists combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and improve their quality of living. Located in the heart of Las Cruces, our clinic operates as an integral part of Three Crosses Regional Hospital's comprehensive healthcare system.

At the Pain Management Clinic, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain therapy treatment. Our specialists develop personalized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and behavioral health interventions. We understand that pain affects each patient differently, which is why we take the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition before recommending a course of treatment.

Conditions We Treat

Our experienced providers specialize in treating a wide range of pain conditions, including:

  • Arthritis pain

  • Acute and chronic back pain

  • Lower back pain and neck pain

  • Failed back surgery syndrome

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Nerve pain disorders

  • Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy (RSD)

  • Headaches and migraines

  • Opioid dependence

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering our patients through education and active participation in their treatment plans. Our goal is not just to manage symptoms but to address the underlying causes of pain whenever possible. For patients dealing with opioid dependence, we offer specialized programs designed to safely reduce reliance on pain medications while effectively managing pain.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please contact us at +1 575-800-3137. Our clinic is conveniently located at 2550 Samaritan Dr, Las Cruces, NM 88001.

For more information about our services, visit our website at www.threecrossesregional.com/pain-management-clinic/
