Talked over me and sounded like someone that was hired off the street with no training.  She talked over me, didn't want to hear what I was saying.  Told me they see over 150 patients a day and made me feel like I didn't matter. I am in pain.  I understand you are busy, but don't treat me like I am just a number.  I heard all I need to hear. Looking elsewhere for care.|No experience. Was referred by a pain doc in Rio Rancho and have severe stenosis (cervical and ?) and will need surgery. But I did get a call from them to schedule me, and asked if they would even bother to get my pain under control so I can stabilize before a surgery and don't die while under. I was told this place does not prescribe controlled substances. This is getting insane. These crazy laws have got to change. People in pain are dying due to lack of access to the pain relief they should have. Just here so you don't waste your time if you need opioids (legal ones) for your pain.|This morning I called over to the UNM Pain Clinic to see if they ever got the referral from the pain specialist at Modern Pain and Spine. The receptionist said that they definitely got it but they sent the referral back to Modern Pain and Spine with the idiotic explanation that they would only except a referral from a primary doctor and that I didn't have current imaging of the area in question or the right documentation. So, I called over to Modern Pain and Spine and the very nice guy receptionist confirmed that UNM sent back the referral to them. I got the distinct impression even if I got a referral from an Optum primary doctor that wouldn't be good enough because it wasn't a UNM primary doctor. The receptionist said that several other patients of their's who they also referred to The UNM Pain Clinic had their referrals sent back to them as well with the same idiotic explanation. So I guess even a referral from a pain specialist that is fully qualified but is not affiliated with UNM is not good enough. Plus, I actually tried to get in to see one of their pain specialists around a year or more ago and at that time they would see me but they were scheduling 8 months out. I would never recommend anyone go to The UNM Pain Clinic ever.|So I am here at UNM today their check and process is a bunch of bullshit. I'm not happy with how the front desk handles things. they're rude. They mess up a lot. They lie about when they make mistakes. I feel more than 75% of the staff don't know what they're doing. and don't bother asking for management cause they don't know anything rather. UNMH pain clinic is part of the reason why the medical system sucks. and then hearing them talk about their dinner plans and donuts chocolate chips is a bunch of bull they need to worry about getting patience in and out|Doctors like this are why people seek out pain pills from the street. I've been in regular pain for almost 14 years but they won't even give me an appointment because women's menstrual pains aren't valid to them. This is ridiculous!

Way to be part of a larger system of ignoring women. Birth control should not be the only option for SERIOUS, DEBILITATING PHYSICAL PAIN THAT HAPPENS FOR A WEEK OUT OF EVERY MONTH.|The UNM Pain Management & Treatment Center is #1, The Best,  Top Notch, etc. The Drs are all very caring & do the very best they can for chronic pain patients WITHIN the limits the strict New Mexico law allows. If you're looking to get high - go somewhere else. If you're an honest & realistic pain patient they'll bend over backwards to help you. Pain Patients be realistic, they can't make your pain a "zero", but they can make it  "Livable" if you do your part by doing your PT exercises & learning how to cope / live with Chronic Pain thru psychotherapy / meditation / self hypnosis and other therapies such as bio-feed back, tens units, etc. Laughter is a great medicine it releases the bodies own "pain meds" in the brain. Laying in bed crying will just make you hurt twice as much - do ANYTHING to avoid it. I love my Drs at the clinic they are the BEST. I've been a patient there since 2015 & a chronic pain patient for well over 25 years.|4-6 Weeks to get an appointment for your pain treatment and 3-4 months for a neurosurgeon. If you can not handle the pain then you go to emergency. They will hand you some steroid which will last for few days and ask you to see your PCP. Few days later you're in pain again, now you decide what you do...|I'm here to talk about some of the glowing reviews that defend the mistreatment and cruelty that patients who have safely and successfully used opiate pain medications for years are now subject to. Government is the reason. Threats to providers cause them to react out of fear and not the patient's well being. People who drank the koolaid about the "crisis" and are  unaware that ILLEGAL STREET FENTANYL, not prescription medications, was responsible for the "crisis" need to get educated. When a patient on opiate pain meds prescribed to them for years is suddenly expected to just stop taking them or substitute suboxone (which is for addiction, not long term chronic pain) they can die. Many providers will not even offer a gradual taper or wean, even though they know it is the medically acceptable way. Forced weaning is only supposed to occur if misuse or addiction occurs, it is  risk vs benefit and shouldn't even happen in patients stable on the medications. It's unethical. Period. Until doctors understand that people are dying needlessly and that the "harsh" state laws (and federal interference btw) are actually causing massive pain and suffering which is unethical, as well as death, we are in trouble. Tell the CDC to stop trying to practice medicine and revoke the ridiculous and not medically sound "guidelines" they have forced on long term pain sufferers. It's barbaric not to treat pain. It causes people to die sooner. And the FACT is that patients who have successfully improved their health and quality of life over many years using opiates have very low rates of addiction, which is totally different from dependence. If you want to get more information just Google something like "mistreatment of chronic pain patients" or "chronic pain advocacy groups", and start facing the facts. Oh btw, these patients are NOT getting high. Those of you who leave reviews which insinuate that opioids are fraught with dangers are uneducated as to the facts. You may consider all the injections and ablations more "reasonable" but they do not work for everybody and they do have side effects as well. Stop judging. Insinuations that any pain patient is just looking for a high or is an addict is not helping matters. The govt is killing people. Doctors are helping.

The worst clinic I have ever been to in my life! The front counter staff will be nice to your face but then talk crap about you behind your back when your not there! The doctors they don't hear you at all and makes you feel stupid when there so called injections don't work! They have absolutely no sympathy for their patients! They whole staff should be replaced! Very unprofessional and surprisingly they haven't been charged with malpractice with how bad they are!|Horrible place to go to if you're looking to find a resolution to your pain they do nothing but suggest temporary relief for patients. The doctors are very unprofessional, they try to diagnose their patients on their opinions not how the patient feels. They also lost my MRI so I couldn't schedule my procedure, I highly recommend finding another pain center if you're looking for a problem solved.|The staff is nice. Today my elderly father had an appointment with the pain clinic. Ms L. Harris NP she cut his pain meds by 30 pills. She refused to listen that he can't survive without his full script. She said to him and the family that either go along with it or she drops him on the spot. The family Dr. Lino has the ability to get an DEA override. Ms. Harris answer she won't honor it. Dr. Lino said he can file for an injection with the court, of which she said she would not honor it.

If Ms Harris/ Lovelace decides not to fill the elderly father full prescription by Friday September 2, 2022. I will have no other choice but to start legal proceedings.|The worst. Brought my father in for a new patient appointment and we had to leave. The doctor was running late.... Yet we were never advised that until one of the receptionist heard my dad complain to me. She began getting loud and defensive right off the bat. I have worked with physicians/surgeons. I have done front desk and medical assisting .. I know how things work. There was no reason whatsoever for this receptionist to get defensive or loud. Everytime my dad wanted to say something she would speak over him. We ended up leaving and not rescheduling. You should always notify the patient when a physician is running behind/late. You're there to provide patient care. Not to argue or speak over them. Stay far a away from this place. Lovelace has really gone downhill.|Dr Gonzales is a horrible doctor. I was promised treatment done in a specific way for over a year, when it came time for the treatment I was already checked into my hospital room and given an IV when he briefly comes in and says see you in a few days... When I was supposed to go home the next day. I'd already tried the treatment his way a year prior and it didn't work. When I finally got home 2 days later my pain was still there, I had several huge bruises on my arms and my clothes were missing. While in the hospital I had to scramble to make care arrangements for my toddler for longer than planned and reschedule several other appointments before the drugs kicked in and I was incoherent. I just had my follow up appt at the office where I complained to Lauren the nurse practitioner, and I was basically kicked out of the pain clinic with a general paper referral- which no other pain clinic will accept, as it must be faxed from the doctors office. And was then told they wouldn't give me any meds for my pain to hold me over until I could get into another clinic. If I don't get into another clinic by the end of next week I will start to go through withdrawals. Dr Gonzales is so machismo and will tell you what you want to hear and then not follow through and will do things however he wants with no communication, no explanation, and no regard for what you need to line up in your personal life before undergoing treatment. STAY AWAY!|I have had nothing but good medical care from this facility since they revamped their clinic.  People on these reviews are complaining about being denied treatment and turned away from their appointment time.  You are told well in advance that you're to report 15 minutes early; if you're late, you're denied.  If you're there when they ask you to be there, you are taken in at your assigned appointment time or earlier.  I was there when a man (sounds like AJ Max) was denied his appointment because he was not 15 minutes early, but late for his original appointment time; he continued to make a spectacle of himself.  Sad!  So you do as you're asked, you'll be pleasantly surprised!  I appreciate my doctor being on time.  All too many times you go to an appointment and have to wait and wait.  Not here!|I'm glad Dr. Gonzalez moved to loveless pain, not downtown clinic anymore. I have no problem with him as my Dr. So far he has treated me well over the past two years. My issues is the receptionist and nurses at the downtown clinic. When they do answer the phones, there rude. There not empathetic or compassionate. The new location for Dr. Gonzalez, is friendly, helpful and compassionate.|The pain clinic is a joke. They told us over the phone they had moved and were at the women hospital. They aren't, they were across the loop in another building, the sign was cover by trees, so you couldn't read the name. My husband was referred there for pain medication, he had already undergone two botched attempts at injections which did damage that showed in imaging, and was given another injection by a doctor there that kept him in bed for 2 weeks. We explained all this to the nurse practitioner, Lauren Harris, her response was, "Well that wasn't us" , it was Dr Merhege, also with Lovelace pain management. She then said we needed to just find a doctor to issue prescriptions, because they don't do that, and said that was it. They did take a fifty dollar copay, and I am sure they will bill Medicare a hefty sum. So if your in pain, don't bother with this place.
column47: Wheelchair-accessible entrance, Wheelchair-accessible parking lot, Wheelchair-accessible washroom, Washroom, Appointments recommended
column48: do they prescribe pain medication or do they just offer shots
column49: They offer a variety of options based on your medical history and disease process(es). I recommend taking a list, as follows: (1) treatments that have been tried & whether or not they have worked on a scale of 0-10 (including physical therapy, counseling, anything, & better if typed/printed); (2) a pain journal for each day, with at least a "dermatome map" or front/back blank image of a body outline, with your areas of concern (rated 0-10, & if the pain is burning, stabbing, numb, dull, etc.), w/ at least 2-4 weeks to show; (3) previous medical records, MRI's/ X-rays, (even if it is just your last few office visit summary medical records); & (4) an understanding that pain management is simply "management of pain". Your doc will approach your pain in different ways to improve your pain, but may not be able to remove it all. Their approaches help. Take someone if you need support, or help, to explain your issues. Good luck & best wishes.

column38: Mychala Prather-Worthen|Annmarie Villegas
column40: Dr Watkins and staff are the most compassionate and knowledgeable of all pain doctors I have been to.  The others simply did not listen.  He does and adjusts everything according to his knowledge and your wellness in mind!  The higher doses don't always make the difference.  He took me off some medications and just started me on a single one and it's changed my entire life.  Of course there still are bad days but there are significantly more good days now and I am much more active than I was before.  He treats you like family every time you see him and the love and care from him and all his staff just simply ooze out of every pore! I absolutely would travel the earth to see him! 10/10!|I was bed ridden, on at least 8 medications, in constant debilitating pain, contemplating staying in this body. I met Dr. Watkins and he changed my life! He took me off my medications, which was scary, but I trusted his process. He put me on a medication that helped so much! He placed a DRG implant in April of this year. I can now be out of bed and with my kids, continuing work in my community for the youth, and have the will to live. He and his staff care about you as a person, he takes your situation on like you are family. Medication is not always helping your situation and he will ensure you are on the ones needed! His love and care for his patients on top of his knowledge makes for an excellent experience! I recommend this facility to all my friends!

Sunrise Medical Pain Clinic in Santa Rosa, NM offers comprehensive pain management services to residents throughout Guadalupe County and eastern New Mexico. Our specialized medical facility combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients experiencing chronic pain conditions, post-surgical discomfort, and injury-related pain. With board-certified physicians and a multidisciplinary approach, we develop personalized treatment plans that may include medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy, and complementary therapies.

At Sunrise Medical Pain Clinic, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our team specializes in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, fibromyalgia, migraines, and complex regional pain syndrome. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to identify the root cause of your pain and implement targeted interventions designed to improve function and quality of life.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation before we develop a customized treatment plan that may include:

  • Medication management and monitoring

  • Interventional procedures such as nerve blocks and injections

  • Physical therapy and rehabilitation

  • Behavioral health support for pain coping strategies

  • Alternative therapies including acupuncture and massage

Visit Our Clinic

Located at 552 US-54, Santa Rosa, NM 88435, our modern facility is equipped with the latest medical technology in a comfortable, welcoming environment. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to ensure accessible care.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 505-433-5572. Our friendly staff is ready to assist you on your journey toward pain relief and improved function.

column40: My Mother missed her appointment due to Safe Ride not picking her up. I took off work and decided to  call the Dr. to see if they can get her in. With the little time they had left after their last appointment,  they were able to take care of my Mom.  Dr. Grossetete was very nice, informative, compassionate and he even had a wonderful personality. He took his time with Mom and listenend to every single word she had to say about her pain. Being that it was an appointment that was just pushed in there, Dr.  Grossetete and his receptionist Claire were very relaxed and informative as we finished our visit. Mom was very pleased and so was I. I would definitely refer them to anyone. You do not see Dr's like him or receptionists like them anymore. Some always look  and act like their in a hurry and run out the door. But Not Dr. Grossetete, he will listen and take in everything you have with a compassionate ear and will help anyway he can to help you.  I give him, Claire, and the other nurse great praise.

column40:
I have had L4 L5 S1 spinal fusion I have had constant sciatic nerve pain for 20 years. Dr. Jim Rice is the best I've ever had the pleasure and fortune to make me better
completely satisfied and thankful
Nothing but best successful healthcare Dr. Jim Rice is the guy|I've gone to Dr. Rice for years now. He is very caring, kind, pleasant and always accurate with my pain injections. He also has a great sense of humor and always makes me laugh. His Nurse Hillary is also so wonderful! I love her.|Don't see dr rice if you're a woman, Gay, or fat. He is the rudest, most condescending, overtly prejudice md I've ever experienced. He has little knowledge about myofacial pain syndrome, trigger points, and could not have been more disrespectful. He made  asinine assumptions not based in reality, talked aggressively at me, interrupted my every sentence, made disgusted looks at my wife and I, belittled my injuries, rolled his eyes at us, and could not look more angry to be there. Disgusting!|This is the worst place I have ever been, I have been trying to get to Dr. Rice since November. it was very difficult to get any appointment, finally after 2 weeks they gave me an appointment for 2 months but unfortunately they canceled it and told me that Dr. Rice would not be at work. ok, they gave me a second visit in two months and I finally arrived somehow. It turns out, as they told me at the registration desk, that the computers weren't working and secondly, they canceled my visit and claimed that they never send texts and I have proof of it on my phone. The lady at the registration desk says I was there in 2016 and I don't remember this place, so how could I have been there? I live in Los Lunas, a long way from them, and I had to take time off from work and again I didn't make it to the appointment. I'd rather suffer in pain than go there. worst place I don't advise anyone to go there.|Dr. Rice is an amazing doctor.  He is caring and considerate.  Unlike most doctors, he takes his time to listen to his patients and their needs.  I have been a patient of his for sometime now and I STRONGLY recommend him if you have any pain.  You can trust him with your health needs.  He is an expert and his staff is amazing, kind, and caring.|I do not know if Angelina P caught Dr. Rice on a very bad day or ???
I was referred to him for lower back pain. After listening to my complaints he did offer at that time to do an injection or have an MRI done first. I explained that I am claustrophobic and his office set up an appointment with Upright MRI which is wonderful. You do not need to go into a "tube". You sit in a comfortable chair and it is aside from the sound very pleasant. I have an appointment scheduled for July and will post a follow up. Throughout the office visit Dr Rice and staff were very pleasant, courteous and professional.|Drs Rice and Pacheco were supposed to help me get control of my back pain and get back to living life. Instead, Dr Rice shamed me for using medication prescribed by the physician who had referred me to him and his only recommendation for me was endless injections. I had an appointment with Dr Pacheco to go over my medications. I was told he could make suggestions which would streamline my medication regimen and help with my daily pain. Instead, his only advice for me was that I needed to try harder to "be happy."
I had to drive 3 hours to get to the appointments with Drs Rice and Pacheco. On one of my last visits there, I was sitting in the waiting area after having already checked in with one cold receptionist behind the glass when my cell phone vibrated. I answered and it was a different receptionist from the clinic calling to tell me I was late and they were going to have to reschedule my appointment. When I corrected her, she hung up without apologizing. I quit going to this steroid injection mill and sought other methods of treatment. Injections are not a safe treatment for back pain long term despite what Dr Rice may sell his patients.|I went to see Dr. Rice I saw not Dr. Rice but a lady. that cost me $50.00, she sent me to have x-rays that cost me $100.00; I called to see about getting an appointment, but was told they were waiting for  authorization to cover the injection. I was told to call my ins. co. they told me never heard of such ! I called Dr. Rices office the young  receptionist told me she did not tell me that. I could talk to the young lady who I saw first that would cost me another $50.00 well I still have not seen dr. Rice. I do not understand. I saw Dr. Rice a few years ago. he was the only dr. that took all of my pain. so I am very  disappointed but I will not deal with his front desk. I was in the medical field for thirty years. if that would have in any of my office they would have all been replaced.

column3:
Naprapathic Medicine of New Mexico serves Santa Fe, NM and surrounding communities with specialized manual therapy focused on pain relief and holistic wellness. Our dedicated practitioners utilize gentle vertebral manipulation techniques to stretch contracted connective tissue that may be irritating nerves as they exit the spinal column. This non-invasive approach addresses the root causes of pain rather than merely treating symptoms, helping patients achieve lasting relief and improved mobility.

Each patient receives individualized care through a combination of:

  • Naprapathic Manipulative techniques

  • Adjunctive therapeutic treatments

  • Personalized nutritional counseling

Our holistic methodology recognizes the interconnectedness of the body's systems and works to restore balance and function through targeted manual therapy.

Educational Excellence

We're proud to share our location with the Southwest University of Naprapathic Medicine (SUNM), where the next generation of Naprapaths receives comprehensive training in this century-old healing tradition. The university maintains rigorous educational standards to preserve and advance Naprapathic Manual Medicine practices.

Visit Us

Experience the benefits of Naprapathic treatment at our convenient Santa Fe location:

2006 Botulph Rd A

Santa Fe, NM 87505

United States

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services:

Phone: +1 505-666-5328

Website: nmnm.org
column11:
At Naprapathic Medicine of New Mexico, we provide a hands-on approach to pain relief. We gently manipulate the vertebrae to stretch the attached contracted connective tissue, which may be irritating the nerves as they exit the spinal column. Treatment consists of Naprapathic Manipulative techniques, adjunctive treatments, and nutritional counseling.

Our School
The Southwest University of Naprapathic Medicine is in the same location as NMNM. SUNM is training future Naprapaths to carry on this century-old tradition of Naprapathic Manual Medicine. Visit the Southwest University of Naprapathic Medicine to learn more!

She is very knowledgeable and encourages natural ways to feel better without depending on medicine. Very friendly staff overall.|I had pretty severe back tilt side to side and a straightening where I should have had curves. I will also keep seeing him once a month for maintenance. Highly recommended!!|I would highly recommend their treatments. Going to Dr Underwood has been a blessing. His staff is very efficient and helpful. When you go to your appointment there's never a long wait. I saw the improvement my husband had after Dr Underwood did his magic!  Thank you looks like I may be coming a patient also.|My parents have lived here for 38 years but I had just recently moved back home and needed to establish myself with a new doctor and I could not have found a kinder, more compassionate and all around just decent human being as Dr. Underwood and his entire staff!! My mother attended the appointment with me and she to was so impressed she will be permanently switching to Dr. Underwood as well!! Since my appointment I have had to call the office twice for something and AnaLisa is of course ALWAYS just so helpful and sweet!!! Special thank you as well to Ashley, you were so kind to my mother and I, you make it easy to want to come back!!! Even the young lady that does the labs, she was so polite and brought me water!! Entire staff just shines as bright as Dr. Underwood does!! Thank you for treating me with respect and listen to me as a patient!! I just cannot say enough thank you's!!!|Doctor Underwood and his staff have always been wonderful to me personally. They are very professional. He takes time to actually sit and listen about my issues with chronic pain. He nor his staff have never had me feel rushed. I definitely recommend going there.|Everyone from front desk to doctors are super friendly and very knowledgeabe to the point you trust them completely. I've had nerves burnt. They've done injections many times and always successfully. In fact I have upcoming procedures. They care about pain and do help to provide relief.|Received steroid injections in lower back for chronic arthritis pain. Injections were ineffective. During follow-up appointment I was not seen by Dr. Underwood. I was told my only option left was placement of wired device that administered electric current, which I declined. I have never heard back again from this office. Will not be returning.|I've been struggling with the choice of my third  surgery or trying to "live" with the pain for years. After thousands of dollars for doctors appointments, travel, hotels and expenses. I was fortunate enough to be referred to Dr. Underwood. I have always thought that pain management involved medication such as opioids and muscle relaxers that I do not tolerate well. Well , I was wrong!! Dr. Underwood has performed two epidural steroid injections and bi-lateral shoulder injections.
I originally injured my back in 1986 with laminectomies and discectomys with fusion being performed on L3-4-5-S1 in 1988 and again in 1990.
After re-rupturing it all plus crushing T4-5-6-7-8 vertebrae and rupturing twelve more disc during seizures the pain was unbearable. Now I can "sleep" in the bed again and I now have hope for a pain free drug free live without any more surgeries!  I have another treatment coming up this month for my thoracic spinal injections!!  Don't worry it sounds much worse than it is! Dr. Underwood and his staff have this down to a science.
Thank you Dr. John Underwood!! If have any doubts ask his office for my number! I'll tell you about my experiences!|Frustration and wait wait wait for anything to be done. I understand I have one of the worst insurance companies in the state of NM if not the worst, but there has to be something that can be done to help alleviate my symptoms that my insurance company will approve. At this point I can not nor will I recommend Champion Pain Management or Dr Underwood to do anything. So far in the past month and a half to two months, this clinic has done ZERO for me.

column40:
I have had very positive experiences from D.J., Dr. Coleman and Dr. Vasquez from NM Pain Center. Very positive, professional staff. Very friendly and accommodating. Dr. Coleman has made a huge impact on the level of pain I have to endure. He has lessened it so much in my neck and back that it has made my life so much easier to live. D.J. The receptionist is a jewel! So sweet. Very professional.|Short wait time. Friendly support staff. Dr. Coleman explained things in great detail and didn't act like he needed to rush on to the next patient. He provided a plan to eliminate my back pain which my previous pain doctor was unable to accomplish. His assistant entered all notes of the visit in real time which was immediately available on the patient portal. One of the best doctors I've been to in Las Cruces.
Update: There was a 2 hour wait the second time I went.|Have been going to Telshore office for about a year. Susan Ravasoud seriously tries to recommend a procedure to help patients minimize pain. She is patient listening to patients discussing problems with pain, and tries to h er help resolve them. Dr. Coleman is a knowledgeable pain doctor. Waits can be a bit long, but worth staying with them. Recommend the Telshore Office. Cannot recommend the Alamogordo office.|Unfortunately I was not impressed with New Mexico Pain Center.  The doctor was unprofessional and thought very highly of himself. Was given referrals for an MRI and told to go get it done without any guidance. The wonderful receptionist help me find a place to go and said they would send the paperwork over. A week later I called and they had not been sent and sitting in someone's box. I had to call three times and still no resolution. Each time I was told they would call me back and never heard from them. Needless to say I have schedule with another management group.|Worst doctors. Do not go. I am currently writing this from the ER as I had injections for a nerve block over a month ago. Since that time the pain at the injection site has increased to the point that it's nearly disabling. Upon telling "Doctor" Ravensoud, I was told basically, "Don't worry about it." Doctor wouldn't even look at my injection site which was swollen and already painful. So now I sit in the ER a month later when the doctor at the PAIN center, which I'm assuming is supposed to specialize in relieving PAIN, refused to help me and could have saved me a lot of pain had she just listened.
Additionally, I was scheduled for yet ANOTHER followup (received texts reminders and email reminders) for the same procedure, waited 2.5 hours, to be asked by "Dr" (I use that term very loosely here) Ravenshroud- "Why are you here?"
"You scheduled it, you tell me. We had our followup already."  "Doc" stared at me like a cow looking at an oncoming train. Deer in the headlights."Doc" tried to make an excuse to save face, but I just left.
They scheduled me, wasted my time, caused me great pain and then ignored me. I called the call center to find out what happened. Apparently there was SUPPOSED to be a 2nd followup, but the fact that the "Doctor" had absolutely no idea that that was supposed to be happening tells me she had no care or followup or any thought to check a patients file. So here I now sit, in the ER, as I type this, hoping that eventually Ill be seen to fix a problem that should and could have been prevented or treated ahead of time before it reached this point. I will no longer be attending this clinic.

This is pure negligence on their part and they refuse to recognize it.

DO NOT USE THIS CLINIC OR "DR" Ravenshroud, you will regret it.|The staff was extremely rude. I was referred there to get a plasma injection. When I inquired if they performed this procedure there I was told that only the doctor could answer that question and that I must give a urine sample before I could talk to the doctor. Once I was finally shown into a room an assistant came in. I attempted to make conversation and the attendant seemed very agitated. I have Interstitial Cystitis so I asked if she knew what that was. She then stormed out of the room. Sometime later man identifying himself as the manager came in. He stated they did not do the plasma procedure there and the they would not treat me in their group because I had insulted whoever the lady was. In a form letter sent to me later they said they would not treat me because I failed to follow their policy of listing my medical history on their specific form rather than them accepting a typed 3-page history. Had the front desk person, or any of the other people I questioned regarding them performing the plasma procedure, all this would  ot have happened. To this day I have no idea who the people I spoke with are. No had a name tag and no one introduced themselves.|a year ago I was referred to New Mexico Pain Center in Alamogordo NM.  MY APPOINTMENT WAS FOR 9 am.  i arrived and there were over 30 people standing inline or just checked in for the 9 am appointment.  There were not even enough chairs for help of the on crutches, walkers etc.  fast forward to now.  My doctor referred me to New Mexico pain center in las cruces for Dr Vasquez.  I made an appointment.  Gave them some info went online to fill out patient forms.  Two weeks later I get a call telling me to pick up 17 pages of patient forms.  I told them it was a 90 miles drive.  She said ok.  No they can't mail or email them and they are not online.
We drove down early to fill out forms.  I was made to sit  and wait to get new patient forms.  Finally she came out asked me a lot of questions stared at the screw for over ten minutes and finally gathered forms and gave them to me.  I went somewhere else to fill them out returned in time for the appointment.  She finally called me up stared at the screen again for ten minutes and finally said do you have an appointment here.  Why didn't she ask me that an hour ago when she stared at the screen.  Then she says your appointment is in Alamogordo.  Not at anytime did these people say my appointment was Alamogordo to see some female doctor where I could again be treated like cows lined up for slaughter.  I got my forms back snd told her to remove ne from everything in that company.  Not even a modicum of respect care or concern.  I will drive back to Tulsa where I can get PRP injections in my knees and be treated like a person.|I am so impressed with NM Pain Center.  DJ, the receptionist/manager was so helpful, positive and empathetic to every patient she dealt with.  Susann Ravessoud, CNP, was comprehensive - she asked questions and listened to my husband's responses.  She had information about pain medications and explained in detail why my husband was in pain and what procedures would work for his case.  We are so fortunate to have found  a clinic with such a caring, knowledgeable and professional staff.  Make an appointment today, help is there for you.

SW Center for Pain Management serves Santa Fe, New Mexico with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Patient-Centered Approach

column3:
PRP Regenerative Pain Institute in Albuquerque, New Mexico offers cutting-edge regenerative medicine treatments for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Founded by board-certified physicians dedicated to non-surgical pain management solutions, the institute specializes in Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) therapy, stem cell treatments, and other innovative regenerative techniques that harness the body's natural healing abilities. Their state-of-the-art facility on Montgomery Boulevard provides a comfortable environment where patients receive personalized care plans designed to address the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms.

The medical team at PRP Regenerative Pain Institute offers treatments for a wide range of conditions, including joint pain, sports injuries, arthritis, back pain, and degenerative disc disease. Their signature PRP therapy involves drawing a small amount of the patient's blood, processing it to concentrate healing platelets, and then precisely injecting this growth factor-rich solution into damaged tissues to stimulate repair and regeneration. This minimally invasive approach helps patients avoid surgery while experiencing significant pain reduction and improved function.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes PRP Regenerative Pain Institute is their commitment to individualized care. Each patient undergoes a thorough evaluation to determine the most appropriate regenerative treatment protocol for their specific condition. The physicians take time to educate patients about their options, expected outcomes, and recovery processes. This collaborative approach ensures patients are active participants in their healing journey, leading to higher satisfaction rates and better long-term results.

Contact Information

PRP Regenerative Pain Institute is conveniently located at 4163 Montgomery Blvd NE, Albuquerque, NM 87109. Patients seeking innovative solutions for chronic pain can schedule a consultation by calling +1 505-503-6990 or visiting their website at http://prppaininstitute.com/. The institute welcomes patients from throughout New Mexico and surrounding states who are looking for advanced alternatives to traditional pain management approaches.

column40:
My wife has been a patient for Dr. Isaac's for approximately four years. As with any medical provider, we have not always seen eye-to-eye; however, he has remained open to hearing our concerns and addressing my wife's pain as he can. We tried a different pain clinic in Abq. and are returning to Dr. Isaac's office for care.
His front desk staff have always been professional and courteous. His office manager, Anthony, is one of the kindest and most genuine people that we have met.|Was sent here for back pain a while back. Finally getting around to leaving a review for this awful medical experience and the horrible medical advice given to me by doctor Isaacs.

I was told basically to avoid bending, twisting or lifting anything and to get as many injections needed until I was pain free. Two huge needles in my spine later (he was arguing with his tech about which gauge needle to use while I was face down on the table) my pain was more or less unaffected. Dr. Isaacs also told me the shots do not impacts surgens ability to operate. A surgeon later told me that is not true at all and they require delayment of surgery because of these injections which cause scar tissue.

I was lied to in order to milk my insurance and went through a harmful and unnecessary procedure that caused me more distress and frustration. I should have known when I saw all the wierd botox promotions in the lobby...

For those with pain from bulged or herniated discs. Give physical therapy another shot. It will give you the tools to heal yourself. Health doesnt come from a needle but dr. Isaacs vacation house would probably disagree with me.|I'm not sure what these low reviews come from..but from my experience I have been utilizing Dr. Isaac's knowledge and experience since 2016. If you are honestly looking to get off of the pharmakeia and get real, God given  self healing, from proven modalities. Then this is the place for you.|I have seen Dr. ISSACS for several years. The staff are friendly and delightful. Scheduling
is easy and convenient. Dr Issacs is very focused and professional . He does have a dry sense of humor but he is devoted to giving excellent care and making sure I'm getting the best treatment possible. I'm very happy with my progress there and won't hesitate to make referrals.|I have been seeing Dr Issacs next week for several years.  He has helped me with back pain, shoulder pain, and leg pain.  The staff are always professional, empathetic, and understanding.  When ever I call, I am able to get in within a few days.  I've referred my husband and two of my sisters - all have seen results from treatments and are very happy with Dr. Issacs.|Excellent service and very friendly staff. I came to Dr. Issacs about 4 years ago for my left knee and the treatment helped tremendously. Just recently I came in for my right knee and knew I would get the help I needed. Money well spent. Dr. Issacs is knowledgeable and cares for your well being. Now I can get back to being pain free.|After working as a writer and in the media, extensively using a keyboard for almost 40 years, I began to have pain in my left thumb two years ago that affected, among other things, my favorite amusement: playing guitar. Pain would shoot into the middle two joints of my left thumb, such that I could barely play. The diagnosis? de Quervain's tenosynovitis. Several weeks ago, my right thumb also became so stricken that I couldn't open a bottle or pick up a jar. Most likely, osteoarthritis, de Quervain's, or both. Of all things, I saw a promo on Instagram for Softwave Technology: high power ultrasound waves used to break up adhesions and scar tissue and particularly effective for treating arthritis and planter fasciatis. Most importantly, available right here in Albuquerque at Dr Isaac's pain management clinic. I wasted little time and have since had 6 treatments on my left hand and 4 on my right. The change is remarkable. After each treatment the pain disappeared before slowly returning but less painful than before. The pain is still present 2 months later, but is greatly reduced. I can again use my hands to open bottles, pick up jars, and, thankfully, play guitar. It hasn't completely remedied the pain, but the change has been invaluable for me. I will return for more treatments once I establish a new baseline. So far, so good. I am so grateful for Dr Isaac and his wonderful staff. They are great to work with, help to get me in for appointments, and I have a new lease on using the most valuable thing I have, my hands. Thank you, Dr Isaac and company.|Unprofessional customer service. I had an appointment scheduled, but was bedridden with a migraine so I didn't show up to my appointment and was unable to call and cancel. I called a few weeks later to try to get on the schedule but no one answered so I left a (detailed) message requesting a call back to get scheduled. Today- I finally get a hold of someone- and get told that no call-no shows on the first appointment will not be seen as a patient at this establishment. They never thought to give a courtesy call to let me know since I had been waiting weeks to be called, as I have been in excruciating pain for 3 months. A simple "we received your call, but unfortunately have to turn you away because you didn't show up for your first appointment" would have been sufficient so I could have started looking for a different establishment.

CHRISTUS St. Vincent Pain & Spine Specialists Procedure Center serves Santa Fe, NM and surrounding communities with specialized care focused on treating and managing acute and chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified specialists works diligently to develop personalized treatment plans that improve quality of life and restore function for patients suffering from debilitating pain conditions.

At CHRISTUS St. Vincent Pain & Spine Specialists Procedure Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Our services include diagnostic evaluations, interventional procedures, medication management, and collaborative care with physical therapists and rehabilitation specialists. We specialize in treating conditions such as herniated discs, spinal stenosis, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain using evidence-based techniques and innovative therapies.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. Justin Averna, DO serves Albuquerque, NM and surrounding communities as a dedicated Interventional Pain Medicine Physician at New Mexico Orthopaedics. With specialized training in pain management techniques, Dr. Averna provides comprehensive care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. His patient-centered approach combines cutting-edge interventional procedures with holistic pain management strategies to improve quality of life and restore function.

Dr. Averna offers a wide range of interventional pain management procedures, including epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and peripheral nerve blocks. His expertise extends to treating complex conditions such as failed back surgery syndrome, complex regional pain syndrome, neuropathic pain, and musculoskeletal disorders.

Education and Credentials

As a board-certified physician, Dr. Averna completed his Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine degree followed by specialized fellowship training in Interventional Pain Medicine. His osteopathic background provides him with additional insights into the musculoskeletal system and how pain patterns develop and persist, allowing for more comprehensive treatment approaches.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

Dr. Averna believes in developing individualized treatment plans that address each patient's unique pain experience. Rather than simply masking symptoms, he focuses on identifying and treating the underlying causes of pain while minimizing medication dependence and improving functional outcomes.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Justin Averna, patients can call +1 505-724-4300 or visit his practice at 2100 Louisiana Blvd NE, Suite 410, Albuquerque, NM 87110. Additional information about Dr. Averna's services and approach to pain management can be found on his professional profile at https://www.nmortho.com/justin-averna-do/.

Elite Pain Clinic in Las Cruces, New Mexico offers specialized pain management services designed to address conditions that are often overlooked yet worsen over time without proper treatment. Our dedicated team of medical providers delivers comprehensive pain therapy solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs, ensuring effective relief and improved quality of life for residents throughout the Las Cruces area.

At Elite Pain Clinic, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our practice offers a wide range of specialized treatments including:

  • Acute Care - Immediate intervention for sudden onset pain

  • Chronic Pain Management - Long-term solutions for persistent conditions

  • Breakthrough Pain Treatment - Addressing flare-ups that occur despite ongoing pain management

  • Suboxone Treatment - Evidence-based approach for those dealing with opioid dependency

Our Founding Philosophy

The founders of Elite Pain Clinic established this privately owned healthcare facility after years of practicing in corporate medical environments. They witnessed concerning shifts in care quality and increasing restrictions placed on providers that limited effective treatment options. This experience inspired them to create a practice where patient care comes first, free from corporate constraints that often compromise treatment quality.

Visit Us

Located at 530 N Telshor Blvd #A, Las Cruces, NM 88011, our clinic provides a comfortable, professional environment where your pain concerns are taken seriously. Contact us at (575) 303-2929 to schedule your consultation or learn more about our services at www.eliteprimarynm.com/elite-pain-clinic.
column11: Pain is one of the most ignored conditions and worsens over time if left untreated. Our team of medical providers are here to care for all pain therapy. Zia Therapy and Pain Relief serves Rio Rancho, NM and the greater Albuquerque area with specialized myofascial release treatments that go beyond conventional therapy approaches. Our holistic methodology addresses not just symptoms but the root causes of pain and movement restrictions that prevent clients from enjoying optimal physical wellness. Unlike traditional clinics that focus solely on temporary relief, we establish a collaborative healing partnership with each patient, guiding them through a transformative journey toward lasting recovery and improved quality of life.

At Zia Therapy and Pain Relief, we utilize hands-on myofascial release techniques to effectively treat both chronic and acute conditions. This therapeutic approach works by gently manipulating the fascia—the connective tissue surrounding muscles, bones, and organs—to release tension, improve circulation, and restore proper function. Our treatments are delivered in a pleasant, relaxing environment designed to enhance the healing process while providing immediate comfort during each session.

Collaborative Healing Approach

What truly distinguishes our practice is our commitment to patient education and involvement. We actively teach body awareness techniques that empower clients to recognize subtle changes between sessions, providing valuable feedback that helps us continually refine treatment strategies. This collaborative approach ensures we address the underlying causes of discomfort rather than merely managing symptoms, resulting in more comprehensive and lasting relief.

Contact Information

To begin your healing journey with Zia Therapy and Pain Relief, visit our clinic at 1520 Deborah Rd SE, Suite K, Rio Rancho, NM 87124. Schedule your consultation by calling +1 978-618-7500 or learn more about our services at www.albuquerquepainrelief.com. Experience the difference that personalized, attentive myofascial release therapy can make in your path to wellness.
column11:
Providing Myofascial Release Treatments to address pain, movement restrictions, and a variety of other issues preventing you from living your best life. Myofascial Release is a hands on technique that provides lasting relief from chronic or acute issues and in a pleasant, relaxing, therapeutic manner.
This is not your typical therapy clinic. At Zia Therapy and Pain Relief the practitioner and the patient go on a healing journey together. We will teach you to increase your body awareness, so you can report all changes from the prior session and we can get to the root of the problem together.

Highly recommend Zia Therapy and Pain Relief! Evan is just the best; if you desire an outstanding occupational therapist -- this is the place to go. Evan's dedication to patient-centered care and innovative therapeutic strategies consistently yield impressive results. He brings a remarkable depth of knowledge, empathy, and adaptability to every case, ensuring each patient reaches their highest potential. Beyond his clinical skill, Evan is a fantastic team player and thought leader --  always willing to collaborate and share insights to benefit everyone he serves. Any patient would be incredibly fortunate to have Evan on board their "Dream Team."  No need to look further, this is the place to make an appointment.|I met Evan when I was in a rehab nursing center. He is a miracle worker. He helped me with pain in my right shoulder first. I was able to lift my arm again. The biggest moment happened when he asked why my left leg was bigger than my right leg. My answer was, " because it wants to be".  He showed me I was wrong. Evan started wrapping my legs. There was an immediate reaction. I had two legs where two stumps had previously been. I was thrilled. I left the facility and have tried to stay wrapping myself. Well I need Evan. I can't wait to get back to his care. Soon!  There aren't enough words of praise for me to give to Evan. Thank you isn't enough. I'm 72 years old and not one doctor ever mentioned my condition. I was just fat. Evan saw that my lymph was broken on our second visit. So he's my "Miracle Man".Thank goodness there is a clinic who has people like Evan to help people like me. This review is going out on my son's phone. I'm Kathryn Wolf and this is my story. I'm just computer challenged.|Came to give Zia therapy a try with my husband and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. I was not expecting much because I went in with no pain just to give the therapy a try to see what it was about. Turns out I did have a couple minor problem areas that I wasn't even aware of! That being said my minor problem areas were located and addressed before they had a chance to turn into real problems. The therapist Evan is very professional and the ambiance is very calming. The worst part of the whole thing was that it ended so soon, it was honestly more relaxing than any massage I've ever received. Am definitely inquiring about receiving a monthly treatment.|I have a connective tissue disorder which results in chronic pain and frequent dislocations and subluxations of my joints. Evan, the therapist at this facility, is highly skilled and knowledgeable in his expertise, myofascial release. He listens to his patient's concerns and works efficiently at locating and working on problem areas. He is a crucial part of my care team. His services help me minimize pain in my daily activities. He constantly seeks out training to enhance himself as a practitioner. If you experience chronic pain, I cannot recommend Evan enough!|This man is amazing! The pain relief treatment  is not only refreshing but also very relaxing. Evan is a master of his craft. I will most certainly be a return patient...as often as I can! Thanks.|Lower back pain relief for me has not been a straight line. It comes and goes. I have been to doctors and they prescribe pain medication. The issue was not something pills would correct. Zia therapy and pain relief help my back pain in a way that lasted longer and longer as they provided their service. The personal connection that Evan provides is only the cherry on top.

Nexus Health Orthopedics & Interventional Pain Management serves Santa Fe, New Mexico with comprehensive orthopedic and pain management solutions. Our specialized medical practice combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment approaches to address a wide range of musculoskeletal conditions and chronic pain disorders. Our team of board-certified physicians brings decades of combined experience in orthopedic medicine, sports injuries, joint replacement, spine care, and interventional pain procedures to provide personalized treatment plans for each patient.

At Nexus Health, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to orthopedic and pain management care. Our services include non-surgical interventions, minimally invasive procedures, regenerative medicine options, and when necessary, advanced surgical techniques. We specialize in treating conditions affecting the spine, joints, muscles, and connective tissues, with particular expertise in managing both acute injuries and chronic pain conditions that have proven resistant to conventional treatments.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our modern medical facility at 4200 Beckner Rd in Santa Fe is equipped with the latest diagnostic and therapeutic technologies. We've created a comfortable, patient-centered environment where individuals can receive comprehensive care under one roof. From initial consultation through treatment and rehabilitation, our team coordinates every aspect of your care journey to ensure optimal outcomes and improved quality of life.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and collaborative decision-making. Our physicians take the time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, working closely with each individual to develop care plans aligned with their specific goals and lifestyle needs. This commitment to personalized medicine has established Nexus Health as a trusted provider in the Santa Fe community.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our website at https://nexushealth-nm.com/our-location/ or contact our office at +1 505-477-2200. We're conveniently located at 4200 Beckner Rd, Santa Fe, NM 87507, and welcome patients from throughout northern New Mexico.

This "pain clinic" is an absolute joke. Looking at some of the other reviews my experience has been the same as other's. I received exactly ZERO help from my provider. The provider I saw for chronic low back pain, Therese Maestas, did nothing for me. refused to prescribe me medication for as-needed pain. complete waste of my time and money.|Go somewhere else!
In 9/2024, I saw a nurse practitioner named Mirna Chavez (she apparently is no longer there). Her manner was cold and detached. She gave me a cursory exam. My lower back pain comes and goes. At that very moment it was gone. She sent me for x-rays. Radiologist William Long read them and said everything was normal. (Side note: They didn't x-ray my SI joints, even though previous x-rays from 2021 showed mild arthritis and it feels to me - and seems to physical therapists - to be a source of pain). She told me I could see the clinic's psychologist and/or go to PT.
Then the end of last month, I went to NM Ortho for a second opinion and was diagnosed with THREE spine conditions.|Very Poorly Run!  Office visits consisted of talking, but nothing was ever accomplished!!! I am searching for a clinic that can help me with my existing chronic pain in several locations. I was shown my lumbar spine imaging by my orthopedic specialist and looked very bad-completely smoke like white.|I've been going to Presbyterian Pain and Spine at Anna Kaseman for a year now.  The office staff has been courteous and professional with every visit.  The medical staff has addressed my issues and relieved my pain.  I highly recommend this location.|I do not understand the HOSTILE Attitude given to me by nurse.
I EXPRESS MY EXPERIENCE & the Nurse ARGUED with my Personal Experience during my procedure on my back, a procedure she was not in attendance for.
One of the Worst. Most Hostile, uncomfortable & downright Bazaar Appointments.|Don't waste your time coming to this place and definitely don't see Dr Toledo she is the most unprofessional Dr ever. She is very unknowledgeable and extremely rude I have several doctors contradicting her diagnosis. she ignored everything I said to her and and lied about everything very bad person she has no idea what she is doing.|I have nothing but amazing things to say about Dr. Averna and all the staff. Every staff member I came in contact with was extremely kind and helpful. Dr. Averna is an amazing doctor that takes the time to listen to his patients and truly makes you feel very comfortable throughout the whole procedure. I was properly informed about my health and care throughout each procedure and office visits. It's rare to find a doctor that combines such personal touches and care for a patient as a person with outstanding quality of medical care and I feel truly blessed that I have Dr. Averna as my doctor. I don't recall all the nurses names but they were all amazing, especially Todd.|I have had nothing but problems with Presbyterian. Starting with them canceling ALL of my appointments when when the covid scamdemic started which caused my conditions to get worse for lack of care. The latest is when I had an appoinment with the pain & spine clinic on Constitution in Albuquerque. My appointment was at 12 pm and I arrived at 12:15 pm. I don't live in Albuquerque so I have a pretty good drive to get there plus deal with traffic conditions. I guess they only allotted me 15 minutes of face time with the doctor and my visit should last no more than 15 minutes. What a farce they are! No wonder people no longer trust the entire health industry.

They don't truly care about the patients. All they care about is money. If this weren't true, they would have taken into consideration the distance I have to travel to get there, not to mention how much it cost me for gas! All they could say is "I'm sorry about that. I can help you reschedule." This isn't the first time they've done this to me. They need to be more accommodating to people that have to travel longer distances instead of only being concerned about the city dwellers. I wish I could change my Medicare but all my records are there and it's very difficult to get my records transferred. Trash healthcare providers and most the employees are no better with how they treat people.

column3:
LEAA Health serves New York, NY with premium medical house calls, bringing comprehensive healthcare directly to patients' homes since 2017. Our dedicated team delivers everything from x-rays and sonograms to regular check-ups and flu vaccines—all in the comfort of your own living space. What sets us apart is our remarkable response time: we typically reach our patients in about 60 minutes, providing urgent care without the wait of traditional medical facilities.

At LEAA Health, we've transformed healthcare delivery by eliminating the need to visit medical offices. Our physicians bring diagnostic equipment, treatment options, and preventative care directly to you, creating a stress-free medical experience. This approach not only increases comfort but also reduces exposure to other illnesses commonly encountered in waiting rooms.

The LEAA Difference

Unlike rushed office visits, our physicians take their time with each patient, conducting thorough evaluations that minimize diagnostic errors. This patient-centered approach allows for more personalized care and better health outcomes. LEAA Health isn't just a medical provider—it's a lifestyle brand that caters to every medical need without compromise.

Transforming Elder Care

For elderly patients, LEAA Health has proven to be a game-changer. The elimination of difficult travel, waiting rooms, and exposure to potential illnesses makes our service particularly valuable for seniors. Many of our elderly patients express amazement that such a convenient service is available to them, transforming their healthcare experience entirely.

Premium Care for Everyone

While our concierge-style service might seem like a luxury for celebrities only, LEAA Health is accessible to patients from all walks of life. We've democratized premium healthcare by bringing it directly to your doorstep, regardless of who you are.

Contact LEAA Health:

Website: https://leaa.io/

Phone: +1 646-650-5145

Address: 509 5th Ave, New York, NY 10017, United States

column40: My dad is bed-ridden with dementia. He Really can not be moved to take him to a doctor when he is sick. When he was coughing with phlegm buildup, LEAA was really my last hope to get him checked out. They came next day, took Xrays and blood tests, then gave him the antibiotics he needed along with his flu shot and iron infusion he also needed. LEAA is an extremely valuable resource for people in similar situations. I hope they can work with Medicare in the near future because it is not inexpensive (what is these days.) But  I highly recommend their professionalism and services. It's comforting to know I can get a good doctor to see my dad at a moment's notice. Thank you so much Sharon and the LEAA team!|I was extremely impressed with the service. They arrived almost immediately, which was a huge relief as the visit was for my elderly mother, who has difficulty getting in and out of the house. The Physician Assistant was very knowledgeable, professional, and compassionate, making the whole process much easier for us. I couldn't be happier with the experience and would highly recommend this service to anyone in need of prompt, quality care at home.|I've used LEAA Health two times for  my elderly mother. Both customer service and medical care have been excellent. I highly recommend LEAA if you want to avoid the hassle factor of urgent care or your regular doctor...or have mobility issues (like my mother). LEAA is a bit costly, but worth it! I only wish they offered service in Atlanta.|This service is a joke! My elderly mom is bedridden due to a broken tibia and she is in a brace. She needs the Covid and flu vaccines according to her doctors and the number of respiratory infections. I called the service and they do not accept ANY insurance and view themselves as a concierge service! I am not asking for spa services in the home, but medical ones! LEAA asked for $250 for the visit and $200 for each vaccine or a total of $650 for shots that are free in any pharmacy.  Most of their patients are elderly, yet they do not accept Medicare, any supplemental insurance or Medicaid. I guess if you're not rich, you can go to hell!|I had the best experience yesterday (Thanksgiving day) with the Leaa team. My mother  (85) was not feeling well and had a a high fever. I was frantic trying to find a doctor to see her. I found Leaa and took a chance. I can't thank them enough for caring for my mother so quickly. Within an hour of my call there was a doctor at our door. He was kind, gentle and thorough. He performed blood work and set up and IV. The Xray tech was close behind to take chest X-rays. Overall it was such a wonderful experience given the circumstances. I highly recommend this service and will call them again for future emergency situations. Thank you, Adam and Dr. Azor for taking my call on a Holiday, providing such great care and working with me on pricing. I truly appreciate it.|After having a nightmare of an experience with Essenmed I was absolutely THRILLED with LEAA. My mom's aid tested her for a UTI on a Thursday night and it was a positive result. I messaged them on the website and they called me at 11am on Friday and by 1:30 they had an md at my mom's house. It's been impossible to get her to come out of the house bc she has dementia.  He sent a prescription for an antibiotic as well as her maintenance meds. I will definitely be using them on a regular basis. It's so difficult finding medical professionals for dementia or homebound patients. SO happy I found LEAA.|Dr. Emanuel and the team are excellent.  My mom is basically bedridden and became quite ill. I called Dr. Emanuel in the evening and he arrived early morning the next day. He was able to test mom and based on the medical results, Dr. Emanuel was able to appropriately & immediately treat her with IV antibiotics for the next 7 days. Although this is an expensive service, it is worth it when it comes to our loved ones. Thank you LEAA!|This service is a life saver! I highly recommend this- they were pros! The PA was so warm, kind and very intelligent. He was able to accommodate and get my husband feeling better quickly! I am so grateful to have found them. Thank you!

Manhattan Sports Therapy in New York City offers comprehensive non-surgical treatment solutions for patients suffering from various musculoskeletal conditions. Located in the heart of Manhattan, our specialized clinic combines advanced therapeutic techniques with personalized care to address back and neck pain, herniated discs, sports injuries, and other mobility-limiting conditions. Our team of experienced healthcare professionals is dedicated to providing conservative treatment options that promote natural healing and long-term wellness without invasive procedures.

At Manhattan Sports Therapy, we pride ourselves on utilizing the most advanced techniques in the field to effectively treat chronic pain and heal injuries from various causes, including:

  • Sports-related accidents and injuries

  • Slip and fall incidents

  • Workplace injuries

  • Repetitive strain conditions

Our comprehensive chiropractic care addresses pulled, tight, or stiff muscles, herniated discs, and spine misalignment through non-invasive methods that promote your body's natural healing processes.

Personalized Rehabilitation Programs

Understanding that each patient's condition is unique, our doctors work closely with you to develop customized treatment plans. These individualized approaches combine various therapeutic modalities to accelerate recovery and help you return to your active lifestyle as quickly as possible. Whether you're a professional athlete, weekend warrior, or someone dealing with everyday pain, our rehabilitation programs are designed to address your specific needs and goals.

Contact Information

Common sense yet cutting edge, Dr Nemirovsky has repeatedly saved me and many friends from pain and surgeries. Try him first- you'll get to the core of the issue quickly.|I can't recommend Dr. Miro highly enough for anyone dealing with plantar fasciitis. He's truly a one-stop-shop who offered shockwave therapy, laser treatment, and a host of others. He has a very holistic and science based approach that helped me not only understand the condition better, but also significantly reduced my pain and improved my mobility.

If you're struggling with plantar fasciitis or any similar issues, Dr. Miro is definitely the specialist to see!|Before seeing Dr. Nemirovsky, I visited another physical therapist to treat my lower back pain caused by long hours working behind a computer, from which I experienced only marginal improvement.
Dr. Nemirovsky accurately diagnosed the cause of the pain and recommended a treatment and gradual exercise regimen that took into consideration my schedule and lifestyle.

His treatment not only gave me immediate pain relief, but, also helped build enduring muscular strength and restore flexibility within the areas that were causing the pain after only a few visits.

In addition to his expertise, the beautiful office and friendly staff make this one of my best medical experiences in the city.|I have been seeing Dr. Nemirovsky for 3+ years and 6 marathons and would recommend him to any runner or athlete! He has helped me through several Achilles challenges, including during race week. He is thorough and makes sure to explain what I should do to improve muscle strength and stability to avoid future injuries. Excellent bedside manner. He provides useful training and overall health guidance as well. I think of him as an extension of my marathon training program. Highly recommend!|The entire staff is very helpful, kind, and extremely efficient. If it wasn't for Dr. Rolland Nemirovsky I strongly feel the bursitis in my shoulder would still be in major pain. If you have shoulder pain, rotator cuff issues, or bursitis don't hesitate, RUN to see this man! I came to Manhattan Sports Therapy skeptical because I had already visited two other physical therapist who were not getting me better. I had pain for 9 months until visiting MST.  Nemirovsky was patient with my healing process and was always transparent when telling me what stages I was in my recovery. Now I am fully recovered back to pumping iron and putting on a backpack without pain. Thank you to everyone in that office for making my experience great from start to finish.|Dr. Nemirovsky is extremely professional and without a doubt the best at what he does. I have been seeing him for over four years now for lower back pain and tightness . I am feeling like a new woman. The results for me on a personal level have been incredible. My flexibility , balance and posture have dramatically changed. His staff is extremely friendly and professional. Grateful to have found him !!!!!|Dr. Rolland Nemirovsky, the chiropractor, is a really nice and friendly individual; however, he is not a good chiropractor or therapist. He's a lot of talk and not a lot of results.
I had a lot of pain in my left leg. It was a simple athlete injury from over-exercising or overworking the muscles. I was going to Dr. Nemirovsky to help it, but it simply was not improving at all. I went three times and I was still limping. My doctoral friends suggested I go see another chiropractor that they suggested. This other chiropractor was baffled that I had been adjusted two days prior because my hips and shoulders were so unaligned it was practically impossible for a competent chiropractor to have adjusted me correctly two days prior. I went one time to this other chiropractor and my injury significantly improved.
Listen, Manhattan sports has a lot of fancy equipment and Dr. Nemirovsky is a lot of talk (like he says so much to try and make it seem like he knows what he is talking about to the point I was already skeptical  after the first session), chiropractic is one of the OLDEST alternative forms of medicine in time. It does not require fancy equipment at all, it simply requires a competent doctor that knows how to readjust your spine.
Dr. Nemirovsky thought it was a long-term process (and I may not know if that is true) but he requires co-payments no matter what insurance you have, so he is just reeling money out of you for as long as possible when you could go to another chiropractor and have the problem solved after 2-3 sessions instead of 4 weeks worth.
Your spine is your core, it's what holds you together. I am a firm believer in chiropractic, but you need to have someone who knows what they're doing.|I've never written a review before but after being treated at Manhattan Sports Therapy, for the last couple of months, particularly by Dr. Nemirovsky, I felt compelled to do so.  Being an avid fitness buff, I found myself with chronic shoulder pain in addition to lower back pain.  Dr. Nemirovsky treated me with his skillful chiropractic modalities as well as instructing me on proper biomechanics.  He also assigned specific exercises and stretches that expedited my healing.  I am incredibly grateful for his work.  I highly recommend his services to anyone who has chronic or acute pain and wants to maintain a high level of fitness.

Pain Management Specialists of New York serves the diverse communities of New York City with exceptional pain management solutions. Located in the heart of Astoria, our practice brings together a team of board-certified physicians dedicated to alleviating both acute and chronic pain conditions. We understand that pain can significantly impact quality of life, which is why we offer personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

At Pain Management Specialists of New York, we utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment approaches to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions. Our physicians combine their extensive medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Whether you're suffering from back pain, joint discomfort, neuropathy, or post-surgical pain, our specialists work diligently to identify the root cause and develop effective management strategies.

Our Approach to Patient Care

Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to provide lasting relief and improved functionality. Each treatment plan is carefully monitored and adjusted as needed to ensure optimal outcomes for our adult patients throughout the New York City area.

column3:
Pain Doctors NY serves Brooklyn, NY and surrounding areas with specialized pain management solutions. Dr. Ilana Etelzon leads this premier medical practice dedicated to helping patients overcome chronic pain conditions through innovative, minimally invasive techniques. With a comprehensive approach that prioritizes patient comfort and long-term relief, Pain Doctors NY has established itself as a trusted resource for individuals suffering from debilitating pain conditions throughout New York.

Dr. Ilana Etelzon brings extensive experience as a Pain Management Specialist with particular expertise in Interventional Pain & Musculoskeletal Medicine. Her non-operative approach focuses on addressing the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms. By employing Minimally Invasive Procedures and cutting-edge Regenerative Therapies, Dr. Etelzon effectively treats a wide spectrum of pain conditions, including lower back pain, sciatica, neck pain, and various musculoskeletal disorders.

What sets Pain Doctors NY apart is their commitment to precision medicine. Dr. Etelzon utilizes advanced fluoroscopic and ultrasound-guided techniques to ensure accurate treatment delivery. Each patient receives individualized attention, with Dr. Etelzon collaborating closely to develop practical and effective treatment plans specifically designed to break the cycle of chronic pain.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

Pain Doctors NY offers a diverse range of specialized treatments including:

  • Regenerative Medicine Procedures that harness the body's natural healing abilities

  • Spinal Injections for targeted pain relief

  • Cervical Epidural Steroid Injections to address neck and upper extremity pain

  • Lumbar Epidural Steroid Injections for lower back and leg pain

  • Radiofrequency Ablation to disrupt pain signal transmission

  • Peripheral Nerve Stimulation for managing chronic nerve pain

  • PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) therapy to accelerate healing and reduce inflammation

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Etelzon and begin your journey toward pain relief, contact Pain Doctors NY at +1 718-682-3686. Their office is conveniently located at 35 West End Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11235. For more information about their services and approach to pain management, visit their website at www.paindoctorsny.com.
column11:

Dr. Etelzon utilizes fluoroscopic and ultrasound-guided techniques and collaborates with patients to create practical and effective treatment plans, aiming to break the pain cycle.

Pain Management Treatments
