column3:
Unique Pain Medicine in New York, NY serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions in the heart of Manhattan. Established in 2010, this specialized medical practice has built a sterling reputation for addressing a wide spectrum of acute and chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. Located conveniently at 369 Lexington Avenue on the 19th Floor, Unique Pain Medicine combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and minimize suffering from debilitating pain issues.

At Unique Pain Medicine, all physicians are board certified in pain management and rehabilitation, bringing exceptional qualifications to every patient interaction. The center excels in treating conditions including back pain, sciatica, herniated disks, neck pain, persistent headaches, and joint pain through evidence-based approaches. What truly distinguishes this practice is their commitment to individualized care—recognizing that pain experiences vary significantly between patients and require tailored treatment strategies.

Personalized Treatment Approach

Understanding that no two patients experience pain in exactly the same way, Unique Pain Medicine lives up to its name by developing customized treatment plans for each individual. Their philosophy—"every patient is unique!"—guides their clinical approach, ensuring that interventions address specific pain triggers, lifestyle factors, and medical history. This patient-centered methodology has helped countless New Yorkers find relief when other generalized approaches have failed.

Convenient Manhattan Location

Situated in the bustling Midtown area at 369 Lexington Avenue, Unique Pain Medicine offers accessibility to patients throughout the New York metropolitan area. The practice can be reached at +1 929-363-0303 for appointments and consultations. For additional information about services and treatment options, prospective patients are encouraged to visit https://uniquepainmedicine.com/ where comprehensive resources about pain management approaches are available.
column11:
Unique Pain Medicine was established in 2010. The goal of our center is to provide individually-oriented, comprehensive care of patients with acute and chronic pain conditions including back pain, sciatica, herniated disks, neck pain, headaches and joint pain.
At Unique Pain Medicine, all of our doctors are board certified in pain management and rehabilitation. We offer various treatment options that will be individually tailed to the needs of the patient. After all, every patient is unique!
column38: Nancy Cordova|Debra Lynn|Monica Lobo|Yasmin Potts-Thomas|Jay Strickland|Neen Bean|nancy dejesus|Donna
column40:
huge shout out to  Dr. Schecter and the team at Unique Pain Management! My previous doctor retired and I was in desparate need of care and relief!

I was welcomed by a friendly, patient-forward staff who truly takes the time to understand my physical needs. They worked with me to create a personalized treatment plan, and I've received top-notch care with noticeable improvements. Following the doctor's instructions at home has been key, and as long as you do so, you're sure to have a speedy recovery.

I highly recommend Dr. Schecter and his team to anyone looking for exceptional pain management--Oh-- and yes, STAY for the delicious snacks right after your procedure! I was here for a good time, not a long time, y'all!|I went for pain using my medicare and they talked me into spending thousands of dollars to ease pain and reduce my bloat.
I really needed an MRI and  I was told I needed 6 sessions.  After 3 there was no difference and I was then told it should have worked at least a little.  GARBAGE WASTE OF MONEY and they never even called me back to see how I was doing.  Charlatans NOT doctors

AND THEY DENIED I WAS A PATIENT...STAY AWAY!!!!!!!|Excellent experience. Dr. Schechter is kind thorough and quick. Answered questions and straightforward and clear.

Front desk were pleasant, quick and direct from my initial call to my visit end.

Entire first patient appt was 40 min. 10/10 would recommend. I work in healthcare and to visit a place like this is exactly how a medical office should be run.|I don't even know where to start, as I have NEVER in my entire life been treated this way by a healthcare professional. My experience at this facility was gut wrenching to say the least. It literally had me in tears by the time I gotten to my car. I'm writing this review with the hopes It can be a step toward making sure others don't experience the same treatment, and even prompt this facility to reassess their practices.

I arrived on 10/28 at 2:42 PM for my 2:45 PM appointment to see Dr. Mann for the progressively worsening pain in my neck/ back / shoulder/ elbow & both hands . I  promptly filling out the required paperwork and returning it to the receptionist, I was asked to wait. After waiting for approximately 15 minutes, I approached the receptionist to ask if Dr. Mann was running on time. I was assured that he was and was told to continue waiting. Ten minutes later, I inquired again and received the same response. At 3:17 PM, I was finally brought to an exam room, where an assistant took my blood pressure, which was noticeably high. I asked how high, she said 167 over (and I didn't hear the rest) I waited an additional 10 min. in the exam room before I returned to the receptionist area to inquire about the delay. One receptionist was  kind enough to check on the doctor and informed me that he was on his way. I was taken to a different exam Room by the lovely male assistant.  I'm guessing Dr. Mann finally received my paperwork as he had questions which he asked the male assistant to ask me. The assistant walked back and forth 2 times to deliver my responses to him. I had to ask, why did he not just come into the room and ask me these questions in person. When Dr. Mann did enter the room, there was NO apology or acknowledgment of the long wait. Instead, his demeanor was brusque and unwelcoming, which made me feel as if my time and health concerns were inconsequential. Rather than addressing my questions directly, he seemed annoyed, and when I mentioned the delay, he dismissed my concern by saying, "No one  goes to a doctor and be  seen at the exact appointment time." He further went on to insisted he was not late as I was taken into the exam room and seen By who! the assistant who ONYL took my blood pressure while texting on her phone. Additionally, despite my elevated blood pressure, he neither acknowledged it nor offered further guidance, which left me feeling as though my health was not being taken seriously. How could you allow a patient to leave with elevated blood pressure levels as high a mine.  He then said there are other patients he was seeing. Fine, not an issue. I was just asking to be communicated with. I told him he had poor bedside manners and it went even more left. He even told me I'm not making the situation any better. I asked how long will this visit take as he was 45 min late. He then insisted again he was NOT late and with an attitude stated "as long as I wanted it to" Pardon, how do you tell a patient that. This interaction ended after two minutes. He stormed out the exam room left me behind & headed directly to the front desk and stated abruptly "she can leave". As a health care professional we take an oath to do no harm. Waiting for so long without updates, feeling dismissed, and dealing with a lack of empathy can make a difficult situation so much harder. Healthcare providers should show compassion, professionalism, and respect -- and no one should have to leave an appointment feeling worse than when they arrived. The lack of communication and empathy from that initial receptionist and doctor.  I think it's perfectly reasonable to expect both timely care and basic courtesy, and neither of these should be compromised, especially in a healthcare setting. I think we all deserve a healthcare provider who prioritizes not only our physical health but also treats you with the respect and compassion every patient deserves. I am very concerned that this experience reflects a lack of regard for patients' time and well-being. I came in with my pain at a 7 and left there with it on 10.... In tears|An OUTSTANDING pain management clinic. Dr. Iannicello is an EXCELLENT physician. I never feel rushed during my visits and he answers all of my questions. Dr. Iannicello has outstanding bedside manner and is thorough in his assessment. Dr. Iannicello has always used healing modalities that are effective and eliminate my pain from various injuries. Grace and Ish are incredibly supportive as well. Both Front desk staff at Brooklyn and Manhattan have gone out of their way to accommodate me. 10 Stars|Michael Schechter, M.D is wonderful! I was lucky enough that The office is in the building that I work in so it was very convenient. Staff and Dr. are so friendly and helpful and knowledgeable. They have access to Lenox Hill radiology MRIs that I had and we're able to give me injections for my neck pain on the first appointment, I'm so glad I found this practice and will definitely be back. I highly recommend their expertise and friendly bedside manner and professionalism.|I have gone to pain management at this establishment and their whole team of doctors and nurses are amazing.
My mother is 93 years old and has suffered from multiple back fractures. Dr. Mann and his team patched her up and she now lives a painless life.
I personally go to the clinic for my knees and hips and after I leave the office, I feel whole.
Now a days it is very hard to find doctors who are compassionate and won't try to rush you out of their office within 15 minutes.
The whole team are wonderful and I would give them 1000 stars if I could.|I have been going to Unique Pain Management for 3 yrs now.  No matter what type of pain I'm in it's always alleviated after my visit. The staff are very pleasant and professional.  My doctor there is Armando Iannicello. He is warm with an excellent bed side manner and explains everything he's doing during your procedure, which puts you at ease.  Since I've found this place I won't go anywhere else for pain management.

Thank you Dr. Bhavika Patel for helping this woman who has spent yrs homebound due to chronic pains.|When I first went to see Dr. Patel I was experiencing extreme pain in my knee.  I wasn't able to sleep thru the night because of the pain.  My daily activities were restricted because of the degree of pain that I was living with.  Dr. Patel gave me a list of options and we on a genicular nerve block and since then my quality of life has  improved significantly.  I'm sleeping thru the night and my daily activities are not centered around my knee.  I'm so much happier.

Pain Treatment Specialists serves patients throughout New York City and New Jersey with exceptional pain management solutions. Our state-of-the-art facilities provide comprehensive care for individuals suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. With a team of Harvard-trained physicians who specialize in interventional pain medicine, we deliver personalized treatment plans using the latest minimally invasive techniques to address the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Our board-certified physicians excel in treating various pain conditions, including:

  • Knee pain (back of knee, inside knee, and general knee discomfort)

  • Back pain (lower and upper regions)

  • Neck pain

  • Shoulder pain

  • Joint and musculoskeletal conditions

Advanced Treatment Options

We offer cutting-edge interventional procedures that minimize recovery time and avoid the risks associated with surgery and opioid medications. Our Ivy League trained doctors carefully evaluate each patient's condition to recommend the most appropriate treatment approach, which may include:

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Physical therapy recommendations

  • Minimally invasive interventional procedures

column3:
New York Pain Medicine serves the New York, NY area with comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our specialized medical practice combines advanced interventional techniques with holistic approaches to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Located in the heart of Manhattan, our clinic has become a trusted destination for patients seeking lasting relief and improved quality of life through personalized treatment plans.

At New York Pain Medicine, we understand that pain is complex and unique to each individual. Our team takes the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, identify triggers, and explain all available treatment options. This patient-centered approach allows us to create customized treatment regimens that address your specific needs and circumstances. We believe in empowering our patients through education and collaborative decision-making.

Expert Leadership

Dr. Douglas Allen leads our exceptional team as our medical director. With dual board certifications in physical medicine, rehabilitation, and interventional pain management, Dr. Allen brings exceptional expertise to coordinate care among our various specialists. His additional qualifications as a certified medical marijuana provider and opiate addiction specialist allow us to offer comprehensive pain solutions while addressing concerns about medication management and dependency.

Collaborative Care Model

While Dr. Allen provides expert guidance, we've consistently found that our collaborative approach delivers the best outcomes for patients. Our multidisciplinary team works together to develop integrated treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, physical therapy, medication management, and alternative therapies. This comprehensive strategy helps our patients return to healthy, pain-free lives with improved function and mobility.

Services and Specialties

Our practice specializes in treating various pain conditions through evidence-based interventions and innovative techniques. We offer comprehensive evaluations, diagnostic testing, and a range of treatment options tailored to each patient's specific needs. Our goal is not just pain relief but helping patients regain function and improve their overall quality of life.

Contact Information

Visit New York Pain Medicine at 425 Madison Ave Suite 302, New York, NY 10017. To schedule a consultation, call us at (212) 245-7900 or visit our website at https://nypainmedicine.com/ for more information about our services and approach to pain management.

column40:
Booking and admin was smooth. Was easy to call the office and speak to someone, which sadly can't be said about the larger hospitals where you need to jump through hoops and input your personal info 5 times before being able to speak to anyone. Dr. Melepura was the 3rd dr I saw about my neck. He was easy to talk to, attentive, and was patient in addressing many questions I had. I appreciated that he gave recommendations based on my personal needs rather than a boilerplate response. Will go back for follow up in a few weeks.|Dr Febin is fantastic! Highly recommend him and his practice the Spin clinic. The doctor is a good listener, kind, attentive and gave me great advice. I was nervous for the procedure but he made me feel very comfortable and it went smoothly. Dia and Jazmin at the front desk are super easy to work with. They are awesome people who truly care. I really appreciate the follow up texts and quick responses to all my questions! I'm starting PT with Derrick soon, will update this review after. The office is really well designed, super comfortable chairs and great decor/vibe. Very chic. Added bonus for sure. Don't think twice, book an appointment!|When I suddenly experienced knee pain I dreaded going to the large orthopedic practice near me, which I knew would mean multiple visits to the crowded waiting room, and a feeling of being herded through the system.  Dr. Melepura offered a very different experience.   His office is modern and calm, and his staff are great. Dr. Melepura listened to me and took time to explain his recommended course of treatment. His thoughtful and unhurried approach reminded me of how health care should be, using all the technology and tools available today without sacrificing the all-important personal doctor/patient dynamic.   I highly recommend SPIN.|Great experience. You will NOT be disappointed. Welcoming from the front desk, doctor to the Physical Therapist. Listened to understand and explained everything. I will be back. Very professional and clean office.|I had an overall positive experience at the clinic. The wait time was appropriate, and the staff and doctor were very personable, making me feel truly cared for. The doctor recommended physical therapy, an MRI, and injections, which helped alleviate my pain within 48 hours. I'm grateful for the care I received, especially since I had been in a lot of pain and unable to work. Thank you for making a difference in my recovery!|Start to finish, I had an amazing experience here! I was able to book a same day appointment for some back pain I was experiencing. The receptionist was lovely, the office was clean and modern, and Dr Melepura totally impressed me with his kind and opening approach. He listened carefully to what I was experiencing, and set me up with a clear plan to help. 10/10 would recommend!!|Dr. Melepura is one of the best doctors I've ever had the pleasure of seeing. He was able to take me as a new patient, same-day when I woke up with immense neck pain, unable to move my head. He's extremely attentive and truly listens and empathizes with whatever pain you're experiencing. We were able to set up a treatment plan and some procedures the very same day. I'm also doing my physical therapy appointments at his office as well, and their PT Derek is superb--extremely patient and encouraging! The entire staff is super lovely, and the office itself is welcoming, bright, and fresh. I cannot say enough good things about this practice! I highly recommend Dr. Melepura to anyone seeking high-quality care.|Every time I come to here, I leave thinking "this is what care is meant to be like; this is what everyone meant when they said 'patient-centered care.'"Dr. Melepura's entire staff - from the incredible ladies at the front desk to his PT Derrek to Dr. Melepura himself - is fantastic.

When you walk in, you are greeted with warmth and offered a water. Dr. Melepura sees you on time for you appointment, is attentive and caring, and takes the time to deeply understand your pain. He also refuses to let you settle for "okay" and insists on making sure you get all the way better. In my last check up, when I reported that I'm not having much pain anymore, his response was "but how much do you think about your back?" When I admitted it's every day, he said "then, that's not good enough - our goal is your pain is such that you don't think about it, that you don't make adjustments in your day-to-day."

Meanwhile, the PT on staff (Derrek) is the best I have seen. I had knee surgery 6 months ago and plateau'ed in my recovery after 8 weeks. 4 months post-op, I still couldn't straighten my leg fully or go up and down stairs, and was having significant pain when walking. The prior physical therapists I was seeing kept telling me to "just keep going" on the same set of exercises that weren't helping. I started seeing Derrek in mid-December, and a month later I was walking again normally without pain. Now, another two weeks later, I'm back doing stairs, lunges, squats and even burpees. Derrek is highly attentive, makes physical therapy sessions fun, and, like Dr. Melepura, provides a level of care that is hard to find, and truly makes a difference. He is giving me my normal life back.

Rarely do I rave so much about a business or doctor's office, but this team is making a true difference and getting me back to full functionality and full strength again after a year of wondering if I might not return to my pre-injury state. I cannot recommend Derrek and Dr. Melepura highly enough.

column40:
I had an incredibly frustrating experience at Ainsworth Institute of Pain Management. Their office is extremely disorganized, and I had to call them multiple times a day just to get any kind of information about whether my injections would be covered by insurance. More often than not, I was given wrong information, only to be hit with thousands of dollars in unexpected charges when they told me insurance would cover it.

The worst part was when I was literally on the operating table, about to receive an injection, and found out that insurance wasn't going to cover it after all. I ended up spending thousands over the course of 4 injections, all because of their inability to properly communicate or manage billing.

When I tried to speak directly with the doctor, I was told an assistant would talk to me instead. This assistant had no knowledge of my case, had no idea what ingredients were in my injection, and couldn't provide me with any helpful information. It wasn't until weeks later that I finally got a call from the doctor, who phoned me on speakerphone while driving, with an extremely annoyed tone, as if it was a huge inconvenience to have to speak with me.

This place is a disaster from top to bottom. The staff was unhelpful and rude, and the physicians were even worse. There are plenty of other clinics to choose from that will actually value your time and money. Stay away from this one.|Ainsworth Institute is one of the most professional, efficient, and reliable clinical practice. Dr. Hunter is at the leading edge of the field of pain management. He provides understandable explanation of procedure, along with risks and benefits.  My patient experience was comfortable and calm before and after. The practice ensures follows up so the clinicians can measures the recovery and response.|Dr. Hunter had destroyed my life. Dr. Hunter suggested and then performed a permanent/ irreversible procedure, Superior Hypogastric Plexus Block using alcohol, to eliminate my pain in my rectum region. Dr. Hunter only mentioned one side effect/complication (semen in the urine) from this procedure to me (recorded on video confirming this), so I agreed to get this procedure done by him because I didn't have this side effect. After I got this procedure, I lost all my feeling in rectum and I was unable to have bowel movements on my own anymore (basically paralyzed in my rectum area)(never mentioned as a risk/side effect from Dr. Hunter). Dr. Hunter said not having bowel movements "doesn't constitute an emergency" to him, although this can create serious health complications or death. Dr. Hunter never told me about this complication or risk (not being able to ever have a bowel movement on my own), because if he did, I would had never ever in my life done this procedure at only 28 years old. I went to numerous other professionals who said this procedure should had never been performed on me for this very reason. Dr. Hunter was upset with me and yelled at me when I called him upset about my permanent complications I had. Dr. Hunter had the audacity to bill me for that phone call I had with him discussing about the complications I had. Dr. Hunter charged my insurance company 10s of thousands of dollars and he had me also pay thousands of dollar to him even though he destroyed my life. I had to take time off work and be put on anti-depressants. I plan on getting a lawyer to get justice for the permanent damage (both mentally and physically) Dr. Hunter had caused me. Afterwards, I will reach out to the New York medical board.|The staff are all awesome people. Professional and down to earth. Courteous, polite, the list is endless. Glad they are the ones in charge of my care.|Was referred here by my folks at Mt. Sinai for CPS/fibromyalgia/C19 and they are a critical resource for me today and for the foreseeable future/lifetime? Dr. Hunter you the man!!! CJ was also the best Thank you both!|The Doctor and the Staff are great, im referring them too all family and friends if they should need the treatment for anything that's similar too what I suffered from, pertaining too extreme pain!!! They are it, trust me you!!!!|I praise dr Corey Hunter and staff
They put up with all my calls got my approval done and it was such a friendly experience I only wish I knew about Ainsworth pain management and drg nerve stimulation implant years ago after I was misdiagnosed with pudendal neuralgia it's definitely a learning curve they have a great team and they wil foot up everyday while I have this trial

Manhattan Pain Medicine, PLLC serves New York, NY with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located in the heart of Manhattan, our multidisciplinary practice combines cutting-edge medical interventions with holistic approaches to address both the physical and psychological aspects of pain. Our team of board-certified specialists works collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving function, reducing pain, and enhancing overall quality of life for our patients.

At Manhattan Pain Medicine, we pride ourselves on our exceptional team of specialists:

  • Dr. Jason Siefferman, MD - Founder and pain management specialist with expertise in interventional procedures and sports medicine

  • Dr. Nino Mikaberidze, MD - Specializing in advanced pain interventions and spine care

  • Dr. Jennifer Wolkin, PhD - Clinical psychologist focusing on pain psychology and mind-body approaches

  • Kira Charles - Certified Feldenkrais Practitioner offering movement therapy for pain reduction

Comprehensive Services

Our practice offers a wide range of services including:

Pain Management

We utilize the latest evidence-based interventions to address acute and chronic pain conditions, including medication management, nerve blocks, and minimally invasive procedures.

Sports Medicine

Our sports medicine specialists help athletes of all levels recover from injuries and improve performance through targeted treatments and rehabilitation protocols.

Spine Services

We provide comprehensive care for spine-related conditions, from conservative management to advanced interventional procedures for disc issues, spinal stenosis, and more.

Pain Psychology

Our integrated approach includes psychological support to address the emotional and cognitive aspects of pain, helping patients develop effective coping strategies.

Movement Therapy

The Feldenkrais Method offered at our practice helps patients improve movement patterns to reduce pain and enhance function in daily activities.

Visit us at manhattanpainmedicine.com or call +1 646-580-3538 to schedule a consultation. Our office is conveniently located at 2 5th Ave, Suite 7, New York, NY 10011.

Pain Treatment Specialists in Brooklyn, NY serves as one of New York City's premier destinations for comprehensive pain management solutions. Located in the heart of Downtown Brooklyn, this specialized medical practice brings together Harvard-trained physicians who focus exclusively on minimally invasive treatments for chronic and acute pain conditions. Their team of board-certified interventional pain doctors combines decades of experience with the latest evidence-based approaches to help patients regain mobility and improve quality of life without relying on surgical interventions or long-term medication dependence.

The clinic offers targeted treatments for a wide range of pain conditions, including:

  • Back Pain Treatment - Both upper and lower back pain solutions

  • Neck Pain Treatment - Addressing cervical spine issues and related discomfort

  • Knee Pain Treatment - Non-surgical interventions for acute and chronic knee conditions

  • Leg Pain Treatment - Comprehensive care for sciatica and other leg pain causes

  • Shoulder Pain Treatment - Specialized approaches for rotator cuff and joint issues

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Pain Treatment Specialists is their commitment to personalized care plans that address the root cause of pain rather than merely masking symptoms. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation to determine the most appropriate interventional techniques for their specific condition. The clinic's philosophy centers on helping patients return to active, fulfilling lives through the least invasive means possible.

Convenient Brooklyn Location

This accessible Downtown Brooklyn location serves residents throughout the borough and beyond. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 516-908-9330 or visiting their website at paintreatmentspecialists.com.

If you're suffering from chronic pain and seeking alternatives to surgery or long-term medication use, the Harvard-trained doctors at Pain Treatment Specialists offer the advanced expertise and compassionate care needed to develop an effective treatment plan tailored to your specific needs.

So much so that my husband wants to see her too!! I highly recommend her, and she has a very charming manner as well! PS I'm adding to this review that my knee is still perfect and she has solved my back issues too, my husband has had fantastic results with his shoulders and back!! If you are in pain, run to see Dr. Patel!!!|I began to see Dr. Hanna on the recommendation of a friend who had gotten great relief from gel injections in her knee. I have been having trouble with  my knees for sometime. My right knee really got bad. I had x-rays showing osteoarthritis. I brought them to Dr Hanna. Unfortunately, after three injections , I was getting no relief. In fact my pain was the same.  He sent me to get an MRI. So grateful because I got to have the MRI and he read the results quickly. As it turned out, there was a lot of damage to my knee, different tears and bulges, etc. Dr. Hanna  had me come in a few days after for a Cortizone injection and put me on a course of anti-inflammatory pills. At this moment, my knee is feeling much better. He did also suggest I follow up with the orthopedic surgeon. Since there are so much damage and gel injections, won't help me. I don't know what I would've done without him. The
Attention and care I got was extraordinary and was very comforting. I'm not sure what my future holds for  my knees.  Dr Hanna  is not a surgeon, and he may be able to keep me from surgery a bit longer. He is a great physician, wonderful at pain management  and a great human being.|Dr. Patel helped me with my back pain. Dr. Hanna seems to understand my bone disorder and the misery it causes best and is tenacious about battling the insurance company to cover treatment deemed unnecessary by them. He has a wonderful bedside manner, is highly professional, and extremely knowledgeable, conscientious, and compassionate. While it has been an adjustment not to receive oral pain medication unless deemed absolutely necessary, I follow his reasoning for prudent dispensing of prescriptions and respect the decision as it's ultimately in the best interest of the patient.

Of all of the pain specialists I've been treated by, I have made the largest improvement in well-being under Dr. Hanna's care and referred my daughter for management of her herniation related pain. The office is also very clean and organized. I highly recommend Dr. Hanna and VIP Vein and Pain for pain management.

Interventional Pain Management & Ortho-Spine Center serves Staten Island, NY and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical practice focuses on identifying and treating chronic and acute pain conditions affecting the back, neck, joints, and other areas of the body. With a team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists, we've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider for residents seeking relief from debilitating pain conditions throughout Staten Island and the greater New York area.

At IPMC, we take a holistic approach to pain management, understanding that each patient's experience with pain is unique. Our specialists begin with thorough diagnostic evaluations to identify the underlying causes of pain rather than simply treating symptoms. This comprehensive assessment allows us to develop individualized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and complementary therapies.

Our Core Services

- Pain Management: Advanced interventional techniques for chronic pain conditions

- Orthopedic Care: Treatment for joint, bone, and muscle disorders

- Spine Specialists: Focused care for cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spine issues

- Minimally Invasive Procedures: Including epidural injections, nerve blocks, and radiofrequency ablation

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes our practice is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just the pain. We understand how chronic pain affects every aspect of life, from work performance to personal relationships. Our team works collaboratively with patients to develop sustainable pain management strategies that improve quality of life and restore function.

Visit our conveniently located Staten Island office at 2537 Amboy Rd, Staten Island, NY 10306, or learn more about our services at [https://www.ipmchealth.com/locations/staten-island](https://www.ipmchealth.com/locations/staten-island). column40:
I recently completed 12 sessions over 6 weeks for Achilles tendonitis rehab, and unfortunately, my experience fell short of expectations.

While the staff was friendly and the facility pleasant, the overall care felt like a "patient mill" with minimal individualized attention.

There was no clear treatment plan, no guidance on how often to do my exercises, rest, or signs to watch for in order to progress safely. I only received this information after I inadvertently irritated my tendon a few weeks in. Additionally, there was no oversight or assessment of my progress during sessions. The assistant who was supposed to observe wasn't paying attention to my form, even when there were no other patients.

Despite being told I was 'behind' at my last session, I hadn't received any progressive loading or more challenging exercises. I feel like I wasn't given the necessary information or oversight to ensure safe progress.

For the price and time commitment, I expected more personalized care. If you're looking for targeted guidance, I wouldn't recommend this place.|Dr. Kapadia is an exceptional physiotherapist who takes the time to truly understand his patients' concerns. His expertise and personalized approach made a noticeable difference in my recovery. His hands-on techniques, combined with tailored exercises, helped me regain mobility and strength much faster than I expected.

The office itself is clean, well-equipped, and has a calming atmosphere that enhances the overall experience. I highly recommend Dr. Kapadia and his assistant May to anyone in need of professional and compassionate physiotherapy care. They truly go above and beyond for their patients!|Working on post-surgery rehab with Dr. Kapadia is the least frustrating PT experience I have ever had. So far it has exponentially more enjoyable and seemingly effective than SPEAR, where I was mostly frustrated with the lack of attention to my surgeon's protocol, among other things.

Dr Kapadia is significantly more attentive and checks all the boxes that SPEAR did not, the sessions are more affordable and the PT environment is not brutally corny like many others.|I have been seeing Dr. Moses for back pain management now for over a year. INVO Pain Medicine Group in New York, NY is a premier pain management practice dedicated to providing comprehensive, patient-centered care for individuals suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Located in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, our board-certified physicians combine advanced interventional techniques with holistic approaches to address the root causes of pain while improving overall quality of life.

At INVO Pain Medicine Group, we offer a wide range of evidence-based treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our multidisciplinary team specializes in treating various pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, sports injuries, and post-surgical pain. column2: Dr. George Hanna, MD - NY Pain Specialist
column3:
Dr. George Hanna, MD - NY Pain Specialist serves patients throughout New York City and northern New Jersey with exceptional pain management care. A Harvard-trained physician with board certification in pain medicine, Dr. Hanna has established himself as a leading authority in non-surgical interventions for chronic pain conditions. His patient-centered approach combines cutting-edge techniques with compassionate care, helping countless individuals reclaim their quality of life without resorting to invasive surgical procedures. Dr. Hanna's expertise spans a comprehensive range of pain conditions, with particular focus on back pain, neck pain, knee pain, and joint pain management.

Dr. Hanna's distinguished academic background includes an undergraduate degree from Cornell University and a medical degree from the prestigious University of Pennsylvania. His specialized training continued with an anesthesiology residency at Massachusetts General Hospital - Harvard Medical School, followed by a pain management fellowship at Brigham and Women's Hospital - Harvard Medical School. This exceptional educational foundation, combined with years of clinical experience, enables Dr. Hanna to provide the highest standard of evidence-based pain care.

Treatment Philosophy

At the core of Dr. Hanna's practice is a commitment to minimally invasive pain management solutions. He utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the precise source of pain, then develops customized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and lifestyle modifications. By addressing both symptoms and underlying causes, Dr. Hanna helps patients achieve sustainable pain relief and improved function.

Practice Locations

Dr. Hanna currently welcomes patients at two convenient locations:

Manhattan Office:

290 Madison Ave, Suite 203

New York, NY 10017

Phone: +1 917-979-8815

New Jersey Office:

Clifton, NJ

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Hanna, patients can call +1 917-979-8815 or visit his profile at paintreatmentspecialists.com. New patients are welcome, and most major insurance plans are accepted.
column11:
Dr. George Hanna is a Harvard-trained, board certified pain doctor and spine specialist, focusing on non-surgical approaches to help patients suffering with back pain, neck pain, knee pain and joint pain.

Dr. Hanna received his undergraduate degree from Cornell University and his medical degree from the University of Pennsylvania. He completed anesthesiology residency at Massachusetts General Hospital - Harvard Medical School and a pain management fellowship at Brigham and Women's Hospital - Harvard Medical School.

Looking for a pain doctor in NY or NJ? Dr. Hanna is currently available in Manhattan, NYC and Clifton, NJ.

Excellent!!!|Arrived early for a cervical injection appointment and then not called to desk until 45 minutes after appointment time, just to collect the copay.

I clearly explained that I have a pickup at 1:45pm, and all everyone can say is, "I understand".

No obvious delays as other patients came in, had their procedure done and left.

Did you forget about me? Or did you just ignore me, shuffling my chart to the bottom of the pile? I did observe that I was the only person of brown complexion in the waiting room on both days (initial visit and procedure visit). Maybe the reason.

No you don't care, it's all about the money, the numbers, how many bodies can you do, not the patient's time. At no time did ANYONE says, we're running behind, this or that happened. And with others coming and going you were not behind by over an hour.

I'm on time (early even) and when I'm ready to leave, now you're almost ready for me. By the time I'm in the Access A Ride car, they are calling me, asking me to come back inside that the doctor is ready for me (it's 1:27pm).

How can you even justify having a new patient waiting an ***hour and 15 minutes*** AFTER their appointment time for their procedure? And think it's okay.

No I don't recommend this practice/doctor. No I will never go back.

Take your pain elsewhere, to someone who will respect your time.

Back Pain Doctor NYC serves patients throughout New York, NY with comprehensive spine care and pain management solutions. Our team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating acute and chronic back pain using evidence-based approaches that minimize recovery time and maximize results. Located in the heart of Manhattan, our state-of-the-art facility offers the latest diagnostic technology and treatment options for patients suffering from spinal conditions.

At The Spine & Rehab Group, we understand how debilitating back pain can be. Our multidisciplinary team includes orthopedic specialists, neurologists, physical therapists, and pain management experts who work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans. We pride ourselves on our non-surgical approach, exploring all conservative treatment options before considering surgical intervention.

Comprehensive Services

Our practice offers a wide range of treatments including epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, physical therapy, and regenerative medicine. We treat conditions such as herniated discs, sciatica, spinal stenosis, degenerative disc disease, and failed back surgery syndrome with precision and care.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Back Pain Doctor NYC apart is our commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We take the time to explain your condition, discuss all available treatment options, and answer any questions you may have. Our goal is not just to alleviate your pain but to improve your overall quality of life.

Visit our modern facility at 109-111 W 24th St #705, New York, NY 10011, or call us at +1 917-672-8720 to schedule a consultation. You can also learn more about our services and approach to spine care at thespineandrehabgroup.com. Same-week appointments are often available for patients in urgent need of care.

column3:
All of Pain - Midtown is a premier pain management clinic located in the heart of New York City. Founded by the experienced Dr. Baruch Kim, our practice is dedicated to providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. At All of Pain, we understand how debilitating pain can be to your quality of life, which is why we've built our practice around a commitment to helping all patients achieve a pain-free existence through personalized treatment plans and cutting-edge medical interventions.

Our specialized team has extensive experience diagnosing and treating a wide range of pain conditions, including:

  • Low and Mid Back Pain

  • Sciatica

  • Herniated Disks

  • Neck Pain

  • Sacroiliac Joint Pain

  • Pelvic Pain

  • Headaches

  • Knee Pain

  • Shoulder Pain

  • Hip Pain

Advanced Treatment Options

At our Midtown NYC office, we offer a comprehensive array of medically proven treatments tailored to each patient's specific needs:

  • Injection Therapies: Epidural Steroid Injections, Medial Branch Blocks, Facet Joint Injections, Joint Injections, Trigger Point Injections

  • Minimally Invasive Procedures: Radiofrequency Ablation, Discogram, Lumbar Discectomy

  • Regenerative Medicine: PRP Therapy, Prolotherapy

Insurance and Appointments

We understand that access to quality pain management is essential, which is why we accept a wide variety of health insurance plans. Our friendly staff will help verify your coverage and explain any potential out-of-pocket costs. For your convenience, we offer same-day appointments for patients in urgent need of care.

Contact Us

Ready to take the first step toward a pain-free life? Contact All of Pain today to schedule your consultation.

Website: www.allofpain.com

Phone: +1 646-725-4600

Address: 1 W 34th St. #402A, New York, NY 10001, United States

column3:
New York Pain Care serves New York, NY with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our multidisciplinary team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating acute and chronic pain conditions using the latest evidence-based techniques and technologies. Since our founding, we've been committed to helping patients regain mobility, reduce pain, and improve their quality of life through personalized treatment plans.

At New York Pain Care, we offer a wide range of interventional and non-invasive treatments for various pain conditions. Our expertise includes treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, sports injuries, and neuropathic pain syndromes. We utilize advanced diagnostic tools to identify the root cause of pain before developing customized treatment protocols that may include physical therapy, medication management, minimally invasive procedures, regenerative medicine, and rehabilitation exercises.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our physicians take the time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and explain treatment options in clear, understandable terms. This collaborative approach ensures patients are active participants in their recovery journey. We coordinate care with other specialists when necessary to provide comprehensive pain management solutions.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 65 Broadway Suite 1605A in the heart of New York's Financial District, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. We've created a comfortable, welcoming environment where patients can receive the highest standard of care. Our central location makes us accessible to patients throughout Manhattan and the surrounding boroughs.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with one of our pain management specialists, please call us at +1 212-242-8162. You can also visit our website at https://www.newyorkpaincare.com/ to learn more about our services or to request an appointment online. Our dedicated team is ready to help you take the first step toward a pain-free life.

Hudson Medical serves New York City with exceptional pain management solutions that have transformed thousands of lives. Founded by the esteemed Dr. Kuo, our practice has built a reputation as NYC's most trusted pain management clinic through 15+ years of dedicated service and successful treatment of over 50,000 patients. We understand that chronic pain can significantly impact your quality of life, which is why our team of specialists is committed to providing personalized care using the latest evidence-based approaches.

At Hudson Medical, we excel in treating a comprehensive range of pain conditions including:

- Back pain and sciatica

- Neck pain

- Sacroiliac joint pain

- Chronic headaches

- Knee, shoulder, and hip pain

Our Manhattan clinic is equipped with state-of-the-art technology that enables us to offer advanced interventional procedures such as epidural steroid injections, kyphoplasty, facet joint injections, and radiofrequency ablation. For patients seeking regenerative medicine options, we provide cutting-edge PRP therapy that harnesses your body's natural healing abilities.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Hudson Medical apart is our unwavering commitment to patient comfort and convenience. We accept most major insurance plans and offer:

- Same-day appointments for urgent pain concerns

- Telehealth consultations for those unable to visit in person

- Customized treatment plans tailored to your specific condition and lifestyle needs

Take the first step toward reclaiming a pain-free life by scheduling your consultation today at our Broadway location in downtown Manhattan.

column2: Matthew P. Grimm, M.D. at Best Pain Doctor NYC
column3:
Best Pain Doctor NYC serves New York, NY with specialized pain management services under the direction of Matthew P. Grimm, M.D. At Spine New York City, patients receive a multi-disciplinary approach to treating both spinal and musculoskeletal pain conditions. Dr. Grimm brings exceptional credentials as a fellowship-trained and board-certified physician in both Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation and Interventional Pain Management, focusing on comprehensive treatment of acute and chronic pain conditions.

Dr. Grimm's philosophy centers on treating each patient as a unique individual. He carefully considers your complete medical history alongside your current symptoms to develop a customized treatment plan specifically designed for your pain condition. This personalized approach ensures that you receive care tailored to your specific needs rather than a one-size-fits-all solution.

Specialized Interventional Techniques

The interventional spinal techniques Dr. Grimm specializes in are highly effective and often help patients avoid surgical intervention. These advanced procedures target the source of pain with precision, providing relief while minimizing recovery time and complications. The ultimate goal of treatment at Best Pain Doctor NYC is to help patients achieve a healthy, pain-free lifestyle through the least invasive means possible.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Matthew Grimm at Best Pain Doctor NYC, visit www.bestpaindoctornyc.com or call +1 646-862-5555. The practice is conveniently located at 160 E 56th St, Suite 11, New York, NY 10022.
column11:
At Spine New York City, a multi-disciplinary approach to treating your pain is utilized specializing in both spinal as well as musculoskeletal pain. I am a fellowship trained and board certified physician in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation as well as Interventional Pain Management, specializing in the treatment of acute and chronic conditions.

I treat every patient uniquely taking in your past history as well as your present complaints in tailoring a treatment plan best for your specific pain.

The interventional spinal techniques I specialize in are very effective and can prevent the need for surgical intervention and the goal of my treatment is to provide my patients with a healthy, pain-free lifestyle.

Matthew Grimm, M.D.

Pain Solutions Medical PC serves Rego Park, NY and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management services. Our dedicated medical practice specializes in addressing chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. With our state-of-the-art facility located in Queens, we've become a trusted resource for patients seeking relief from debilitating pain conditions that affect their daily lives and overall wellbeing.

Pain Solutions PC offers a comprehensive, compassionate and patient-centered approach to caring for people suffering from pain. Our team of pain management specialists work with you to understand the cause of your pain and determine the most effective treatment and rehabilitation plan to enhance your quality of life. We believe in treating the whole person, not just symptoms, creating customized care plans that address both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies.

Expert Medical Team

Our practice is led by renowned specialists Dr. Sekhar Upadhyayula and Dr. Mikhail Kogan, who together bring over 60 years of experience treating spinal disorders and various pain conditions. Their extensive expertise allows our clinic to offer advanced diagnostic capabilities and innovative treatment options that many general practices cannot provide. Our physicians stay current with the latest developments in pain medicine to ensure patients receive the most effective care available.

Services and Treatment Options

We specialize in treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Our treatment modalities range from medication management and minimally invasive procedures to physical therapy recommendations and lifestyle modifications. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the specific needs and circumstances of individual patients.

Visit Our Practice

Located at 97-45 63rd Dr, Rego Park, NY 11374, our office provides a comfortable, welcoming environment for all patients. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 718-544-1171 or visit our website at www.nypainsolutions.com. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to those who need it most.

Receptionist was extremely rude. No sympathy. Waited for the dr for almost 2 hours when asked where was the dr (Dr. Kogan)? They said he had a procedure when my appointment was at 1:30pm. Clearly this doctor cared for business and not the patient.  And absolutely shows no sympathy for old patients. Just money maker.|Meeting Dr Mikhial Kogan was a god sent, I was struggling with a painful discomfort in feet  for months, I've visited many wrong specialist which could not dignose my condition, lastly I was referred from my Pc to him & from the moment I had my appointment & meeting him I've explained everything I was suggesting from, he listened to me  carefully & he was very polite & friendly as he explained everything in details to me how he can help me, Dr Kogan is very knowledgeable & quality to practice his field of study. Am happy I met him & I trust him with my health in the future, not forgetting his beautiful team from the front desk to his assistant in the Or room, nursery Theresa is very friendly & patient
Thank you pain solutions|Dr. Kogan is a wonderful doctor. I came in with so much pain but he quickly found options to help. I recommend him to anyone with pain. The staff are wonderful and very respectful. Even help with translation in spanish.|I've seen both doctors at this location. One is very kind and great at his job. The other assaulted me, injured my already injured shoulder, and pinned me down to a table with his groin while he was injuring me and screaming at me to go to physical therapy (which I do 2-3x a week, though he never asked if I went and just decided to scream in my face out of nowhere instead). It took my PT 3 weeks to fix the damage he did.

I had a new severe injury that impaired my ability to move and breathe. Doc (the good one) scheduled me for trigger point injections. I arrive on time, do the paperwork, sit down, wait for an hour. Have to go to the bathroom (no toilet tissue) and ask how long the wait might be when I ask for toilet tissue. They say 5 procedures ahead of me after I've already waited an hour. I walked over in excruciating pain, in a severe storm and tornado warning. I'm physically unable to sit or stand long due to my conditions, and they were about to have me waiting 5+ hours for a 5min procedure. They were never going to say a word. I had to leave for work.

They asked if I wanted to be rescheduled to the following week. Why? So I can cancel another important medical appointment, unexpectedly wait 5+ hours for a 5min procedure again, and still get no treatment? I can go untreated at home, so why go through the hassle? It seemed like one of the doctors called out or something, which happens, but you inform patients. You don't just expect people to wait several hours in pain and in severe weather warnings (we're being told to stay home unless leaving for something absolutely urgent right now) without a word. They were not busy, both front desk people were just sitting there the whole time, so they absolutely could have informed us.

Added bonus was the drunk as can be patient tossing flower pots around and breaking them? That was bizarre, though ultimately not the staff's fault.

Now I'm stuck with this severe pain made worse by the wait, walking in the severe weather, etc. and I have zero options for treatment. No other doctors nearby take my insurance, but I don't feel like I can schedule here again if this is how they do things. Delays happen but I need to know if it's gonna be several hours for such a brief procedure.|Dr kogan is an excellent doctor very compassionate very understanding he take time to explain he call you even on his days off to check on you to make sure that everything is good with you he is what they call a real doctor he is the epitome of true medicine.
you couldn't ask for a better doctor I've been to many doctors before but none like him he is truly a blessing I would truly recommend that if you experiencing any type of pain go to pain management and see him he will take care and he's an excellent surgeon he will not leave a lot of scars you will not be in a lot of pain and you will be back on your feet within a matter of time truly truly recommend him|Dr. U is amazing! He goes beyond the call of duty. If it were not for Dr. U, my husband would not be alive. Dr. U is caring, knowledgeable, has vast medical experience, professional, ethical, and very sensitive to his patients needs. I highly recommend Dr U.|Dr doctor kogan one of best  pain management I have ever come across. He is intelligent kind and caring..his staff are great they always welcomes there patients and sets appointments. Love the doctor and staff.|Dr Kogan has been my pain management doctor for a little over a year. He has been very detailed and concerned about my pain from day one and will recommend him to anyone. New York Interventional Pain Physicians serves Jackson Heights and the broader Queens, NY area with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of interventional pain specialists combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients overcome chronic pain conditions. We understand that persistent pain affects not just your physical wellbeing but every aspect of your life, which is why we're committed to developing personalized treatment plans that address your specific needs.

At New York Interventional Pain Physicians, we apply cutting-edge technology and incorporate the latest research discoveries in our approach to treating and preventing chronic pain. Our interventional techniques target the source of pain directly, offering relief where traditional methods have failed. We specialize in a wide range of conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain syndromes.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating simple yet effective treatment plans that fit seamlessly into our patients' lives. By focusing on minimally invasive procedures and comprehensive pain management strategies, we help reduce dependence on medication while improving functionality and quality of life. Our approach not only alleviates suffering but also contributes to lower healthcare costs in the long term.

Benefits Beyond Pain Relief

The impact of effective pain management extends far beyond physical comfort. Our patients report improvements in their personal relationships, work performance, and overall life satisfaction. By addressing both physical and mental aspects of chronic pain, we help our patients reclaim the joy and productivity that persistent pain can diminish.

If you're struggling with chronic pain, don't wait to seek help. Contact New York Interventional Pain Physicians today at +1 917-810-9893 or visit us at 35-30 81st St Suite 1, Jackson Heights, NY 11372. Learn more about our services at www.nyipp.com.

Our dedicated team of specialists combines advanced medical expertise with personalized care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. At Downtown Pain Physicians, we pride ourselves on delivering a one-on-one experience for every patient. Our doctors take the time to thoroughly understand each individual's condition, medical history, and specific pain concerns. Using state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and proven therapeutic techniques, we develop customized treatment plans designed to reduce pain quickly and enable a return to normal function and activities.

Holistic Approach to Pain Relief

Our practice distinguishes itself through a holistic approach to pain management. Rather than merely addressing symptoms, we focus on identifying and treating the root causes of pain. This comprehensive methodology often serves as an effective alternative to pain medications and surgeries for various musculoskeletal conditions. By targeting the underlying issues, we aim to provide long-term relief and improved functionality without unnecessary pharmaceutical dependence or invasive procedures.

Service Areas

column48: Does herniated discs treatment require surgery?
column49: Herniated discs can be treated conservatively with medications and physical therapy. If these treatments do not help, your doctor may recommend surgery.

column40:
Edit: updating my review after working with the doctor and her manager. They do really care and want to help, if you aren't getting adequate help from the front desk, there are people in the background that are willing to assist if your case is justified. They spent alot of time with me working through the intracies of my issues and clearing it with insurance.

I recently went here for my pain management needs and this office is terrible. They make the process of booking an appointment challenging, send texts with incorrect information, and constantly have long wait times.

Ive been trying to get my prescription issue remediated for an extended period of time and the individuals using the chat system they force you through provide minimal help.|My wife is a patient at this location for the past year. She's being treated for chronic pain due to multiple years of hernia surgeries,lower back & hip pain. Unfortunately, for the past,approximately, 9 months there has been frequent delays with prior approval for her medications. My wife has been without her medications from 4 to 5 days due to issues with prior approval. The system of communication with the pain clinic is strictly through a messaging system called (Klara) and by leaving voice messages which brings you back to Klara messaging. Sometimes the response from the clinic is within acceptable waiting time and sometimes no one from the clinic responds at all. If the patient has an upcoming injection procedure and your medication is due, the prior approval for picking up your medication will be delayed until the procedure is done. In other words if you're supposed to pick up your medication,for example, on April 1 and your upcoming procedure is on April 5, you will have wait until April 5,after the procedure, in order to get the prior approval for your pills. Therefore, if you run out of medicine on April 1, you will be without meds for days and that is where the problem begins because the patient, as in my wife's case, has no medicine to manage her pain. This creates pain,suffering,stress,worry,frustration, because she can't manage her pain and when she messages the clinic, they don't answer. Another thing is that this clinic prescribes medication every 2/weeks as opposed to every month. I hope this clinic can make corrections soon so that patients can continue to receive ultimate pain management  treatment without any interruptions. Update as of 1/2025. There has been improvements with communications via phone from the pain clinic and via Klara. The prior approvals have also improved. I'm not sure what the issues were previously,however,things are running smoothly  and my wife who is the patient at this clinic so far is receiving excellent  pain management services by Dr. Do our and her PAs. Also, initial contact with front desk secretaries are cordial and customer service oriented.|I have had to call and message over ten times on one occasion and visit the practice in person to chase them up because they hadn't sent a prescription that I needed.
It was a medication which I can't abruptly stop so it was very dangerous to run out.
If you can go anywhere else, do not go here.
They are completely negligent and dangerously understaffed.|I have been a patient of Dr. Do Ouro for over 10 years. She has from day one treated me with dignity and respect. She always listens to my concerns and has always put my needs above anything else. She always looks out for the benefits of her patients and not the latest governmental or industry trends. In a world which is putting more pressure on doctors to do less Dr. Do Ouro does more.  I consider her family she truly has giving me and continues to give me a better quality of life!|My mom has been seen by Dr. Do Ouro for the past year due to chronic pain from multiple back surgeries. Although Dr. Do Ouro is a great doctor, very compassionate and understanding with her patients, the communication with her office is awful. They NEVER pick up the phone and take over a week to respond via Klara (Communication Platform)
Also, they failed to send medical reports to the attorney and insurance company which resulted in my mom's workers compensation payments to be suspended.
We will have to change her pain doctor due to this extreme lack of communication.|I can't tell you how lucky I am to have her change my life. She managed my pain so different in a way with new techniques. I am so grateful the staff is so wonderful. I recommend this pain Management before any other. She is an expert in a field that Most of Other doctors do not treat you properly. Thank you so much, Dr D!! And very much appreciate everyone that works. Her team is the best.!!!! Very professional!|After a few procedures, I was standing at the counter for hours baking bread and other items. It had been SOOOO LONG since I was able to do that!!! Now my back and neck issues, degenerative disc disease and occasional impingement, etc, are permanent. I'm not looking for a cure, I just wanted to be able to have a DECENT quality of life. They do wear off but the procedures are done right there..in office. Using to rooms in the back that looks just like an OR in a big hospital!! Anesthesia on site. Sleep for 15-20 minutes and DONE!!
Dr DoOuro has done what no other doctor has been able to. I no longer cry in my bed thinking it's just getting worse and I can't do anything......I can't say enough about her!! I must also comment on her staff. To run 2 operating rooms and keep it moving smoothly, makes her staff some of the best I've seen (I've seen A LOT). You know the saying," moves like a well oiled machine ", well Dr Do Ouro and her wonderful staff, keeps things moving like a well oiled machine!! In case you can't tell, I HIGHLY recommend her and staff at the 2nd Ave 42nd St office.|If it was not for Dr.DoOuro I would have not been able to continue work and provide for my family. I have been a patient of her for almost 20 years now.
I have severe spinal stenosis had surgery and nothing helped . Just do what she says follow her lead even if you do not agree with her .
They are strict with opioids and they should be because many people abuse these meds and make it hard for those who really  need them
Asya whi is her PA is just great and does a wonderful job in getting you out of pain.
She happens to be one of the best Doctors I have ever met and has golden hands.

Our Facility and Accessibility

column40: Dr. Elbaz and his team have been beyond helpful! Dr. Elbaz and Dr. Kim have the best bedside manner I've ever experienced. They have compassion and a genuine desire to help which comes across to the patient from the very first appointment. They make you feel safe and listened to about your pain concerns. There's nothing better than feeling like a person when trusting a doctor with your pain and life. After a serious car accident, my insurance would cover many doctor visits and potential surgeries, but after surpassing their unrealistic time limit, I wasn't able to schedule with any doctors. That was when I was referred to Dr. Elbaz and his team. He reassured me his job was to help make me feel better and we would let the lawyers deal with the money. Immediately he got to work on figuring out how best to help me. Dr. Elbaz and his team performed a discectomy on my lower back which had me in excruciating pain daily for over a year. I found myself unable to bend down to shave my legs, tie my shoes, in addition to having discomfort and difficulty standing and/or sitting. The recovery time for the discectomy performed on me took longer than anticipated, but after I fully recovered, I felt significantly less pain in my lower back and could resume shaving my legs. Although I sustained multiple injuries and experience pain all over, Dr. Elbaz and his team have helped and continue to help me feel better than days and years before. Between consultations, shots to help alleviate pain, dispensing pain medication prescriptions, and surgeries, you're in excellent hands! column40:
Kanzer, Daniel MD
Mount Sinai Pain Management Program

an extraordinarily gifted doctor and someone possessed of the kind of empathy that is so rare (and so great) to find in someone as young as he... Dr. Daniel Kanzer, by virtue of his thoroughness, has quite possibly saved me from life in a wheelchair...
taking over as my pain management doctor after my primary care physician of 30 years retired late year before last. we met each month and on one visit early last spring, he asked if my pain was worse and i said.."about the same, i think.." and he said, "well, your body language says something else, so lets get an MRI of your back, just to see... the MRI showed a problem and Dr. Kanzer insisted that i see my neurosurgeon (the same doctor who performed a laminectomy and a multi-level fusion on my lumbar spine  11 years ago) ASAP ... i did and was told that i had severe stenosis which had caused the buckling of my cauda equina nerve root,  something that would require a major operation in order to avoid the almost inevitable eventuality of becoming permanently crippled by the severing of my spinal cord... i had the operation 5 months ago and was informed by both my surgeon and the attending physician from the spine center at NYU that it would be an intense experience with a long and unavoidably painful period of rehab that might take a year or more to heal...(they inserted two 15-inch steel rods from my sacrum to my mid-thorasic spine, replacing the extant apparatus in the process).
Daniel has been with me throughout this ordeal, making certain that my pain has never been more than i can handle and , for this, i will be eternally grateful...
i spent two months at in-house rehab and am now finishing my third month of out patient sessions...we have lowered the dose of pain meds from the extremely high level, i was on, for the first couple of months, post-op...back to the maintenance dose i was taking pre-op. Dr. K has closely monitored my progress and with great compassion (and a marvelous sense of humor) helping me to  "maintain the strain"

In Conclusion, i give Dr. Kanzer and the Mount Sinai Pain Management Program my highest, unqualified recommendation for anyone suffering from the unrelenting pain of any severe back problem...

Thanks again , Doc...I am so very happy that my current PrimaryCarePhysician (who retired into private practice after years as chief cardiologist at Mount Sinai Hospital) recommended that i apply to your program...!

sincerely...your patient (and friend),
david charles teschendorf
NY, NY
March 2024|Dr Serben is the pain God. Had sciatica so bad in 2014. I'd rather have had a few toothaches and been in labor than that horrible pain. I couldn't even sleep in my bed  Slept in my recliner when I could sleep. Went to a few pain Dr's with no relief.   Then my pcp referred me to Dr Serben. Been b pain free. He did an epidural HE got the right spot. Excellent at his profession. Will not do or give any treatment or medication that isn't good for your issue.  The Best at Mt Sinai|Dr. Serbin does not get back to his patients. I had a family member that needed their medication. His team or him did not get back to them. They had to suffer for weeks.
He is a horrible person and doctor|Dr. Serban is a great pain doctor, dare I say the best in NYC without actually having been to each and every one of them myself. While he's prudent, he's always suggesting new approaches to deal with my pain issues. He's willing to discuss new approaches and dissuade me from any treatment if he thinks it's unsuitable for me. He cares deeply about this patient and I'm sure it's true of all his patients. Importantly to me, I haven't found a doctor in NYC who is better at treating Adhesive Arachnoiditis (AA), the source of my particularly vicious form of pain. A doctor both skilled at, and willing to even attempt to treat AA is a rare find even in a place as big as NYC. To find someone like Dr. Serban who both wants to and is very good at treating AA and is very compassionate on top of it all, is a very rare combination indeed.
As is probably the case with all Five Star doctors, getting an appointment with Dr. Serban, even rescheduling an appointment, may result in a very long wait. There is no getting around the fact that Dr. Serban is in very high demand and we all want to be treated as if we're his most important patient. This is where the Practice's scheduling person's telephone skills make or break its reputation, and to some degree the doctor's too. If a patient can't be made to feel special by getting the best appointment in the book, then shouldn't the bad news be delivered in such a way as to make that patient feel like he/she is still valued by the doctor and Practice. More often than not the message either doesn't get sent at all, or gets sent in a way that makes the patient feel even worse.|Ive been seeing Dr.Serbian for 8yrs and the only thing that im disappointed with is when I was in the hospital Dr.Serbian didnt even come and see me.|horrible wait times for everything, to be seen, get an appointment calling in HORRIBLE - people who work there DONT CARE - OUTDATED facilities worst|

Knee Pain Centers of America in New York, NY stands as a premier medical facility dedicated to providing innovative, non-surgical solutions for patients suffering from knee osteoarthritis and chronic knee pain. Located in the heart of Manhattan at 129 Central Park North, our specialized clinic has become a trusted destination for individuals seeking alternatives to invasive knee replacement surgery. Our team of board-certified knee pain doctors combines decades of experience with cutting-edge treatment protocols to deliver personalized care plans that address the root causes of knee discomfort.

At Knee Pain Centers of America, we understand that knee replacement surgery isn't the only way to find relief. Our comprehensive approach includes advanced interventional procedures, regenerative medicine techniques, and customized physical therapy programs designed to improve mobility and reduce pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to the patient's specific condition, lifestyle needs, and long-term health goals.

Our Innovative Procedures Include:

• Viscosupplementation injections to improve joint lubrication

• Platelet-rich plasma (PRP) therapy for tissue regeneration

• Targeted corticosteroid injections for inflammation reduction

• Minimally invasive nerve ablation procedures

• Custom bracing and supportive devices

• Advanced physical rehabilitation protocols

Why Choose Knee Pain Centers of America?

Our patient-centered approach focuses on providing sustainable relief while avoiding unnecessary surgery. We take pride in our high success rates and the thousands of New Yorkers who have regained their active lifestyles through our innovative treatments. Our convenient Central Park location offers a comfortable, state-of-the-art facility where patients receive personalized attention from our expert medical team.

To learn more about our innovative knee pain solutions or to schedule a consultation, visit kneepaincentersofamerica.com or call us at +1 877-769-5633. Take the first step toward a pain-free life today.

Metropolis Pain Medicine in New York, NY offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the five boroughs. Founded with a mission to provide personalized care, our board-certified specialists combine evidence-based treatments with innovative approaches to address chronic pain conditions. We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal goals.

At Metropolis Pain Medicine, we treat a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies to provide holistic care. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible to promote faster recovery and improved quality of life.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our compassionate team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop treatment strategies that align with your specific needs. We prioritize patient education, ensuring you understand your diagnosis and treatment options to make informed decisions about your care.

Convenient Manhattan Location

Located at 111 John St #2509, New York, NY 10038, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. We're conveniently accessible from all parts of Manhattan and surrounding areas, with nearby public transportation options. For appointments or consultations, call us at +1 347-424-4996 or visit our website at http://www.doctordevi.com/ to learn more about our services and patient resources.

Insurance and Appointments

Metropolis Pain Medicine works with most major insurance providers and offers flexible scheduling options to accommodate busy New York lifestyles. New patients are welcome, and we strive to provide timely appointments for those seeking relief from acute or chronic pain conditions. Our administrative team is ready to assist with insurance verification and appointment scheduling to ensure a seamless experience.
